name: Ab Crunch Machine
directions: Select a light resistance and sit down on the ab machine placing your fet under the pads provided and grabing the top handles. Your arms should be bent at a 90 degre angle as you rest the triceps on the pads provided. This wil be your starting position.

At the same time, begin to lift the legs up as you crunch your uper torso. Breathe out as you perform this movement. Tip: Be sure to use a slow and controled motion. Concentrate on using your abs to move the weight while relaxing your legs and fet.
After a second pause, slowly return to the starting position as you breathe in.
Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.
For this exercise, always select a weight that you can easily handle as using to much weight can easily lead to injury.

name: Ab Roller
directions: Hold the Ab Roler with both hands and knel on the flor.
Now place the ab roler on the flor in front of you so that you are on al your hands and knes (as in a kneling push up position). This wil be your starting position.

Slowly rol the ab roler straight forward, stretching your body into a straight position. Tip: Go down as far as you can without touching the flor with your body. Breathe in during this portion of the movement.
After a pause at the stretched position, start puling yourself back to the starting position as you breathe out. Tip: Go slowly and kep your abs tight at al times.

name: Adductor
directions: Lie face down with one leg on a foam rol.
Rotate the leg so that the foam rol contacts against your iner thigh. Shift as much weight onto the foam rol as can be tolerated.
While trying to relax the muscles if the iner thigh, rol over the foam betwen your hip and kne, holding points of tension for 10-30 seconds. Repeat with the other leg.

name: Adductor/Groin
directions: Lie on your back with your fet raised towards the ceiling.
Have your partner hold your fet or ankles. Abduct your legs as far as you can. This wil be your starting position.
Atempt to squeze your legs together for 10 or more seconds, while your partner prevents you from doing so.

Now, relax the muscles in your legs as your partner pushes your fet apart, stretching as far as is comfortable for you. Be sure to let your partner know when the stretch is adequate to prevent overstretching or injury.

name: Advanced Kettlebell Windmill
directions: Clean and pres a ketlebel overhead with one arm.

Keping the ketlebel locked out at al times, push your but out in the direction of the locked out ketlebel. Kep the non-working arm behind your back and turn your fet out at a forty-five degre angle from the arm with the ketlebel.
Lower yourself as far as posible.
Pause for a second and reverse the motion back to the starting position.

name: Air Bike
directions: Lie flat on the flor with your lower back presed to the ground. For this exercise, you wil ned to put your hands beside your head. Be careful however to not strain with the neck as you perform it. Now lift your shoulders into the crunch position.
Bring knes up to where they are perpendicular to the flor, with your lower legs paralel to the flor. This wil be your starting position.

Now simultaneously, slowly go through a cycle pedal motion kicking forward with the right leg and bringing in the kne of the left leg. Bring your right elbow close to your left kne by crunching to the side, as you breathe out.
Go back to the initial position as you breathe in.
Crunch to the oposite side as you cycle your legs and bring closer your left elbow to your right kne and exhale.
Continue alternating in this maner until al of the recomended repetitions for each side have ben completed.

name: All Fours Quad Stretch
directions: Start of on your hands and knes, then lift your leg of the flor and hold the fot with your hand.
Use your hand to hold the fot or ankle, keping the kne fuly flexed, stretching the quadriceps and hip flexors.
Focus on extending your hips, thrusting them towards the flor. Hold for 10-20 seconds and then switch sides.

name: Alternate Hammer Curl
directions: Stand up with your torso upright and a dumbel in each hand being held at arms length. The elbows should be close to the torso.
The palms of the hands should be facing your torso. This wil be your starting position.

While holding the uper arm stationary, curl the right weight forward while contracting the biceps as you breathe out. Continue the movement until your biceps is fuly contracted and the dumbels are at shoulder level. Hold the contracted position for a second as you squeze the biceps. Tip: Only the forearms should move.
Slowly begin to bring the dumbels back to starting position as your breathe in.
Repeat the movement with the left hand. This equals one repetition.
Continue alternating in this maner for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Alternate Heel Touchers
directions: Lie on the flor with the knes bent and the fet on the flor around 18-24 inches apart. Your arms should be extended by your side. This wil be your starting position.
Crunch over your torso forward and up about 3-4 inches to the right side and touch your right hel as you hold the contraction for a second. Exhale while performing this movement.
Now go back slowly to the starting position as you inhale.

Now crunch over your torso forward and up around 3-4 inches to the left side and touch your left hel as you hold the contraction for a second. Exhale while performing this movement and then go back to the starting position as you inhale. Now that both hels have ben touched, that is considered 1 repetition.
Continue alternating sides in this maner until al prescribed repetitions are done.

name: Alternate Incline Dumbbell Curl
directions: Sit down on an incline bench with a dumbel in each hand being held at arms length. Tip: Kep the elbows close to the torso.This wil be your starting position.

While holding the uper arm stationary, curl the right weight forward while contracting the biceps as you breathe out. As you do so, rotate the hand so that the palm is facing up. Continue the movement until your biceps is fuly contracted and the dumbels are at shoulder level. Hold the contracted position for a second as you squeze the biceps. Tip: Only the forearms should move.
Slowly begin to bring the dumbel back to starting position as your breathe in.
Repeat the movement with the left hand. This equals one repetition.
Continue alternating in this maner for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Alternate Leg Diagonal Bound
directions: Asume a comfortable stance with one fot slightly in front of the other.
Begin by pushing of with the front leg, driving the oposite kne forward and as high as posible before landing. Atempt to cover as much distance to each side with each bound.
It may help to use a line on the ground to guage distance from side to side.
Repeat the sequence with the other leg.

name: Alternating Cable Shoulder Press
directions: Move the cables to the botom of the tower and select an apropriate weight.
Grasp the cables and hold them at shoulder height, palms facing forward. This wil be your starting position.
Keping your head and chest up, extend through the elbow to pres one side directly over head.
After pausing at the top, return to the starting position and repeat on the oposite side.

name: Alternating Deltoid Raise
directions: In a standing position, hold a pair of dumbels at your side.
Keping your elbows slightly bent, raise the weights directly in front of you to shoulder height, avoiding any swinging or cheating.
Return the weights to your side.
On the next repetition, raise the weights lateraly, raising them out to your side to about shoulder height.
Return the weights to the starting position and continue alternating to the front and side.

name: Alternating Floor Press
directions: Lie on the flor with two ketlebels next to your shoulders.
Position one in place on your chest and then the other, griping the ketlebels on the handle with the palms facing forward.
Extend both arms, so that the ketlebels are being held above your chest. Lower one ketlebel, bringing it to your chest and turn the wrist in the direction of the locked out ketlebel.
Raise the ketlebel and repeat on the oposite side.

name: Alternating Hang Clean
directions: Place two ketlebels betwen your fet. To get in the starting position, push your but back and lok straight ahead.

Clean one ketlebel to your shoulder and hold on to the other ketlebel in a hanging position. Clean the ketlebel to your shoulder by extending through the legs and hips as you pul the ketlebel towards your shoulders. 
Rotate your wrist as you do so.
Lower the cleaned ketlebel to a hanging position and clean the alternate ketlebel. Repeat.

name: Alternating Kettlebell Press
directions: Clean two ketlebels to your shoulders. Clean the ketlebels to your shoulders by extending through the legs and hips as you pul the ketlebels towards your shoulders. Rotate your wrists as you do so.
Pres one directly overhead by extending through the elbow, turning it so the palm faces forward while holding the other ketlebel stationary .
Lower the presed ketlebel to the starting position and imediately pres with your other arm.

name: Alternating Kettlebell Row
directions: Place two ketlebels in front of your fet. Bend your knes slightly and push your but out as much as posible. As you bend over to get into the starting position grab both ketlebels by the handles.
Pul one ketlebel of of the flor while holding on to the other ketlebel. Retract the shoulder blade of the working side, as you flex the elbow, drawing the ketlebel towards your stomach or rib cage.
Lower the ketlebel in the working arm and repeat with your other arm.

name: Alternating Renegade Row
directions: Place two ketlebels on the flor about shoulder width apart. Position yourself on your toes and your hands as though you were doing a pushup, with the body straight and extended. Use the handles of the ketlebels to suport your uper body. You may ned to position your fet wide for suport.
Push one ketlebel into the flor and row the other ketlebel, retracting the shoulder blade of the working side as you flex the elbow, puling it to your side.
Then lower the ketlebel to the flor and begin the ketlebel in the oposite hand. Repeat for several reps.

name: Ankle Circles
directions: Use a sturdy object like a squat rack to hold yourself.

Lift the right leg in the air (just around 2 inches from the flor) and perform a circular motion with the big toe. Pretend that you are drawing a big circle with it. Tip: One circle equals 1 repetition. Breathe normaly as you perform the movement.
When you are done with the right fot, then repeat with the left leg.

name: Ankle On The Knee
directions: From a lying position, bend your knes and kep your fet on the flor.
Place your ankle of one fot on your oposite kne.
Grasp the thigh or kne of the botom leg and pul both of your legs into the chest. Relax your neck and shoulders. Hold for 10-20 seconds and then switch sides.

name: Anterior Tibialis-SMR
directions: Begin seated on the ground with your legs bent and your fet on the flor.

Using a Muscle Roler or a roling pin, aply presure to the muscles on the outside of your shins. Work from just below the kne to above the ankle, pausing at points of tension for 10-30 seconds. Repeat on the other leg.

name: Anti-Gravity Press
directions: Place a bar on the ground behind the head of an incline bench.
Lay on the bench face down. With a pronated grip, pick the barbel up from the flor. Flex the elbows, performing a reverse curl to bring the bar near your chest. This wil be your starting position.
To begin, pres the barbel out in front of your head by extending your elbows. Kep your arms paralel to the ground throughout the movement.
Return to the starting position and repeat to complete the set.

name: Arm Circles
directions: Stand up and extend your arms straight out by the sides. The arms should be paralel to the flor and perpendicular (90-degre angle) to your torso. This wil be your starting position.
Slowly start to make circles of about 1 fot in diameter with each outstretched arm. Breathe normaly as you perform the movement.
Continue the circular motion of the outstretched arms for about ten seconds. Then reverse the movement, going the oposite direction.

name: Arnold Dumbbell Press
directions: Sit on an exercise bench with back suport and hold two dumbels in front of you at about uper chest level with your palms facing your body and your elbows bent. Tip: Your arms should be next to your torso. The starting position should lok like the contracted portion of a dumbel curl.
Now to perform the movement, raise the dumbels as you rotate the palms of your hands until they are facing forward.
Continue lifting the dumbels until your arms are extended above you in straight arm position. Breathe out as you perform this portion of the movement.

After a second pause at the top, begin to lower the dumbels to the original position by rotating the palms of your hands towards you. Tip: The left arm wil be rotated in a counter clockwise maner while the right one wil be rotated clockwise. Breathe in as you perform this portion of the movement.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Around The Worlds
directions: Lay down on a flat bench holding a dumbel in each hand with the palms of the hands facing towards the ceiling. Tip: Your arms should be paralel to the flor and next to your thighs. To avoid injury, make sure that you kep your elbows slightly bent. This wil be your starting position.

Now move the dumbels by creating a semi-circle as you displace them from the initial position to over the head. Al of the movement should hapen with the arms paralel to the flor at al times. Breathe in as you perform this portion of the movement.
Reverse the movement to return the weight to the starting position as you exhale.

name: Atlas Stone Trainer
directions: This trainer is efective for developing Atlas Stone strength for those who don't have aces to stones, and are typicaly made from bar ends or heavy pipe.
Begin by loading the desired weight onto the bar. Stradle the weight, wraping your arms around the implement, bending at the hips.
Begin by puling the weight up past the knes, extending through the hips. As the weight clears the knes, it can be laped by resting it on your thighs and siting back, huging it tightly to your chest.
Finish the movement by extending through your hips and knes to raise the weight as high as posible. The weight can be returned to the lap or to the ground for sucesive repetitions.

name: Atlas Stones
directions: Begin with the atlas stone betwen your fet. Bend at the hips to wrap your arms verticaly around the Atlas Stone, atempting to get your fingers underneath the stone. Many stones wil have a smal flat portion on the botom, which wil make the stone easier to hold.
Puling the stone into your torso, drive through the back half of your fet to pul the stone from the ground.
As the stone pases the knes, lap it by siting backward, puling the stone on top of your thighs.

Sit low, geting the stone high onto your chest as you change your grip to reach over the stone. Stand, driving through with your hips. Close distance to the loading platform, and lean back, extending the hips to get the stone as high as posible.

name: Axle Deadlift
directions: Aproach the bar so that it is centered over your fet. You fet should be about hip width apart. Bend at the hip to grip the bar at shoulder width, alowing your shoulder blades to protract. Typicaly, you would use an over/under grip.

With your fet and your grip set, take a big breath and then lower your hips and flex the knes until your shins contact the bar. Lok forward with your head, kep your chest up and your back arched, and begin driving through the hels to move the weight upward.
After the bar pases the knes, agresively pul the bar back, puling your shoulder blades together as you drive your hips forward into the bar.
Lower the bar by bending at the hips and guiding it to the flor.

name: Back Flyes - With Bands
directions: Run a band around a stationary post like that of a squat rack.
Grab the band by the handles and stand back so that the tension in the band rises.

Extend and lift the arms straight in front of you. Tip: Your arms should be straight and paralel to the flor while perpendicular to your torso. Your fet should be firmly planted on the flor spread at shoulder width. This wil be your starting position.
As you exhale, move your arms to the sides and back. Kep your arms extended and paralel to the flor. Continue the movement until the arms are extended to your sides.
After a pause, go back to the original position as you inhale.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Backward Drag
directions: Load a sled with the desired weight, ataching a rope or straps to the sled that you can hold onto.
Begin the exercise by moving backwards for a given distance. Leaning back, extend through the legs for short steps to move as quickly as posible.

name: Backward Medicine Ball Throw
directions: This exercise is best done with a partner. If you lack a partner, the bal can be thrown and retrieved or thrown against a wal.
Begin standing a few meters in front of your partner, both facing the same direction. Begin holding the bal betwen your legs.
Squat down and then forcefuly reverse direction, coming to ful extension and you tos the bal over your head to your partner.
Your partner can then rol the bal back to you. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Balance Board
directions: Place a balance board in front of you.
Stand up on it and try to balance yourself.
Hold the balance for as long as desired.

name: Ball Leg Curl
directions: Begin on the flor laying on your back with your fet on top of the bal.
Position the bal so that when your legs are extended your ankles are on top of the bal. This wil be your starting position.
Raise your hips of of the ground, keping your weight on the shoulder blades and your fet.
Flex the knes, puling the bal as close to you as you can, contracting the hamstrings.
After a brief pause, return to the starting position.

name: Band Assisted Pull-Up
directions: Choke the band around the center of the pulup bar. You can use diferent bands to provide varying levels of asistance.
Pul the end of the band down, and place one bent kne into the lop, ensuring it won't slip out. Take a medium to wide grip on the bar. This wil be your starting position.

Pul yourself upward by contracting the lats as you flex the elbow. The elbow should be driven to your side. Pul to the front, atempting to get your chin over the bar. Avoid swinging or jerking movements.
After a brief pause, return to the starting position.

name: Band Good Morning
directions: Using a 41 inch band, stand on one end, spreading your fet a smal amount. Bend at the hips to lop the end of the band behind your neck. This wil be your starting position.
Keping your legs straight, extend through the hips to come to a near vertical position.
Ensure that you do not round your back as you go down back to the starting position.

name: Band Good Morning (Pull Through)
directions: Lop the band around a post. Standing a litle ways away, lop the oposite end around the neck. Your hands can help hold the band in position.
Begin by bending at the hips, geting your but back as far as posible. Kep your back flat and bend forward to about 90 degres. Your knes should be only slightly bent.
Return to the starting position be driving through with the hips to come back to a standing position.

name: Band Hip Adductions
directions: Anchor a band around a solid post or other object.
Stand with your left side to the post, and put your right fot through the band, geting it around the ankle.
Stand up straight and hold onto the post if neded. This wil be your starting position.
Keping the kne straight, raise your right legs out to the side as far as you can.
Return to the starting position and repeat for the desired rep count.
Switch sides.

name: Band Pull Apart
directions: Begin with your arms extended straight out in front of you, holding the band with both hands.
Initiate the movement by performing a reverse fly motion, moving your hands out lateraly to your sides.
Kep your elbows extended as you perform the movement, bringing the band to your chest. Ensure that you kep your shoulders back during the exercise.
Pause as you complete the movement, returning to the starting position under control.

name: Band Skull Crusher
directions: Secure a band to the base of a rack or the bench. Lay on the bench so that the band is lined up with your head.
Take hold of the band, raising your elbows so that the uper arm is perpendicular to the flor. With the elbow flexed, the band should be above your head. This wil be your starting position.
Extend through the elbow to straighten your arm, keping your uper arm in place. Pause at the top of the motion, and return to the starting position.

name: Barbell Ab Rollout
directions: For this exercise you wil ned to get into a pushup position, but instead of having your hands of the flor, you wil be grabing on to an Olympic barbel (loaded with 5-10 lbs on each side) instead. This wil be your starting position.

While keping a slight arch on your back, lift your hips and rol the barbel towards your fet as you exhale. Tip: As you perform the movement, your glutes should be coming up, you should be keping the abs tight and should maintain your back posture at al times. Also your arms should be staying perpendicular to the flor throughout the movement. If you don't, you wil work out your shoulders and back more than the abs.
After a second contraction at the top, start to rol the barbel back forward to the starting position slowly as you inhale.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Barbell Ab Rollout - On Knees
directions: Hold an Olympic barbel loaded with 5-10lbs on each side and knel on the flor.
Now place the barbel on the flor in front of you so that you are on al your hands and knes (as in a kneling push up position). This wil be your starting position.

Slowly rol the barbel straight forward, stretching your body into a straight position. Tip: Go down as far as you can without touching the flor with your body. Breathe in during this portion of the movement.
After a second pause at the stretched position, start puling yourself back to the starting position as you breathe out. Tip: Go slowly and kep your abs tight at al times.

name: Barbell Bench Press - Medium Grip
directions: Lie back on a flat bench. Using a medium width grip (a grip that creates a 90-degre angle in the midle of the movement betwen the forearms and the uper arms), lift the bar from the rack and hold it straight over you with your arms locked. This wil be your starting position.
From the starting position, breathe in and begin coming down slowly until the bar touches your midle chest.

After a brief pause, push the bar back to the starting position as you breathe out. Focus on pushing the bar using your chest muscles. Lock your arms and squeze your chest in the contracted position at the top of the motion, hold for a second and then start coming down slowly again. Tip: Idealy, lowering the weight should take about twice as long as raising it.
Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.
When you are done, place the bar back in the rack.

name: Barbell Curl
directions: Stand up with your torso upright while holding a barbel at a shoulder-width grip. The palm of your hands should be facing forward and the elbows should be close to the torso. This wil be your starting position.
While holding the uper arms stationary, curl the weights forward while contracting the biceps as you breathe out. Tip: Only the forearms should move.
Continue the movement until your biceps are fuly contracted and the bar is at shoulder level. Hold the contracted position for a second and squeze the biceps hard.
Slowly begin to bring the bar back to starting position as your breathe in.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.
You can also perform this movement using a straight bar atachment hoked to a low puley. This variation sems to realy provide a god contraction at the top of the movement.
You may also use the closer grip for variety purposes.

name: Barbell Curls Lying Against An Incline
directions: Lie against an incline bench, with your arms holding a barbel and hanging down in a horizontal line. This wil be your starting position.

While keping the uper arms stationary, curl the weight up as high as you can while squezing the biceps. Breathe out as you perform this portion of the movement. Tip: Only the forearms should move. Do not swing the arms.
After a second contraction, slowly go back to the starting position as you inhale. Tip: Make sure that you go al of the way down.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Barbell Deadlift
directions: Stand in front of a loaded barbel.

While keping the back as straight as posible, bend your knes, bend forward and grasp the bar using a medium (shoulder width) overhand grip. This wil be the starting position of the exercise. Tip: If it is dificult to hold on to the bar with this grip, alternate your grip or use wrist straps.

While holding the bar, start the lift by pushing with your legs while simultaneously geting your torso to the upright position as you breathe out. In the upright position, stick your chest out and contract the back by bringing the shoulder blades back. Think of how the soldiers in the military lok when they are in standing in atention.

Go back to the starting position by bending at the knes while simultaneously leaning the torso forward at the waist while keping the back straight. When the weights on the bar touch the flor you are back at the starting position and ready to perform another repetition.
Perform the amount of repetitions prescribed in the program.
This is not an exercise to be taken lightly. If you have back isues, substitute it for a rowing motion instead.
If you have a healthy back, ensure perfect form and never round the back as this can cause back injury. Be cautious as wel with the weight used; in case of doubt, use les weight rather than more.

name: Barbell Full Squat
directions: This exercise is best performed inside a squat rack for safety purposes. To begin, first set the bar on a rack just above shoulder level. Once the corect height is chosen and the bar is loaded, step under the bar and place the back of your shoulders (slightly below the neck) acros it.
Hold on to the bar using both arms at each side and lift it of the rack by first pushing with your legs and at the same time straightening your torso.

Step away from the rack and position your legs using a shoulder-width medium stance with the toes slightly pointed out. Kep your head up at al times and maintain a straight back. This wil be your starting position.

Begin to slowly lower the bar by bending the knes and siting back with your hips as you maintain a straight posture with the head up. Continue down until your hamstrings are on your calves. Inhale as you perform this portion of the movement.
Begin to raise the bar as you exhale by pushing the flor with the hel or midle of your fot as you straighten the legs and extend the hips to go back to the starting position.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Barbell Glute Bridge
directions: Begin seated on the ground with a loaded barbel over your legs. Using a fat bar or having a pad on the bar can greatly reduce the discomfort caused by this exercise. Rol the bar so that it is directly above your hips, and lay down flat on the flor.
Begin the movement by driving through with your hels, extending your hips verticaly through the bar. Your weight should be suported by your uper back and the hels of your fet.
Extend as far as posible, then reverse the motion to return to the starting position.

name: Barbell Guillotine Bench Press
directions: Using a medium width grip (a grip that creates a 90-degre angle in the midle of the movement betwen the forearms and the uper arms), lift the bar from the rack and hold it straight over your neck with your arms locked. This wil be your starting position.
As you breathe in, bring the bar down slowly until it is about 1 inch from your neck.

After a second pause, bring the bar back to the starting position as you breathe out and push the bar using your chest muscles. Lock your arms and squeze your chest in the contracted position, hold for a second and then start coming down slowly again. It should take at least twice as long to go down than to come up.
Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.
When you are done, place the bar back in the rack.
It is advised that you use a spoter for this exercise. If no spoter is available, then be very conservative with the amount of weight used.
Also, beware of leting the bar drift to far forward. You want the bar to be about 1 inch from your neck and nowhere else.
You should be in ful control of the barbel at al times.

name: Barbell Hack Squat
directions: Stand up straight while holding a barbel behind you at arms length and your fet at shoulder width. Tip: A shoulder width grip is best with the palms of your hands facing back. You can use wrist wraps for this exercise for a beter grip. This wil be your starting position.
While keping your head and eyes up and back straight, squat until your uper thighs are paralel to the flor. Breathe in as you slowly go down.
Presing mainly with the hel of the fot and squezing the thighs, go back up as you breathe out.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Barbell Hip Thrust
directions: Begin seated on the ground with a bench directly behind you. Have a loaded barbel over your legs. Using a fat bar or having a pad on the bar can greatly reduce the discomfort caused by this exercise.
Rol the bar so that it is directly above your hips, and lean back against the bench so that your shoulder blades are near the top of it.

Begin the movement by driving through your fet, extending your hips verticaly through the bar. Your weight should be suported by your shoulder blades and your fet. Extend as far as posible, then reverse the motion to return to the starting position.

name: Barbell Incline Bench Press - Medium Grip
directions: Lie back on an incline bench. Using a medium-width grip (a grip that creates a 90-degre angle in the midle of the movement betwen the forearms and the uper arms), lift the bar from the rack and hold it straight over you with your arms locked. This wil be your starting position.
As you breathe in, come down slowly until you fel the bar on you uper chest.

After a second pause, bring the bar back to the starting position as you breathe out and push the bar using your chest muscles. Lock your arms in the contracted position, squeze your chest, hold for a second and then start coming down slowly again. Tip: it should take at least twice as long to go down than to come up.
Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.
When you are done, place the bar back in the rack.

name: Barbell Incline Shoulder Raise
directions: Lie back on an Incline Bench. Using a medium width grip (a grip that is slightly wider than shoulder width), lift the bar from the rack and hold it straight over you with your arms straight. This wil be your starting position.
While keping the arms straight, lift the bar by protracting your shoulder blades, raising the shoulders from the bench as you breathe out.
Bring back the bar to the starting position as you breathe in.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Barbell Lunge
directions: This exercise is best performed inside a squat rack for safety purposes. To begin, first set the bar on a rack just below shoulder level. Once the corect height is chosen and the bar is loaded, step under the bar and place the back of your shoulders (slightly below the neck) acros it.
Hold on to the bar using both arms at each side and lift it of the rack by first pushing with your legs and at the same time straightening your torso.

Step away from the rack and step forward with your right leg and squat down through your hips, while keping the torso upright and maintaining balance. Inhale as you go down. Note: Do not alow your kne to go forward beyond your toes as you come down, as this wil put undue stres on the kne joint. li>
Using mainly the hel of your fot, push up and go back to the starting position as you exhale.
Repeat the movement for the recomended amount of repetitions and then perform with the left leg.
One way is to alternate each leg. For instance do one repetition with the right, then the left, then the right and so on.

The other way is to do what I cal a static lunge where your starting position is with one of your fet already forward. In this case, you just go up and down from that starting position until you are done with the recomended amount of repetitions. Then you switch legs and do the same.

A more chalenging version is the walking lunges where you walk acros the rom but in a lunging fashion. For walking lunges the leg being left back has to be brought forward after the lunging action has hapened in order to continue moving ahead. This version is reserved for the most advanced athletes.

name: Barbell Rear Delt Row
directions: Stand up straight while holding a barbel using a wide (higher than shoulder width) and overhand (palms facing your body) grip.

Bend knes slightly and bend over as you kep the natural arch of your back. Let the arms hang in front of you as they hold the bar. Once your torso is paralel to the flor, flare the elbows out and away from your body. Tip: Your torso and your arms should resemble the leter "T". Now you are ready to begin the exercise.

While keping the uper arms perpendicular to the torso, pul the barbel up towards your uper chest as you squeze the rear delts and you breathe out. Tip: When performed corectly, this exercise should resemble a bench pres in reverse. Also, refrain from using your biceps to do the work. Focus on targeting the rear delts; the arms should only act as hoks.
Slowly go back to the initial position as you breathe in.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Barbell Rollout from Bench
directions: Place a loaded barbel on the ground, near the end of a bench. Knel with both legs on the bench, and take a medium to narow grip on the barbel. This wil be your starting position.
To begin, extend through the hips to slowly rol the bar forward. As you rol out, flex the shoulder to rol the bar above your head. Ensure that your arms remain extended throughout the movement.
When the bar has ben moved as far forward as posible, return to the starting position.

name: Barbell Seated Calf Raise
directions: Place a block about 12 inches in front of a flat bench.
Sit on the bench and place the bal of your fet on the block.
Have someone place a barbel over your uper thighs about 3 inches above your knes and hold it there. This wil be your starting position.
Raise up on your toes as high as posible as you squeze the calves and as you breathe out.
After a second contraction, slowly go back to the starting position. Tip: To get maximum benefit stretch your calves as far as you can.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Barbell Shoulder Press
directions: Sit on a bench with back suport in a squat rack. Position a barbel at a height that is just above your head. Grab the barbel with a pronated grip (palms facing forward).

Once you pick up the barbel with the corect grip width, lift the bar up over your head by locking your arms. Hold at about shoulder level and slightly in front of your head. This is your starting position.
Lower the bar down to the shoulders slowly as you inhale.
Lift the bar back up to the starting position as you exhale.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.
This exercise can also be performed standing.

name: Barbell Shrug
directions: Stand up straight with your fet at shoulder width as you hold a barbel with both hands in front of you using a pronated grip (palms facing the thighs). Tip: Your hands should be a litle wider than shoulder width apart. You can use wrist wraps for this exercise for a beter grip. This wil be your starting position.
Raise your shoulders up as far as you can go as you breathe out and hold the contraction for a second. Tip: Refrain from trying to lift the barbel by using your biceps.
Slowly return to the starting position as you breathe in.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Barbell Shrug Behind The Back
directions: Stand up straight with your fet at shoulder width as you hold a barbel with both hands behind your back using a pronated grip (palms facing back). Tip: Your hands should be a litle wider than shoulder width apart. You can use wrist wraps for this exercise for beter grip. This wil be your starting position.

Raise your shoulders up as far as you can go as you breathe out and hold the contraction for a second. Tip: Refrain from trying to lift the barbel by using your biceps. The arms should remain stretched out at al times.
Slowly return to the starting position as you breathe in.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Barbell Side Bend
directions: Stand up straight while holding a barbel placed on the back of your shoulders (slightly below the neck). Your fet should be shoulder width apart. This wil be your starting position.

While keping your back straight and your head up, bend only at the waist to the right as far as posible. Breathe in as you bend to the side. Then hold for a second and come back up to the starting position as you exhale. Tip: Kep the rest of the body stationary.
Now repeat the movement but bending to the left instead. Hold for a second and come back to the starting position.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Barbell Side Split Squat
directions: Stand up straight while holding a barbel placed on the back of your shoulders (slightly below the neck). Your fet should be placed wide apart with the fot of the lead leg angled out to the side. This wil be your starting position.
Lower your body towards the side of your angled fot by bending the kne and hip of your lead leg and while keping the oposite leg only slightly bent. Breathe in as you lower your body.
Return to the starting position by extending the hip and kne of the lead leg. Breathe out as you perform this movement.
After performing the recomended amount of reps, repeat the movement with the oposite leg.

name: Barbell Squat
directions: This exercise is best performed inside a squat rack for safety purposes. To begin, first set the bar on a rack to just below shoulder level. Once the corect height is chosen and the bar is loaded, step under the bar and place the back of your shoulders (slightly below the neck) acros it.
Hold on to the bar using both arms at each side and lift it of the rack by first pushing with your legs and at the same time straightening your torso.

Step away from the rack and position your legs using a shoulder width medium stance with the toes slightly pointed out. Kep your head up at al times and also maintain a straight back. This wil be your starting position. (Note: For the purposes of this discusion we wil use the medium stance described above which targets overal development; however you can chose any of the thre stances discused in the fot stances section).

Begin to slowly lower the bar by bending the knes and hips as you maintain a straight posture with the head up. Continue down until the angle betwen the uper leg and the calves becomes slightly les than 90-degres. Inhale as you perform this portion of the movement. Tip: If you performed the exercise corectly, the front of the knes should make an imaginary straight line with the toes that is perpendicular to the front. If your knes are past that imaginary line (if they are past your toes) then you are placing undue stres on the kne and the exercise has ben performed incorectly.
Begin to raise the bar as you exhale by pushing the flor with the hel of your fot as you straighten the legs again and go back to the starting position.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Barbell Squat To A Bench
directions: This exercise is best performed inside a squat rack for safety purposes. To begin, first place a flat bench or a box behind you. The flat bench is used to teach you to set your hips back and to hit depth.

Then, set the bar on a rack that best matches your height. Once the corect height is chosen and the bar is loaded, step under the bar and place the back of your shoulders (slightly below the neck) acros it.
Hold on to the bar using both arms at each side and lift it of the rack by first pushing with your legs and at the same time straightening your torso.

Step away from the rack and position your legs using a shoulder width medium stance with the toes slightly pointed out. Kep your head up at al times as loking down wil get you of balance and also maintain a straight back. This wil be your starting position. (Note: For the purposes of this discusion we wil use the medium stance described above which targets overal development; however you can chose any of the thre stances discused in the fot stances section).

Begin to slowly lower the bar by bending the knes and siting your hips back as you maintain a straight posture with the head up. Continue down until you slightly touch the bench behind you. Inhale as you perform this portion of the movement. Tip: If you performed the exercise corectly, the front of the knes should make an imaginary straight line with the toes that is perpendicular to the front. If your knes are past that imaginary line (if they are past your toes) then you are placing undue stres on the kne and the exercise has ben performed incorectly.
Begin to raise the bar as you exhale by pushing the flor with the hel of your fot as you straighten the legs and extend the hips to go back to the starting position.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Barbell Step Ups
directions: Stand up straight while holding a barbel placed on the back of your shoulders (slightly below the neck) and stand upright behind an elevated platform (such as the one used for spoting behind a flat bench). This is your starting position.

Place the right fot on the elevated platform. Step on the platform by extending the hip and the kne of your right leg. Use the hel mainly to lift the rest of your body up and place the fot of the left leg on the platform as wel. Breathe out as you execute the force required to come up.

Step down with the left leg by flexing the hip and kne of the right leg as you inhale. Return to the original standing position by placing the right fot of to next to the left fot on the initial position.
Repeat with the right leg for the recomended amount of repetitions and then perform with the left leg.

name: Barbell Walking Lunge
directions: Begin standing with your fet shoulder width apart and a barbel acros your uper back.

Step forward with one leg, flexing the knes to drop your hips. Descend until your rear kne nearly touches the ground. Your posture should remain upright, and your front kne should stay above the front fot.
Drive through the hel of your lead fot and extend both knes to raise yourself back up.
Step forward with your rear fot, repeating the lunge on the oposite leg.

name: Battling Ropes
directions: For this exercise you wil ned a heavy rope anchored at its center 15-20 fet away. Standing in front of the rope, take an end in each hand with your arms extended at your side. This wil be your starting position.
Initiate the movement by rapidly raising one arm to shoulder level as quickly as you can.
As you let that arm drop to the starting position, raise the oposite side.
Continue alternating your left and right arms, whiping the ropes up and down as fast as you can.

name: Bear Crawl Sled Drags
directions: Wearing either a harnes or a lose weight belt, atach the chain to the back so that you wil be facing away from the sled. Bend down so that your hands are on the ground. Your back should be flat and knes bent. This is your starting position.
Begin by driving with legs, alternating left and right. Use your hands to maintain balance and to help pul. Try to kep your back flat as you move over a given distance.

name: Behind Head Chest Stretch
directions: Sit upright on the flor with your partner behind you.
Place your hands behind your hand, and push your elbows back as far as you can. Your partner should hold your elbows. This wil be your starting position.
Gently atempt to pul your elbows forward with your hands stil behind your head for 10 or more seconds. Your partner should prevent your elbows from moving.

Now, relax your muscles and have your partner gently pul the elbows back as far as it comfortable for you. Be sure to let your partner know when the stretch is adequate to prevent overstretching or injury.

name: Bench Dips
directions: For this exercise you wil ned to place a bench behind your back. With the bench perpendicular to your body, and while loking away from it, hold on to the bench on its edge with the hands fuly extended, separated at shoulder width. The legs wil be extended forward, bent at the waist and perpendicular to your torso. This wil be your starting position.

Slowly lower your body as you inhale by bending at the elbows until you lower yourself far enough to where there is an angle slightly smaler than 90 degres betwen the uper arm and the forearm. Tip: Kep the elbows as close as posible throughout the movement. Forearms should always be pointing down.
Using your triceps to bring your torso up again, lift yourself back to the starting position.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Bench Jump
directions: Begin with a box or bench 1-2 fet in front of you. Stand with your fet shoulder width apart. This wil be your starting position.
Perform a short squat in preparation for the jump; swing your arms behind you.
Rebound out of this position, extending through the hips, knes, and ankles to jump as high as posible. Swing your arms forward and up.
Jump over the bench, landing with the knes bent, absorbing the impact through the legs.
Turn around and face the oposite direction, then jump back over the bench.

name: Bench Press - Powerlifting
directions: Begin by lying on the bench, geting your head beyond the bar if posible. Tuck your fet underneath you and arch your back. Using the bar to help suport your weight, lift your shoulder of the bench and retract them, squezing the shoulder blades together. Use your fet to drive your traps into the bench. Maintain this tight body position throughout the movement.
However wide your grip, it should cover the ring on the bar. Pul the bar out of the rack without protracting your shoulders. Focus on squezing the bar and trying to pul it apart.
Lower the bar to your lower chest or uper stomach. The bar, wrist, and elbow should stay in line at al times.
Pause when the barbel touches your torso, and then drive the bar up with as much force as posible. The elbows should be tucked in until lockout.

name: Bench Press - With Bands
directions: Using a flat bench secure a band under the leg of the bench that is nearest to your head.
Once the band is secure, grab it by both handles and lie down on the bench.
Extend your arms so that you are holding the band handles in front of you at shoulder width.
Once at shoulder width, rotate your wrists forward so that the palms of your hands are facing away from you. This wil be your starting position.
Bring down the handles slowly until your elbow forms a 90 degre angle. Kep ful control at al times.

As you breathe out, bring the handles up using your pectoral muscles. Lock your arms in the contracted position, squeze your chest, hold for a second and then start coming down slowly. Tip: It should take at least twice as long to go down than to come up.
Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions of your training program.

name: Bench Press with Chains
directions: Adjust the leader chain, shortening it to the desired length.Place the chains on the sleves of the bar.

Lying on the bench, get your head beyond the bar if posible. Tuck your fet underneath you and arch your back. Using the bar to help suport your weight, lift your shoulder of the bench and retract them, squezing the shoulder blades together. Use your fet to drive your traps into the bench. Maintain this tight body position throughout the movement. However wide your grip, it should cover the ring on the bar.

Pul the bar out of the rack without protracting your shoulders. Focus on squezing the bar and trying to pul it apart. Lower the bar to your lower chest or uper stomach. The bar, wrist, and elbow should stay in line at al times.
Pause when the barbel touches your torso, and then drive the bar up with as much force as posible. The elbows should be tucked in until lockout.

name: Bench Sprint
directions: Stand on the ground with one fot resting on a bench or box with your hel close to the edge.
Push of with your fot on top of the bench, extending through the hip and kne.
Land with the oposite fot on top of the box, returning your other fot back to the start position.
Continue alternating from one fot to another to complete the set.

name: Bent Over Barbell Row
directions: Holding a barbel with a pronated grip (palms facing down), bend your knes slightly and bring your torso forward, by bending at the waist, while keping the back straight until it is almost paralel to the flor. Tip: Make sure that you kep the head up. The barbel should hang directly in front of you as your arms hang perpendicular to the flor and your torso. This is your starting position.

Now, while keping the torso stationary, breathe out and lift the barbel to you. Kep the elbows close to the body and only use the forearms to hold the weight. At the top contracted position, squeze the back muscles and hold for a brief pause.
Then inhale and slowly lower the barbel back to the starting position.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Bent Over Dumbbell Rear Delt Raise With Head On Bench
directions: Stand up straight while holding a dumbel in each hand and with an incline bench in front of you.

While keping your back straight and maintaining the natural arch of your back, lean forward until your forehead touches the bench in front of you. Let the arms hang in front of you perpendicular to the ground. The palms of your hands should be facing each other and your torso should be paralel to the flor. This wil be your starting position.

Keping your torso forward and stationary, and the arms straight with a slight bend at the elbows, lift the dumbels straight to the side until both arms are paralel to the flor. Exhale as you lift the weights. Caution: avoid swinging the torso or bringing the arms back as oposed to the side.
After a one second contraction at the top, slowly lower the dumbels back to the starting position.
Repeat the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Bent Over Low-Pulley Side Lateral
directions: Select a weight and hold the handle of the low puley with your right hand.

Bend at the waist until your torso is nearly paralel to the flor. Your legs should be slightly bent with your left hand placed on your lower left thigh. Your right arm should be hanging from your shoulder in front of you and with a slight bend at the elbow. This wil be your starting position.
Raise your right arm, elbow slightly bent, to the side until the arm is paralel to the flor and in line with your right ear. Breathe out as you perform this step.
Slowly lower the weight back to the starting position as you breathe in.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions and repeat the movement with the other arm.

name: Bent Over One-Arm Long Bar Row
directions: Put weight on one of the ends of an Olympic barbel. Make sure that you either place the other end of the barbel in the corner of two wals; or put a heavy object on the ground so the barbel canot slide backward.
Bend forward until your torso is as close to paralel with the flor as you can and kep your knes slightly bent.
Now grab the bar with one arm just behind the plates on the side where the weight was placed and put your other hand on your kne. This wil be your starting position.

Pul the bar straight up with your elbow in (to maximize back stimulation) until the plates touch your lower chest. Squeze the back muscles as you lift the weight up and hold for a second at the top of the movement. Breathe out as you lift the weight. Tip: Do not alow for any swinging of the torso. Only the arm should move.

Slowly lower the bar to the starting position geting a nice stretch on the lats. Tip: Do not let the plates touch the flor. To ensure the best range of motion, I recomend using smal plates (25-lb ones) as oposed to larger plates (like 35-45lb ones).
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions and switch arms.

name: Bent Over Two-Arm Long Bar Row
directions: Put weight on one of the ends of an Olympic barbel. Make sure that you either place the other end of the barbel in the corner of two wals; or put a heavy object on the ground so the barbel canot slide backward.
Bend forward until your torso is as close to paralel with the flor as you can and kep your knes slightly bent.
Now grab the bar with both arms just behind the plates on the side where the weight was placed and put your other hand on your kne. This wil be your starting position.

Pul the bar straight up with your elbows in (to maximize back stimulation) until the plates touch your lower chest. Squeze the back muscles as you lift the weight up and hold for a second at the top of the movement. Breathe out as you lift the weight. Tip: Use a stirup or double handle cable atachment by hoking it under the end of the bar.

Slowly lower the bar to the starting position geting a nice stretch on the lats. Tip: Do not let the plates touch the flor. To ensure the best range of motion, I recomend using smal plates (25-lb ones) as oposed to larger plates (like 35-45lb ones).
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Bent Over Two-Dumbbell Row
directions: With a dumbel in each hand (palms facing your torso), bend your knes slightly and bring your torso forward by bending at the waist; as you bend make sure to kep your back straight until it is almost paralel to the flor. Tip: Make sure that you kep the head up. The weights should hang directly in front of you as your arms hang perpendicular to the flor and your torso. This is your starting position.

While keping the torso stationary, lift the dumbels to your side (as you breathe out), keping the elbows close to the body (do not exert any force with the forearm other than holding the weights). On the top contracted position, squeze the back muscles and hold for a second.
Slowly lower the weight again to the starting position as you inhale.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.
This exercise is not recomended for people with back problems. A Low Puley Row is a beter choice for people with back isues.
Ensure perfect form and never round the back as this can promote back injury.
Be cautious with the weight used; in case of doubt, use les weight rather than more.

name: Bent Over Two-Dumbbell Row With Palms In
directions: With a dumbel in each hand (palms facing each other), bend your knes slightly and bring your torso forward, by bending at the waist, while keping the back straight until it is almost paralel to the flor. Tip: Make sure that you kep the head up. The weights should hang directly in front of you as your arms hang perpendicular to the flor and your torso. This is your starting position.

While keping the torso stationary, lift the dumbels to your side as you breathe out, squezing your shoulder blades together. On the top contracted position, squeze the back muscles and hold for a second.
Slowly lower the weight again to the starting position as you inhale.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.
This exercise is not recomended for people with back problems. A Low Puley Row is a beter choice for people with back isues.
Ensure perfect form and never round the back as this can cause back injury.
Be cautious as wel with the weight used; in case of doubt, use les weight rather than more.

name: Bent Press
directions: Clean a ketlebel to your shoulder. Clean the ketlebel to your shoulders by extending through the legs and hips as you raise the ketlebel towards your shoulder. The wrist should rotate as you do so. This wil be your starting position.

Begin my leaning to the side oposite the ketlebel, continuing until you are able to touch the ground with your fre hand, keping your eyes on the ketlebel. As you do so, pres the weight verticaly be extending through the elbow, keping your arm perpendicular to the ground.
Return to an upright position, with the ketlebel above your head. Return the ketlebel to the shoulder and repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Bent-Arm Barbell Pullover
directions: Lie on a flat bench with a barbel using a shoulder grip width.
Hold the bar straight over your chest with a bend in your arms. This wil be your starting position.
While keping your arms in the bent arm position, lower the weight slowly in an arc behind your head while breathing in until you fel a stretch on the chest.
At that point, bring the barbel back to the starting position using the arc through which the weight was lowered and exhale as you perform this movement.
Hold the weight on the initial position for a second and repeat the motion for the prescribed number of repetitions.
You can perform this exercise using a dumbel or an E-Z bar instead of dumbels.

name: Bent-Arm Dumbbell Pullover
directions: Place a dumbel standing up on a flat bench.

Ensuring that the dumbel stays securely placed at the top of the bench, lie perpendicular to the bench (torso acros it as in forming a cros) with only your shoulders lying on the surface. Hips should be below the bench and legs bent with fet firmly on the flor. The head wil be of the bench as wel.

Grasp the dumbel with both hands and hold it straight over your chest with a bend in your arms. Both palms should be presing against the underside one of the sides of the dumbel. This wil be your starting position. Caution: Always ensure that the dumbel used for this exercise is secure. Using a dumbel with lose plates can result in the dumbel faling apart and faling on your face.
While keping your arms locked in the bent arm position, lower the weight slowly in an arc behind your head while breathing in until you fel a stretch on the chest.
At that point, bring the dumbel back to the starting position using the arc through which the weight was lowered and exhale as you perform this movement.
Hold the weight on the initial position for a second and repeat the motion for the prescribed number of repetitions.
You can perform this exercise using a barbel or an e-z bar instead of dumbels.
Also, if using dumbels like Powerblocks, just use a dumbel on each hand with the palms of your hands facing each other.

name: Bent-Knee Hip Raise
directions: Lay flat on the flor with your arms next to your sides.
Now bend your knes at around a 75 degre angle and lift your fet of the flor by around 2 inches.

Using your lower abs, bring your knes in towards you as you maintain the 75 degre angle bend in your legs. Continue this movement until you raise your hips of of the flor by roling your pelvis backward. Breathe out as you perform this portion of the movement. Tip: At the end of the movement your knes wil be over your chest.
Squeze your abs at the top of the movement for a second and then return to the starting position slowly as you breathe in. Tip: Maintain a controled motion at al times.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Bicycling
directions: To begin, seat yourself on the bike and adjust the seat to your height.

name: Bicycling, Stationary
directions: To begin, seat yourself on the bike and adjust the seat to your height.

Select the desired option from the menu. You may have to start pedaling to turn it on. You can use the manual seting, or you can select a program to use. Typicaly, you can enter your age and weight to estimate the amount of calories burned during exercise. The level of resistance can be changed throughout the workout. The handles can be used to monitor your heart rate to help you stay at an apropriate intensity.

name: Board Press
directions: Begin by lying on the bench, geting your head beyond the bar if posible. One to five boards, made out of 2x6's, can be screwed together and held in place by a training partner, bands, or just tucked under your shirt.

Tuck your fet underneath you and arch your back. Using the bar to help suport your weight, lift your shoulder of the bench and retract them, squezing the shoulder blades together. Use your fet to drive your traps into the bench. Maintain this tight body position throughout the movement.

You can take a standard bench grip, or shoulder width to focus on the triceps. Pul the bar out of the rack without protracting your shoulders. The bar, wrist, and elbow should stay in line at al times. Focus on squezing the bar and trying to pul it apart.
Lower the bar to the boards, and then drive the bar up with as much force as posible. The elbows should be tucked in until lockout.

name: Body Tricep Press
directions: Position a bar in a rack at chest height.
Standing, take a shoulder width grip on the bar and step a yard or two back, fet together and arms extended so that you are leaning on the bar. This wil be your starting position.
Begin by flexing the elbow, lowering yourself towards the bar.
Pause, and then reverse the motion by extending the elbows.
Progres from bodyweight by ading chains over your shoulders.

name: Body-Up
directions: Asume a plank position on the ground. You should be suporting your bodyweight on your toes and forearms, keping your torso straight. Your forearms should be shoulder-width apart. This wil be your starting position.
Presing your palms firmly into the ground, extend through the elbows to raise your body from the ground. Kep your torso rigid as you perform the movement.
Slowly lower your forearms back to the ground by alowing the elbows to flex.
Repeat.

name: Bodyweight Flyes
directions: Position two equaly loaded EZ bars on the ground next to each other. Ensure they are able to rol.
Asume a push-up position over the bars, suporting your weight on your toes and hands with your arms extended and body straight.
Place your hands on the bars. This wil be your starting position.
Using a slow and controled motion, move your hands away from the midline of your body, roling the bars apart. Inhale during this portion of the motion.
After moving the bars as far apart as you can, return to the starting position by puling them back together. Exhale as you perform this movement.

name: Bodyweight Mid Row
directions: Begin by taking a medium to wide grip on a pul-up aparatus with your palms facing away from you. From a hanging position, tuck your knes to your chest, leaning back and geting your legs over your side of the pul-up aparatus. This wil be your starting position.
Begining with your arms straight, flex the elbows and retract the shoulder blades to raise your body up until your legs contact the pul-up aparatus.
After a brief pause, return to the starting position.

name: Bodyweight Squat
directions: Stand with your fet shoulder width apart. You can place your hands behind your head. This wil be your starting position.
Begin the movement by flexing your knes and hips, siting back with your hips.
Continue down to ful depth if you are able,and quickly reverse the motion until you return to the starting position. As you squat, kep your head and chest up and push your knes out.

name: Bodyweight Walking Lunge
directions: Begin standing with your fet shoulder width apart and your hands on your hips.

Step forward with one leg, flexing the knes to drop your hips. Descend until your rear kne nearly touches the ground. Your posture should remain upright, and your front kne should stay above the front fot.
Drive through the hel of your lead fot and extend both knes to raise yourself back up.
Step forward with your rear fot, repeating the lunge on the oposite leg.

name: Bosu Ball Cable Crunch With Side Bends
directions: Conect a standard handle to each arm of a cable machine, and position them in the most downward position.
Grab a Bosu Bal and position it in front and center of the cable machine.
Lie down on the Bosu Bal with the smal of your back arched around the bal. Your rear end should be close to the flor without touching it.
With both hands, reach back and grab the handle of each cable.
With your fet positioned in a wide stance, extend your arms straight out in front of you and in betwen your knes. Your hands should be at kne level.
Kep your arms straight and in-line with the upward angle of the cable. Elevate your torso in a crunching motion without droping or bending your arms.
Maintain the rigid position with your arms. Slowly descend back to the starting position with your back arched around the Bosu Bal and your abdominals elongated.
Repeat the same series of movements to failure.
Once you reach failure, kep your abs tight and raise your torso into plank position so your back is elevated of the Bosu Bal.
Lower your arms down to your side; kep them straight. Start doing alternating side bends; reach for your hels! This finishing movement wil focus on your obliques.

name: Bottoms Up
directions: Begin by lying on your back on the ground. Your legs should be straight and your arms at your side. This wil be your starting position.

To perform the movement, tuck the knes toward your chest by flexing the hips and knes. Folowing this, extend your legs directly above you so that they are perpendicular to the ground. Rotate and elevate your pelvis to raise your glutes from the flor.
After a brief pause, return to the starting position.

name: Bottoms-Up Clean From The Hang Position
directions: Initiate the exercise by standing upright with a ketlebel in one hand.

Swing the ketlebel back forcefuly and then reverse the motion forcefuly.
Crush the ketlebel handle as hard as posible and raise the ketlebel to your shoulder.

name: Box Jump (Multiple Response)
directions: Asume a relaxed stance facing the box or platform aproximately an arm's length away. Arms should be down at the sides and legs slightly bent.
Using the arms to aid in the initial burst, jump upward and forward, landing with fet simultaneously on top of the box or platform.
Imediately drop or jump back down to the original starting place; then repeat the sequence.

name: Box Skip
directions: You wil ned several boxes lined up about 8 fet apart.
Begin facing the first box with one leg slightly behind the other.
Drive of the back leg, atempting to gain as much height with the hips as posible.

Imediately upon landing on the box, drive the other leg forward and upward to gain height and distance, leaping from the box. Land betwen the first two boxes with the same leg that landed on the first box.
Then, step to the next box and repeat.

name: Box Squat
directions: The box squat alows you to squat to desired depth and develop explosive strength in the squat movement. Begin in a power rack with a box at the apropriate height behind you. Typicaly, you would aim for a box height that brings you to a paralel squat, but you can train higher or lower if desired.

Begin by steping under the bar and placing it acros the back of the shoulders. Squeze your shoulder blades together and rotate your elbows forward, atempting to bend the bar acros your shoulders. Remove the bar from the rack, creating a tight arch in your lower back, and step back into position. Place your fet wider for more emphasis on the back, glutes, aductors, and hamstrings, or closer together for more quad development. Kep your head facing forward.

With your back, shoulders, and core tight, push your knes and but out and you begin your descent. Sit back with your hips until you are seated on the box. Idealy, your shins should be perpendicular to the ground. Pause when you reach the box, and relax the hip flexors. Never bounce of of a box.
Keping the weight on your hels and pushing your fet and knes out, drive upward of of the box as you lead the movement with your head. Continue upward, maintaining tightnes head to toe.

name: Box Squat with Bands
directions: Begin in a power rack with a box at the apropriate height behind you. Set up the bands on the sleves, secured to either band pegs, the rack, or dumbels so that there is apropriate tension. If dumbels are used, secure them so that they don't move. Also, ensure that the dumbels you are using are heavy enough for the bands that you are using. Aditional plates can be used to hold the dumbels down. If more tension is neded, you can either widen the base on the flor or choke the bands. Typicaly, you would aim for a box height that brings you to a paralel squat, but you can train higher or lower if desired.

Begin by steping under the bar and placing it acros the back of the shoulders. Squeze your shoulder blades together and rotate your elbows forward, atempting to bend the bar acros your shoulders. Remove the bar from the rack, creating a tight arch in your lower back, and step back into position. Place your fet wider for more emphasis on the back, glutes, aductors, and hamstrings, or closer together for more quad development. Kep your head facing forward.

With your back, shoulders, and core tight, push your knes and but out and you begin your descent. Sit back with your hips until you are seated on the box. Idealy, your shins should be perpendicular to the ground. Pause when you reach the box, and relax the hip flexors. Never bounce of of a box.

Keping the weight on your hels and pushing your fet and knes out, drive upward of of the box as you lead the movement with your head. Continue upward, maintaining tightnes head to toe. Use care to return the barbel to the rack.

name: Box Squat with Chains
directions: Begin in a power rack with a box at the apropriate height behind you. Typicaly, you would aim for a box height that brings you to a paralel squat, but you can train higher or lower if desired.

To set up the chains, begin by loping the leader chain over the sleves of the bar. The heavy chain should be atached using a snap hok. Adjust the length of the lead chain so that a few links are stil on the flor at the top of the movement.

Begin by steping under the bar and placing it acros the back of the shoulders. Squeze your shoulder blades together and rotate your elbows forward, atempting to bend the bar acros your shoulders. Remove the bar from the rack, creating a tight arch in your lower back, and step back into position. Place your fet wider for more emphasis on the back, glutes, aductors, and hamstrings, or closer together for more quad development. Kep your head facing forward.

With your back, shoulders, and core tight, push your knes and but out and you begin your descent. Sit back with your hips until you are seated on the box. Idealy, your shins should be perpendicular to the ground. Pause when you reach the box, and relax the hip flexors. Never bounce of of a box.
Keping the weight on your hels and pushing your fet and knes out, drive upward of of the box as you lead the movement with your head. Continue upward, maintaining tightnes head to toe.

name: Brachialis-SMR
directions: Lie on your side, with your uper arm against the foam roler. The uper arm should be more or les aligned with your body, with the outside of the bicep presed against the foam roler.
Raise your hips of of the flor, suporting your weight on your arm and on your fet. Hold for 10-30 seconds, and then switch sides.

name: Bradford/Rocky Presses
directions: Sit on a Military Pres Bench with a bar at shoulder level with a pronated grip (palms facing forward). Tip: Your grip should be wider than shoulder width and it should create a 90-degre angle betwen the forearm and the uper arm as the barbel goes down. This is your starting position.
Once you pick up the barbel with the corect grip, lift the bar up over your head by locking your arms.
Now lower the bar down to the back of the head slowly as you inhale.
Lift the bar back up to the starting position as you exhale.
Lower the bar down to the starting position slowly as you inhale. This is one repetition.
Alternate in this maner until you complete the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Butt Lift (Bridge)
directions: Lie flat on the flor on your back with the hands by your side and your knes bent. Your fet should be placed around shoulder width. This wil be your starting position.
Pushing mainly with your hels, lift your hips of the flor while keping your back straight. Breathe out as you perform this part of the motion and hold at the top for a second.
Slowly go back to the starting position as you breathe in.

name: Butt-Ups
directions: Begin a pushup position but with your elbows on the ground and resting on your forearms. Your arms should be bent at a 90 degre angle.
Arch your back slightly out rather than keping your back completely straight.

Raise your glutes toward the ceiling, squezing your abs tightly to close the distance betwen your ribcage and hips. The end result wil be that youl end up in a high bridge position. Exhale as you perform this portion of the movement.
Lower back down slowly to your starting position as you breathe in. Tip: Don't let your back sag downwards.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Butterfly
directions: Sit on the machine with your back flat on the pad.
Take hold of the handles. Tip: Your uper arms should be positioned paralel to the flor; adjust the machine acordingly. This wil be your starting position.
Push the handles together slowly as you squeze your chest in the midle. Breathe out during this part of the motion and hold the contraction for a second.
Return back to the starting position slowly as you inhale until your chest muscles are fuly stretched.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Cable Chest Press
directions: Adjust the weight to an apropriate amount and be seated, grasping the handles. Your uper arms should be about 45 degres to the body, with your head and chest up. The elbows should be bent to about 90 degres. This wil be your starting position.
Begin by extending through the elbow, presing the handles together straight in front of you. Kep your shoulder blades retracted as you execute the movement.
After pausing at ful extension, return to th starting position, keping tension on the cables.
You can also execute this movement with your back of the pad, at an incline or decline, or alternate hands.

name: Cable Crossover
directions: To get yourself into the starting position, place the puleys on a high position (above your head), select the resistance to be used and hold the puleys in each hand.

Step forward in front of an imaginary straight line betwen both puleys while puling your arms together in front of you. Your torso should have a smal forward bend from the waist. This wil be your starting position.

With a slight bend on your elbows in order to prevent stres at the biceps tendon, extend your arms to the side (straight out at both sides) in a wide arc until you fel a stretch on your chest. Breathe in as you perform this portion of the movement. Tip: Kep in mind that throughout the movement, the arms and torso should remain stationary; the movement should only ocur at the shoulder joint.
Return your arms back to the starting position as you breathe out. Make sure to use the same arc of motion used to lower the weights.
Hold for a second at the starting position and repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.

name: Cable Crunch
directions: Knel below a high puley that contains a rope atachment.
Grasp cable rope atachment and lower the rope until your hands are placed next to your face.
Flex your hips slightly and alow the weight to hyperextend the lower back. This wil be your starting position.

With the hips stationary, flex the waist as you contract the abs so that the elbows travel towards the midle of the thighs. Exhale as you perform this portion of the movement and hold the contraction for a second.

Slowly return to the starting position as you inhale. Tip: Make sure that you kep constant tension on the abs throughout the movement. Also, do not chose a weight so heavy that the lower back handles the brunt of the work.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Cable Deadlifts
directions: Move the cables to the botom of the towers and select an apropriate weight. Stand directly in betwen the uprights.
To begin, squat down be flexing your hips and knes until you can reach the handles.
After grasping them, begin your ascent. Driving through your hels extend your hips and knes keping your hands hanging at your side. Kep your head and chest up throughout the movement.
After reaching a ful standing position, Return to the starting position and repeat.

name: Cable Hammer Curls - Rope Attachment
directions: Atach a rope atachment to a low puley and stand facing the machine about 12 inches away from it.
Grasp the rope with a neutral (palms-in) grip and stand straight up keping the natural arch of the back and your torso stationary.
Put your elbows in by your side and kep them there stationary during the entire movement. Tip: Only the forearms should move; not your uper arms. This wil be your starting position.
Using your biceps, pul your arms up as you exhale until your biceps touch your forearms. Tip: Remember to kep the elbows in and your uper arms stationary.
After a 1 second contraction where you squeze your biceps, slowly start to bring the weight back to the original position.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Cable Hip Adduction
directions: Stand in front of a low puley facing forward with one leg next to the puley and the other one away.
Atach the ankle cuf to the cable and also to the ankle of the leg that is next to the puley.
Now step out and away from the stack with a wide stance and grasp the bar of the puley system.
Stand on the fot that does not have the ankle cuf (the far fot) and alow the leg with the cuf to be puled towards the low puley. This wil be your starting position.
Now perform the movement by moving the leg with the ankle cuf in front of the far leg by using the iner thighs to abduct the hip. Breathe out during this portion of the movement.
Slowly return to the starting position as you breathe in.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions and then repeat the same movement with the oposite leg.

name: Cable Incline Pushdown
directions: Lie on incline an bench facing away from a high puley machine that has a straight bar atachment on it.

Grasp the straight bar atachment overhead with a pronated (overhand; palms down) shoulder width grip and extend your arms in front of you. The bar should be around 2 inches away from your uper thighs. This wil be your starting position.
Keping the uper arms stationary, lift your arms back in a semi circle until the bar is straight over your head. Breathe in during this portion of the movement.
Slowly go back to the starting position using your lats and hold the contraction once you reach the starting position. Breathe out during the execution of this movement.
