Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Cable Incline Triceps Extension
directions: Lie on incline an bench facing away from a high puley machine that has a straight bar atachment on it.

Grasp the straight bar atachment overhead with a pronated (overhand; palms down) narow grip (les than shoulder width) and kep your elbows tucked in to your sides. Your uper arms should create around a 25 degre angle when measured from the flor.
Keping the uper arms stationary, extend the arms as you flex the triceps. Breathe out during this portion of the movement and hold the contraction for a second.
Slowly go back to the starting position.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Cable Internal Rotation
directions: Sit next to a low puley sideways (with legs stretched in front of you or crosed) and grasp the single hand cable atachment with the arm nearest to the cable. Tip: If you can adjust the puleys height, you can use a flat bench to sit on instead.
Position the elbow against your side with the elbow bent at 90 and the arm pointing towards the puley. This wil be your starting position.

Pul the single hand cable atachment toward your body by internaly rotating your shoulder until your forearm is acros your abs. You wil be creating an imaginary semi-circle. Tip: The forearm should be perpendicular to your torso at al times.
Slowly go back to the initial position.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions and then repeat the movement with the next arm.

name: Cable Iron Cross
directions: Begin by moving the puleys to the high position, select the resistance to be used, and take a handle in each hand.
Stand directly betwen both puleys with your arms extended out to your sides. Your head and chest should be up while your arms form a T. This wil be your starting position.
Keping the elbows extended, pul your arms straight to your sides.
Return your arms back to the starting position after a pause at the peak contraction.
Continue the movement for the prescribed number of repetitions.

name: Cable Judo Flip
directions: Conect a rope atachment to a tower, and move the cable to the lowest puley position. Stand with your side to the cable with a wide stance, and grab the rope with both hands.
Twist your body away from the puley as you bring the rope over your shoulder like youre performing a judo flip.
Shift your weight betwen your fet as you twist and crunch forward, puling the cable downward.
Return to the starting position and repeat until failure.
Then, reposition and repeat the same series of movements on the oposite side.

name: Cable Lying Triceps Extension
directions: Lie on a flat bench and grasp the straight bar atachment of a low puley with a narow overhand grip. Tip: The easiest way to do this is to have someone hand you the bar as you lay down.
With your arms extended, position the bar over your torso. Your arms and your torso should create a 90-degre angle. This wil be your starting position.
Lower the bar by bending at the elbow while keping the uper arms stationary and elbows in. Go down until the bar lightly touches your forehead. Breathe in as you perform this portion of the movement.
Flex the triceps as you lift the bar back to its starting position. Exhale as you perform this portion of the movement.
Hold for a second at the contracted position and repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Cable One Arm Tricep Extension
directions: With your right hand, grasp a single handle atached to the high-cable puley using a supinated (underhand; palms facing up) grip. You should be standing directly in front of the weight stack.

Now pul the handle down so that your uper arm and elbow are locked in to the side of your body. Your uper arm and forearm should form an acute angle (les than 90-degres). You can kep the other arm by the waist and you can have one leg in front of you and the other one back for beter balance. This wil be your starting position.

As you contract the triceps, move the single handle atachment down to your side until your arm is straight. Breathe out as you perform this movement. Tip: Only the forearms should move. Your uper arms should remain stationary at al times.
Squeze the triceps and hold for a second in this contracted position.
Slowly return the handle to the starting position.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions and then perform the same movement with the other arm.

name: Cable Preacher Curl
directions: Place a preacher bench about 2 fet in front of a puley machine.
Atach a straight bar to the low puley.
Sit at the preacher bench with your elbow and uper arms firmly on top of the bench pad and have someone hand you the bar from the low puley.
Grab the bar and fuly extend your arms on top of the preacher bench pad. This wil be your starting position.
Now start piling the weight up towards your shoulders and squeze the biceps hard at the top of the movement. Exhale as you perform this motion. Also, hold for a second at the top.
Now slowly lower the weight to the starting position.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Cable Rear Delt Fly
directions: Adjust the puleys to the apropriate height and adjust the weight. The puleys should be above your head.
Grab the left puley with your right hand and the right puley with your left hand, crosing them in front of you. This wil be your starting position.
Initiate the movement by moving your arms back and outward, keping your arms straight as you execute the movement.
Pause at the end of the motion before returning the handles to the start position.

name: Cable Reverse Crunch
directions: Conect an ankle strap atachment to a low puley cable and position a mat on the flor in front of it.
Sit down with your fet toward the puley and atach the cable to your ankles.
Lie down, elevate your legs and bend your knes at a 90-degre angle. Your legs and the cable should be aligned. If not, adjust the puley up or down until they are.
With your hands behind your head, bring your knes inward to your torso and elevate your hips of the flor.
Pause for a moment and in a slow and controled maner drop your hips and bring your legs back to the starting 90-degre angle. You should stil have tension on your abs in the resting position.
Repeat the same movement to failure.

name: Cable Rope Overhead Triceps Extension
directions: Atach a rope to the botom puley of the puley machine.

Grasping the rope with both hands, extend your arms with your hands directly above your head using a neutral grip (palms facing each other). Your elbows should be in close to your head and the arms should be perpendicular to the flor with the knuckles aimed at the ceiling. This wil be your starting position.
Slowly lower the rope behind your head as you hold the uper arms stationary. Inhale as you perform this movement and pause when your triceps are fuly stretched.
Return to the starting position by flexing your triceps as you breathe out.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Cable Rope Rear-Delt Rows
directions: Sit in the same position on a low puley row station as you would if you were doing seated cable rows for the back.
Atach a rope to the puley and grasp it with an overhand grip. Your arms should be extended and paralel to the flor with the elbows flared out.
Kep your lower back upright and slide your hips back so that your knes are slightly bent. This wil be your starting position.

Pul the cable atachment towards your uper chest, just below the neck, as you kep your elbows up and out to the sides. Continue this motion as you exhale until the elbows travel slightly behind the back. Tip: Kep your uper arms horizontal, perpendicular to the torso and paralel to the flor throughout the motion.
Go back to the initial position where the arms are extended and the shoulders are stretched forward. Inhale as you perform this portion of the movement.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Cable Russian Twists
directions: Conect a standard handle atachment, and position the cable to a midle puley position.
Lie on a stability bal perpendicular to the cable and grab the handle with one hand. You should be aproximately arms length away from the puley, with the tension of the weight on the cable.
Grab the handle with both hands and fuly extend your arms above your chest. You hands should be directly in-line with the puley. If not, adjust the puley up or down until they are.
Kep your hips elevated and abs engaged. Rotate your torso away from the puley for a ful-quarter rotation. Your body should be flat from head to knes.
Pause for a moment and in a slow and controled maner reset to the starting position. You should stil have side tension on the cable in the resting position.
Repeat the same movement to failure.
Then, reposition and repeat the same series of movements on the oposite side.

name: Cable Seated Crunch
directions: Seat on a flat bench with your back facing a high puley.

Grasp the cable rope atachment with both hands (with the palms of the hands facing each other) and place your hands securely over both shoulders. Tip: Alow the weight to hyperextend the lower back slightly. This wil be your starting position.
With the hips stationary, flex the waist so the elbows travel toward the hips. Breathe out as you perform this step.
As you inhale, go back to the initial position slowly.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Cable Seated Lateral Raise
directions: Stand in the midle of two low puleys that are oposite to each other and place a flat bench right behind you (in perpendicular fashion to you; the narow edge of the bench should be the one behind you). Select the weight to be used on each puley.
Now sit at the edge of the flat bench behind you with your fet placed in front of your knes.
Bend forward while keping your back flat and rest your torso on the thighs.

Have someone give you the single handles atached to the puleys. Grasp the left puley with the right hand and the right puley with the left after you select your weight. The puleys should run under your knes and your arms wil be extended with palms facing each other and a slight bend at the elbows. This wil be the starting position.

While keping the arms stationary, raise the uper arms to the sides until they are paralel to the flor and at shoulder height. Exhale during the execution of this movement and hold the contraction for a second.
Slowly lower your arms to the starting position as you inhale.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions. Tip: Maintain uper arms perpendicular to torso and a fixed elbow position (10 degre to 30 degre angle) throughout exercise.

name: Cable Shoulder Press
directions: Move the cables to the botom of the towers and select an apropriate weight.
Stand directly in betwen the uprights. Grasp the cables and hold them at shoulder height, palms facing forward. This wil be your starting position.
Keping your head and chest up, extend through the elbow to pres the handles directly over head.
After pausing at the top, return to the starting position and repeat.

name: Cable Shrugs
directions: Grasp a cable bar atachment that is atached to a low puley with a shoulder width or slightly wider overhand (palms facing down) grip.
Stand erect close to the puley with your arms extended in front of you holding the bar. This wil be your starting position.

Lift the bar by elevating the shoulders as high as posible as you exhale. Hold the contraction at the top for a second. Tip: The arms should remain extended at al times. Refrain from using the biceps to help lift the bar. Only the shoulders should be moving up and down.
Lower the bar back to the original position.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Cable Tuck Reverse Crunch
directions: Use a twin cable tower. Conect a rope atachment to one cable and an ankle atachment to the other. Both should be positioned at the lowest puley seting.
Place a mat in betwen the cables and sit down; atach the ankle strap to your fet.
Lie back and grab the rope with both hands; position the rope behind your head with your hands by your ears.
Make sure you are positioned in the midle with your legs completely outstretched.
In one motion, pul the rope forward in a crunching movement and bring your knes inward to your torso.
As your elbows and knes come together, elevate your shoulders and hips of the flor.

Pause for a moment and in a slow and controled maner reset to the starting position. You should hold your legs of the ground after the begining repetition to kep tension on the cable in the resting position.
Repeat the same movement to failure.

name: Cable Wrist Curl
directions: Start out by placing a flat bench in front of a low puley cable that has a straight bar atachment.

Use your arms to grab the cable bar with a narow to shoulder width supinated grip (palms up) and bring them up so that your forearms are resting against the top of your thighs. Your wrists should be hanging just beyond your knes.
Start out by curling your wrist upwards and exhaling. Kep the contraction for a second.
Slowly lower your wrists back down to the starting position while inhaling.
Your forearms should be stationary as your wrist is the only movement neded to perform this exercise.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

This exercise can also be performed siting down by kneling and using the bench as a resting position for your forearms. Your wrist can hang over the bench and the same movements as mentioned above can be performed.
You can also use a dumbel instead of a barbel.

name: Calf Press
directions: Adjust the seat so that your legs are only slightly bent in the start position. The bals of your fet should be firmly on the platform.
Select an apropriate weight, and grasp the handles. This wil be your starting position.

Straighten the legs by extending the knes, just barely lifting the weight from the stack. Your ankle should be fuly flexed, toes pointing up. Execute the movement by presing downward through the bals of your fet as far as posible.
After a brief pause, reverse the motion and repeat.

name: Calf Press On The Leg Press Machine
directions: Using a leg pres machine, sit down on the machine and place your legs on the platform directly in front of you at a medium (shoulder width) fot stance.

Lower the safety bars holding the weighted platform in place and pres the platform al the way up until your legs are fuly extended in front of you without locking your knes. (Note: In some leg pres units you can leave the safety bars on for increased safety. If your leg pres unit alows for this, then this is the prefered method of performing the exercise.) Your torso and the legs should make perfect 90-degre angle. Now carefuly place your toes and bals of your fet on the lower portion of the platform with the hels extending of. Toes should be facing forward, outwards or inwards as described at the begining of the chapter. This wil be your starting position.

Pres on the platform by raising your hels as you breathe out by extending your ankles as high as posible and flexing your calf. Ensure that the kne is kept stationary at al times. There should be no bending at any time. Hold the contracted position by a second before you start to go back down.
Go back slowly to the starting position as you breathe in by lowering your hels as you bend the ankles until calves are stretched.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Calf Raise On A Dumbbell
directions: Hang on to a sturdy object for balance and stand on a dumbel handle, preferably one with round plates so that it rols as in this maner you have to work harder to stabilize yourself; thus increasing the efectivenes of the exercise.
Now rol your fot slightly forward so that you can get a nice stretch of the calf. This wil be your starting position.

Lift the calf as you rol your fot over the top of the handle so that you get a ful extension. Exhale during the execution of this movement. Contract the calf hard at the top and hold for a second. Tip: As you come up, rol the dumbel slightly backward.
Now inhale as you rol the dumbel slightly forward as you come down to get a beter stretch.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Calf Raises - With Bands
directions: Grab an exercise band and stand on it with your toes making sure that the length of the band betwen the fot and the arms is the same for both sides.

While holding the handles of the band, raise the arms to the side of your head as if you were geting ready to perform a shoulder pres. The palms should be facing forward with the elbows bent and to the sides. This movement wil create tension on the band. This wil be your starting position.
Keping the hands by your shoulder, stand up on your toes as you exhale and contract the calves hard at the top of the movement.
After a one second contraction, slowly go back down to the starting position.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Calf Stretch Elbows Against Wall
directions: Stand facing a wal from a couple fet away.
Lean against the wal, placing your weight on your forearms.
Atempt to kep your hels on the ground. Hold for 10-20 seconds. You may move further or closer the wal, making it more or les dificult, respectively.

name: Calf Stretch Hands Against Wall
directions: Stand facing a wal from several fet away. Stager your stance, placing one fot forward.
Lean forward and rest your hands on the wal, keping your hel, hip and head in a straight line.
Atempt to kep your hel on the ground. Hold for 10-20 seconds and then switch sides.

name: Calf-Machine Shoulder Shrug
directions: Position yourself on the calf machine so that the shoulder pads are above your shoulders. Your torso should be straight with the arms extended normaly by your side. This wil be your starting position.
Raise your shoulders up towards your ears as you exhale and hold the contraction for a ful second.
Slowly return to the starting position as you inhale.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Calves-SMR
directions: Begin seated on the flor. Place a foam roler underneath your lower leg. Your other leg can either be crosed over the oposite or be placed on the flor, suporting some of your weight. This wil be your starting position.

Place your hands to your side or just behind you, and pres down to raise your hips of of the flor, placing much of your weight against your calf muscle. Rol from below the kne to above the ankle, pausing at points of tension for 10-30 seconds. Repeat for the other leg.

name: Car Deadlift
directions: This event aparatus typicaly has neutral grip handles, however some have a straight bar that you can aproach like a normal deadlift. The aparatus can be loaded with a vehicle or other heavy objects such as tractor tires or kegs.

Center yourself betwen the handles if you are a strong squater, or back a couple inches if you are a strong deadlifter. You fet should be about hip width apart. Bend at the hip to grip the handles. With your fet and your grip set, take a big breath and then lower your hips and flex the knes.

Lok forward with your head, kep your chest up and your back arched, and begin driving through the hels to move the weight upward. As the weight comes up, pul your shoulder blades together as you drive your hips forward.
Lower the weight by bending at the hips and guiding it to the flor.

name: Car Drivers
directions: While standing upright, hold a barbel plate in both hands at the 3 and 9 o'clock positions. Your palms should be facing each other and your arms should be extended straight out in front of you. This wil be your starting position.
Initiate the movement by rotating the plate as far to one side as posible. Use the same type of movement you would use to turn a stering whel to one side.
Reverse the motion, turning it al the way to the oposite side.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Carioca Quick Step
directions: Begin with your fet a few inches apart and your left arm up in a relaxed, athletic position.
With your right fot, quick step behind and pul the kne up.
Fire your arms back up when you pul the right kne, being sure that your kne goes straight up and down. Avoid turning your fet as you move and continue to lok forward as you move to the side.

name: Cat Stretch
directions: Position yourself on the flor on your hands and knes.
Pul your bely in and round your spine, lower back, shoulders, and neck, leting your head drop.
Hold for 15 seconds.

name: Catch and Overhead Throw
directions: Begin standing while facing a wal or a partner.
Using both hands, position the bal behind your head, stretching as much as posible, and forcefuly throw the bal forward.

Ensure that you folow your throw through, being prepared to receive your rebound from your throw. If you are throwing against the wal, make sure that you stand close enough to the wal to receive the rebound, and aim a litle higher than you would with a partner.

name: Chain Handle Extension
directions: You wil ned two cable handle atachments and a flat bench, as wel as chains, for this exercise. Clip the midle of the chains to the handles, and position yourself on the flat bench. Your elbows should be pointing straight up.
Begin by extending through the elbow, keping your uper arm stil, with your wrists pronated.
Pause at the lockout, and reverse the motion to return to the starting position.

name: Chain Press
directions: Begin by conecting the chains to the cable handle atachments. Position yourself on the flat bench in the same position as for a dumbel pres. Your wrists should be pronated and arms perpendicular to the flor. This wil be your starting position.
Lower the chains by flexing the elbows, unloading some of the chain onto the flor.
Continue until your elbow forms a 90 degre angle, and then reverse the motion by extending through the elbow to lockout.

name: Chair Leg Extended Stretch
directions: Sit upright in a chair and grip the seat on the sides.
Raise one leg, extending the kne, flexing the ankle as you do so.
Slowly move that leg outward as far as you can, and then back to the center and down.
Repeat for your other leg.

name: Chair Lower Back Stretch
directions: Sit upright on a chair.
Bend to one side with your arm over your head. You can hold onto the chair with your fre hand.
Hold for 10 seconds, and repeat for your other side.

name: Chair Squat
directions: To begin, first set the bar to a position that best matches your height. Once the bar is loaded, step under it and position it acros the back of your shoulders.
Take the bar with your hands facing forward, unlock it and lift it of the rack by extending your legs.

Move your fet forward about 18 inches in front of the bar. Position your legs using a shoulder width stance with the toes slightly pointed out. Lok forward at al times and maintain a neutral or slightly arched spine. This wil be your starting position.
Slowly lower the bar by bending the knes as you maintain a straight posture with the head up. Continue down until the angle betwen the uper and lower leg breaks 90 degres.
Begin to raise the bar as you exhale by pushing the flor with the hels of your fet, extending the knes and returning to the starting position.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Chair Upper Body Stretch
directions: Sit on the edge of a chair, griping the back of it.
Straighten your arms, keping your back straight, and pul your uper body forward so you fel a stretch. Hold for 20-30 seconds.

name: Chest And Front Of Shoulder Stretch
directions: Start of by standing with your legs together, holding a bodybar or a bromstick.
Take a slightly wider than shoulder width grip on the pole and hold it in front of you with your palms facing down.
Carefuly lift the pole up and behind your head.

name: Chest Push (multiple response)
directions: Begin in a kneling position facing a wal or utilize a partner. Hold the bal with both hands tight into the chest.
Execute the pas by exploding forward and outward with the hips while pushing the bal as hard as posible.
Folow through by faling forward, catching yourself with your hands.
Imediately return to an upright position. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Chest Push (single response)
directions: Begin in a kneling position holding the medicine bal with both hands tightly into the chest.
Execute the pas by exploding forward and outward with the hips while pushing the bal as far as posible.
Folow through by faling forward, catching yourself with your hands.

name: Chest Push from 3 point stance
directions: Begin in a thre point stance, squated down with your back flat and one hand on the ground. Place the medicine bal directly in front of you.
To begin, take your first step as you pul the bal to your chest, positioning both hands to prepare for the throw.
As you execute the second step, explosively release the bal forward as hard as posible.

name: Chest Push with Run Release
directions: Begin in an athletic stance with the knes bent, hips back, and back flat. Hold the medicine bal near your legs. This wil be your starting position.
While taking your first step draw the medicine bal into your chest.
As you take the second step, explosively push the bal forward, imediately sprinting for 10 yards after the release. If you are realy fast, you can catch your own pas!

name: Chest Stretch on Stability Ball
directions: Get on your hands and knes next to an exercise bal.
Place your elbows on top of the bal, keping your arm out to your side. This wil be your starting position.
Lower your torso towards the flor, keping your elbow on top of the bal. Hold the stretch for 20-30 seconds, and repeat with the other arm.

name: Child's Pose
directions: Get on your hands and knes, walk your hands in front of you.
Lower your butocks down to sit on your hels. Let your arms drag along the flor as you sit back to stretch your entire spine.
Once you setle onto your hels, bring your hands next to your fet and relax. "breathe" into your back. Rest your forehead on the flor. Avoid this position if you have kne problems.

name: Chin To Chest Stretch
directions: Get into a seated position on the flor.
Place both hands at the rear of your head, fingers interlocked, thumbs pointing down and elbows pointing straight ahead. Slowly pul your head down to your chest. Hold for 20-30 seconds.

name: Chin-Up
directions: Grab the pul-up bar with the palms facing your torso and a grip closer than the shoulder width.

As you have both arms extended in front of you holding the bar at the chosen grip width, kep your torso as straight as posible while creating a curvature on your lower back and sticking your chest out. This is your starting position. Tip: Keping the torso as straight as posible maximizes biceps stimulation while minimizing back involvement.

As you breathe out, pul your torso up until your head is around the level of the pul-up bar. Concentrate on using the biceps muscles in order to perform the movement. Kep the elbows close to your body. Tip: The uper torso should remain stationary as it moves through space and only the arms should move. The forearms should do no other work other than hold the bar.

After a second of squezing the biceps in the contracted position, slowly lower your torso back to the starting position; when your arms are fuly extended. Breathe in as you perform this portion of the movement.
Repeat this motion for the prescribed amount of repetitions.
If you are new at this exercise and do not have the strength to perform it, use a pul-up asist machine if available. These machines use weight to help you push your bodyweight.
Otherwise, a spoter holding your legs can help.
On the other hand, more advanced lifters can ad weight to the exercise by using a weight belt that alows the adition of weighted plates.

name: Circus Bell
directions: The circus bel is an oversized dumbel with a thick handle. Begin with the dumbel betwen your fet, and grip the handle with both hands.
Clean the dumbel by extending through your hips and knes to deliver the implement to the desired shoulder, leting go with the extra hand.

Ensure that you get one of the dumbel heads behind the shoulder to kep from being thrown of balance. To raise it overhead, dip by flexing the knes, and the drive upwards as you extend the dumbel overhead, leaning slightly away from it as you do so.
Carefuly guide the bel back to the flor, keping it under control as much as posible. It is best to perform this event on a thick ruber mat to prevent damage to the flor.

name: Clean
directions: With a barbel on the flor close to the shins, take an overhand (or hok) grip just outside the legs. Lower your hips with the weight focused on the hels, back straight, head facing forward, chest up, with your shoulders just in front of the bar. This wil be your starting position.

Begin the first pul by driving through the hels, extending your knes. Your back angle should stay the same, and your arms should remain straight. Move the weight with control as you continue to above the knes.

Next comes the second pul, the main source of aceleration for the clean. As the bar aproaches the mid-thigh position, begin extending through the hips. In a jumping motion, acelerate by extending the hips, knes, and ankles, using sped to move the bar upward. There should be no ned to actively pul through the arms to acelerate the weight; at the end of the second pul, the body should be fuly extended, leaning slightly back, with the arms stil extended.

As ful extension is achieved, transition into the third pul by agresively shruging and flexing the arms with the elbows up and out. At peak extension, agresively pul yourself down, rotating your elbows under the bar as you do so. Receive the bar in a front squat position, the depth of which is dependent upon the height of the bar at the end of the third pul. The bar should be racked onto the protracted shoulders, lightly touching the throat with the hands relaxed. Continue to descend to the botom squat position, which wil help in the recovery.
Imediately recover by driving through the hels, keping the torso upright and elbows up. Continue until you have risen to a standing position.

name: Clean and Jerk
directions: With a barbel on the flor close to the shins, take an overhand or hok grip just outside the legs. Lower your hips with the weight focused on the hels, back straight, head facing forward, chest up, with your shoulders just in front of the bar. This wil be your starting position.

Begin the first pul by driving through the hels, extending your knes. Your back angle should stay the same, and your arms should remain straight. Move the weight with control as you continue to above the knes.

Next comes the second pul, the main source of aceleration for the clean. As the bar aproaches the mid-thigh position, begin extending through the hips. In a jumping motion, acelerate by extending the hips, knes, and ankles, using sped to move the bar upward. There should be no ned to actively pul through the arms to acelerate the weight; at the end of the second pul, the body should be fuly extended, leaning slightly back, with the arms stil extended.

As ful extension is achieved, transition into the third pul by agresively shruging and flexing the arms with the elbows up and out. At peak extension, agresively pul yourself down, rotating your elbows under the bar as you do so. Receive the bar in a front squat position, the depth of which is dependent upon the height of the bar at the end of the third pul. The bar should be racked onto the protracted shoulders, lightly touching the throat with the hands relaxed. Continue to descend to the botom squat position, which wil help in the recovery.
Imediately recover by driving through the hels, keping the torso upright and elbows up. Continue until you have risen to a standing position.

The second phase is the jerk, which raises the weight overhead. Standing with the weight racked on the front of the shoulders, begin with the dip. With your fet directly under your hips, flex the knes without moving the hips backward. Go down only slightly, and reverse direction as powerfuly as posible.
Drive through the hels create as much sped and force as posible, and be sure to move your head out of the way as the bar leaves the shoulders.

At this moment as the fet leave the flor, the fet must be placed into the receiving position as quickly as posible. In the brief moment the fet are not actively driving against the platform, the athletes efort to push the bar up wil drive them down. The fet should be split, with one fot forward, and one fot back. Receive the bar with the arms locked out overhead. Return to a standing position.

name: Clean and Press
directions:
Asume a shoulder-width stance, with knes inside the arms. Now while keping the back flat, bend at the knes and hips so that you can grab the bar with the arms fuly extended and a pronated grip that is slightly wider than shoulder width. Point the elbows out to sides. The bar should be close to the shins. 
Position the shoulders over or slightly ahead of the bar. Establish a flat back posture. This wil be your starting position.

Begin to pul the bar by extending the knes. Move your hips forward and raise the shoulders at the same rate while keping the angle of the back constant; continue to lift the bar straight up while keping it close to your body.

As the bar pases the kne, extend at the ankles, knes, and hips forcefuly, similar to a jumping motion. As you do so, continue to guide the bar with your hands, shruging your shoulders and using the momentum from your movement to pul the bar as high as posible. The bar should travel close to your body, and you should kep your elbows out.

At maximum elevation, your fet should clear the flor and you should start to pul yourself under the bar. The mechanics of this could change slightly, depending on the weight used. You should descend into a squating position as you pul yourself under the bar.

As the bar hits terminal height, rotate your elbows around and under the bar. Rack the bar acros the front of the shoulders while keping the torso erect and flexing the hips and knes to absorb the weight of the bar.
Stand to ful height, holding the bar in the clean position.
Without moving your fet, pres the bar overhead as you exhale. Lower the bar under control .

name: Clean Deadlift
directions: Begin standing with a barbel close to your shins. Your fet should be directly under your hips with your fet turned out slightly. Grip the bar with a double overhand grip or hok grip, about shoulder width apart. Squat down to the bar. Your spine should be in ful extension, with a back angle that places your shoulders in front of the bar and your back as vertical as posible.
Begin by driving through the flor through the front of your hels. As the bar travels upward, maintain a constant back angle. Flare your knes out to the side to help kep them out of the bar's path.
After the bar croses the knes, complete the lift by driving the hips into the bar until your hips and knes are extended.

name: Clean from Blocks
directions: With a barbel on boxes or stands of the desired height, take an overhand or hok grip just outside the legs. Lower your hips with the weight focused on the hels, back straight, head facing forward, chest up, with your shoulders just in front of the bar. This wil be your starting position.
Begin the first pul by driving through the hels, extending your knes. Your back angle should stay the same, and your arms should remain straight with the elbows pointed out.

As ful extension is achieved, transition into the receiving position by agresively shruging and flexing the arms with the elbows up and out. Agresively pul yourself down, rotating your elbows under the bar as you do so. Receive the bar in a front squat position, the depth of which is dependent upon the height of the bar at the end of the third pul. The bar should be racked onto the protracted shoulders, lightly touching the throat with the hands relaxed. Continue to descend to the botom squat position, which wil help in the recovery.
Imediately recover by driving through the hels, keping the torso upright and elbows up. Continue until you have risen to a standing position. Return the weight to the boxes for the next rep.

name: Clean Pull
directions: With a barbel on the flor close to the shins, take an overhand or hok grip just outside the legs. Lower your hips with the weight focused on the hels, back straight, head facing forward, chest up, with your shoulders just in front of the bar. This wil be your starting position.

Begin the first pul by driving through the hels, extending your knes. Your back angle should stay the same, and your arms should remain straight and elbows out. Move the weight with control as you continue to above the knes.

Next comes the second pul, the main source of aceleration for the clean. As the bar aproaches the mid-thigh position, begin extending through the hips. In a jumping motion, acelerate by extending the hips, knes, and ankles, using sped to move the bar upward. There should be no ned to actively pul through the arms to acelerate the weight; at the end of the second pul, the body should be fuly extended, leaning slightly back, with the arms stil extended. Ful extension should be violent and abrupt, and ensure that you do not prolong the extension for longer than necesary.

name: Clean Shrug
directions: Begin with a shoulder width, double overhand or hok grip, with the bar hanging at the mid thigh position. Your back should be straight and inclined slightly forward.
Shrug your shoulders towards your ears. While this exercise can usualy by loaded with heavier weight than a clean, avoid overloading to the point that the execution slows down.

name: Clock Push-Up
directions: Move into a prone position on the flor, suporting your weight on your hands and toes.
Your arms should be fuly extended with the hands around shoulder width. Kep your body straight throughout the movement. This wil be your starting position.
Descend by flexing at the elbow, lowering your chest toward the ground.
At the botom, reverse the motion by pushing yourself up through elbow extension as quickly as posible until you are air borne. Aim to jump 12-18 inches to one side.
As you acelerate up, move your outside fot away from your direction of travel. Leaving the ground, shift your body about 30 degres for the next repetition.
Return to the starting position and repeat the exercise, working al the way around until you are back where you started.

name: Close-Grip Barbell Bench Press
directions: Lie back on a flat bench. Using a close grip (around shoulder width), lift the bar from the rack and hold it straight over you with your arms locked. This wil be your starting position.

As you breathe in, come down slowly until you fel the bar on your midle chest. Tip: Make sure that - as oposed to a regular bench pres - you kep the elbows close to the torso at al times in order to maximize triceps involvement.

After a second pause, bring the bar back to the starting position as you breathe out and push the bar using your triceps muscles. Lock your arms in the contracted position, hold for a second and then start coming down slowly again. Tip: It should take at least twice as long to go down than to come up.
Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.
When you are done, place the bar back in the rack.

name: Close-Grip Dumbbell Press
directions: Place a dumbel standing up on a flat bench.

Ensuring that the dumbel stays securely placed at the top of the bench, lie perpendicular to the bench with only your shoulders lying on the surface. Hips should be below the bench and your legs bent with your fet firmly on the flor.

Grasp the dumbel with both hands and hold it straight over your chest at arms length. Both palms should be presing against the underside of the sides of the dumbel. This wil be your starting position.
Initiate the movement by lowering the dumbel to your chest.
Return to the starting position by extending the elbows.

name: Close-Grip EZ Bar Curl
directions: Stand up with your torso upright while holding an E-Z Curl Bar at the closer iner handle. The palm of your hands should be facing forward and they should be slightly tilted inwards due to the shape of the bar. The elbows should be close to the torso. This wil be your starting position.
While holding the uper arms stationary, curl the weights forward while contracting the biceps as you breathe out. Tip: Only the forearms should move.
Continue the movement until your biceps are fuly contracted and the bar is at shoulder level. Hold the contracted position for a second and squeze the biceps hard.
Slowly begin to bring the bar back to starting position as your breathe in.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.
You can also perform this movement using an E-Z atachment hoked to a low puley. This variation sems to realy provide a god contraction at the top of the movement.
You may also use the wider grip for variety purposes.

name: Close-Grip EZ-Bar Curl with Band
directions: Atach a band to each end of the bar. Take the bar, placing a fot on the midle of the band. Stand upright with a narow, supinated grip on the EZ bar. The elbows should be close to the torso. This wil be your starting position.
While keping the uper arms in place, flex the elbows to execute the curl. Exhale as the weight is lifted.
Continue the movement until your biceps are fuly contracted and the bar is at shoulder level. Hold the contracted position for a second and squeze the biceps hard.
Slowly begin to bring the bar back to starting position as your breathe in.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Close-Grip EZ-Bar Press
directions: Lie on a flat bench with an EZ bar loaded to an apropriate weight.
Using a narow grip lift the bar and hold it straight over your torso with your elbows in. The arms should be perpendicular to the flor. This wil be your starting position.
Now lower the bar down to your lower chest as you breathe in. Kep the elbows in as you perform this movement.
Using the triceps to push the bar back up, pres it back to the starting position by extending the elbows as you exhale.
Repeat.

name: Close-Grip Front Lat Pulldown
directions: Sit down on a pul-down machine with a wide bar atached to the top puley. Make sure that you adjust the kne pad of the machine to fit your height. These pads wil prevent your body from being raised by the resistance atached to the bar.

Grab the bar with the palms facing forward using the prescribed grip. Note on grips: For a wide grip, your hands ned to be spaced out at a distance wider than your shoulder width. For a medium grip, your hands ned to be spaced out at a distance equal to your shoulder width and for a close grip at a distance smaler than your shoulder width.

As you have both arms extended in front of you - while holding the bar at the chosen grip width - bring your torso back around 30 degres or so while creating a curvature on your lower back and sticking your chest out. This is your starting position.

As you breathe out, bring the bar down until it touches your uper chest by drawing the shoulders and the uper arms down and back. Tip: Concentrate on squezing the back muscles once you reach the ful contracted position. The uper torso should remain stationary (only the arms should move). The forearms should do no other work except for holding the bar; therefore do not try to pul the bar down using the forearms.

After a second in the contracted position, while squezing your shoulder blades together, slowly raise the bar back to the starting position when your arms are fuly extended and the lats are fuly stretched. Inhale during this portion of the movement.
6. Repeat this motion for the prescribed amount of repetitions.

name: Close-Grip Push-Up off of a Dumbbell
directions: Lie on the flor and place your hands on an upright dumbel. Suporting your weight on your toes and hands, kep your torso rigid and your elbows in with your arms straight. This wil be your starting position.
Lower your body, alowing the elbows to flex while you inhale. Kep your body straight, not alowing your hips to rise or sag.
Pres yourself back up to the starting position by extending the elbows. Breathe out as you perform this step.
After a pause at the contracted position, repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.

name: Close-Grip Standing Barbell Curl
directions: Hold a barbel with both hands, palms up and a few inches apart.

Stand with your torso straight and your head up. Your fet should be about shoulder width and your elbows close to your torso. This wil be your starting position. Tip: You wil kep your uper arms and elbows stationary throughout the movement.

Curl the bar up in a semicircular motion until the forearms touch your biceps. Exhale as you perform this portion of the movement and contract your biceps hard for a second at the top. Tip: Avoid bending the back or using swinging motions as you lift the weight. Only the forearms should move.
Slowly go back down to the starting position as you inhale.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Cocoons
directions: Begin by lying on your back on the ground. Your legs should be straight and your arms extended behind your head. This wil be your starting position.

To perform the movement, tuck the knes toward your chest, rotating your pelvis to lift your glutes from the flor. As you do so, flex the spine, bringing your arms back over your head to perform a simultaneous crunch motion.
After a brief pause, return to the starting position.

name: Conan's Wheel
directions: With the weight loaded, take a zurcher hold on the end of the implement. Place the bar in the crok of the elbow and hold onto your wrist. Try to kep the weight of of the forearms.

Begin by lifting the weight from the ground. Kep a tight, upright posture as you being to walk, taking short, fast steps. Lok up and away as you turn in a circle. Do not hold your breath during the event. Continue walking until you complete one or more complete turns.

name: Concentration Curls
directions: Sit down on a flat bench with one dumbel in front of you betwen your legs. Your legs should be spread with your knes bent and fet on the flor.

Use your right arm to pick the dumbel up. Place the back of your right uper arm on the top of your iner right thigh. Rotate the palm of your hand until it is facing forward away from your thigh. Tip: Your arm should be extended and the dumbel should be above the flor. This wil be your starting position.

While holding the uper arm stationary, curl the weights forward while contracting the biceps as you breathe out. Only the forearms should move. Continue the movement until your biceps are fuly contracted and the dumbels are at shoulder level. Tip: At the top of the movement make sure that the litle finger of your arm is higher than your thumb. This guarantes a god contraction. Hold the contracted position for a second as you squeze the biceps.
Slowly begin to bring the dumbels back to starting position as your breathe in. Caution: Avoid swinging motions at any time.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions. Then repeat the movement with the left arm.

name: Cross Body Hammer Curl
directions: Stand up straight with a dumbel in each hand. Your hands should be down at your side with your palms facing in.

While keping your palms facing in and without twisting your arm, curl the dumbel of the right arm up towards your left shoulder as you exhale. Touch the top of the dumbel to your shoulder and hold the contraction for a second.
Slowly lower the dumbel along the same path as you inhale and then repeat the same movement for the left arm.
Continue alternating in this fashion until the recomended amount of repetitions is performed for each arm.

name: Cross Over - With Bands
directions: Secure an exercise band around a stationary post.
While facing away from the post, grab the handles on both ends of the band and step forward enough to create tension on the band.

Raise your arms to the sides, paralel to the flor, perpendicular to your torso (your torso and the arms should resemble the leter "T") and with the palms facing forward. Have them extended with a slight bend at the elbows. This wil be your starting position.
While keping your arms straight, bring them acros your chest in a semicircular motion to the front as you exhale and flex your pecs. Hold the contraction for a second.
Slowly return to the starting position as you inhale.
Perform for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Cross-Body Crunch
directions: Lie flat on your back and bend your knes about 60 degres.
Kep your fet flat on the flor and place your hands losely behind your head. This wil be your starting position.

Now curl up and bring your right elbow and shoulder acros your body while bring your left kne in toward your left shoulder at the same time. Reach with your elbow and try to touch your kne. Exhale as you perform this movement. Tip: Try to bring your shoulder up towards your kne rather than just your elbow and remember that the key is to contract the abs as you perform the movement; not just to move the elbow.
Now go back down to the starting position as you inhale and repeat with the left elbow and the right kne.
Continue alternating in this maner until al prescribed repetitions are done.

name: Crossover Reverse Lunge
directions: Stand with your fet shoulder width apart. This wil be your starting position.
Perform a rear lunge by steping back with one fot and flexing the hips and front kne. As you do so, rotate your torso acros the front leg.
After a brief pause, return to the starting position and repeat on the other side, continuing in an alternating fashion.

name: Crucifix
directions: In the crucifix, you staticaly hold weights out to the side for time. While the event can be practiced using dumbels, it is best to practice with one of the various implements used, such as axes and hamers, as it fels diferent.

Begin standing, and raise your arms out to the side holding the implements. Your arms should be paralel to the ground. In competition, judges or sensors are used to let you know when you break paralel. Hold for as long as you can. Typicaly, the weights should be heavy enough that you fail in 30-60 seconds.

name: Crunch - Hands Overhead
directions: Lie on the flor with your back flat and knes bent with around a 60-degre angle betwen the hamstrings and the calves.
Kep your fet flat on the flor and stretch your arms overhead with your palms crosed. This wil be your starting position.

Curl your uper body forward and bring your shoulder blades just of the flor. At al times, kep your arms aligned with your head, neck and shoulder. Don't move them forward from that position. Exhale as you perform this portion of the movement and hold the contraction for a second.
Slowly lower down to the starting position as you inhale.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Crunch - Legs On Exercise Ball
directions: Lie flat on your back with your fet resting on an exercise bal and your knes bent at a 90 degre angle.
Place your fet thre to four inches apart and point your toes inward so they touch.
Place your hands lightly on either side of your head keping your elbows in. Tip: Don't lock your fingers behind your head.
Push the smal of your back down in the flor in order to beter isolate your abdominal muscles. This wil be your starting position.

Begin to rol your shoulders of the flor and continue to push down as hard as you can with your lower back. Your shoulders should come up of the flor only about four inches, and your lower back should remain on the flor. Breathe out as you execute this portion of the movement. Squeze your abdominals hard at the top of the contraction and hold for a second. Tip: Focus on a slow, controled movement. Refrain from using momentum at any time.
Slowly go back down to the starting position as you inhale.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Crunches
directions: Lie flat on your back with your fet flat on the ground, or resting on a bench with your knes bent at a 90 degre angle. If you are resting your fet on a bench, place them thre to four inches apart and point your toes inward so they touch.
Now place your hands lightly on either side of your head keping your elbows in. Tip: Don't lock your fingers behind your head.
While pushing the smal of your back down in the flor to beter isolate your abdominal muscles, begin to rol your shoulders of the flor.

Continue to push down as hard as you can with your lower back as you contract your abdominals and exhale. Your shoulders should come up of the flor only about four inches, and your lower back should remain on the flor. At the top of the movement, contract your abdominals hard and kep the contraction for a second. Tip: Focus on slow, controled movement - don't cheat yourself by using momentum.
After the one second contraction, begin to come down slowly again to the starting position as you inhale.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Cuban Press
directions: From a seated or standing position, hold a dumbel in each hand with your shoulders rotated forward. Your arms should be fuly extended next to your thighs with only a slight bend at the elbows and with the palms of your hands facing your thighs. This wil be your starting position.

Begin the movement by lifting the elbows up, as if performing a dumbel upright row, until they are at shoulder height. Tip: The torso and the uper arm should resemble the leter "T". Exhale as you perform this movement.

Once you reach this position, inhale and then externaly rotate the dumbels up while keping the uper arms in the same level and exhaling. Continue this movement until the forearms are perpendicular to the flor and the hands are pointing towards the ceiling. Inhale once you complete this movement.
Now pres the dumbels up over your head as if performing a shoulder pres as you exhale.
Go back to the initial position as you breathe in by reversing the steps.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Dancer's Stretch
directions: Sit up on the flor.
Cros your right leg over your left, keping the kne bent. Your left leg is straight and down on the flor.
Place your left arm on your right leg and your right hand on the flor.
Rotate your uper body to the right, and hold for 10-20 seconds. Switch sides.

name: Dead Bug
directions: Begin lying on your back with your hands extended above you toward the ceiling.
Bring your fet, knes, and hips up to 90 degres.

Exhale hard to bring your ribcage down and flaten your back onto the flor, rotating your pelvis up and squezing your glutes. Hold this position throughout the movement. This wil be your starting position.
Initiate the exercise by extending one leg, straightening the kne and hip to bring the leg just above the ground.
Maintain the position of your lumbar and pelvis as you perform the movement, as your back is going to want to arch.
Stay tight and return the working leg to the starting position.
Repeat on the oposite side, alternating until the set is complete.

name: Deadlift with Bands
directions: To deadlift with short bands, simply lop them over the bar before you start, and step into them to set up. For long bands, they wil ned to be anchored to a secure base, such as heavy dumbels or a rack.

With your fet, and your grip set, take a big breath and then lower your hips and bend the knes until your shins contact the bar. Lok forward with your head, kep your chest up and your back arched, and begin driving through the hels to move the weight upward. After the bar pases the knes, agresively pul the bar back, puling your shoulder blades together as you drive your hips forward into the bar.
Lower the bar by bending at the hips and guiding it to the flor.

name: Deadlift with Chains
directions: You can atach the chains to the sleves of the bar, or just drape the midle over the bar so there is a greater weight increase as you lift.

Aproach the bar so that it is centered over your fet. You fet should be about hip width apart. Bend at the hip to grip the bar at shoulder width, alowing your shoulder blades to protract. Typicaly, you would use an overhand grip or an over/under grip on heavier sets. With your fet, and your grip set, take a big breath and then lower your hips and bend the knes until your shins contact the bar.

Lok forward with your head, kep your chest up and your back arched, and begin driving through the hels to move the weight upward. After the bar pases the knes, agresively pul the bar back, puling your shoulder blades together as you drive your hips forward into the bar.
Lower the bar by bending at the hips and guiding it to the flor.

name: Decline Barbell Bench Press
directions: Secure your legs at the end of the decline bench and slowly lay down on the bench.

Using a medium width grip (a grip that creates a 90-degre angle in the midle of the movement betwen the forearms and the uper arms), lift the bar from the rack and hold it straight over you with your arms locked. The arms should be perpendicular to the flor. This wil be your starting position. Tip: In order to protect your rotator cuf, it is best if you have a spoter help you lift the barbel of the rack.
As you breathe in, come down slowly until you fel the bar on your lower chest.

After a second pause, bring the bar back to the starting position as you breathe out and push the bar using your chest muscles. Lock your arms and squeze your chest in the contracted position, hold for a second and then start coming down slowly again. Tip: It should take at least twice as long to go down than to come up).
Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.
When you are done, place the bar back in the rack.
If you are new at this exercise, it is advised that you use a spoter. If no spoter is available, then be conservative with the amount of weight used.
Also, beware of leting the bar drift to far forward. You want the bar to touch your lower chest and nowhere else.
Don't bounce the weight of your chest. You should be in ful control of the barbel at al times.

name: Decline Close-Grip Bench To Skull Crusher
directions: Secure your legs at the end of the decline bench and slowly lay down on the bench.

Using a close grip (a grip that is slightly les than shoulder width), lift the bar from the rack and hold it straight over you with your arms locked and elbows in. The arms should be perpendicular to the flor. This wil be your starting position. Tip: In order to protect your rotator cuf, it is best if you have a spoter help you lift the barbel of the rack.
Now lower the bar down to your lower chest as you breathe in. Kep the elbows in as you perform this movement.
Using the triceps to push the bar back up, pres it back to the starting position as you exhale.

As you breathe in and you kep the uper arms stationary, bring the bar down slowly by moving your forearms in a semicircular motion towards you until you fel the bar slightly touch your forehead. Breathe in as you perform this portion of the movement.
Lift the bar back to the starting position by contracting the triceps and exhaling.
Repeat steps 3-6 until the recomended amount of repetitions is performed.

name: Decline Crunch
directions: Secure your legs at the end of the decline bench and lie down.
Now place your hands lightly on either side of your head keping your elbows in. Tip: Don't lock your fingers behind your head.
While pushing the smal of your back down in the bench to beter isolate your abdominal muscles, begin to rol your shoulders of it.

Continue to push down as hard as you can with your lower back as you contract your abdominals and exhale. Your shoulders should come up of the bench only about four inches, and your lower back should remain on the bench. At the top of the movement, contract your abdominals hard and kep the contraction for a second. Tip: Focus on slow, controled movement - don't cheat yourself by using momentum.
After the one second contraction, begin to come down slowly again to the starting position as you inhale.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Decline Dumbbell Bench Press
directions: Secure your legs at the end of the decline bench and lie down with a dumbel on each hand on top of your thighs. The palms of your hand wil be facing each other.
Once you are laying down, move the dumbels in front of you at shoulder width.
Once at shoulder width, rotate your wrists forward so that the palms of your hands are facing away from you. This wil be your starting position.
Bring down the weights slowly to your side as you breathe out. Kep ful control of the dumbels at al times. Tip: Throughout the motion, the forearms should always be perpendicular to the flor.

As you breathe out, push the dumbels up using your pectoral muscles. Lock your arms in the contracted position, squeze your chest, hold for a second and then start coming down slowly. Tip: It should take at least twice as long to go down than to come up.
Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions of your training program.

name: Decline Dumbbell Flyes
directions: Secure your legs at the end of the decline bench and lie down with a dumbel on each hand on top of your thighs. The palms of your hand wil be facing each other.

Once you are laying down, move the dumbels in front of you at shoulder width. The palms of the hands should be facing each other and the arms should be perpendicular to the flor and fuly extended. This wil be your starting position.

With a slight bend on your elbows in order to prevent stres at the biceps tendon, lower your arms out at both sides in a wide arc until you fel a stretch on your chest. Breathe in as you perform this portion of the movement. Tip: Kep in mind that throughout the movement, the arms should remain stationary; the movement should only ocur at the shoulder joint.
Return your arms back to the starting position as you squeze your chest muscles and breathe out. Tip: Make sure to use the same arc of motion used to lower the weights.
Hold for a second at the contracted position and repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.

name: Decline Dumbbell Triceps Extension
directions: Secure your legs at the end of the decline bench and lie down with a dumbel on each hand on top of your thighs. The palms of your hand wil be facing each other.

Once you are laying down, move the dumbels in front of you at shoulder width. The palms of the hands should be facing each other and the arms should be perpendicular to the flor and fuly extended. This wil be your starting position.

As you breathe in and you kep the uper arms stationary (and elbows in), bring the dumbels down slowly by moving your forearms in a semicircular motion towards you until your thumbs are next to your ears. Breathe in as you perform this portion of the movement.
Lift the dumbels back to the starting position by contracting the triceps and exhaling.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Decline EZ Bar Triceps Extension
directions: Secure your legs at the end of the decline bench and slowly lay down on the bench.

Using a close grip (a grip that is slightly les than shoulder width), lift the EZ bar from the rack and hold it straight over you with your arms locked and elbows in. The arms should be perpendicular to the flor. This wil be your starting position. Tip: In order to protect your rotator cuf, it is best if you have a spoter help you lift the barbel of the rack.

As you breathe in and you kep the uper arms stationary, bring the bar down slowly by moving your forearms in a semicircular motion towards you until you fel the bar slightly touch your forehead. Breathe in as you perform this portion of the movement.
Lift the bar back to the starting position by contracting the triceps and exhaling.
Repeat until the recomended amount of repetitions is performed.

name: Decline Oblique Crunch
directions: Secure your legs at the end of the decline bench and slowly lay down on the bench.
Raise your uper body of the bench until your torso is about 35-45 degres if measured from the flor.
Put one hand beside your head and the other on your thigh. This wil be your starting position.

Raise your uper body slowly from the starting position while turning your torso to the left. Continue crunching up as you exhale until your right elbow touches your left kne. Hold this contracted position for a second. Tip: Focus on keping your abs tight and keping the movement slow and controled.
Lower your body back down slowly to the starting position as you inhale.

After completing one set on the right for the recomended amount of repetitions, switch to your left side. Tip: Focus on realy twisting your torso and feling the contraction when you are in the up position.

name: Decline Push-Up
directions: Lie on the flor face down and place your hands about 36 inches apart while holding your torso up at arms length. Move your fet up to a box or bench. This wil be your starting position.
Next, lower yourself downward until your chest almost touches the flor as you inhale.
Now breathe out and pres your uper body back up to the starting position while squezing your chest.
After a brief pause at the top contracted position, you can begin to lower yourself downward again for as many repetitions as neded.

name: Decline Reverse Crunch
directions: Lie on your back on a decline bench and hold on to the top of the bench with both hands. Don't let your body slip down from this position.

Hold your legs paralel to the flor using your abs to hold them there while keping your knes and fet together. Tip: Your legs should be fuly extended with a slight bend on the kne. This wil be your starting position.
While exhaling, move your legs towards the torso as you rol your pelvis backwards and you raise your hips of the bench. At the end of this movement your knes wil be touching your chest.
Hold the contraction for a second and move your legs back to the starting position while inhaling.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Decline Smith Press
directions: Place a decline bench underneath the Smith machine. Now place the barbel at a height that you can reach when lying down and your arms are almost fuly extended. Using a pronated grip that is wider than shoulder width, unlock the bar from the rack and hold it straight over you with your arms extended. This wil be your starting position.
As you inhale, lower the bar under control by alowing the elbows to flex, lightly contacting the torso.
After a brief pause, bring the bar back to the starting position by extending the elbows, exhaling as you do so.
Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.
When the set is complete, lock the bar back in the rack.

name: Deficit Deadlift
directions: Begin by having a platform or weight plates that you can stand on, usualy 1-3 inches in height. Aproach the bar so that it is centered over your fet. You fet should be about hip width apart. Bend at the hip to grip the bar at shoulder width, alowing your shoulder blades to protract. Typicaly, you would use an overhand grip or an over/under grip on heavier sets.

With your fet, and your grip set, take a big breath and then lower your hips and bend the knes until your shins contact the bar. Lok forward with your head, kep your chest up and your back arched, and begin driving through the hels to move the weight upward. After the bar pases the knes, agresively pul the bar back, puling your shoulder blades together as you drive your hips forward into the bar.
Lower the bar by bending at the hips and guiding it to the flor.

name: Depth Jump Leap
directions: For this dril you wil ned two boxes or benches, one 12 to 16 inches high and the other 2 to 26 inches high.

Stand on one of the two boxes with arms at the sides; fet should be together and slightly of the edge as in the depth jump. Place the other box aproximately two or thre fet in front of and facing the performer.
Begin by droping of the initial box, landing and simultaneously taking of with both fet.
Rebound by driving upward and outward as intensely as posible, using the arms and ful extension of the body to jump onto the higher box. Again, alow the legs to absorb the impact.

name: Dip Machine
directions: Sit securely in a dip machine, select the weight and firmly grasp the handles.
Now kep your elbows in at your sides in order to place emphasis on the triceps. The elbows should be bent at a 90 degre angle.
As you contract the triceps, extend your arms downwards as you exhale. Tip: At the botom of the movement, focus on keping a litle bend in your arms to kep tension on the triceps muscle.
Now slowly let your arms come back up to the starting position as you inhale.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Dips - Chest Version
directions: For this exercise you wil ned aces to paralel bars. To get yourself into the starting position, hold your body at arms length (arms locked) above the bars.
While breathing in, lower yourself slowly with your torso leaning forward around 30 degres or so and your elbows flared out slightly until you fel a slight stretch in the chest.
Once you fel the stretch, use your chest to bring your body back to the starting position as you breathe out. Tip: Remember to squeze the chest at the top of the movement for a second.
Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.

name: Dips - Triceps Version
directions: To get into the starting position, hold your body at arm's length with your arms nearly locked above the bars.

Now, inhale and slowly lower yourself downward. Your torso should remain upright and your elbows should stay close to your body. This helps to beter focus on tricep involvement. Lower yourself until there is a 90 degre angle formed betwen the uper arm and forearm.
Then, exhale and push your torso back up using your triceps to bring your body back to the starting position.
Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.

name: Donkey Calf Raises
directions: For this exercise you wil ned aces to a donkey calf raise machine. Start by positioning your lower back and hips under the paded lever provided. The tailbone area should be the one making contact with the pad.

Place both of your arms on the side handles and place the bals of your fet on the calf block with the hels extending of. Align the toes forward, inward or outward, depending on the area you wish to target, and straighten the knes without locking them. This wil be your starting position.

Raise your hels as you breathe out by extending your ankles as high as posible and flexing your calf. Ensure that the kne is kept stationary at al times. There should be no bending at any time. Hold the contracted position by a second before you start to go back down.
Go back slowly to the starting position as you breathe in by lowering your hels as you bend the ankles until calves are stretched.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Double Kettlebell Alternating Hang Clean
directions: Place two ketlebels betwen your fet. To get in the starting position, push your but back and lok straight ahead.
Clean one ketlebel to your shoulder and hold on to the other ketlebel.
With a fluid motion, lower the top ketlebel while driving the botom ketlebel up.

name: Double Kettlebell Jerk
directions: Hold a ketlebel by the handle in each hand.

Clean the ketlebels to your shoulders by extending through the legs and hips as you pul the ketlebels towards your shoulders. Rotate your wrists as you do so, so that the palms face forward. This wil be your starting position.
Dip your body by bending the knes, keping your torso upright.
Imediately reverse direction, driving through the hels, in esence jumping to create momentum.
As you do so, pres the ketlebels overhead to lockout by extending the arms, using your body's momentum to move the weights.
Return your fet to the ground in a split fashion, with one fot forward and one fot back.
Keping the weights overhead, return to a standing position, bringing your fet together. Lower the weights to perform the next repetition.

name: Double Kettlebell Push Press
directions: Clean two ketlebels to your shoulders.

Squat down a few inches and reverse the motion rapidly. Use the momentum from the legs to drive the
ketlebels overhead.
Once the ketlebels are locked out, lower the ketlebels to your shoulders and repeat.

name: Double Kettlebell Snatch
directions: Place two ketlebels behind your fet. Bend your knes and sit back to pick up the ketlebels.
Swing the ketlebels betwen your legs forcefuly and reverse the direction.
Drive through with your hips and lock the ketlebels overhead in one uninterupted motion.

name: Double Kettlebell Windmill
directions: Place a ketlebel in front of your front fot and clean and pres a ketlebel overhead with your oposite arm. Clean the ketlebel to your shoulder by extending through the legs and hips as you pul the ketlebel towards your shoulders. Rotate your wrist as you do so, so that the palm faces forward.
Keping the ketlebel locked out at al times, push your but out in the direction of the locked out ketlebel. Turn your fet out at a forty-five degre angle from the arm with the locked out ketlebel.
Bending at the hip to one side, sticking your but out, slowly lean until you can retrieve the ketlebel from the flor. Kep your eyes on the ketlebel that you hold over your head at al times.
Pause for a second after retrieving the ketlebel from the ground and reverse the motion back to the starting position.

name: Double Leg Butt Kick
directions: Begin standing with your knes slightly bent.
Quickly squat a short distance, flexing the hips and knes, and imediately extend to jump for maximum vertical height.
As you go up, tuck your hels by flexing the knes, atempting to touch the butocks.
Finish the motion by landing with the knes only partialy bent, using your legs to absorb the impact.

name: Downward Facing Balance
directions: Lie facedown on top of an exercise bal.
While resting on your stomach on the bal, walk your hands forward along the flor and lift your legs, extending your elbows and knes.

name: Drag Curl
directions: Grab a barbel with a supinated grip (palms facing forward) and get your elbows close to your torso and back. This wil be your starting position.

As you exhale, curl the bar up while keping the elbows to the back as you "Drag" the bar up by keping it in contact with your torso. Tip: As you can se, you wil not be keping the elbows pined to your sides, but instead you wil be bringing them back. Also, do not lift your shoulders.
Slowly go back to the starting position as you kep the bar in contact with the torso at al times.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Drop Push
directions: Position low boxes or other platforms 2-3 fet apart.
Move to a pushup position betwen them, suporting yourself by placing your hands on the boxes.
With god posture, drop from the platforms by presing up and moving your hands to shoulder width, cushioning your landing by absorbing the impact through the arm.

name: Dumbbell Alternate Bicep Curl
directions: Stand (torso upright) with a dumbel in each hand held at arms length. The elbows should be close to the torso and the palms of your hand should be facing your thighs.

While holding the uper arm stationary, curl the right weight as you rotate the palm of the hands until they are facing forward. At this point continue contracting the biceps as you breathe out until your biceps is fuly contracted and the dumbels are at shoulder level. Hold the contracted position for a second as you squeze the biceps. Tip: Only the forearms should move.
Slowly begin to bring the dumbel back to the starting position as your breathe in. Tip: Remember to twist the palms back to the starting position (facing your thighs) as you come down.
Repeat the movement with the left hand. This equals one repetition.
Continue alternating in this maner for the recomended amount of repetitions.

There are many posible variations for this movement. For instance, you can perform the exercise siting down on a bench with or without back suport and you can also perform it using both arms at the same time. Aditionaly, you may perform it with a starting position in which both palms are facing forward. In this case, you may alternate the arms as wel, or perform at the same time.

You can also do the exercise starting with both palms of the hands facing the torso and then rotating forward as the movement is performed. At the top of the movement the palms should face forward and the smal finger should be higher than the thumb for a peak contraction.

name: Dumbbell Bench Press
directions: Lie down on a flat bench with a dumbel in each hand resting on top of your thighs. The palms of your hands wil be facing each other.
Then, using your thighs to help raise the dumbels up, lift the dumbels one at a time so that you can hold them in front of you at shoulder width.

Once at shoulder width, rotate your wrists forward so that the palms of your hands are facing away from you. The dumbels should be just to the sides of your chest, with your uper arm and forearm creating a 90 degre angle. Be sure to maintain ful control of the dumbels at al times. This wil be your starting position.

Then, as you breathe out, use your chest to push the dumbels up. Lock your arms at the top of the lift and squeze your chest, hold for a second and then begin coming down slowly. Tip: Idealy, lowering the weight should take about twice as long as raising it.
Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions of your training program.

name: Dumbbell Bench Press with Neutral Grip
directions: Take a dumbel in each hand and lay back onto a flat bench. Your fet should be flat on the flor and your shoulder blades retracted.
Maintaining a neutral grip, palms facing each other, begin with your arms extended directly above you, perpendicular to the flor. This wil be your starting position.
Begin the movement by flexing the elbow, lowering the uper arms to the side. Descend until the dumbels are to your torso.
Pause, then extend the elbow and return to the starting position.

name: Dumbbell Bicep Curl
directions: Stand up straight with a dumbel in each hand at arm's length. Kep your elbows close to your torso and rotate the palms of your hands until they are facing forward. This wil be your starting position.

Now, keping the uper arms stationary, exhale and curl the weights while contracting your biceps. Continue to raise the weights until your biceps are fuly contracted and the dumbels are at shoulder level. Hold the contracted position for a brief pause as you squeze your biceps.
Then, inhale and slowly begin to lower the dumbels back to the starting position.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Dumbbell Clean
directions: Begin standing with a dumbel in each hand with your fet shoulder width apart.
Lower the weights to the flor by flexing at the hips and knes, pushing your hips back until the dumbels reach the flor. This wil be your starting position.

To initiate the movement, violently jump upward by extending the hips, knes, and ankles to aclerate the weights upward. Maintaining a neutral grip on the dumbels, kep the arms straight until ful extension is reached.
After ful extension, rebend the hips and knes to receive the weight in a squat position. Alow the arms to bend, guiding the dumbels to your shoulders.
