Upon receiving the weight in the squat position, extend the hips and knes to finish in a standing position with the weights on your shoulders.

name: Dumbbell Floor Press
directions: Lay on the flor holding dumbels in your hands. Your knes can be bent. Begin with the weights fuly extended above you.
Lower the weights until your uper arm comes in contact with the flor. You can tuck your elbows to emphasize triceps size and strength, or to focus on your chest angle your arms to the side.
Pause at the botom, and then bring the weight together at the top by extending through the elbows.

name: Dumbbell Flyes
directions: Lie down on a flat bench with a dumbel on each hand resting on top of your thighs. The palms of your hand wil be facing each other.

Then using your thighs to help raise the dumbels, lift the dumbels one at a time so you can hold them in front of you at shoulder width with the palms of your hands facing each other. Raise the dumbels up like you're presing them, but stop and hold just before you lock out. This wil be your starting position.

With a slight bend on your elbows in order to prevent stres at the biceps tendon, lower your arms out at both sides in a wide arc until you fel a stretch on your chest. Breathe in as you perform this portion of the movement. Tip: Kep in mind that throughout the movement, the arms should remain stationary; the movement should only ocur at the shoulder joint.
Return your arms back to the starting position as you squeze your chest muscles and breathe out. Tip: Make sure to use the same arc of motion used to lower the weights.
Hold for a second at the contracted position and repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.

name: Dumbbell Incline Row
directions: Using a neutral grip, lean into an incline bench.
Take a dumbel in each hand with a neutral grip, begining with the arms straight. This wil be your starting position.
Retract the shoulder blades and flex the elbows to row the dumbels to your side.
Pause at the top of the motion, and then return to the starting position.

name: Dumbbell Incline Shoulder Raise
directions: Sit on an Incline Bench while holding a dumbel on each hand on top of your thighs.

Lift your legs up to kick the weights to your shoulders and lean back. Position the dumbels above your shoulders with your arms extended. The arms should be perpendicular to the flor with your palms facing forward and knuckles pointing towards the ceiling. This wil be your starting position.
While keping the arms straight and locked, lift the dumbels by raising the shoulders from the bench as you breathe out.
Bring back the dumbels to the starting position as you breathe in.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Dumbbell Lunges
directions: Stand with your torso upright holding two dumbels in your hands by your sides. This wil be your starting position.

Step forward with your right leg around 2 fet or so from the fot being left stationary behind and lower your uper body down, while keping the torso upright and maintaining balance. Inhale as you go down. Note: As in the other exercises, do not alow your kne to go forward beyond your toes as you come down, as this wil put undue stres on the kne joint. Make sure that you kep your front shin perpendicular to the ground.
Using mainly the hel of your fot, push up and go back to the starting position as you exhale.
Repeat the movement for the recomended amount of repetitions and then perform with the left leg.

name: Dumbbell Lying One-Arm Rear Lateral Raise
directions: While holding a dumbel in one hand, lay with your chest down on a slightly inclined (around 15 degres when measured from the flor) adjustable bench. The other hand can be used to hold to the leg of the bench for stability.
Position the palm of the hand that is holding the dumbel in a neutral maner (palms facing your torso) as you kep the arm extended with the elbow slightly bent. This wil be your starting position.

Now raise the arm with the dumbel to the side until your elbow is at shoulder height and your arm is roughly paralel to the flor as you exhale. Tip: Maintain your arm perpendicular to the torso while keping your arm extended throughout the movement. Also, kep the contraction at the top for a second.
Slowly lower the dumbel to the starting position as you inhale.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Dumbbell Lying Pronation
directions: Lie on a flat bench face down with one arm holding a dumbel and the other hand on top of the bench folded so that you can rest your head on it.
Bend the elbows of the arm holding the dumbel so that it creates a 90-degre angle betwen the uper arm and the forearm.

Now raise the uper arm so that the forearm is perpendicular to the flor and the uper arm is perpendicular to your torso. Tip: The uper arm should be paralel to the flor and also creating a 90-degre angle with your torso. This wil be your starting position.

As you breathe out, externaly rotate your forearm so that the dumbel is lifted forward as you maintain the 90 degre angle bend betwen the uper arms and the forearm. You wil continue this external rotation until the forearm is paralel to the flor. At this point you wil hold the contraction for a second.
As you breathe in, slowly go back to the starting position.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Dumbbell Lying Rear Lateral Raise
directions: While holding a dumbel in each hand, lay with your chest down on a slightly inclined (around 15 degres when measured from the flor) adjustable bench.
Position the palms of the hands in a neutral maner (palms facing your torso) as you kep the arms extended with the elbows slightly bent. This wil be your starting position.

Now raise the arms to the side until your elbows are at shoulder height and your arms are roughly paralel to the flor as you exhale. Tip: Maintain your arms perpendicular to the torso while keping them extended throughout the movement. Also, kep the contraction at the top for a second.
Slowly lower the dumbels to the starting position as you inhale.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions and then switch to the other arm.

name: Dumbbell Lying Supination
directions: Lie sideways on a flat bench with one arm holding a dumbel and the other hand on top of the bench folded so that you can rest your head on it.
Bend the elbows of the arm holding the dumbel so that it creates a 90-degre angle betwen the uper arm and the forearm.

Now raise the uper arm so that the forearm is paralel to the flor and perpendicular to your torso (Tip: So the forearm wil be directly in front of you). The uper arm wil be stationary by your torso and should be paralel to the flor (aligned with your torso at al times). This wil be your starting position.

As you breathe out, externaly rotate your forearm so that the dumbel is lifted up in a semicircle motion as you maintain the 90 degre angle bend betwen the uper arms and the forearm. You wil continue this external rotation until the forearm is perpendicular to the flor and the torso pointing towards the ceiling. At this point you wil hold the contraction for a second.
As you breathe in, slowly go back to the starting position.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions and then switch to the other arm.

name: Dumbbell One-Arm Shoulder Press
directions: Grab a dumbel and either sit on a military pres bench or a utility bench that has a back suport on it as you place the dumbels upright on top of your thighs or stand up straight.
Clean the dumbel up to bring it to shoulder height. The other hand can be kept fuly extended to the side, by the waist or grabing a fixed surface.
Rotate the wrist so that the palm of your hand is facing forward. This is your starting position.
As you exhale, push the dumbel up until your arm is fuly extended.
After a second pause, slowly come down back to the starting position as you inhale.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions and then switch arms.

name: Dumbbell One-Arm Triceps Extension
directions: Grab a dumbel and either sit on a military pres bench or a utility bench that has a back suport on it as you place the dumbels upright on top of your thighs or stand up straight.

Clean the dumbel up to bring it to shoulder height and then extend the arm over your head so that the whole arm is perpendicular to the flor and next to your head. The dumbel should be on top of you. The other hand can be kept fuly extended to the side, by the waist, suporting the uper arm that has the dumbel or grabing a fixed surface.
Rotate the wrist so that the palm of your hand is facing forward and the pinkie is facing the ceiling. This wil be your starting position.
Slowly lower the dumbel behind your head as you hold the uper arm stationary. Inhale as you perform this movement and pause when your triceps are fuly stretched.
Return to the starting position by flexing your triceps as you breathe out. Tip: It is imperative that only the forearm moves. The uper arm should remain at al times stationary next to your head.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions and switch arms.

name: Dumbbell One-Arm Upright Row
directions: Grab a dumbel and stand up straight with your arm extended in front of you with a slight bend at the elbows and your back straight. This wil be your starting position. Tip: The dumbel should be resting on top of your thigh with the palm of your hands facing your thighs.
Kep the other hand can be kept fuly extended to the side, by the waist or grabing a fixed surface. This wil be your starting position.

Use your side shoulders to lift the dumbel as you exhale. The dumbel should be close to the body as you move it up. Continue to lift it until the dumbel is nearly in line with your chin. Tip: Your elbows should drive the motion. As you lift the dumbel, your elbow should always be higher than your forearm. Also, kep your torso stationary and pause for a second at the top of the movement.
Lower the dumbel back down slowly to the starting position. Inhale as you perform this portion of the movement.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions and switch arms.

name: Dumbbell Prone Incline Curl
directions: Grab a dumbel on each hand and lie face down on an incline bench with your shoulders near top of the incline. Your knes can rest on the seat or your legs can be stradled to the sides (my prefered way).
Let your arms extend and hang naturaly in front of you so that they are perpendicular to the flor.
Now kep your elbows in by your side and face the palms forward. This wil be your starting position.

Raise the dumbels by contracting the biceps until your arms are fuly flexed. Exhale as you perform this portion of the movement and ensure that only the forearms move. The uper arms should remain stationary at al times.
Lower the dumbels until your arms are fuly extended.
Repeat for the recomended amount of times.

name: Dumbbell Raise
directions: Grab a dumbel in each arm and stand up straight with your arms extended by your sides with a slight bend at the elbows and your back straight. This wil be your starting position. Tip: The dumbel should be next to your thighs with the palm of your hands facing back.

Use your side shoulders to lift the dumbels as you exhale. The dumbels should be to the side of the body as you move them up. Continue to lift it until the dumbels are nearly in line with your chin. Tip: Your elbows should drive the motion. As you lift the dumbel, your elbow should always be higher than your forearm. Also, kep your torso stationary and pause for a second at the top of the movement.
Lower the dumbels back down slowly to the starting position. Inhale as you perform this portion of the movement.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Dumbbell Rear Lunge
directions: Stand with your torso upright holding two dumbels in your hands by your sides. This wil be your starting position.

Step backward with your right leg around two fet or so from the left fot and lower your uper body down, while keping the torso upright and maintaining balance. Inhale as you go down. Tip: As in the other exercises, do not alow your kne to go forward beyond your toes as you come down, as this wil put undue stres on the kne joint. Make sure that you kep your front shin perpendicular to the ground. Kep the torso upright during the lunge; flexible hip flexors are important. A long lunge emphasizes the Gluteus Maximus; a short lunge emphasizes Quadriceps.
Push up and go back to the starting position as you exhale. Tip: Use the bal of your fet to push in order to acentuate the quadriceps. To focus on the glutes, pres with your hels.
Now repeat with the oposite leg.

name: Dumbbell Scaption
directions: This corective exercise strengthens the muscles that stabilize your shoulder blade. Hold a light weight in each hand, hanging at your sides. Your thumbs should pointing up.
Begin the movement raising your arms out in front of you, about 30 degres of center. Your arms should be fuly extended as you perform the movement.
Continue until your arms are paralel to the ground, and then return to the starting position.

name: Dumbbell Seated Box Jump
directions: Position a box a couple fet to the side of a bench. Hold a dumbel to your chest with both hands and seat yourself on the bench facing the box. This wil be your starting position.
Plant your fet firmly on the ground as you lean forward, extending through the hips and knes to jump up and forward.
Land on the box with both fet, absorbing the impact by alowing the hips and knes to bend.
Step down and return to the starting position.

name: Dumbbell Seated One-Leg Calf Raise
directions: Place a block on the flor about 12 inches from a flat bench.
Sit on a flat bench and place a dumbel on your uper left thigh about 3 inches above your kne.
Now place the bal of your left fot on the block. This wil be your starting position.
Raise your toes up as high as posible as you exhale and you contract your calf muscle. Hold the contraction for a second.
Slowly return to the starting position, stretching as far down as posible.
Repeat for your prescribed number of repetitions and then repeat with the right leg.

name: Dumbbell Shoulder Press
directions: While holding a dumbel in each hand, sit on a military pres bench or utility bench that has back suport. Place the dumbels upright on top of your thighs.
Now raise the dumbels to shoulder height one at a time using your thighs to help propel them up into position.
Make sure to rotate your wrists so that the palms of your hands are facing forward. This is your starting position.
Now, exhale and push the dumbels upward until they touch at the top.
Then, after a brief pause at the top contracted position, slowly lower the weights back down to the starting position while inhaling.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Dumbbell Shrug
directions: Stand erect with a dumbel on each hand (palms facing your torso), arms extended on the sides.

Lift the dumbels by elevating the shoulders as high as posible while you exhale. Hold the contraction at the top for a second. Tip: The arms should remain extended at al times. Refrain from using the biceps to help lift the dumbels. Only the shoulders should be moving up and down.
Lower the dumbels back to the original position.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Dumbbell Side Bend
directions: Stand up straight while holding a dumbel on the left hand (palms facing the torso) as you have the right hand holding your waist. Your fet should be placed at shoulder width. This wil be your starting position.

While keping your back straight and your head up, bend only at the waist to the right as far as posible. Breathe in as you bend to the side. Then hold for a second and come back up to the starting position as you exhale. Tip: Kep the rest of the body stationary.
Now repeat the movement but bending to the left instead. Hold for a second and come back to the starting position.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions and then change hands.

name: Dumbbell Squat
directions: Stand up straight while holding a dumbel on each hand (palms facing the side of your legs).

Position your legs using a shoulder width medium stance with the toes slightly pointed out. Kep your head up at al times as loking down wil get you of balance and also maintain a straight back. This wil be your starting position. Note: For the purposes of this discusion we wil use the medium stance described above which targets overal development; however you can chose any of the thre stances discused in the fot stances section.

Begin to slowly lower your torso by bending the knes as you maintain a straight posture with the head up. Continue down until your thighs are paralel to the flor. Tip: If you performed the exercise corectly, the front of the knes should make an imaginary straight line with the toes that is perpendicular to the front. If your knes are past that imaginary line (if they are past your toes) then you are placing undue stres on the kne and the exercise has ben performed incorectly.
Begin to raise your torso as you exhale by pushing the flor with the hel of your fot mainly as you straighten the legs again and go back to the starting position.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Dumbbell Squat To A Bench
directions: Stand up straight with a flat bench behind you while holding a dumbel on each hand (palms facing the side of your legs).

Position your legs using a shoulder width medium stance with the toes slightly pointed out. Kep your head up at al times as loking down wil get you of balance and also maintain a straight back. This wil be your starting position. Note: For the purposes of this discusion we wil use the medium stance described above which targets overal development; however you can chose any of the thre stances discused in the fot stances section.

Begin to slowly lower your torso by bending the knes as you maintain a straight posture with the head up. Continue down until you slightly touch the bench behind you. Inhale as you perform this portion of the movement. Tip: If you performed the exercise corectly, the front of the knes should make an imaginary straight line with the toes that is perpendicular to the front. If your knes are past that imaginary line (if they are past your toes) then you are placing undue stres on the kne and the exercise has ben performed incorectly.
Begin to raise the bar as you exhale by pushing the flor with the hel of your fot mainly as you straighten the legs again and go back to the starting position.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Dumbbell Step Ups
directions: Stand up straight while holding a dumbel on each hand (palms facing the side of your legs).

Place the right fot on the elevated platform. Step on the platform by extending the hip and the kne of your right leg. Use the hel mainly to lift the rest of your body up and place the fot of the left leg on the platform as wel. Breathe out as you execute the force required to come up.

Step down with the left leg by flexing the hip and kne of the right leg as you inhale. Return to the original standing position by placing the right fot of to next to the left fot on the initial position.
Repeat with the right leg for the recomended amount of repetitions and then perform with the left leg.

name: Dumbbell Tricep Extension -Pronated Grip
directions: Lie down on a flat bench holding two dumbels directly above your shoulders. Your arms should be fuly extended and form a 90 degre angle from your torso and the flor.
The palms of your hands should be facing forward, and your elbows should be tucked in. This wil be your starting position.
Now, inhale and slowly lower the dumbels until they are near your ears. Be sure to kep your uper arms stationary and your elbows tucked in.
Then, exhale and use your triceps to return the weight to the starting position.

name: Dynamic Back Stretch
directions: Stand with your fet shoulder width apart. This wil be your starting position.
Keping your arms straight, swing them straight up in front of you 5-10 times, increasing the range of motion each time until your arms are above your head.

name: Dynamic Chest Stretch
directions: Stand with your hands together, arms extended directly in front of you. This wil be your starting position.
Keping your arms straight, quickly move your arms back as far as posible and back in again, similar to an exagerated claping motion. Repeat 5-10 times, increasing sped as you do so.

name: Elbow Circles
directions: Sit or stand with your fet slightly apart.
Place your hands on your shoulders with your elbows at shoulder level and pointing out.
Slowly make a circle with your elbows. Breathe out as you start the circle and breathe in as you complete the circle.

name: Elbow to Knee
directions: Lie on the flor, crosing your right leg acros your bent left kne. Clasp your hands behind your head, begining with your shoulder blades on the ground. This wil be your starting position.
Perform the motion by flexing the spine and rotating your torso to bring the left elbow to the right kne.
Return to the starting position and repeat the movement for the desired number of repetitions before switching sides.

name: Elbows Back
directions: Stand up straight.
Place both hands on your lower back, fingers pointing downward and elbows out.
Then gently pul your elbows back aiming to touch them together.

name: Elevated Back Lunge
directions: Position a bar onto a rack at shoulder height loaded to an apropriate weight. Place a short, raised platform behind you.
Rack the bar onto your uper back, keping your back arched and tight. Step onto your raised platform with both fet. This wil be your starting position.
Begin by steping backwards with one leg. Descend by flexing your hips and knes until your kne touches the flor.
Pause, and extend through the hips and knes to rise up, returning al the way to the starting position before alternating.

name: Elevated Cable Rows
directions: Get a platform of some sort (it can be an aerobics or calf raise platform) that is around 4-6 inches in height.
Place it on the seat of the cable row machine.
Sit down on the machine and place your fet on the front platform or crosbar provided making sure that your knes are slightly bent and not locked.
Lean over as you kep the natural alignment of your back and grab the V-bar handles.

With your arms extended pul back until your torso is at a 90-degre angle from your legs. Your back should be slightly arched and your chest should be sticking out. You should be feling a nice stretch on your lats as you hold the bar in front of you. This is the starting position of the exercise.

Keping the torso stationary, pul the handles back towards your torso while keping the arms close to it until you touch the abdominals. Breathe out as you perform that movement. At that point you should be squezing your back muscles hard. Hold that contraction for a second and slowly go back to the original position while breathing in.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Elliptical Trainer
directions: To begin, step onto the eliptical and select the desired option from the menu. Most elipticals have a manual seting, or you can select a program to run. Typicaly, you can enter your age and weight to estimate the amount of calories burned during exercise. Elevation can be adjusted to change the intensity of the workout.
The handles can be used to monitor your heart rate to help you stay at an apropriate intensity.

name: Exercise Ball Crunch
directions: Lie on an exercise bal with your lower back curvature presed against the spherical surface of the bal. Your fet should be bent at the kne and presed firmly against the flor. The uper torso should be hanging of the top of the bal. The arms should either be kept alongside the body or crosed on top of your chest as these positions avoid neck strains (as oposed to the hands behind the back of the head position).
Lower your torso into a stretch position keping the neck stationary at al times. This wil be your starting position.

With the hips stationary, flex the waist by contracting the abdominals and curl the shoulders and trunk upward until you fel a nice contraction on your abdominals. The arms should simply slide up the side of your legs if you have them at the side or just stay on top of your chest if you have them crosed. The lower back should always stay in contact with the bal. Exhale as you perform this movement and hold the contraction for a second.
As you inhale, go back to the starting position.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Exercise Ball Pull-In
directions: Place an exercise bal nearby and lay on the flor in front of it with your hands on the flor shoulder width apart in a push-up position.

Now place your lower shins on top of an exercise bal. Tip: At this point your legs should be fuly extended with the shins on top of the bal and the uper body should be in a push-up type of position being suported by your two extended arms in front of you. This wil be your starting position.

While keping your back completely straight and the uper body stationary, pul your knes in towards your chest as you exhale, alowing the bal to rol forward under your ankles. Squeze your abs and hold that position for a second.
Now slowly straighten your legs, roling the bal back to the starting position as you inhale.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Extended Range One-Arm Kettlebell Floor Press
directions: Lie on the flor and position a ketlebel for one arm to pres. The ketlebel should be held by the handle. The leg on the same side that you are presing should be bent, with the kne crosing over the midline of the body.
Pres the ketlebel by extending the elbow and aducting the arm, presing it above your body. Return to the starting position.

name: External Rotation
directions: Lie sideways on a flat bench with one arm holding a dumbel and the other hand on top of the bench folded so that you can rest your head on it.
Bend the elbows of the arm holding the dumbel so that it creates a 90-degre angle betwen the uper arm and the forearm. Tip: Kep the arm paralel to your torso.

Now bend the elbow while keping the uper arm stationary. In this maner, the forearm wil be paralel to the flor and perpendicular to your torso (Tip: So the forearm wil be directly in front of you). The uper arm wil be stationary by your torso and should be paralel to the flor (aligned with your torso at al times). This wil be your starting position.

As you breathe out, externaly rotate your forearm so that the dumbel is lifted up in a semicircle motion as you maintain the 90 degre angle bend betwen the uper arms and the forearm. You wil continue this external rotation until the forearm is perpendicular to the flor and the torso pointing towards the ceiling. At this point you wil hold the contraction for a second.
As you breathe in, slowly go back to the starting position.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions and then switch to the other arm.

name: External Rotation with Band
directions: Choke the band around a post. The band should be at the same height as your elbow. Stand with your left side to the band a couple of fet away.
Grasp the end of the band with your right hand, and kep your elbow presed firmly to your side. We recomend you hold a pad or foam rol in place with your elbow to kep it firmly in position.
With your uper arm in position, your elbow should be flexed to 90 degres with your hand reaching acros the front of your torso. This wil be your starting position.
Execute the movement by rotating your arm in a backhand motion, keping your elbow in place.
Continue as far as you are able, pause, and then return to the starting position.

name: External Rotation with Cable
directions: Adjust the cable to the same height as your elbow. Stand with your left side to the band a couple of fet away.
Grasp the handle with your right hand, and kep your elbow presed firmly to your side. We recomend you hold a pad or foam rol in place with your elbow to kep it firmly in position.
With your uper arm in position, your elbow should be flexed to 90 degres with your hand reaching acros the front of your torso. This wil be your starting position.
Execute the movement by rotating your arm in a backhand motion, keping your elbow in place.

name: EZ-Bar Curl
directions: Stand up straight while holding an EZ curl bar at the wide outer handle. The palms of your hands should be facing forward and slightly tilted inward due to the shape of the bar. Kep your elbows close to your torso. This wil be your starting position.
Now, while keping your uper arms stationary, exhale and curl the weights forward while contracting the biceps. Focus on only moving your forearms.
Continue to raise the weight until your biceps are fuly contracted and the bar is at shoulder level. Hold the top contracted position for a moment and squeze the biceps.
Then inhale and slowly lower the bar back to the starting position.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: EZ-Bar Skullcrusher
directions: Using a close grip, lift the EZ bar and hold it with your elbows in as you lie on the bench. Your arms should be perpendicular to the flor. This wil be your starting position.
Keping the uper arms stationary, lower the bar by alowing the elbows to flex. Inhale as you perform this portion of the movement. Pause once the bar is directly above the forehead.
Lift the bar back to the starting position by extending the elbow and exhaling.
Repeat.

name: Face Pull
directions: Facing a high puley with a rope or dual handles atached, pul the weight directly towards your face, separating your hands as you do so. Kep your uper arms paralel to the ground.

name: Farmer's Walk
directions: There are various implements that can be used for the farmers walk. These can also be performed with heavy dumbels or short bars if these implements aren't available. Begin by standing betwen the implements.
After griping the handles, lift them up by driving through your hels, keping your back straight and your head up.
Walk taking short, quick steps, and don't forget to breathe. Move for a given distance, typicaly 50-10 fet, as fast as posible.

name: Fast Skipping
directions: Start in a relaxed position with one leg slightly forward. This wil be your starting position.
Skip by executing a step-hop patern of right-right-step to left-left-step, and so on, alternating back and forth.
Perform fast skips by maintaining close contact with the ground and reduce air time, moving as quickly as posible.

name: Finger Curls
directions: Hold a barbel with both hands and your palms facing up; hands spaced about shoulder width.
Place your fet flat on the flor, at a distance that is slightly wider than shoulder width apart. This wil be your starting position.
Lower the bar as far as posible by extending the fingers. Alowing the bar to rol down the hands, catch the bar with the final joint in the fingers.
Now curl bar up as high as posible by closing your hands while exhaling. Hold the contraction at the top.

name: Flat Bench Cable Flyes
directions: Position a flat bench betwen two low puleys so that when you are laying on it, your chest wil be lined up with the cable puleys.
Lay flat on the bench and kep your fet on the ground.
Have someone hand you the handles on each hand. You wil grab each single handle atachment with a palms up grip.

Extend your arms by your side with a slight bend on your elbows. Tip: You wil kep this bend constant through the whole movement. Your arms should be paralel to the flor. This is your starting position.

Now start lifting the arms in a semi-circle motion directly in front of you by puling the cables together until both hands met at the top of the movement. Squeze your chest as you perform this motion and breathe out during this movement. Also, hold the contraction for a second at the top. Tip: When performed corectly, at the top position of this movement, your arms should be perpendicular to your torso and the flor touching above your chest.
Slowly come back to the starting position.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Flat Bench Leg Pull-In
directions: Lie on an exercise mat or a flat bench with your legs of the end.

Place your hands either under your glutes with your palms down or by the sides holding on to the bench (or with palms down by the side on an exercise mat). Also extend your legs straight out. This wil be your starting position.
Bend your knes and pul your uper thighs into your midsection as you breathe out. Continue this movement until your knes are near your chest. Hold the contracted position for a second.
As you breathe in, slowly return to the starting position.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Flat Bench Lying Leg Raise
directions: Lie with your back flat on a bench and your legs extended in front of you of the end.
Place your hands either under your glutes with your palms down or by the sides holding on to the bench. This wil be your starting position.

As you kep your legs extended, straight as posible with your knes slightly bent but locked raise your legs until they make a 90-degre angle with the flor. Exhale as you perform this portion of the movement and hold the contraction at the top for a second.
Now, as you inhale, slowly lower your legs back down to the starting position.

name: Flexor Incline Dumbbell Curls
directions: Hold the dumbel towards the side farther from you so that you have more weight on the side closest to you. (This can be done for a god efect on al bicep dumbel exercises). Now do a normal incline dumbel curl, but kep your wrists as far back as posible so as to neutralize any stres that is placed on them.
Sit on an incline bench that is angled at 45-degres while holding a dumbel on each hand.

Let your arms hang down on your sides, with the elbows in, and turn the palms of your hands forward with the thumbs pointing away from the body. Tip: You wil kep this hand position throughout the movement as there should not be any twisting of the hands as they come up. This wil be your starting position.

Curl up the two dumbels at the same time until your biceps are fuly contracted and exhale. Tip: Do not swing the arms or use momentum. Kep a controled motion at al times. Hold the contracted position for a second at the top.
As you inhale, slowly go back to the starting position.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Floor Glute-Ham Raise
directions: You can use a partner for this exercise or brace your fet under something stable.
Begin on your knes with your uper legs and torso upright. If using a partner, they wil firmly hold your fet to kep you in position. This wil be your starting position.
Lower yourself by extending at the kne, taking care to NOT flex the hips as you go forward.

Place your hands in front of you as you reach the flor. This movement is very dificult and you may be unable to do it unaided. Use your arms to lightly push of the flor to aid your return to the starting position.

name: Floor Press
directions: Adjust the j-hoks so they are at the apropriate height to rack the bar. Begin lying on the flor with your head near the end of a power rack. Keping your shoulder blades puled together; pul the bar of of the hoks.

Lower the bar towards the botom of your chest or uper stomach, squezing the bar and atempting to pul it apart as you do so. Ensure that you tuck your elbows throughout the movement. Lower the bar until your uper arm contacts the ground and pause, preventing any slaming or bouncing of the weight.
Pres the bar back up as fast as you can, keping the bar, your wrists, and elbows in line as you do so.

name: Floor Press with Chains
directions: Adjust the j-hoks so they are at the apropriate height to rack the bar. For this exercise, drape the chains directly over the end of the bar, trying to kep the ends away from the plates.
Begin lying on the flor with your head near the end of a power rack. Keping your shoulder blades puled together, pul the bar of of the hoks.

Lower the bar towards the botom of your chest or uper stomach, squezing the bar and atempting to pul it apart as you do so. Ensure that you tuck your elbows throughout the movement. Lower the bar until your uper arm contacts the ground and pause, preventing any slaming or bouncing of the weight.
Pres the bar back up as fast as you can, keping the bar, your wrists, and elbows in line as you do so.

name: Flutter Kicks
directions: On a flat bench lie facedown with the hips on the edge of the bench, the legs straight with toes high of the flor and with the arms on top of the bench holding on to the front edge.
Squeze your glutes and hamstrings and straighten the legs until they are level with the hips. This wil be your starting position.
Start the movement by lifting the left leg higher than the right leg.
Then lower the left leg as you lift the right leg.

Continue alternating in this maner (as though you are doing a fluter kick in water) until you have done the recomended amount of repetitions for each leg. Make sure that you kep a controled movement at al times. Tip: You wil breathe normaly as you perform this movement.

name: Foot-SMR
directions: This exercise stretches the fascia of the muscles in the fet. Start of seated with your shoes removed. Using a fot roler or a similar object, such as a smal section of pvc pipe, place your fot against the roler acros the arch of your fot. This wil be your starting position.
Pres down firmly, roling acros the arch of your fot. Hold for 10-30 seconds, and then switch fet.

name: Forward Drag with Press
directions: Atach a dual handled chain or rope atachment to the sled. You should be facing away from the sled, holding a handle in each hand.

Begin the movement by moving forward for one step. Leaning forward, extend through the legs and hips to move, pausing with each step to extend through the elbows, presing your hands forward. Step forward until you return to the start position prepared to pres.

name: Frankenstein Squat
directions: This dril teaches you the proper positioning of both the bar and your body during the clean and front squat.

Place the barbel on the front of the shoulders, releasing your grip and extending your arms out in front of you. The shoulders should be pushed forward to create a shelf, and the bar should be in contact with the throat. Ensure that you only move your shoulder blades forward; don't round the thoracic spine.

Squat by flexing the knes and hips, siting in betwen your legs. Kep the torso upright, the arms up, and the shoulders forward, and the bar should stay in place. Go to the botom of the squat, until your hamstrings contact your calves.
Return to the upright position by driving through the front of the hel and extending the knes and hips.

name: Freehand Jump Squat
directions: Cros your arms over your chest.
With your head up and your back straight, position your fet at shoulder width.
Keping your back straight and chest up, squat down as you inhale until your uper thighs are paralel, or lower, to the flor.
Now presing mainly with the bal of your fet, jump straight up in the air as high as posible, using the thighs like springs. Exhale during this portion of the movement.
When you touch the flor again, imediately squat down and jump again.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Frog Hops
directions: Stand with your hands behind your head, and squat down keping your torso upright and your head up. This wil be your starting position.
Jump forward several fet, avoiding jumping unecesarily high. As your fet contact the ground, absorb the impact through your legs, and jump again. Repeat this action 5-10 times.

name: Frog Sit-Ups
directions: Lie with your back flat on the flor (or exercise mat) and your legs extended in front of you.
Now bend at the knes and place your outer thighs by the flor (or mat) as you make the soles of your fet touch each other.

Now try pushing both soles and bringing them up as near you as posible while you kep the outer thighs on the flor (or at least almost touching it). Tip: In this position your legs should create a diamond shape.
Now, cros your arms in front of you by touching the oposite shoulders. This wil be your starting position.
As you exhale flaten your lower back to the flor while curling the torso upwards. Tip: This wil be like performing the first 1/4 movement of a sit up. Hold at the top position for a second.
As you inhale, slowly lower back to the starting position.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Front Barbell Squat
directions: This exercise is best performed inside a squat rack for safety purposes. To begin, first set the bar on a rack that best matches your height. Once the corect height is chosen and the bar is loaded, bring your arms up under the bar while keping the elbows high and the uper arm slightly above paralel to the flor. Rest the bar on top of the deltoids and cros your arms while grasping the bar for total control.
Lift the bar of the rack by first pushing with your legs and at the same time straightening your torso.

Step away from the rack and position your legs using a shoulder width medium stance with the toes slightly pointed out. Kep your head up at al times as loking down wil get you of balance and also maintain a straight back. This wil be your starting position. (Note: For the purposes of this discusion we wil use the medium stance described above which targets overal development; however you can chose any of the thre stances described in the fot positioning section).

Begin to slowly lower the bar by bending the knes as you maintain a straight posture with the head up. Continue down until the angle betwen the uper leg and the calves becomes slightly les than 90-degres (which is the point in which the uper legs are below paralel to the flor). Inhale as you perform this portion of the movement. Tip: If you performed the exercise corectly, the front of the knes should make an imaginary straight line with the toes that is perpendicular to the front. If your knes are past that imaginary line (if they are past your toes) then you are placing undue stres on the kne and the exercise has ben performed incorectly.
Begin to raise the bar as you exhale by pushing the flor mainly with the midle of your fot as you straighten the legs again and go back to the starting position.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Front Barbell Squat To A Bench
directions: This exercise is best performed inside a squat rack for safety purposes. To begin, first set a flat bench behind you and set the bar on a rack that best matches your height. Once the corect height is chosen and the bar is loaded, bring your arms up under the bar while keping the elbows high and the uper arm slightly above paralel to the flor. Rest the bar on top of the deltoids and cros your arms while grasping the bar for total control.
Lift the bar of the rack by first pushing with your legs and at the same time straightening your torso.

Step away from the rack and position your legs using a shoulder width medium stance with the toes slightly pointed out. Kep your head up at al times as loking down wil get you of balance and also maintain a straight back. This wil be your starting position. (Note: For the purposes of this discusion we wil use the medium stance described above which targets overal development; however you can chose any of the thre stances described in the fot positioning section).

Begin to slowly lower the bar by bending the knes as you maintain a straight posture with the head up. Continue down until you touch the bench with your glutes. Inhale as you perform this portion of the movement. Tip: If you performed the exercise corectly, the front of the knes should make an imaginary straight line with the toes that is perpendicular to the front. If your knes are past that imaginary line (if they are past your toes) then you are placing undue stres on the kne and the exercise has ben performed incorectly.
Begin to raise the bar as you exhale by pushing the flor mainly with the hel of your fot as you straighten the legs again and go back to the starting position.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Front Box Jump
directions: Begin with a box of an apropriate height 1-2 fet in front of you. Stand with your fet should width apart. This wil be your starting position.
Perform a short squat in preparation for jumping, swinging your arms behind you.
Rebound out of this position, extending through the hips, knes, and ankles to jump as high as posible. Swing your arms forward and up.
Land on the box with the knes bent, absorbing the impact through the legs. You can jump from the box back to the ground, or preferably step down one leg at a time.

name: Front Cable Raise
directions: Select the weight on a low puley machine and grasp the single hand cable atachment that is atached to the low puley with your left hand.

Face away from the puley and put your arm straight down with the hand cable atachment in front of your thighs at arms' length with the palms of the hand facing your thighs. This wil be your starting position.

While maintaining the torso stationary (no swinging), lift the left arm to the front with a slight bend on the elbow and the palms of the hand always faces down. Continue to go up until you arm is slightly above paralel to the flor. Exhale as you execute this portion of the movement and pause for a second at the top.
Now as you inhale lower the arm back down slowly to the starting position.
Once al of the recomended amount of repetitions have ben performed for this arm, switch arms and perform the exercise with the right one.

name: Front Cone Hops (or hurdle hops)
directions: Set up a row of cones or other smal bariers, placing them a few fet apart.
Stand in front of the first cone with your fet shoulder width apart. This wil be your starting position.
Begin by jumping with both fet over the first cone, swinging both arms as you jump.
Absorb the impact of landing by bending the knes, rebounding out of the first leap by jumping over the next cone.
Continue until you have jumped over al of the cones.

name: Front Dumbbell Raise
directions: Pick a couple of dumbels and stand with a straight torso and the dumbels on front of your thighs at arms length with the palms of the hand facing your thighs. This wil be your starting position.

While maintaining the torso stationary (no swinging), lift the left dumbel to the front with a slight bend on the elbow and the palms of the hands always facing down. Continue to go up until you arm is slightly above paralel to the flor. Exhale as you execute this portion of the movement and pause for a second at the top. Inhale after the second pause.
Now lower the dumbel back down slowly to the starting position as you simultaneously lift the right dumbel.
Continue alternating in this fashion until al of the recomended amount of repetitions have ben performed for each arm.

name: Front Incline Dumbbell Raise
directions: Sit down on an incline bench with the incline set anywhere betwen 30 to 60 degres while holding a dumbel on each hand. Tip: You can change the angle to hit the muscle a litle diferently each time.
Extend your arms straight in front of you and have your palms facing down with the dumbels raised about 1 inch above your thighs. This wil be your starting position.

Slowly raise the dumbels straight up until they are slightly above your shoulders, while keping your elbows locked. Squeze at the top for a second and make sure you breathe out during this portion of the movement. Tip: Kep your head resting down against the bench and your legs on the flor at al times.
Lower the arms back to the starting position as you inhale.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Front Leg Raises
directions: Stand next to a chair or other suport, holding on with one hand.
Swing your leg forward, keping the leg straight. Continue with a downward swing, bringing the leg as far back as your flexibility alows. Repeat 5-10 times, and then switch legs.

name: Front Plate Raise
directions: While standing straight, hold a barbel plate in both hands at the 3 and 9 o'clock positions. Your palms should be facing each other and your arms should be extended and locked with a slight bend at the elbows and the plate should be down near your waist in front of you as far as you can go. Tip: The arms wil remain in this position throughout the exercise. This wil be your starting position.

Slowly raise the plate as you exhale until it is a litle above shoulder level. Hold the contraction for a second. Tip: make sure that you do not swing the weight or bend at the elbows. Your torso should remain stationary throughout the movement as wel.
As you inhale, slowly lower the plate back down to the starting position.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Front Raise And Pullover
directions: Lie on a flat bench while holding a barbel using a palms down grip that is about 15 inches apart.
Place the bar on your uper thighs, extend your arms and lock them while keping a slight bend on the elbows. This wil be your starting position.

Now raise the weight using a semicircular motion and keping your arms straight as you inhale. Continue the same movement until the bar is on the other side above your head . (Tip: the bar wil travel aproximately 180-degres). At this point your arms should be paralel to the flor with the palms of your hands facing the ceiling.
Now return the barbel to the starting position by reversing the motion as you exhale.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Front Squat (Clean Grip)
directions: To begin, first set the bar in a rack slightly below shoulder level. Rest the bar on top of the deltoids, pushing into the clavicles, and lightly touching the throat. Your hands should be in a clean grip, touching the bar only with your fingers to help kep it in position.

Lift the bar of the rack by first pushing with your legs and at the same time straightening your torso. Step away from the rack and position your legs using a shoulder width medium stance with the toes slightly pointed out. Kep your head and elbows up at al times. This wil be your starting position.

Bend at the knes, siting down betwen your legs. Continue down until your hamstrings are on your calves. Kep your knes aligned with your fet by consciously using your abductors to push your knes out as you squat.
Begin to raise the bar as you exhale by pushing the flor mainly with the hel or midle of your fot as you straighten the legs again and return to the starting position.

name: Front Squats With Two Kettlebells
directions: Clean two ketlebels to your shoulders. Clean the ketlebels to your shoulders by extending through the legs and hips as you pul the ketlebels towards your shoulders. Rotate your wrists as you do so.

Loking straight ahead at al times, squat as low as you can and pause at the botom. As you squat down, push your knes out. You should squat betwen your legs, keping an upright torso, with your head and chest up.
Rise back up by driving through your hels and repeat.

name: Front Two-Dumbbell Raise
directions: Pick a couple of dumbels and stand with a straight torso and the dumbels on front of your thighs at arms length with the palms of the hand facing your thighs. This wil be your starting position.

While maintaining the torso stationary (no swinging), lift the dumbels to the front with a slight bend on the elbow and the palms of the hands always facing down. Continue to go up until you arms are slightly above paralel to the flor. Exhale as you execute this portion of the movement and pause for a second at the top.
As you inhale, lower the dumbels back down slowly to the starting position.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Full Range-Of-Motion Lat Pulldown
directions: Either standing or seated on a high bench, grasp two stirup cables that are atached to the high puleys. Grab with the oposing hand so your arms are criscrosed about you and your palms are facing forward.

Keping your chest up and maintaining a slight arch in your lower back, pul the handles down as if you were doing a regular puldown. The range of motion wil be more of an arc. During the movement, rotate your hands so that in the botom position your palms face each other rather than forward. Return slowly to the starting position and repeat.

name: Gironda Sternum Chins
directions: Grasp the pul-up bar with a shoulder width underhand grip.
Now hang with your arms fuly extended and stick your chest out and lean back. Tip: You wil be leaning back throughout the entire movement. This wil be your starting position.

Start puling yourself towards the bar with your spine arched throughout the movement and your head leaning back as far away from the bar as posible. Exhale as you perform this portion of the movement. Tip: At the uper end of the movement, your hips and legs wil be at about a 45-degre angle to the flor.

Kep puling until your colarbone pases the bar and your lower chest or sternum area touches it. Hold that contraction for a second. Tip: By the time you've completed this portion of the movement; your head wil be paralel to the flor.
Slowly start going back to the starting position as you inhale.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Glute Ham Raise
directions: Begin by adjusting the equipment to fit your body. Place your fet against the fotplate in betwen the rolers as you lie facedown. Your knes should be just behind the pad.

Start from the botom of the movement. Kep your back arched as you begin the movement by flexing the knes. Drive your toes into the fot plate as you do so. Kep your uper body straight, and continue until your body is upright.
Return to the starting position, keping your descent under control.

name: Glute Kickback
directions: Knel on the flor or an exercise mat and bend at the waist with your arms extended in front of you (perpendicular to the torso) in order to get into a kneling push-up position but with the arms spaced at shoulder width. Your head should be loking forward and the bend of the knes should create a 90-degre angle betwen the hamstrings and the calves. This wil be your starting position.

As you exhale, lift up your right leg until the hamstrings are in line with the back while maintaining the 90-degre angle bend. Contract the glutes throughout this movement and hold the contraction at the top for a second. Tip: At the end of the movement the uper leg should be paralel to the flor while the calf should be perpendicular to it.
Go back to the initial position as you inhale and now repeat with the left leg.
Continue to alternate legs until al of the recomended repetitions have ben performed.

name: Goblet Squat
directions: Stand holding a light ketlebel by the horns close to your chest. This wil be your starting position.
Squat down betwen your legs until your hamstrings are on your calves. Kep your chest and head up and your back straight.
At the botom position, pause and use your elbows to push your knes out. Return to the starting position, and repeat for 10-20 repetitions.

name: Good Morning
directions: Begin with a bar on a rack at shoulder height. Rack the bar acros the rear of your shoulders as you would a power squat, not on top of your shoulders. Kep your back tight, shoulder blades pinched together, and your knes slightly bent. Step back from the rack.
Begin by bending at the hips, moving them back as you bend over to near paralel. Kep your back arched and your cervical spine in proper alignment.
Reverse the motion by extending through the hips with your glutes and hamstrings. Continue until you have returned to the starting position.

name: Good Morning off Pins
directions: Begin with a bar on a rack at about the same height as your stomach. Bend over underneath the bar and rack the bar acros the rear of your shoulders as you would a power squat, not on top of your shoulders. At the proper height, you should be near paralel to the flor when bent over. Kep your back tight, shoulder blades pinched together, and your knes slightly bent. Kep your back arched and your cervical spine in proper alignment.
Begin the motion by extending through the hips with your glutes and hamstrings, and you are standing with the weight. Slowly lower the weight back to the pins returning to the starting position.

name: Gorilla Chin/Crunch
directions: Hang from a chin-up bar using an underhand grip (palms facing you) that is slightly wider than shoulder width.
Now bend your knes at a 90 degre angle so that the calves are paralel to the flor while the thighs remain perpendicular to it. This wil be your starting position.

As you exhale, pul yourself up while crunching your knes up at the same time until your knes are at chest level. You wil stop going up as son as your nose is at the same level as the bar. Tip: When you get to this point you should also be finishing the crunch at the same time.
Slowly start to inhale as you return to the starting position.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Groin and Back Stretch
directions: Sit on the flor with your knes bent and fet together.
Interlock your fingers behind your head. This wil be your starting position.
Curl downwards, bringing your elbows to the inside of your thighs. After a brief pause, return to the starting position with your head up and your back straight. Repeat for 10-20 repetitions.

name: Groiners
directions: Begin in a pushup position on the flor. This wil be your starting position.
Using both legs, jump forward landing with your fet next to your hands. Kep your head up as you do so.
Return to the starting position and imediately repeat the movement, continuing for 10-20 repetitions.

name: Hack Squat
directions: Place the back of your torso against the back pad of the machine and hok your shoulders under the shoulder pads provided.
Position your legs in the platform using a shoulder width medium stance with the toes slightly pointed out. Tip: Kep your head up at al times and also maintain the back on the pad at al times.
Place your arms on the side handles of the machine and disengage the safety bars (which on most designs is done by moving the side handles from a facing front position to a diagonal position).

Now straighten your legs without locking the knes. This wil be your starting position. (Note: For the purposes of this discusion we wil use the medium stance described above which targets overal development; however you can chose any of the thre stances described in the fot positioning section).

Begin to slowly lower the unit by bending the knes as you maintain a straight posture with the head up (back on the pad at al times). Continue down until the angle betwen the uper leg and the calves becomes slightly les than 90-degres (which is the point in which the uper legs are below paralel to the flor). Inhale as you perform this portion of the movement. Tip: If you performed the exercise corectly, the front of the knes should make an imaginary straight line with the toes that is perpendicular to the front. If your knes are past that imaginary line (if they are past your toes) then you are placing undue stres on the kne and the exercise has ben performed incorectly.
Begin to raise the unit as you exhale by pushing the flor with mainly with the hel of your fot as you straighten the legs again and go back to the starting position.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Hammer Curls
directions: Stand up with your torso upright and a dumbel on each hand being held at arms length. The elbows should be close to the torso.
The palms of the hands should be facing your torso. This wil be your starting position.

Now, while holding your uper arm stationary, exhale and curl the weight forward while contracting the biceps. Continue to raise the weight until the biceps are fuly contracted and the dumbel is at shoulder level. Hold the contracted position for a brief moment as you squeze the biceps. Tip: Focus on keping the elbow stationary and only moving your forearm.
After the brief pause, inhale and slowly begin the lower the dumbels back down to the starting position.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Hammer Grip Incline DB Bench Press
directions: Lie back on an incline bench with a dumbel on each hand on top of your thighs. The palms of your hand wil be facing each other.
By using your thighs to help you get the dumbels up, clean the dumbels one arm at a time so that you can hold them at shoulder width.

Once at shoulder width, kep the palms of your hands with a neutral grip (palms facing each other). Kep your elbows flared out with the uper arms in line with the shoulders (perpendicular to the torso) and the elbows bent creating a 90-degre angle betwen the uper arm and the forearm. This wil be your starting position.
Now bring down the weights slowly to your side as you breathe in. Kep ful control of the dumbels at al times.

As you breathe out, push the dumbels up using your pectoral muscles. Lock your arms in the contracted position, hold for a second and then start coming down slowly. Tip: It should take at least twice as long to go down than to come up.
Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.
When you are done, place the dumbels back in your thighs and then on the flor. This is the safest maner to dispose of the dumbels.

name: Hamstring Stretch
directions: Lie on your back with one leg extended above you, with the hip at ninety degres. Kep the other leg flat on the flor.
Lop a belt, band, or rope over the bal of your fot. This wil be your starting position.
Pul on the belt to create tension in the calves and hamstrings. Hold this stretch for 10-30 seconds, and repeat with the other leg.

name: Hamstring-SMR
directions: In a seated position, extend your legs over a foam rol so that it is position on the back of the uper legs. Place your hands to the side or behind you to help suport your weight. This wil be your starting position.
Using your hands, lift your hips of of the flor and shift your weight on the foam rol to one leg. Relax the hamstrings of the leg you are stretching.
Rol over the foam from below the hip to above the back of the kne, pausing at points of tension for 10-30 seconds. Repeat for the other leg.

name: Handstand Push-Ups
directions: With your back to the wal bend at the waist and place both hands on the flor at shoulder width.

Kick yourself up against the wal with your arms straight. Your body should be upside down with the arms and legs fuly extended. Kep your whole body as straight as posible. Tip: If doing this for the first time, have a spoter help you. Also, make sure that you kep facing the wal with your head, rather than loking down.
Slowly lower yourself to the ground as you inhale until your head almost touches the flor. Tip: It is of utmost importance that you come down slow in order to avoid head injury.
Push yourself back up slowly as you exhale until your elbows are nearly locked.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Hang Clean
directions: Begin with a shoulder width, double overhand or hok grip, with the bar hanging at the mid thigh position. Your back should be straight and inclined slightly forward.
Begin by agresively extending through the hips, knes and ankles, driving the weight upward. As you do so, shrug your shoulders towards your ears.
Imediately recover by driving through the hels, keping the torso upright and elbows up. Continue until you have risen to a standing position.

name: Hang Clean - Below the Knees
directions: Begin with a shoulder width, double overhand or hok grip, with the bar hanging just below the knes. Your back should be straight and inclined slightly forward.

Begin by agresively extending through the hips, knes and ankles, driving the weight upward. As you do so, shrug your shoulders towards your ears. As ful extension is achieved, transition into the third pul by agresively shruging and flexing the arms with the elbows up and out.

At peak extension, agresively pul yourself down, rotating your elbows under the bar as you do so. Receive the bar in a front squat position, the depth of which is dependent upon the height of the bar at the end of the third pul. The bar should be racked onto the protracted shoulders, lightly touching the throat with the hands relaxed. Continue to descend to the botom squat position, which wil help in the recovery.
Imediately recover by driving through the hels, keping the torso upright and elbows up. Continue until you have risen to a standing position.

name: Hang Snatch
directions: Begin with a wide grip on the bar, with an overhand or hok grip. The fet should be directly below the hips with the fet turned out. Your knes should be slightly bent, and the torso inclined forward. The spine should be fuly extended and the head facing forward. The bar should be at the hips. This wil be your starting position.
Agresively extend through the legs and hips. At peak extension, shrug the shoulders and alow the elbows to flex to the side.

As you move your fet into the receiving position, forcefuly pul yourself below the bar as you elevate the bar overhead. Receive the bar with your body as low as posible and the arms fuly extended overhead.
Return to a standing position with the weight overhead. Folow by returning the weight to the ground under control.

name: Hang Snatch - Below Knees
directions: Begin with a wide grip on the bar, with an overhand or hok grip. The fet should be directly below the hips with the fet turned out. Your knes should be slightly bent, and the torso inclined forward. The spine should be fuly extended and the head facing forward. The bar should be just below the knes. This wil be your starting position.
Agresively extend through the legs and hips. At peak extension, shrug the shoulders and alow the elbows to flex to the side.

As you move your fet into the receiving position, forcefuly pul yourself below the bar as you elevate the bar overhead. Receive the bar with your body as low as posible and the arms fuly extended overhead.
Return to a standing position with the weight overhead, and then return the weight to the flor under control.

name: Hanging Bar Good Morning
directions: Begin with a bar on a rack at about the same height as your stomach. Suspend the bar using chains or suspension straps.

Bend over underneath the bar and rack the bar acros the rear of your shoulders as you would a power squat, not on top of your traps. At the proper height, you should be near paralel to the flor when bent over. Kep your back tight, shoulder blades pinched together, and your knes slightly bent. Kep your back arched and your cervical spine in proper alignment.
Begin the motion by extending through the hips with your glutes and hamstrings, and you are standing with the weight.
Slowly lower the weight back to the starting position, where it is suported by the chains.

name: Hanging Leg Raise
directions: Hang from a chin-up bar with both arms extended at arms length in top of you using either a wide grip or a medium grip. The legs should be straight down with the pelvis roled slightly backwards. This wil be your starting position.
Raise your legs until the torso makes a 90-degre angle with the legs. Exhale as you perform this movement and hold the contraction for a second or so.
Go back slowly to the starting position as you breathe in.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Hanging Pike
directions: Hang from a chin-up bar with your legs and fet together using an overhand grip (palms facing away from you) that is slightly wider than shoulder width. Tip: You may use wrist wraps in order to facilitate holding on to the bar.
Now bend your knes at a 90 degre angle and bring the uper legs forward so that the calves are perpendicular to the flor while the thighs remain paralel to it. This wil be your starting position.
Pul your legs up as you exhale until you almost touch your shins with the bar above you. Tip: Try to straighten your legs as much as posible while at the top.
Lower your legs as slowly as posible until you reach the starting position. Tip: Avoid swinging and using momentum at al times.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Heaving Snatch Balance
directions: This dril helps you learn the snatch. Begin by holding a light weight acros the back of the shoulders. Your fet should be slightly wider than hip width apart with the fet turned out, the same position that you would perform a squat with.
Begin by diping with the knes slightly, and poping back up to briefly unload the bar. Drive yourself underneath the bar, elevating it overhead as you descend into a ful squat.
Return to a standing position.

name: Heavy Bag Thrust
directions: Utilize a heavy bag for this exercise. Asume an upright stance next to the bag, with your fet stagered, fairly wide apart. Place your hand on the bag at about chest height. This wil be your starting position.
Begin by twisting at the waist, pushing the bag forward as hard as posible. Perform this move quickly, pushing the bag away from your body.
Receive the bag as it swings back by reversing these steps.

name: High Cable Curls
directions: Stand betwen a couple of high puleys and grab a handle in each arm. Position your uper arms in a way that they are paralel to the flor with the palms of your hands facing you. This wil be your starting position.

Curl the handles towards you until they are next to your ears. Make sure that as you do so you flex your biceps and exhale. The uper arms should remain stationary and only the forearms should move. Hold for a second in the contracted position as you squeze the biceps.
Slowly bring back the arms to the starting position.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Hip Circles (prone)
directions: Position yourself on your hands and knes on the ground. Maintaining god posture, raise one bent kne of of the ground. This wil be your starting position.
Keping the kne in a bent position, rotate the femur in an arc, atempting to make a big circle with your kne.
Perform this slowly for a number of repetitions, and repeat on the other side.

name: Hip Crossover
directions: Lie with your back on an exercise mat and arms straight out from your sides, palms facing up.
Next, raise legs up so that your lower legs and your thighs form a 90-degre angle at the kne. Legs should be closed together.
Begin exercise by lowering your closed legs to the left side, while keping your hips flat on the flor as much as posible (they wil come of a litle bit).
Hold, then reverse movement back to the oposite side.

name: Hip Extension with Bands
directions: Secure one end of the band to the lower portion of a post and atach the other to one ankle.
Facing the atachment point of the band, hold on to the column to stabilize yourself.
Keping your head and your chest up, move the resisted leg back as far as you can while keping the kne straight.
Return the leg to the starting position.

name: Hip Flexion with Band
directions: Secure one end of the band to the lower portion of a post and atach the other to one ankle.
Face away from the atachment point of the band.
Keping your head and your chest up, raise your kne up to 90 degres and pause.
Return the leg to the starting position.

name: Hip Lift with Band
directions: After chosing a suitable band, lay down in the midle of the rack, after securing the band on either side of you. If your rack doesn't have pegs, the band can be secured using heavy dumbels or similar objects, just ensure they won't move.
Adjust your position so that the band is directly over your hips. Bend your knes and place your fet flat on the flor. Your hands can be on the flor or holding the band in position.
Keping your shoulders on the ground, drive through your hels to raise your hips, pushing into the band as high as you can.
Pause at the top of the motion, and return to the starting position.

name: Hug A Ball
directions: Seat yourself on the flor.
Stradle an exercise bal betwen both legs and lower your hips down toward the flor.

Hug your arms around the bal to suport your body. Adjust your legs so that your fet are flat on the flor and your knes line up over your ankles. Kep a god grip on the bal so it doesn't rol away from you and send you back onto your butocks.

name: Hug Knees To Chest
directions: Lie down on your back and pul both knes up to your chest.
Hold your arms under the knes, not over (that would put to much presure on your kne joints).
Slowly pul the knes toward your shoulders. This also stretches your butocks muscles.

name: Hurdle Hops
directions: Set up a row of hurdles or other smal bariers, placing them a few fet apart.
Stand in front of the first hurdle with your fet shoulder width apart. This wil be your starting position.
Begin by jumping with both fet over the first hurdle, swinging both arms as you jump.
Absorb the impact of landing by bending the knes, rebounding out of the first leap by jumping over the next hurdle. Continue until you have jumped over al of the hurdles.

name: Hyperextensions (Back Extensions)
directions: Lie face down on a hyperextension bench, tucking your ankles securely under the fotpads.
Adjust the uper pad if posible so your uper thighs lie flat acros the wide pad, leaving enough rom for you to bend at the waist without any restriction.

With your body straight, cros your arms in front of you (my preference) or behind your head. This wil be your starting position. Tip: You can also hold a weight plate for extra resistance in front of you under your crosed arms.

Start bending forward slowly at the waist as far as you can while keping your back flat. Inhale as you perform this movement. Kep moving forward until you fel a nice stretch on the hamstrings and you can no longer kep going without a rounding of the back. Tip: Never round the back as you perform this exercise. Also, some people can go farther than others. The key thing is that you go as far as your body alows you to without rounding the back.

Slowly raise your torso back to the initial position as you inhale. Tip: Avoid the temptation to arch your back past a straight line. Also, do not swing the torso at any time in order to protect the back from injury.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Hyperextensions With No Hyperextension Bench
directions: With someone holding down your legs, slide yourself down to the edge a flat bench until your hips hang of the end of the bench. Tip: Your entire uper body should be hanging down towards the flor. Also, you wil be in the same position as if you were on a hyperextension bench but the range of motion wil be shorter due to the height of the flat bench vs. that of the hyperextension bench.

With your body straight, cros your arms in front of you (my preference) or behind your head. This wil be your starting position. Tip: You can also hold a weight plate for extra resistance in front of you under your crosed arms.

Start bending forward slowly at the waist as far as you can while keping your back flat. Inhale as you perform this movement. Kep moving forward until you almost touch the flor or you fel a nice stretch on the hamstrings (whichever comes first). Tip: Never round the back as you perform this exercise.

Slowly raise your torso back to the initial position as you exhale. Tip: Avoid the temptation to arch your back past a straight line. Also, do not swing the torso at any time in order to protect the back from injury.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Iliotibial Tract-SMR
directions: Lay on your side, with the botom leg placed onto a foam roler betwen the hip and the kne. The other leg can be crosed in front of you.
Place as much of your weight as is tolerable onto your botom leg; there is no ned to kep your botom leg in contact with the ground. Be sure to relax the muscles of the leg you are stretching.
Rol your leg over the foam from you hip to your kne, pausing for 10-30 seconds at points of tension. Repeat with the oposite leg.

name: Incline Barbell Triceps Extension
directions: Hold a barbel with an overhand grip (palms down) that is a litle closer together than shoulder width.
Lie back on an incline bench set at any angle betwen 45-75-degres.
Bring the bar overhead with your arms extended and elbows in. The arms should be in line with the torso above the head. This wil be your starting position.

Now lower the bar in a semicircular motion behind your head until your forearms touch your biceps. Inhale as you perform this movement. Tip: Kep your uper arms stationary and close to your head at al times. Only the forearms should move.
Return to the starting position as you breathe out and you contract the triceps. Hold the contraction for a second.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Incline Bench Pull
directions: Grab a dumbel in each hand and lie face down on an incline bench that is set to an incline that is aproximately 30 degres.
Let the arms hang to your sides fuly extended as they point to the flor.
Turn the wrists until your hands have a pronated (palms down) grip.
Now flare the elbows out. This wil be your starting position.

As you breathe out, start to pul the dumbels up as if you are doing a reverse bench pres. You wil do this by bending at the elbows and bringing the uper arms up as you let the forearms hang. Continue this motion until the uper arms are at the same level as your back. Tip: The elbows wil come out to the side and your uper arms and torso should make the leter "T" at the top of the movement. Hold the contraction at the top for a second.
Slowly go back down to the starting position as you breathe in.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Incline Cable Chest Press
directions: Adjust the weight to an apropriate amount and be seated, grasping the handles. Your uper arms should be about 45 degres to the body, with your head and chest up. The elbows should be bent to about 90 degres. This wil be your starting position.
Begin by extending through the elbow, presing the handles together straight in front of you. Kep your shoulder blades retracted as you execute the movement.
After pausing at ful extension, return to the starting position, keping tension on the cables.

name: Incline Cable Flye
directions: To get yourself into the starting position, set the puleys at the flor level (lowest level posible on the machine that is below your torso).
Place an incline bench (set at 45 degres) in betwen the puleys, select a weight on each one and grab a puley on each hand.
With a handle on each hand, lie on the incline bench and bring your hands together at arms length in front of your face. This wil be your starting position.

With a slight bend of your elbows (in order to prevent stres at the biceps tendon), lower your arms out at both sides in a wide arc until you fel a stretch on your chest. Breathe in as you perform this portion of the movement. Tip: Kep in mind that throughout the movement, the arms should remain stationary. The movement should only ocur at the shoulder joint.

Return your arms back to the starting position as you squeze your chest muscles and exhale. Hold the contracted position for a second. Tip: Make sure to use the same arc of motion used to lower the weights.
Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.

name: Incline Dumbbell Bench With Palms Facing In
