directions: Lie back on an incline bench with a dumbel on each hand on top of your thighs. The palms of your hand wil be facing each other.
By using your thighs to help you get the dumbels up, clean the dumbels one arm at a time so that you can hold them at shoulder width.

Once at shoulder width, kep the palms of your hands with a neutral grip (palms facing each other). Kep your elbows flared out with the uper arms in line with the shoulders (perpendicular to the torso) and the elbows bent creating a 90-degre angle betwen the uper arm and the forearm. This wil be your starting position.
Now bring down the weights slowly to your side as you breathe in. Kep ful control of the dumbels at al times.

As you breathe out, push the dumbels up using your pectoral muscles. Lock your arms in the contracted position, hold for a second and then start coming down slowly. Tip: It should take at least twice as long to go down than to come up.
Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.
When you are done, place the dumbels back in your thighs and then on the flor. This is the safest maner to dispose of the dumbels.

name: Incline Dumbbell Curl
directions: Sit back on an incline bench with a dumbel in each hand held at arms length. Kep your elbows close to your torso and rotate the palms of your hands until they are facing forward. This wil be your starting position.

While holding the uper arm stationary, curl the weights forward while contracting the biceps as you breathe out. Only the forearms should move. Continue the movement until your biceps are fuly contracted and the dumbels are at shoulder level. Hold the contracted position for a second.
Slowly begin to bring the dumbels back to starting position as your breathe in.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Incline Dumbbell Flyes
directions: Hold a dumbel on each hand and lie on an incline bench that is set to an incline angle of no more than 30 degres.
Extend your arms above you with a slight bend at the elbows.
Now rotate the wrists so that the palms of your hands are facing you. Tip: The pinky fingers should be next to each other. This wil be your starting position.

As you breathe in, start to slowly lower the arms to the side while keping the arms extended and while rotating the wrists until the palms of the hand are facing each other. Tip: At the end of the movement the arms wil be by your side with the palms facing the ceiling.

As you exhale start to bring the dumbels back up to the starting position by reversing the motion and rotating the hands so that the pinky fingers are next to each other again. Tip: Kep in mind that the movement wil only hapen at the shoulder joint and at the wrist. There is no motion that hapens at the elbow joint.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Incline Dumbbell Flyes - With A Twist
directions: Hold a dumbel in each hand and lie on an incline bench that is set to an incline angle of no more than 30 degres.
Extend your arms above you with a slight bend at the elbows.
Now rotate the wrists so that the palms of your hands are facing you. Tip: The pinky fingers should be next to each other. This wil be your starting position.

As you breathe in, start to slowly lower the arms to the side while keping the arms extended and while rotating the wrists until the palms of the hand are facing each other. Tip: At the end of the movement the arms wil be by your side with the palms facing the ceiling.

As you exhale start to bring the dumbels back up to the starting position by reversing the motion and rotating the hands so that the pinky fingers are next to each other again. Tip: Kep in mind that the movement wil only hapen at the shoulder joint and at the wrist. There is no motion that hapens at the elbow joint.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Incline Dumbbell Press
directions: Lie back on an incline bench with a dumbel in each hand atop your thighs. The palms of your hands wil be facing each other.
Then, using your thighs to help push the dumbels up, lift the dumbels one at a time so that you can hold them at shoulder width.
Once you have the dumbels raised to shoulder width, rotate your wrists forward so that the palms of your hands are facing away from you. This wil be your starting position.
Be sure to kep ful control of the dumbels at al times. Then breathe out and push the dumbels up with your chest.
Lock your arms at the top, hold for a second, and then start slowly lowering the weight. Tip Idealy, lowering the weights should take about twice as long as raising them.
Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.
When you are done, place the dumbels back on your thighs and then on the flor. This is the safest maner to release the dumbels.

name: Incline Hammer Curls
directions: Seat yourself on an incline bench with a dumbel in each hand. You should presed firmly against he back with your fet together. Alow the dumbels to hang straight down at your side, holding them with a neutral grip. This wil be your starting position.
Initiate the movement by flexing at the elbow, atempting to kep the uper arm stationary.
Continue to the top of the movement and pause, then slowly return to the start position.

name: Incline Inner Biceps Curl
directions: Hold a dumbel in each hand and lie back on an incline bench.
The dumbels should be at arm's length hanging at your sides and your palms should be facing out. This wil be your starting position.

Now as you exhale curl the weight outward and up while keping your forearms in line with your side deltoids. Continue the curl until the dumbels are at shoulder height and to the sides of your deltoids. Tip: The end of the movement should lok similar to a double biceps pose.
After a second contraction at the top of the movement, start to inhale and slowly lower the weights back to the starting position using the same path used to bring them up.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Incline Push-Up
directions: Stand facing bench or sturdy elevated platform. Place hands on edge of bench or platform, slightly wider than shoulder width.
Position forefot back from bench or platform with arms and body straight. Arms should be perpendicular to body. Keping body straight, lower chest to edge of box or platform by bending arms.
Push body up until arms are extended. Repeat.

name: Incline Push-Up Close-Grip
directions: Stand facing a Smith machine bar or sturdy elevated platform at an apropriate height.
Place your hands next to one another on the bar.
Position your fet back from the bar with arms and body straight. This wil be your starting position.
Keping your body straight, lower your chest to the bar by bending the arms.
Return to the starting position by extending the elbows, presing yourself back up.

name: Incline Push-Up Depth Jump
directions: For this dril you wil ned a box about 12 inches high, and two thick mats or aerobics steps.

Place the steps just outside of your shoulders, and place your fet on top of the box so that you are in an incline pushup position, your hands just inside the steps. This wil be your starting position.

Begin by bending at the elbows to lower your body, quickly reversing position to push your body of of the ground. As you leave the ground, move your hands onto the steps, bending your elbows to absorb the impact.
Repeat the motion to return to the starting position.

name: Incline Push-Up Medium
directions: Stand facing a Smith machine bar or sturdy elevated platform at an apropriate height.
Place your hands on the bar, with your hands about shoulder width apart.
Position your fet back from the bar with arms and body straight. This wil be your starting position.
Keping your body straight, lower your chest to the bar by bending the arms.
Return to the starting position by extending the elbows, presing yourself back up.

name: Incline Push-Up Reverse Grip
directions: Stand facing a Smith machine bar or sturdy elevated platform at an apropriate height.
Place your hands on the bar palms up, with your hands about shoulder width apart.
Position your fet back from the bar with arms and body straight. This wil be your starting position.
Keping your body straight, lower your chest to the bar by bending the arms.
Return to the starting position by extending the elbows, presing yourself back up.

name: Incline Push-Up Wide
directions: Stand facing a Smith machine bar or sturdy elevated platform at an apropriate height.
Place your hands on the bar, with your hands wider than shoulder width.
Position your fet back from the bar with arms and body straight. Your arms should be perpendicular to the body. This wil be your starting position.
Keping your body straight, lower your chest to the bar by bending the arms.
Return to the starting position by extending the elbows, presing yourself back up.

name: Intermediate Groin Stretch
directions: Lie on your back with your legs extended. Lop a belt, rope, or band around one of your fet, and swing that leg as far to the side as you can. This wil be your starting position.
Pul gently on the belt to create tension in your groin and hamstring muscles. Hold for 10-20 seconds, and repeat on the other side.

name: Intermediate Hip Flexor and Quad Stretch
directions: Lie face down on the flor, with a rope, belt, or band loped around one fot.

Flex the kne and extend the hip of the leg to be stretched, using both hands to pul on the belt. Your kne and your hip should come of of the flor, creating tension in the hip flexors and quadriceps. Hold the stretch for 10-20 seconds, and repeat on the other leg.

name: Internal Rotation with Band
directions: Choke the band around a post. The band should be at the same height as your elbow. Stand with your right side to the band a couple of fet away.
Grasp the end of the band with your right hand, and kep your elbow presed firmly to your side. We recomend you hold a pad or foam rol in place with your elbow to kep it firmly in position.
With your uper arm in position, your elbow should be flexed to 90 degres with your hand reaching away from your torso. This wil be your starting position.
Execute the movement by rotating your arm in a forehand motion, keping your elbow in place.
Continue as far as you are able, pause, and then return to the starting position.

name: Inverted Row
directions: Position a bar in a rack to about waist height. You can also use a smith machine.

Take a wider than shoulder width grip on the bar and position yourself hanging underneath the bar. Your body should be straight with your hels on the ground with your arms fuly extended. This wil be your starting position.
Begin by flexing the elbow, puling your chest towards the bar. Retract your shoulder blades as you perform the movement.
Pause at the top of the motion, and return yourself to the start position.
Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Inverted Row with Straps
directions: Hang a rope or suspension straps from a rack or other stable object. Grasp the ends and position yourself in a supine position hanging from the ropes. Your body should be straight with your hels on the ground with your arms fuly extended. This wil be your starting position.
Begin by flexing the elbow, puling your chest to your hands. Retract your shoulder blades as you perform the movement.
Pause at the top of the motion, and return yourself to the start position.
Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Iron Crosses (stretch)
directions: Lie face down on the flor, with your arms extended out to your side, palms presed to the flor. This wil be your starting position.
To begin, flex one kne and bring that leg acros the back of your body, atempting to touch it to the ground near the oposite hand.
Promptly return the leg to the starting postion, and quickly repeat with the other leg. Continue alternating for 10-20 repetitions.

name: Isometric Chest Squeezes
directions: While either seating or standing, bend your arms at a 90-degre angle and place the palms of your hands together in front of your chest. Tip: Your hands should be open with the palms together and fingers facing forward (perpendicular to your torso).
Push both hands against each other as you contract your chest. Start with slow tension and increase slowly. Kep breathing normaly as you execute this contraction.
Hold for the recomended number of seconds.
Now release the tension slowly.
Rest for the recomended amount of time and repeat.

name: Isometric Neck Exercise - Front And Back
directions: With your head and neck in a neutral position (normal position with head erect facing forward), place both of your hands on the front side of your head.
Now gently push forward as you contract the neck muscles but resisting any movement of your head. Start with slow tension and increase slowly. Kep breathing normaly as you execute this contraction.
Hold for the recomended number of seconds.
Now release the tension slowly.
Rest for the recomended amount of time and repeat with your hands placed on the back side of your head.

name: Isometric Neck Exercise - Sides
directions: With your head and neck in a neutral position (normal position with head erect facing forward), place your left hand on the left side of your head.

Now gently push towards the left as you contract the left neck muscles but resisting any movement of your head. Start with slow tension and increase slowly. Kep breathing normaly as you execute this contraction.
Hold for the recomended number of seconds.
Now release the tension slowly.
Rest for the recomended amount of time and repeat with your right hand placed on the right side of your head.

name: Isometric Wipers
directions: Asume a push-up position, suporting your weight on your hands and toes while keping your body straight. Your hands should be just outside of shoulder width. This wil be your starting position.
Begin by shifting your body weight as far to one side as posible, alowing the elbow on that side to flex as you lower your body.
Reverse the motion by extending the flexed arm, pushing yourself up and then droping to the other side.
Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: IT Band and Glute Stretch
directions: Lop a belt, rope, or band around one of your fet, and swing that leg acros your body to the oposite side, keping the leg extended as you lay on the ground. This wil be your starting position.
Keping your fot of of the flor, pul on the belt, using the tension to pul the toes up. Hold for 10-20 seconds, and repeat on the other side.

name: Jackknife Sit-Up
directions: Lie flat on the flor (or exercise mat) on your back with your arms extended straight back behind your head and your legs extended also. This wil be your starting position.

As you exhale, bend at the waist while simultaneously raising your legs and arms to met in a jacknife position. Tip: The legs should be extended and lifted at aproximately a 35-45 degre angle from the flor and the arms should be extended and paralel to your legs. The uper torso should be of the flor.
While inhaling, lower your arms and legs back to the starting position.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Janda Sit-Up
directions: Position your body on the flor in the basic sit-up position; knes to a ninety degre angle with fet flat on the flor and arms either crosed over your chest or to the sides. This wil be your starting position.

As you strongly tighten your glutes and hamstrings, fil your lungs with air and in a slow (thre to six second count) ascent, slowly exhale. Tip: It is important to tighten the glutes and hamstrings as this wil cause the hip flexors to be inactivated in a proces caled reciprocal inhibition, which basicaly means that oposite muscles to the contracted ones wil relax.
As you inhale, slowly go back in a controled maner to the starting position.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Jefferson Squats
directions: Place a barbel on the flor.
Stand in the midle of the bar length wise.
Bend down by bending at the knes and keping your back straight and grasp the front of the bar with your right hand. Your palm should be in (neutral grip) facing the left side.

Grasp the rear of the bar with your left hand. The palm of your hand should be in neutral grip alignment (palms facing the right side). Tip: Ensure that your grip is even on the bar. Your torso should be positioned right in the midle of the bar and the distance betwen your torso and your right hand (which should be at the front) should be the same as the distance betwen your torso and your left hand (which should be to your back).
Now stand straight up with the weight. Tip: Your fet should be shoulder width apart and your toes slightly pointed out.

Squat down by bending at the knes and keping your back straight until your uper thighs are paralel with the flor. Tip: Kep your back as vertical as posible with the flor and your head up. Also remember to not let your knes go past your toes. Inhale during this portion of the movement.

Now drive yourself back up to the starting position by pushing with the fet . Tip: Kep the bar hanging at arm's length and your elbows locked with a slight bend. The arms only serve as hoks. Avoid doing any lifting with them. Do the lifting with your thighs; not your arms.

name: Jerk Balance
directions: This dril helps you learn to drive yourself low enough during the jerk and corects those who move backward during the movement. Begin with the bar racked in the jerk position, with the shoulders forward, torso upright, and the fet split slightly apart.
Initiate the movement as you would a normal jerk, diping at the knes while keping your torso vertical, and driving back up forcefuly, using momentum and not your arms to elevate the weight.
Kep the rear fot in place, using it to drive your body forward into a ful split as you jerk the weight. Recover by standing up with the weight overhead.

name: Jerk Dip Squat
directions: This movement strengthens the dip portion of the jerk. Begin with the bar racked in the jerk position, with the shoulders forward to create a shelf and the bar lightly contacting the throat. The fet should be directly under the hips, with the fet turned out as is comfortable.

Keping the torso vertical, dip by flexing the knes, alowing them to travel forward and without moving the hips to the rear. The dip should not be excesive. Return the weight to the starting position by driving forcefuly though the fet.

name: JM Press
directions: Start the exercise the same way you would a close grip bench pres. You wil lie on a flat bench while holding a barbel at arms length (fuly extended) with the elbows in. However, instead of having the arms perpendicular to the torso, make sure the bar is set in a direct line above the uper chest. This wil be your starting position.

Now begining from a fuly extended position lower the bar down as if performing a lying triceps extension. Inhale as you perform this movement. When you reach the half way point, let the bar rol back about one inch by moving the uper arms towards your legs until they are perpendicular to the torso. Tip: Kep the bend at the elbows constant as you bring the uper arms forward.
As you exhale, pres the bar back up by using the triceps to perform a close grip bench pres.
Now go back to the starting position and start over.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Jogging-Treadmill
directions: To begin, step onto the treadmil and select the desired option from the menu. Most treadmils have a manual seting, or you can select a program to run. Typicaly, you can enter your age and weight to estimate the amount of calories burned during exercise. Elevation can be adjusted to change the intensity of the workout.

Treadmils ofer convenience, cardiovascular benefits, and usualy have les impact than joging outside. A 150 lb person wil burn almost 250 calories joging for 30 minutes, compared to more than 450 calories runing. Maintain proper posture as you jog, and only hold onto the handles when necesary, such as when dismounting or checking your heart rate.

name: Keg Load
directions: To load kegs, place the desired number a distance from the loading platform, typicaly 30-50 fet.
Begin by grabing the close handle of the first keg, tilting it onto its side to grab the oposite edge of the botom of the keg. Lift the keg up to your chest.

The higher you can place the keg, the faster you should be able to move to the platform. Shouldering is usualy not alowed. Be sure to kep a firm hold on the keg. Move as quickly as posible to the platform, and load it, extending through your hips, knes, and ankles to get it as high as posible.
Return to the starting position to retrieve the next keg, and repeat until the event is completed.

name: Kettlebell Arnold Press
directions: Clean a ketlebel to your shoulder. Clean the ketlebel to your shoulder by extending through the legs and hips as you raise the ketlebel towards your shoulder. The palm should be facing inward.
Loking straight ahead, pres the ketlebel out and overhead, rotating your wrist so that your palm faces forward at the top of the motion.
Return the ketlebel to the starting position, with the palm facing in.

name: Kettlebell Dead Clean
directions: Place ketlebel betwen your fet. To get in the starting position, push your but back and lok straight ahead.
Clean the ketlebel to your shoulder. Clean the ketlebel to your shoulders by extending through the legs and hips as you raise the ketlebel towards your shoulder. The wrist should rotate as you do so.
Lower the ketlebel, keping the hamstrings loaded by keping your back straight and your but out.

name: Kettlebell Figure 8
directions: Place one ketlebel betwen your legs and take a wider than shoulder width stance. Bend over by pushing your but out and keping your back flat.
Pick up a ketlebel and pas it to your other hand betwen your legs. The receiving hand should reach from behind the legs. Go back and forth for several repetitions.

name: Kettlebell Hang Clean
directions: Place ketlebel betwen your fet. To get in the starting position, push your but back and lok straight ahead.
Clean ketlebel to your shoulder. Clean the ketlebel to your shoulders by extending through the legs and hips as you raise the ketlebel towards your shoulder. The wrist should rotate as you do so.
Lower ketlebel to a hanging position betwen your legs while keping the hamstrings loaded. Kep your head up at al times.

name: Kettlebell One-Legged Deadlift
directions: Hold a ketlebel by the handle in one hand. Stand on one leg, on the same side that you hold the ketlebel.
Keping that kne slightly bent, perform a stif leged deadlift by bending at the hip, extending your fre leg behind you for balance.
Continue lowering the ketlebel until you are paralel to the ground, and then return to the upright position.

name: Kettlebell Pass Between The Legs
directions: Place one ketlebel betwen your legs and take a comfortable stance. Bend over by pushing your but out and keping your back flat.
Pick up a ketlebel and pas it to your other hand betwen your legs, in the fashion of a "W". Go back and forth for several repetitions.

name: Kettlebell Pirate Ships
directions: With a wide stance, hold a ketlebel with both hands. Alow it to hang at waist level with your arms extended. This wil be your starting position.
Initiate the movement by turning to one side, swinging the ketlebel to head height. Briefly pause at the top of the motion.
Alow the bel to drop as you rotate to the oposite side, again raising the ketlebel to head height.
Repeat for the desired amount of repetitions.

name: Kettlebell Pistol Squat
directions: Pick up a ketlebel with two hands and hold it by the horns. Hold one leg of of the flor and squat down on the other.
Squat down by flexing the kne and siting back with the hips, holding the ketlebel up in front of you.
Hold the botom position for a second and then reverse the motion, driving through the hel and keping your head and chest up.
Lower yourself again and repeat.

name: Kettlebell Seated Press
directions: Sit on the flor and spread your legs out comfortably.
Clean one ketlebel to your shoulder.
Pres the ketlebel up and out until it is locked out overhead. Return to the starting position.

name: Kettlebell Seesaw Press
directions: Clean two ketlebels two your shoulders.
Pres one ketlebel.
Lower the ketlebel and imediately pres the other ketlebel. Make sure to do the same amount of reps on both sides.

name: Kettlebell Sumo High Pull
directions: Place a ketlebel on the ground betwen your fet. Position your fet in a wide stance, and grasp the ketlebel with two hands. Set your hips back as far as posible, with your knes bent. Kep your chest and head up. This wil be your starting position.
Begin by extending the hips and knes, simultaneously puling the ketlebel to your shoulders, raising your elbows as you do so. Reverse the motion to return to the starting position.

name: Kettlebell Thruster
directions: Clean two ketlebels to your shoulders. Clean the ketlebels to your shoulders by extending through the legs and hips as you pul the ketlebels towards your shoulders. Rotate your wrists as you do so. This wil be your starting position.
Begin to squat by flexing your hips and knes, lowering your hips betwen your legs. Maintain an upright, straight back as you descend as low as you can.

At the botom, reverse direction and squat by extending your knes and hips, driving through your hels. As you do so, pres both ketlebels overhead by extending your arms straight up, using the momentum from the squat to help drive the weights upward.
As you begin the next repetition, return the weights to the shoulders.

name: Kettlebell Turkish Get-Up (Lunge style)
directions: Lie on your back on the flor and pres a ketlebel to the top position by extending the elbow. Bend the kne on the same side as the ketlebel.

Keping the ketlebel locked out at al times, pivot to the oposite side and use your non- working arm to asist you in driving forward to the lunge position. Using your fre hand, push yourself to a seated position, then progresing to one kne.
While loking up at the ketlebel, slowly stand up. Reverse the motion back to the starting position and repeat.

name: Kettlebell Turkish Get-Up (Squat style)
directions: Lie on your back on the flor and pres a ketlebel to the top position by extending the elbow. Bend the kne on the same side as the ketlebel.
Keping the ketlebel locked out at al times, pivot to the oposite side and use your non- working arm to asist you in driving forward to the lunge position.
Using your fre hand, push yourself to a seated position, then progresing to your fet. While loking up at the ketlebel, slowly stand up. Reverse the motion back to the starting position and repeat.

name: Kettlebell Windmill
directions: Place a ketlebel in front of your lead fot and clean and pres it overhead with your oposite arm. Clean the ketlebel to your shoulder by extending through the legs and hips as you pul the ketlebel towards your shoulders. Rotate your wrist as you do so, so that the palm faces forward. Pres it overhead by extending the elbow.

Keping the ketlebel locked out at al times, push your but out in the direction of the locked out ketlebel. Turn your fet out at a forty-five degre angle from the arm with the locked out ketlebel. Bending at the hip to one side, sticking your but out, slowly lean until you can touch the flor with your fre hand. Kep your eyes on the ketlebel that you hold over your head at al times.
Pause for a second after reaching the ground and reverse the motion back to the starting position.

name: Kipping Muscle Up
directions: Grip the rings using a false grip, with the base of your palms on top of the rings.
Begin with a movement swinging your legs backward slightly.

Counter that movement by swinging your legs forward and up, jerking your chin and chest back, puling yourself up with both arms as you do so. As you reach the top position of the pul-up, pul the rings to your armpits as you rol your shoulders forward, alowing your elbows to move straight back behind you. This puts you into the proper position to continue into the dip portion of the movement.
Maintaining control and stability, extend through the elbow to complete the motion.
Use care when lowering yourself to the ground.

name: Knee Across The Body
directions: Lie down on the flor with your right leg straight. Bend your left leg and lower it acros your body, holding the kne down toward the flor with your right hand. (The kne doesn't ned to touch the flor if you're tight.)

Place your left arm comfortably beside you and turn your head to the left. Imagine you have a weight tied to your tailbone. let your tailbone fal back toward the flor as your chest reaches in the oposite direction to stretch your lower back. Switch sides.

name: Knee Circles
directions: Stand with your legs together and hands by your waist.
Now move your knes in a circular motion as you breathe normaly.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Knee Tuck Jump
directions: Begin in a comfortable standing position with your knes slightly bent. Hold your hands in front of you, palms down with your fingertips together at chest height. This wil be your starting position.
Rapidly dip down into a quarter squat and imediately explode upward. Drive the knes towards the chest, atempting to touch them to the palms of the hands.
Jump as high as you can, raising your knes up, and then ensure a god land be re-extending your legs, absorbing impact through be alowing the knes to rebend.

name: Knee/Hip Raise On Parallel Bars
directions: Position your body on the vertical leg raise bench so that your forearms are resting on the pads next to the torso and holding on to the handles. Your arms wil be bent at a 90 degre angle.
The torso should be straight with the lower back presed against the pad of the machine and the legs extended pointing towards the flor. This wil be your starting position.

Now as you breathe out, lift your legs up as you kep them extended. Continue this movement until your legs are roughly paralel to the flor and then hold the contraction for a second. Tip: Do not use any momentum or swinging as you perform this exercise.
Slowly go back to the starting position as you breathe in.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Kneeling Arm Drill
directions: This dril helps increase arm eficiency during the run. Begin kneling, left fot in front, right kne down. Aply presure through the front hel to kep your glutes and hamstrings activated.
Begin by blocking the arms in long, pendulum like swings. Close the arm angle, blocking with the arms as you would when joging, progresing to a run and finaly a sprint.
As son as your hands pas the hip, acelerate them forward during the sprinting motion to move them as quickly as posible.
Switch knes and repeat.

name: Kneeling Cable Crunch With Alternating Oblique Twists
directions: Conect a rope atachment to a high puley cable and position a mat on the flor in front of it.
Grab the rope with both hands and knel aproximately two fet back from the tower.
Position the rope behind your head with your hands by your ears.
Kep your hands in the same place, contract your abs and pul downward on the rope in a crunching movement until your elbows reach your knes.
Pause briefly at the botom and rise up in a slow and controled maner until you reach the starting position.
Repeat the same downward movement until youre halfway down, at which time youl begin rotating one of your elbows to the oposite kne.
Again, pause briefly at the botom and rise up in a slow and controled maner until you reach the starting position.
Repeat the same movement as before, but alternate the other elbow to the oposite kne.
Continue this series of movements to failure.

name: Kneeling Cable Triceps Extension
directions: Place a bench sideways in front of a high puley machine.
Hold a straight bar atachment above your head with your hands about 6 inches apart with your palms facing down.
Face away from the machine and knel.
Place your head and the back of your uper arms on the bench. Your elbows should be bent with the forearms pointing towards the high puley. This wil be your starting position.

While keping your uper arms close to your head at al times with the elbows in, pres the bar out in a semicircular motion until the elbows are locked and your arms are paralel to the flor. Contract the triceps hard and kep this position for a second. Exhale as you perform this movement.
Slowly return to the starting position as you breathe in.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Kneeling Forearm Stretch
directions: Start by kneling on a mat with your palms flat and your fingers pointing back toward your knes.
Slowly lean back keping your palms flat on the flor until you fel a stretch in your wrists and forearms. Hold for 20-30 seconds.

name: Kneeling High Pulley Row
directions: Select the apropriate weight using a puley that is above your head. Atach a rope to the cable and knel a couple of fet away, holding the rope out in front of you with both arms extended. This wil be your starting position.
Initiate the movement by flexing the elbows and fuly retracting your shoulders, puling the rope toward your uper chest with your elbows out.
After pausing briefly, slowly return to the starting position.

name: Kneeling Hip Flexor
directions: Knel on a mat and bring your right kne up so the botom of your fot is on the flor and extend your left leg out behind you so the top of your fot is on the flor.
Shift your weight forward until you fel a stretch in your hip. Hold for 15 seconds, then repeat for your other side.

name: Kneeling Jump Squat
directions: Begin kneling on the flor with a barbel racked acros the back of your shoulders, or you can use your body weight for this exercise. This can be done inside of a power rack to make unracking easier.
Sit back with your hips until your glutes touch your fet, keping your head and chest up.
Explode up with your hips, generating enough power to land with your fet flat on the flor.
Continue with the squat by driving through your hels and extending the knes to come to a standing position.

name: Kneeling Single-Arm High Pulley Row
directions: Atach a single handle to a high puley and make your weight selection.
Knel in front of the cable tower, taking the cable with one hand with your arm extended. This wil be your starting position.

Starting with your palm facing forward, pul the weight down to your torso by flexing the elbow and retract the shoulder blade. As you do so, rotate the wrist so that at the completion of the movement, your palm is now facing you.
After a brief pause, return to the starting position.

name: Kneeling Squat
directions: Set the bar to the proper height in a power rack. Knel behind the bar; it may be beneficial to put a mat down to pad your knes. Slide under the bar, racking it acros the back of your shoulders. Your shoulder blades should be retracted and the bar tight acros your back. Unrack the weight.
With your head loking forward, sit back with your but until you touch your calves.
Reverse the motion, returning the torso to an upright position.

name: Landmine 180's
directions: Position a bar into a landmine or securely anchor it in a corner. Load the bar to an apropriate weight.
Raise the bar from the flor, taking it to shoulder height with both hands with your arms extended in front of you. Adopt a wide stance. This wil be your starting position.
Perform the movement by rotating the trunk and hips as you swing the weight al the way down to one side. Kep your arms extended throughout the exercise.
Reverse the motion to swing the weight al the way to the oposite side.
Continue alternating the movement until the set is complete.

name: Landmine Linear Jammer
directions: Position a bar into landmine or, lacking one, securely anchor it in a corner. Load the bar to an apropriate weight and position the handle atachment on the bar.
Raise the bar from the flor, taking the handles to your shoulders. This wil be your starting position.
In an athletic stance, squat by flexing your hips and seting your hips back, keping your arms flexed.

Reverse the motion by powerfuly extending through the hips, knes, and ankles, while also extending the elbows to straighten the arms. This movement should be done explosively, coming out of the squat to ful extension as powerfuly as posible.
Return to the starting position.

name: Lateral Bound
directions: Asume a half squat position facing 90 degres from your direction of travel. This wil be your starting position.
Alow your lead leg to do a countermovement inward as you shift your weight to the outside leg.
Imediately push of and extend, atempting to bound to the side as far as posible.
Upon landing, imediately push of in the oposite direction, returning to your original start position.
Continue back and forth for several repetitions.

name: Lateral Box Jump
directions: Asume a comfortable standing position, with a short box positioned next to you. This wil be your starting position.
Quickly dip into a quarter squat to initiate the stretch reflex, and imediately reverse direction to jump up and to the side.
Bring your knes high enough to ensure your fet have god clearance over the box.
Land on the center of the box, using your legs to absorb the impact.
Carefuly jump down to the other side of the box, and continue going back and forth for several repetitions.

name: Lateral Cone Hops
directions: Position a number of cones in a row several fet apart.
Stand next to the end of the cones, facing 90 degres to the direction of travel. This wil be your starting position.
Begin the jump by diping with the knes to initiate a stretch reflex, and imediately reverse direction to push of the ground, jumping up and sideways over the cone.
Use your legs to absorb impact upon landing, and rebound into the next jump, continuing down the row of cones.

name: Lateral Raise - With Bands
directions: To begin, stand on an exercise band so that tension begins at arm's length. Grasp the handles using a pronated (palms facing your thighs) grip that is slightly les than shoulder width. The handles should be resting on the sides of your thighs. Your arms should be extended with a slight bend at the elbows and your back should be straight. This wil be your starting position.

Use your side shoulders to lift the handles to the sides as you exhale. Continue to lift the handles until they are slightly above paralel. Tip: As you lift the handles, slightly tilt the hand as if you were pouring water and kep your arms extended. Also, kep your torso stationary and pause for a second at the top of the movement.
Lower the handles back down slowly to the starting position. Inhale as you perform this portion of the movement.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Latissimus Dorsi-SMR
directions: While lying on the flor, place a foam rol under your back and to one side, just behind your arm pit. This wil be your starting position.
Kep the arm of the side being stretched behind and to the side of you as you shift your weight onto your lats, keping your uper body of of the ground. Hold for 10-30 seconds, and switch sides.

name: Leg Extensions
directions: For this exercise you wil ned to use a leg extension machine. First chose your weight and sit on the machine with your legs under the pad (fet pointed forward) and the hands holding the side bars. This wil be your starting position. Tip: You wil ned to adjust the pad so that it fals on top of your lower leg (just above your fet). Also, make sure that your legs form a 90-degre angle betwen the lower and uper leg. If the angle is les than 90-degres then that means the kne is over the toes which in turn creates undue stres at the kne joint. If the machine is designed that way, either lok for another machine or just make sure that when you start executing the exercise you stop going down once you hit the 90-degre angle.
Using your quadriceps, extend your legs to the maximum as you exhale. Ensure that the rest of the body remains stationary on the seat. Pause a second on the contracted position.
Slowly lower the weight back to the original position as you inhale, ensuring that you do not go past the 90-degre angle limit.
Repeat for the recomended amount of times.

name: Leg Lift
directions: While standing up straight with both fet next to each other at around shoulder width, grab a sturdy surface such as the sides of a squat rack or the top of a chair to brace yourself and kep balance.
With or without an ankle weight, lift one leg behind you as if performing a leg curl but standing up while keping the other leg straight. Breathe out as you perform this movement.
Slowly bring the raised leg back to the flor as you breathe in.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.
Repeat the movement with the oposite leg.

name: Leg Press
directions: Using a leg pres machine, sit down on the machine and place your legs on the platform directly in front of you at a medium (shoulder width) fot stance. (Note: For the purposes of this discusion we wil use the medium stance described above which targets overal development; however you can chose any of the thre stances described in the fot positioning section).

Lower the safety bars holding the weighted platform in place and pres the platform al the way up until your legs are fuly extended in front of you. Tip: Make sure that you do not lock your knes. Your torso and the legs should make a perfect 90-degre angle. This wil be your starting position.
As you inhale, slowly lower the platform until your uper and lower legs make a 90-degre angle.
Pushing mainly with the hels of your fet and using the quadriceps go back to the starting position as you exhale.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions and ensure to lock the safety pins properly once you are done. You do not want that platform faling on you fuly loaded.

name: Leg Pull-In
directions: Lie on an exercise mat with your legs extended and your hands either palms facing down next to you or under your glutes. Tip: My preference is with the hands next to me. This wil be your starting position.

Bend your knes and pul your uper thighs into your midsection as you breathe out. Continue the motion until your knes are around chest level. Contract your abs as you execute this movement and hold for a second at the top. Tip: As you perform the motion, the lower legs (calves) should always remain paralel to the flor.
Return to the starting position as you inhale.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Leg-Over Floor Press
directions: Lie on the flor with one ketlebel in place on your chest, holding it by the handle. Extend leg on working side over leg on non-working side.Your fre arm can be extended out to your side for suport.
Pres the ketlebl into a locked out position.
Lower the weight until the elbow touches the ground, keping the ketlebel above the elbow. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Leg-Up Hamstring Stretch
directions: Lie flat on your back, bend one kne, and put that fot flat on the flor to stabilize your spine.
Extend the other leg in the air. If you're tight, you wont be able to straighten it. That's okay. Extend the kne so that the sole of the lifted fot faces the ceiling (or as close as you can get it).
Slowly straighten the legs as much as posible and then pul the leg toward your nose. Switch sides.

name: Leverage Chest Press
directions: Load an apropriate weight onto the pins and adjust the seat for your height. The handles should be near the botom or midle of the pectorals at the begining of the motion.
Your chest and head should be up and your shoulder blades retracted. This wil be your starting position.
Pres the handles forward by extending through the elbow.
After a brief pause at the top, return the weight just above the start position, keping tension on the muscles by not returning the weight to the stops until the set is complete.

name: Leverage Deadlift
directions: Load the pins to an apropriate weight. Position yourself directly betwen the handles. Grasp the botom handles with a comfortable grip, and then lower your hips as you take a breath. Lok forward with your head and kep your chest up. This wil be your starting position.
Return the weight to the starting position.

name: Leverage Decline Chest Press
directions: Load an apropriate weight onto the pins and adjust the seat for your height. The handles should be near the botom of the pectorals at the begining of the motion. Your chest and head should be up and your shoulder blades retracted. This wil be your starting position.
Pres the handles forward by extending through the elbow.
After a brief pause at the top, return the weight just above the start position, keping tension on the muscles by not returning the weight to the stops until the set is complete.

name: Leverage High Row
directions: Load an apropriate weight onto the pins and adjust the seat height so that you can just reach the handles above you. Adjust the kne pad to help kep you down. Grasp the handles with a pronated grip. This wil be your starting position.
Pul the handles towards your torso, retracting your shoulder blades as you flex the elbow.
Pause at the botom of the motion, and then slowly return the handles to the starting position.
For multiple repetitions, avoid completely returning the weight to the stops to kep tension on the muscles being worked.

name: Leverage Incline Chest Press
directions: Load an apropriate weight onto the pins and adjust the seat for your height. The handles should be near the top of the pectorals at the begining of the motion. Your chest and head should be up and your shoulder blades retracted. This wil be your starting position.
Pres the handles forward by extending through the elbow.
After a brief pause at the top, return the weight just above the start position, keping tension on the muscles by not returning the weight to the stops until the set is complete.

name: Leverage Iso Row
directions: Load an apropriate weight onto the pins and adjust the seat height so that the handles are at chest level. Grasp the handles with either a neutral or pronated grip. This wil be your starting position.
Pul the handles towards your torso, retracting your shoulder blades as you flex the elbow.

Pause at the botom of the motion, and then slowly return the handles to the starting position. For multiple repetitions, avoid completely returning the weight to the stops to kep tension on the muscles being worked.

name: Leverage Shoulder Press
directions: Load an apropriate weight onto the pins and adjust the seat for your height. The handles should be near the top of the shoulders at the begining of the motion. Your chest and head should be up and handles held with a pronated grip. This wil be your starting position.
Pres the handles upward by extending through the elbow.
After a brief pause at the top, return the weight to just above the start position, keping tension on the muscles by not returning the weight to the stops until the set is complete.

name: Leverage Shrug
directions: Load the pins to an apropriate weight. Position yourself directly betwen the handles.
Grasp the top handles with a comfortable grip, and then lower your hips as you take a breath. Lok forward with your head and kep your chest up.

Drive through the flor with your hels, extending your hips and knes as you rise to a standing position. Kep your arms straight throughout the movement, finishing with your shoulders back. This wil be your starting position.
Raise the weight by shruging the shoulders towards your ears, moving straight up and down.
Pause at the top of the motion, and then return the weight to the starting position.

name: Linear 3-Part Start Technique
directions: This dril helps you acelerate as quickly as posible into a sprint from a dead stop. It helps to use a line to start from. Begin with two fet on the line. Place your left fot with the toe next to your right ankle. Place your right fot 4-6 inches behind the left.
Place your right hand onto the line, and thing bring your nose close to your left kne.
Squat down as you lean foward, your head being lower than your hips and your weight loaded onto the left leg. This wil be your starting position.
Take your left hand up so that it is paralel to the ground, pointing behind you, and explode out when ready.

name: Linear Acceleration Wall Drill
directions: Lean at around 45 degres against a wal. Your fet should be together, glutes contracted.
Begin by lifting your right kne quickly, pausing, and then driving it straight down into the ground.
Switch legs, raising the oposite kne, and then atacking the ground straight down.
Repeat once more with your right leg, and as son as the right fot strikes the ground hamer them out rapidly, alternating left and right as fast as you can.

name: Linear Depth Jump
directions: You wil ned two boxes or benches spaced a few fet away from each other. Begin by standing on one box facing towards the other platform.
To initiate the movement, gently drop down to the ground betwen your platforms, alowing the knes and hips to flex.
Reverse the motion by exploding, extending through the hips, knes, and ankles to jump onto the other platform.
Land softly, asborbing the impact through the legs.

name: Log Lift
directions: Begin standing with the log in front of you. Grasp the handles, and begin to clean the log. As you are bent over to start the clean, atempt to get the log as high as posible, puling it into your chest. Extend through the hips and knes to bring it up to complete the clean.

Push your head back and lok up, creating a shelf on your chest to rest the log. Begin the pres by diping, flexing slightly through the knes and reversing the motion. This push pres wil generate momentum to start the log moving verticaly. Continue by extending through the elbows to pres the log above your head. There are no strict rules on form, so use whatever techniques you are most eficient with. As the log is presed, ensure that you push your head through on each repetition, loking forward.
Repeat as many times as posible. Atempt to control the descent of the log as it is returned to the ground.

name: London Bridges
directions: Atach a climbing rope to a high beam or cros member. Below it, ensure that the smith machine bar is locked in place with the safeties and canot move. Alternatively, a secure box could also be utilized.
Stand on the bar, using the rope to balance yourself. This wil be your starting position.
Keping your body straight, lean back and lower your body by slowly going hand over hand with the rope. Continue until you are perpendicular to the ground.
Keping your body straight, reverse the motion, going hand over hand back to the starting position.

name: Looking At Ceiling
directions: Knel on the flor, holding your hels with both hands.
Lift your butocks up and forward while bringing your head back to lok up at the ceiling, to give an arch in your back.

name: Low Cable Crossover
directions: To move into the starting position, place the puleys at the low position, select the resistance to be used and grasp a handle in each hand.
Step forward, gaining tension in the puleys. Your palms should be facing forward, hands below the waist, and your arms straight. This wil be your starting position.
With a slight bend in your arms, draw your hands upward and toward the midline of your body. Your hands should come together in front of your chest, palms facing up.
Return your arms back to the starting position after a brief pause.

name: Low Cable Triceps Extension
directions: Select the desired weight and lay down face up on the bench of a seated row machine that has a rope atached to it. Your head should be pointing towards the atachment.
Grab the outside of the rope ends with your palms facing each other (neutral grip).

Position your elbows so that they are bent at a 90 degre angle and your uper arms are perpendicular (90 degre angle) to your torso. Tip: Kep the elbows in and make sure that the uper arms point to the ceiling while your forearms point towards the puley above your head. This wil be your starting position.

As you breathe out, extend your lower arms until they are straight and vertical. The uper arms and elbows remain stationary throughout the movement. Only the forearms should move. Contract the triceps hard for a second.
As you breathe in slowly return to the starting position.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Low Pulley Row To Neck
directions: Sit on a low puley row machine with a rope atachment.

Grab the ends of the rope using a palms-down grip and sit with your back straight and your knes slightly bent. Tip: Kep your back almost completely vertical and your arms fuly extended in front of you. This wil be your starting position.

While keping your torso stationary, lift your elbows and start bending them as you pul the rope towards your neck while exhaling. Throughout the movement your uper arms should remain paralel to the flor. Tip: Continue this motion until your hands are almost next to your ears (the forearms wil not be paralel to the flor at the end of the movement as they wil be angled a bit upwards) and your elbows are out away from your sides.
After holding for a second or so at the contracted position, come back slowly to the starting position as you inhale. Tip: Again, during no part of the movement should the torso move.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Lower Back Curl
directions: Lie on your stomach with your arms out to your sides. This wil be your starting position.
Using your lower back muscles, extend your spine lifting your chest of of the ground. Do not use your arms to push yourself up. Kep your head up during the movement. Repeat for 10-20 repetitions.

name: Lower Back-SMR
directions: In a seated position, place a foam rol under your lower back. Cros your arms in front of you and protract your shoulders. This wil be your starting position.

Raise your hips of of the flor and lean back, keping your weight on your lower back. Now shift your weight slightly to one side, keping your weight of of the spine and on the muscles to the side of it. Rol over your lower back, holding points of tension for 10-30 seconds. Repeat on the other side.

name: Lunge Pass Through
directions: Stand with your torso upright holding a ketlebel in your right hand. This wil be your starting position.
Step forward with your left fot and lower your uper body down by flexing the hip and the kne, keping the torso upright. Lower your back kne until it nearly touches the ground.
As you lunge, pas the ketlebel under your front leg to your oposite hand.
Presing through the hel of your fot, return to the starting position.
Repeat the movement for the recomended amount of repetitions, alternating legs.

name: Lunge Sprint
directions: Adjust a bar in a Smith machine to an apropriate height. Position yourself under the bar, racking it acros the back of your shoulders. Unrack the bar, and then split your fet, moving one fot forward and one fot back. This wil be your starting position.
Lower your back kne nearly to the ground, flexing the knes and lowering your hips as you do so.
At the botom of the descent, imediately reverse direction. Explosively drive through the hel of your front fot with light presure from your back fot. Jump up and reverse the position of your legs.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Lying Bent Leg Groin
directions: Lie on your back with your knes bent and the soles of the fet presed together. Have your partner hold your knes. This wil be your starting position.
Atempt to squeze your knes together, while your partner prevents any movement from ocuring.
After 10-20 seconds, relax your muscles as your partner gently pushes your knes towards the flor. Be sure to inform your helper when the stretch is adequate to prevent injury or overstretching.

name: Lying Cable Curl
directions: Grab a straight bar or E-Z bar atachment that is atached to the low puley with both hands, using an underhand (palms facing up) shoulder-width grip.
Lie flat on your back on top of an exercise mat in front of the weight stack with your fet flat against the frame of the puley machine and your legs straight.
With your arms extended and your elbows close to your body slightly bend your arms. This wil be your starting position.
While keping your uper arms stationary and the elbows close to your body, curl the bar up slowly toward your chest as you breathe out and you squeze the biceps.
After a second squeze at the top of the movement, slowly return to the starting position.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Lying Cambered Barbell Row
directions: Place a cambered bar underneath an exercise bench.
Lie face down on the exercise bench and grab the bar using a palms down (pronated grip) that is wider than shoulder width. This wil be your starting position.
As you exhale row the bar up as you kep the elbows close to your body to either your chest, in order to target the uper mid back, or to your stomach if targeting the lats is your goal.
After a second hold at the top, lower back down to the starting position slowly as you inhale.

name: Lying Close-Grip Bar Curl On High Pulley
directions: Place a flat bench in front of a high puley or lat puldown machine.
Hold the straight bar atachment using an underhand grip (palms up) that is about shoulder width.
Lie on your back with your head over the end of the bench.
Now extend your arms straight above your shoulders. Your torso and your arms should make a 90-degre angle and the elbows should be in. This wil be your starting position.

As you breathe out, curl the bar down in a semicircular motion until it touches your chin. Squeze the biceps for a second at the top contracted position. Tip: As you execute this motion only the forearms should move. At no time should the uper arms be moving at al. They are to remain perpendicular throughout the movement.
Return to starting position slowly.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Lying Close-Grip Barbell Triceps Extension Behind The Head
directions: While holding a barbel or EZ Curl bar with a pronated grip (palms facing forward), lie on your back on a flat bench with your head close to the end of the bench. Tip: If you are holding a barbel grab it using a shoulder-width grip and if you are using an E-Z Bar grab it on the iner handles.

Extend your arms in front of you and slowly bring the bar back in a semi circular motion (while keping the arms extended) to a position over your head. At the end of this step your arms should be overhead and paralel to the flor. This wil be your starting position. Tip: Kep your elbows in at al times.
As you inhale, lower the bar by bending at the elbows and while keping the uper arm stationary. Kep lowering the bar until your forearms are perpendicular to the flor.

As you exhale bring the bar back up to the starting position by pushing the bar up in a semi-circular motion until the lower arms are also paralel to the flor. Contract the triceps hard at the top of the movement for a second. Tip: Again, only the forearms should move. The uper arms should remain stationary at al times.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Lying Close-Grip Barbell Triceps Press To Chin
directions: While holding a barbel or EZ Curl bar with a pronated grip (palms facing forward), lie on your back on a flat bench with your head of the end of the bench. Tip: If you are holding a barbel grab it using a shoulder-width grip and if you are using an E-Z Bar grab it on the iner handles.
Extend your arms in front of you as you hold the barbel over your chest. The arms should be perpendicular to your torso (90-degre angle). This wil be your starting position.
As you inhale, lower the bar in a semi-circular motion by bending at the elbows and while keping the uper arm stationary and elbows in. Kep lowering the bar until it lightly touches your chin.

As you exhale bring the bar back up to the starting position by pushing the bar up in a semi-circular motion. Contract the triceps hard at the top of the movement for a second. Tip: Again, only the forearms should move. The uper arms should remain stationary at al times.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Lying Crossover
directions: Lie on your back with your legs extended.

Cros one leg over your body with the kne bent, atempting to touch the kne to the ground. Your partner should knel beside you, holding your shoulder down with one hand and controling the crosed leg with the other. this wil be your starting position.
Atempt to raise the bent kne of of the ground as your partner prevents any actual movement.
After 10-20 seconds, relax the leg as your partner gently preses the kne towards the flor. Repeat with the other side.

name: Lying Dumbbell Tricep Extension
directions: Lie on a flat bench while holding two dumbels directly in front of you. Your arms should be fuly extended at a 90-degre angle from your torso and the flor. The palms should be facing in and the elbows should be tucked in. This is the starting position.
As you breathe in and you kep the uper arms stationary with the elbows in, slowly lower the weight until the dumbels are near your ears.
At that point, while keping the elbows in and the uper arms stationary, use the triceps to bring the weight back up to the starting position as you breathe out.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Lying Face Down Plate Neck Resistance
directions: Lie face down with your whole body straight on a flat bench while holding a weight plate behind your head. Tip: You wil ned to position yourself so that your shoulders are slightly above the end of a flat bench in order for the uper chest, neck and face to be of the bench. This wil be your starting position.
While keping the plate secure on the back of your head slowly lower your head (as in saying "yes") as you breathe in.
Raise your head back up to the starting position in a semi-circular motion as you breathe out. Hold the contraction for a second.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Lying Face Up Plate Neck Resistance
directions: Lie face up with your whole body straight on a flat bench while holding a weight plate on top of your forehead. Tip: You wil ned to position yourself so that your shoulders are slightly above the end of a flat bench in order for the traps, neck and head to be of the bench. This wil be your starting position.
While keping the plate secure on your forehead slowly lower your head back in a semi-circular motion as you breathe in.
Raise your head back up to the starting position in a semi-circular motion as you breathe out. Hold the contraction for a second.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Lying Glute
directions: Lie on your back with your partner kneling beside you.

Flex the hip of one leg, raising it of of the flor. Rotate the leg so the fot is over the oposite hip, the lower leg perpendicular to your body. Your partner should hold the kne and ankle in place. This wil be your starting position.
Atempt to push your leg towards your partner, who should be preventing any actual movement of the leg.

After 10-20 seconds, completely relax as your partner gently pushes the ankle and kne towards your chest. Be sure to inform your helper when the stretch is adequate to prevent injury or overstretching.

name: Lying Hamstring
directions: Lie on your back with your legs extended. Your partner should be kneling beside you. Raise one leg up towards the ceiling and have your partner hold the ankle. Your partner can use their shoulder to brace your leg if necesary. This wil be your starting position.
With your partner holding your leg in place, atempt to flex the kne, contracting the hamstrings for 10-20 seconds.

Then relax your leg, alowing your partner to gently push the leg towards your head. Be sure to inform your helper when the stretch is adequate to prevent injury or overstretching. Switch sides once complete.

name: Lying High Bench Barbell Curl
directions: Lie face forward on a tal flat bench while holding a barbel with a supinated grip (palms facing up). Tip: If you are holding a barbel grab it using a shoulder-width grip and if you are using an E-Z Bar grab it on the iner handles. Your uper body should be positioned in a way that the uper chest is over the end of the bench and the barbel is hanging in front of you with the arms extended and perpendicular to the flor. This wil be your starting position.
While keping the elbows in and the uper arms stationary, curl the weight up in a semi-circular motion as you contract the biceps and exhale. Hold at the top of the movement for a second.
As you inhale, slowly go back to the starting position. Tip: Maintain ful control of the weight at al times and avoid any swinging. Remember, only the forearms should move throughout the movement.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Lying Leg Curls
directions: Adjust the machine lever to fit your height and lie face down on the leg curl machine with the pad of the lever on the back of your legs (just a few inches under the calves). Tip: Preferably use a leg curl machine that is angled as oposed to flat since an angled position is more favorable for hamstrings recruitment.

Keping the torso flat on the bench, ensure your legs are fuly stretched and grab the side handles of the machine. Position your toes straight (or you can also use any of the other two stances described on the fot positioning section). This wil be your starting position.
As you exhale, curl your legs up as far as posible without lifting the uper legs from the pad. Once you hit the fuly contracted position, hold it for a second.
As you inhale, bring the legs back to the initial position. Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Lying Machine Squat
directions: Adjust the leg machine to a height that wil alow you to get inside it with your knes bent and the thighs slightly below paralel.

Once you select the weight, position yourself inside the machine face up with the knes bent and thighs slightly below paralel to the platform. Make sure that the knes do not go past the toes. The angle created betwen the hamstrings and the calves should be one that is slightly les than 90 degres (since your starting position requires you to start slightly below paralel). Your back and your head should be resting on the machine while your shoulders are presed under the shoulder pads.
Place your hands by the handles and position your fet slightly pointing out at a shoulder width position. This wil be your starting position.

While presing with the bals of the fet as you breathe out, make your whole body erect as you squeze the quads. Hold the contracted position for a second. Tip: Since you are starting below paralel, you can opt to use your hands to help you up by presing on your thighs only on the first repetition.

Slowly squat down as you inhale but instead of going al the way down to the starting position, just stop once your thighs are paralel to the platform. The angle betwen your hamstrings and calves should be a 90-degre angle.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Lying One-Arm Lateral Raise
directions: While holding a dumbel in one hand, lay with your chest down on a flat bench. The other hand can be used to hold to the leg of the bench for stability.
Position the palm of the hand that is holding the dumbel in a neutral maner (palms facing your torso) as you kep the arm extended with the elbow slightly bent. This wil be your starting position.

Now raise the arm with the dumbel to the side until your elbow is at shoulder height and your arm is roughly paralel to the flor as you exhale. Tip: Maintain your arm perpendicular to the torso while keping your arm extended throughout the movement. Also, kep the contraction at the top for a second.
Slowly lower the dumbel to the starting position as you inhale.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Lying Prone Quadriceps
directions: Lay face down on the flor with your partner kneling beside you. Flex one kne and raise that leg of the ground, atempting to touch your glutes with your fot. Your partner should hold the kne and ankle. This wil be your starting position.
Atempt to extend your kne while your partner prevents any actual movement.
After 10-20 seconds, relax your muscles as your partner gently pushes the fot towards your glutes, further stretching the quadriceps and hip flexors.
After 10-20 seconds, switch sides.

name: Lying Rear Delt Raise
directions: While holding a dumbel in each hand, lay with your chest down on a flat bench.
Position the palms of the hands in a neutral maner (palms facing your torso) as you kep the arms extended with the elbows slightly bent. This wil be your starting position.

Now raise the arms to the side until your elbows are at shoulder height and your arms are roughly paralel to the flor as you exhale. Tip: Maintain your arms perpendicular to the torso while keping them extended throughout the movement. Also, kep the contraction at the top for a second.
Slowly lower the dumbels to the starting position as you inhale.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions and then switch to the other arm.

name: Lying Supine Dumbbell Curl
directions: Lie down on a flat bench face up while holding a dumbel in each arm on top of your thighs.
Bring the dumbels to the sides with the arms extended and the palms of the hands facing your thighs (neutral grip).

While keping the arms close to your torso and elbows in, slowly lower your arms (as you kep them extended with a slight bend at the elbows) as far down towards the flor as you can go. Once you canot go down any further, lock your uper arms in that position and that wil be your starting position.

As you breathe out, slowly begin to curl the weights up as you simultaneously rotate your wrists so that the palms of the hands face up. Continue curling the weight until your biceps are fuly contracted and squeze hard at the top position for a second. Tip: Only the forearms should move. Uper arms should remain stationary and elbows should stay in throughout the movement.
Return back to the starting position very slowly.

name: Lying T-Bar Row
directions: Load up the T-bar Row Machine with the desired weight and adjust the leg height so that your uper chest is at the top of the pad. Tip: In some machines al you can do is stand on the apropriate step that alows you to be at a height that has the uper chest at the top of the pad.
Lay face down on the pad and grab the handles. You can either use a palms down, palms up, or palms in position depending on what part of your back you want to emphasize.
Lift the bar of the rack and extend your arms in front of you. This wil be your starting position.

As you exhale slowly pul the weight up and squeze your back at the top of the movement. Tip: Kep the uper arms as close to the torso as posible throughout the movement in order to beter engage the back muscles. Also, do not lift your body of of the pad at any time and refrain from using the biceps to lift the weight.
After a second contraction at the top of the movement, as you inhale, slowly go back down to the starting position.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Lying Triceps Press
directions: Lie on a flat bench with either an e-z bar (my preference) or a straight bar placed on the flor behind your head and your fet on the flor.

Grab the bar behind you, using a medium overhand (pronated) grip, and raise the bar in front of you at arms length. Tip: The arms should be perpendicular to the torso and the flor. The elbows should be tucked in. This is the starting position.
As you breathe in, slowly lower the weight until the bar lightly touches your forehead while keping the uper arms and elbows stationary.
At that point, use the triceps to bring the weight back up to the starting position as you breathe out.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.
There are a few variations of this exercise. You can perform it on a decline bench as oposed to a flat bench.
You can also perform it using dumbels in which case the palms of the hands wil be facing each other as oposed to facing forward.
Also, you can try to do it using a revere grip (palms facing you) but this variation sems to strain my wrists.

name: Machine Bench Press
directions: Sit down on the Chest Pres Machine and select the weight.
Step on the lever provided by the machine since it wil help you to bring the handles forward so that you can grab the handles and fuly extend the arms.

Grab the handles with a palms-down grip and lift your elbows so that your uper arms are paralel to the flor to the sides of your torso. Tip: Your forearms wil be pointing forward since you are grabing the handles. Once you bring the handles forward and extend the arms you wil be at the starting position.
Now bring the handles back towards you as you breathe in.
Push the handles away from you as you flex your pecs and you breathe out. Hold the contraction for a second before going back to the starting position.
Repeat for the recomended amount of reps.
When finished step on the lever again and slowly get the handles back to their original place.

name: Machine Bicep Curl
directions: Adjust the seat to the apropriate height and make your weight selection. Place your uper arms against the pads and grasp the handles. This wil be your starting position.
Perform the movement by flexing the elbow, puling your lower arm towards your uper arm.
Pause at the top of the movement, and then slowly return the weight to the starting position.
Avoid returning the weight al the way to the stops until the set is complete to kep tension on the muscles being worked.

name: Machine Preacher Curls
directions: Sit down on the Preacher Curl Machine and select the weight.

Place the back of your uper arms (your triceps) on the preacher pad provided and grab the handles using an underhand grip (palms facing up). Tip: Make sure that when you place the arms on the pad you kep the elbows in. This wil be your starting position.

Now lift the handles as you exhale and you contract the biceps. At the top of the position make sure that you hold the contraction for a second. Tip: Only the forearms should move. The uper arms should remain stationary and on the pad at al times.
Lower the handles slowly back to the starting position as you inhale.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Machine Shoulder (Military) Press
directions: Sit down on the Shoulder Pres Machine and select the weight.
Grab the handles to your sides as you kep the elbows bent and in line with your torso. This wil be your starting position.
Now lift the handles as you exhale and you extend the arms fuly. At the top of the position make sure that you hold the contraction for a second.
Lower the handles slowly back to the starting position as you inhale.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Machine Triceps Extension
directions: Adjust the seat to the apropriate height and make your weight selection. Place your uper arms against the pads and grasp the handles. This wil be your starting position.
Perform the movement by extending the elbow, puling your lower arm away from your uper arm.
Pause at the completion of the movement, and then slowly return the weight to the starting position.
Avoid returning the weight al the way to the stops until the set is complete to kep tension on the muscles being worked.

name: Medicine Ball Chest Pass
directions: You wil ned a partner for this exercise. Lacking one, this movement can be performed against a wal.
Begin facing your partner holding the medicine bal at your torso with both hands.
Pul the bal to your chest, and reverse the motion by extending through the elbows. For sports aplications, you can take a step as you throw.
Your partner should catch the bal, and throw it back to you.
Receive the throw with both hands at chest height.

name: Medicine Ball Full Twist
directions: For this exercise you wil ned a medicine bal and a partner. Stand back to back with your partner, spaced 2-3 fet apart. This wil be your starting position.
Hold the bal in front of the trunk. Open the hips and turn the shoulders at the same time as your partner.
For ful rotation, you and your partner should twist in the same direction, i.e. counter-clockwise.
Pas the bal to your partner, and both of you can now twist in the oposite direction to repeat the procedure.

name: Medicine Ball Scoop Throw
directions: Asume a semisquat stance with a medicine bal in your hands. Your arms should hang so the bal is near your fet.
Begin by thrusting the hips forward as you extend through the legs, jumping up.
As you do, swing your arms up and over your head, keping them extended, releasing the bal at the peak of your movement. The goal is to throw the bal the greatest distance behind you.

name: Middle Back Shrug
directions: Lie facedown on an incline bench while holding a dumbel in each hand. Your arms should be fuly extended hanging down and pointing towards the flor. The palms of your hands should be facing each other. This wil be your starting position.

As you exhale, squeze your shoulder blades together and hold the contraction for a ful second. Tip: This movement is just like the reverse action of a hug, or trying to perform rear laterals as if you had no arms.
As you inhale go back to the starting position.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Middle Back Stretch
directions: Stand so your fet are shoulder width apart and your hands are on your hips.
Twist at your waist until you fel a stretch. Hold for 10 to 15 seconds, then twist to the other side.

name: Mixed Grip Chin
directions: Using a spacing that is just about 1 inch wider than shoulder width, grab a pul-up bar with the palms of one hand facing forward and the palms of the other hand facing towards you. This wil be your starting position.

Now start to pul yourself up as you exhale. Tip: With the arm that has the palms facing up concentrate on using the back muscles in order to perform the movement. The elbow of that arm should remain close to the torso. With the other arm that has the palms facing forward, the elbows wil be away but in line with the torso. You wil concentrate on using the lats to pul your body up.
After a second contraction at the top, start to slowly come down as you inhale.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

On the folowing set, switch grips; so if you had the right hand with the palms facing you and the left one with the palms facing forward, on the next set you wil have the palms facing forward for the right hand and facing you for the left.
If you are new at this exercise and do not have the strength to perform it, use a chin asist machine if available. These machines use weight to help you push your bodyweight.
Otherwise, a spoter holding your legs can help.
On the other hand, more advanced lifters can ad weight to the exercise by using a weight belt that alows the adition of weighted plates.

name: Monster Walk
directions: Place a band around both ankles and another around both knes. There should be enough tension that they are tight when your fet are shoulder width apart.
To begin, take short steps forward alternating your left and right fot.
After several steps, do just the oposite and walk backward to where you started.

name: Mountain Climbers
