directions: Begin in a pushup position, with your weight suported by your hands and toes. Flexing the kne and hip, bring one leg until the kne is aproximately under the hip. This wil be your starting position.

Explosively reverse the positions of your legs, extending the bent leg until the leg is straight and suported by the toe, and bringing the other fot up with the hip and kne flexed. Repeat in an alternating fashion for 20-30 seconds.

name: Moving Claw Series
directions: This move helps prepare your runing form to help you excel at sprinting. As you run, be sure to flex the kne, aiming to kick your glutes as the hip extends.
Reload the quad as the leg moves back forward, atacking the ground on the next step.
Ensure that as you run, you block with the arms, punching through in a rapid 1-2 motion.

name: Muscle Snatch
directions: Begin with a loaded barbel held at the mid thigh position with a wide grip. The fet should be directly below the hips, with the fet turned out as neded. Lower the hips, with the chest up and the head loking forward. The shoulders should be just in front of the bar. This wil be the starting position.

Begin the pul by driving through the front of the hels, raising the bar. Transition into the second pul by extending through the hips knes and ankles, driving the bar up as quickly as posible. The bar should be close to the body.
Continue raising the bar to the overhead position, without rebending the knes.

name: Muscle Up
directions: Grip the rings using a false grip, with the base of your palms on top of the rings. Initiate a pul up by puling the elbows down to your side, flexing the elbows.

As you reach the top position of the pul-up, pul the rings to your armpits as you rol your shoulders forward, alowing your elbows to move straight back behind you. This puts you into the proper position to continue into the dip portion of the movement.
Maintaining control and stability, extend through the elbow to complete the motion.
Use care when lowering yourself to the ground.

name: Narrow Stance Hack Squats
directions: Place the back of your torso against the back pad of the machine and hok your shoulders under the shoulder pads provided.

Position your legs in the platform using a les than shoulder width narow stance with the toes slightly pointed out. Your fet should be around 3 inches or les apart. Tip: Kep your head up at al times and also maintain the back on the pad at al times.
Place your arms on the side handles of the machine and disengage the safety bars (which on most designs is done by moving the side handles from a facing front position to a diagonal position).
Now straighten your legs without locking the knes. This wil be your starting position.

Begin to slowly lower the unit by bending the knes as you maintain a straight posture with the head up (back on the pad at al times). Continue down until the angle betwen the uper leg and the calves becomes slightly les than 90-degres (which is the point in which the uper legs are below paralel to the flor). Inhale as you perform this portion of the movement.
Begin to raise the unit as you exhale by pushing the flor with mainly with the hels of your fet as you straighten the legs again and go back to the starting position.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Narrow Stance Leg Press
directions: Using a leg pres machine, sit down on the machine and place your legs on the platform directly in front of you at a les-than-shoulder-width narow stance with the toes slightly pointed out. Your fet should be around 3 inches or les apart. Tip: Kep your head up at al times and also maintain the back on the pad at al times.

Lower the safety bars holding the weighted platform in place and pres the platform al the way up until your legs are fuly extended in front of you. Tip: Make sure that you do not lock your knes. Your torso and the legs should make a perfect 90-degre angle. This wil be your starting position.
As you inhale, slowly lower the platform until your uper and lower legs make a 90-degre angle.
Pushing mainly with the hels of your fet and using the quadriceps go back to the starting position as you exhale.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions and ensure to lock the safety pins properly once you are done. You do not want that platform faling on you fuly loaded.

name: Narrow Stance Squats
directions: This exercise is best performed inside a squat rack for safety purposes. To begin, first set the bar on a rack that best matches your height. Once the corect height is chosen and the bar is loaded, step under the bar and place the back of your shoulders (slightly below the neck) acros it.
Hold on to the bar using both arms at each side and lift it of the rack by first pushing with your legs and at the same time straightening your torso.

Step away from the rack and position your legs using a les-than-shoulder-width narow stance with the toes slightly pointed out. Fet should be around 3-6 inches apart. Kep your head up at al times (loking down wil get you of balance) and maintain a straight back. This wil be your starting position. (Note: For the purposes of this discusion we wil use the medium stance described above which targets overal development; however you can chose any of the thre stances discused in the fot stances section).

Begin to slowly lower the bar by bending the knes as you maintain a straight posture with the head up. Continue down until the angle betwen the uper leg and the calves becomes slightly les than 90-degres (which is the point in which the uper legs are below paralel to the flor). Inhale as you perform this portion of the movement. Tip: If you performed the exercise corectly, the front of the knes should make an imaginary straight line with the toes that is perpendicular to the front. If your knes are past that imaginary line (if they are past your toes) then you are placing undue stres on the kne and the exercise has ben performed incorectly.
Begin to raise the bar as you exhale by pushing the flor with the hel of your fot mainly as you straighten the legs again and go back to the starting position.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Natural Glute Ham Raise
directions: Using the leg pad of a lat puldown machine or a preacher bench, position yourself so that your ankles are under the pads, knes on the seat, and you are facing away from the machine. You should be upright and maintaining god posture.
This wil be your starting position. Lower yourself under control until your knes are almost completely straight.
Remaining in control, raise yourself back up to the starting position.
If you are unable to complete a rep, use a band, a partner, or push of of a box to aid in completing a repetition.

name: Neck Press
directions: Lie back on a flat bench. Using a medium-width grip (a grip that creates a 90-degre angle in the midle of the movement betwen the forearms and the uper arms), lift the bar from the rack and hold it straight over your neck with your arms locked. This wil be your starting position.
As you breathe in, come down slowly until you fel the bar on your neck.

After a second pause, bring the bar back to the starting position as you breathe out and push the bar using your chest muscles. Lock your arms and squeze your chest in the contracted position, hold for a second and then start coming down slowly again. Tip: It should take at least twice as long to go down than to come up).
Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.
When you are done, place the bar back in the rack.
It is imperative that if you are new at this exercise, it is advised that you use a spoter. If no spoter is available, then be conservative with the amount of weight used.
For obvious reasons you ned to be in ful control of the barbel at al times.

name: Neck-SMR
directions: Using a muscle roler or a roling pin, place the roler behind your head and against your neck. Make sure that you do not place the roler directly against the spine, but turned slightly so that the roler is presed against the muscles to either side of the spine. This wil be your starting position.
Starting at the top of your neck, slowly rol down the muscles of your neck, pausing at points of tension for 10-30 seconds.

name: Oblique Crunches
directions: Lie flat on the flor with your lower back presed to the ground. For this exercise, you wil ned to put one hand beside your head and the other to the side against the flor.
Make sure your fet are elevated and resting on a flat surface.
Now lift the shoulder in which your hand is touching your head.

Simply elevate your shoulder and body upward until you touch your kne. For example, if you have your right hand besides your head, then you want to elevate your body upwards until your right elbow touches your left kne. The same variation can be aplied doing the inverse and using your left elbow to touch your right kne.
After your kne touches your elbow, lower your body until you have reached the starting position.
Remember to breathe in during the ecentric (lowering) part of the exercise and to breathe out during the concentric (upward) part of the exercise.
Continue alternating in this maner until al of the recomended repetitions for each side have ben completed.

name: Oblique Crunches - On The Floor
directions: Start out by lying on your right side with your legs lying on top of each other. Make sure your knes are bent a litle bit.
Place your left hand behind your head.
Once you are in this set position, begin by moving your left elbow up as you would perform a normal crunch except this time the main emphasis is on your obliques.
Crunch as high as you can, hold the contraction for a second and then slowly drop back down into the starting position.
Remember to breathe in during the ecentric (lowering) part of the exercise and to breathe out during the concentric (elevation) part of the exercise.

name: Olympic Squat
directions: Begin with a barbel suported on top of the traps. The chest should be up, and the head facing forward. Adopt a hip width stance with the fet turned out as neded.

Descend by flexing the knes, refraining from moving the hips back as much as posible. This requires that the knes travel forward; ensure that they stay aligned with the fet. The goal is to kep the torso as upright as posible. Continue al the way down, keping the weight on the front of the hel.
At the moment the uper legs contact the lower, reverse the motion, driving the weight upward.

name: On Your Side Quad Stretch
directions: Start of by lying on your right side, with your right kne bent at a 90-degre angle resting on the flor in front of you (this stabilizes the torso).
Bend your left kne behind you and hold your left fot with your left hand. To stretch your hip flexor, pres your left hip forward as you push your left fot back into your hand. Switch sides.

name: On-Your-Back Quad Stretch
directions: Lie on a flat bench or step, and hang one leg and arm over the side.
Bend the kne and hold the top of the fot. As you do this, be careful not to arch your lower back.
Pul the bely buton to the spine to stay in neutral. Pres your fot down and into your hand. To ad the hip stretch, lift the hip of the leg you're holding up toward the ceiling.
Switch sides.

name: One Arm Against Wall
directions: From a standing position, place a bent arm against a wal or dorway.
Slowly lean toward your arm until you fel a stretch in your lats.

name: One Arm Chin-Up
directions: For this exercise, start out by placing a towel around a chin up bar.
Grab the chin-up bar with your palm facing you. One hand wil be grabing the chin-up bar and the other wil be grabing the towel.
Bring your torso back around 30 degres or so while creating a curvature on your lower back and sticking your chest out. This is your starting position.v

Pul your torso up until the bar touches your uper chest by drawing the shoulders and the uper arms down and back. Exhale as you perform this portion of the movement. Tip: Concentrate on squezing the back muscles once you reach the ful contracted position. The uper torso should remain stationary as it moves through space and only the arms should move. The forearms should do no other work other than hold the bar.
After a second on the contracted position, start to inhale and slowly lower your torso back to the starting position when your arms are fuly extended and the lats are fuly stretched.
Repeat this motion for the prescribed amount of repetitions.
Switch arms and repeat the movement.
If you are new at this exercise and do not have the strength to perform it, use a chin asist machine if available. These machines use weight to help you push your bodyweight.
Otherwise, a spoter holding your legs can help.

name: One Arm Dumbbell Bench Press
directions: Lie down on a flat bench with a dumbel in one hand on top of your thigh.

By using your thigh to help you get the dumbel up, clean the dumbel up so that you can hold it in front of you at shoulder width. Use the hand you are not lifting with to help position the dumbel over you properly.
Once at shoulder width, rotate your wrist forward so that the palm of your hand is facing away from you. This wil be your starting position.

Bring down the weights slowly to your side as you breathe in. Kep ful control of the dumbel at al times. Tip: Use the hand that you are not lifting with to help kep the dumbel balance as you may strugle a bit at first. Only use your non-lifting hand if it is neded. Otherwise, kep it resting to the side.

As you breathe out, push the dumbels up using your pectoral muscles. Lock your arms in the contracted position, squeze your chest, hold for a second and then start coming down slowly. Tip: It should take at least twice as long to go down than to come up.
Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions of your training program.
Switch arms and repeat the movement.

name: One Arm Dumbbell Preacher Curl
directions: Grab a dumbel with the right arm and place the uper arm on top of the preacher bench or the incline bench. The dumbel should be held at shoulder length. This wil be your starting position.
As you breathe in, slowly lower the dumbel until your uper arm is extended and the biceps is fuly stretched.

As you exhale, use the biceps to curl the weight up until your biceps is fuly contracted and the dumbel is at shoulder height. Again, remember that to ensure ful contraction you ned to bring that smal finger higher than the thumb.
Squeze the biceps hard for a second at the contracted position and repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.
Switch arms and repeat the movement.

name: One Arm Floor Press
directions: Lie down on a flat surface with your back presing against the flor or an exercise mat. Make sure your knes are bent.

Have a partner hand you the bar on one hand. When starting, your arm should be just about fuly extended, similar to the starting position of a barbel bench pres. However, this time your grip wil be neutral (palms facing your torso).
Make sure the hand you are not using to lift the weight is placed by your side.
Begin the exercise by lowering the barbel until your elbow touches the ground. Make sure to breathe in as this is the ecentric (lowering part of the exercise).
Then start lifting the barbel back up to the original starting position. Remember to breathe out during the concentric (lifting part of the exercise).
Repeat until you have performed your recomended repetitions.
Switch arms and repeat the movement.

name: One Arm Lat Pulldown
directions: Select an apropriate weight and adjust the kne pad to help kep you down. Grasp the handle with a pronated grip. This wil be your starting position.
Pul the handle down, squezing your elbow to your side as you flex the elbow.
Pause at the botom of the motion, and then slowly return the handle to the starting position.
For multiple repetitions, avoid completely returning the weight to kep tension on the muscles being worked.

name: One Arm Pronated Dumbbell Triceps Extension
directions: Lie flat on a bench while holding a dumbel at arms length. Your arm should be perpendicular to your body. The palm of your hand should be facing towards your fet as a pronated grip is required to perform this exercise.
Place your non lifting hand on your bicep for suport.
Slowly begin to lower the dumbel down as you breathe in.
Then, begin lifting the dumbel upward as you contract the triceps. Remember to breathe out during the concentric (lifting part of the exercise).
Repeat until you have performed your set repetitions.
Switch arms and repeat the movement.

name: One Arm Supinated Dumbbell Triceps Extension
directions: Lie flat on a bench while holding a dumbel at arms length. Your arm should be perpendicular to your body. The palm of your hand should be facing towards your face as a supinated grip is required to perform this exercise.
Place your non lifting hand on your bicep for suport.
Slowly begin to lower the dumbel down as you breathe in.
Then, begin lifting the dumbel upward as you contract the triceps. Remember to breathe out during the concentric (lifting part of the exercise).
Repeat until you have performed your set repetitions.
Switch arms and repeat the movement.
Switch arms again and repeat the movement.

name: One Half Locust
directions: Lie facedown on the flor.
Put your left hand under your left hipbone to pad your hip and pubic bone.
Bend your right kne so you can hold the fot in your right hand.

Lift the fot in the air and simultaneously lift your shoulders of the flor. This also stretches the right hip flexor and the chest and shoulders. Switch sides. If it doesn't bother your back, you can try it with both arms and legs at the same time.

name: One Handed Hang
directions: Grab onto a chinup bar with one hand, using a pronated grip. Kep your fet on the flor or a step. Alow the majority of your weight to hang from that hand, while keping your fet on the ground. Hold for 10-20 seconds and switch sides.

name: One Knee To Chest
directions: Start of by lying on the flor.
Extend one leg straight and pul the other kne to your chest. Hold under the kne joint to protect the knecap.
Gently tug that kne toward your nose.
Switch sides. This stretches the butocks and lower back of the bent leg and the hip flexor of the straight leg.

name: One Leg Barbell Squat
directions: Start by standing about 2 to 3 fet in front of a flat bench with your back facing the bench. Have a barbel in front of you on the flor. Tip: Your fet should be shoulder width apart from each other.
Bend the knes and use a pronated grip with your hands being wider than shoulder width apart from each other to lift the barbel up until you can rest it on your chest.

Then lift the barbel over your head and rest it on the base of your neck. Move one fot back so that your toe is resting on the flat bench. Your other fot should be stationary in front of you. Kep your head up at al times as loking down wil get you of balance and also maintain a straight back. Tip: Make sure your back is straight and chest is out while performing this exercise.
As you inhale, slowly lower your leg until your thigh is paralel to the flor. At this point, your kne should be over your toes. Your chest should be directly above the midle of your thigh.
Leading with the chest and hips and contracting the quadriceps, elevate your leg back to the starting position as you exhale.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.
Switch legs and repeat the movement.

name: One-Arm Dumbbell Row
directions: Chose a flat bench and place a dumbel on each side of it.

Place the right leg on top of the end of the bench, bend your torso forward from the waist until your uper body is paralel to the flor, and place your right hand on the other end of the bench for suport.
Use the left hand to pick up the dumbel on the flor and hold the weight while keping your lower back straight. The palm of the hand should be facing your torso. This wil be your starting position.

Pul the resistance straight up to the side of your chest, keping your uper arm close to your side and keping the torso stationary. Breathe out as you perform this step. Tip: Concentrate on squezing the back muscles once you reach the ful contracted position. Also, make sure that the force is performed with the back muscles and not the arms. Finaly, the uper torso should remain stationary and only the arms should move. The forearms should do no other work except for holding the dumbel; therefore do not try to pul the dumbel up using the forearms.
Lower the resistance straight down to the starting position. Breathe in as you perform this step.
Repeat the movement for the specified amount of repetitions.
Switch sides and repeat again with the other arm.

name: One-Arm Flat Bench Dumbbell Flye
directions: Lie down on a flat bench with a dumbel in one hand resting on top of your thigh. The palm of your hand with the dumbel in it should be at a neutral grip.

By using your thighs to help you get the dumbel up, clean the dumbel so that you can hold it in front of you with your lifting arm being fuly extended. Remember to maintain a neutral grip with this exercise. Your non lifting hand should be to the side holding the flat bench for beter suport. This wil be your starting position.

Your arm with the weight should have a slight bend on your elbow in order to prevent stres at the biceps tendon. Begin by lowering your arm with the weight in it out in a wide arc until you fel a stretch on your chest. Breathe in as you perform this portion of the movement. Tip: Kep in mind that throughout the movement, your lifting arm should remain stationary; the movement should only ocur at the shoulder joint.
Return your lifting arm back to the starting position as you squeze your chest muscles and breathe out. Tip: Make sure to use the same arc of motion used to lower the weights.
Hold for a second at the contracted position and repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.
Switch arms and repeat the exercise.

name: One-Arm High-Pulley Cable Side Bends
directions: Conect a standard handle to a tower. Move cable to highest puley position.
Stand with side to cable. With one hand, reach up and grab handle with underhand grip.
Pul down cable until elbow touches your side and the handle is by your shoulder.
Position fet hip-width apart. Place fre hand on hip to help gauge pivot point.
Kep arm in static position. Contract oblique to bring the weight down in a side crunch.
Once you reach maximum contraction, slowly release the weight to the starting position. The weight stack should never be unloaded in a resting position. The aim is constant tension during the set.
Repeat to failure.
Then, reposition and repeat the same series of movements on the oposite side.

name: One-Arm Incline Lateral Raise
directions: Lie down sideways on an incline bench pres with a dumbel in the hand. Make sure the shoulder is presing against the incline bench and the arm is lying acros your body with the palm around your navel.
Hold a dumbel in your upermost arm while keping it extended in front of you paralel to the flor. This is your starting position.

While keping the dumbel paralel to the flor at al times, perform a lateral raise. Your arm should travel straight up until it is pointing at the ceiling. Tip: Exhale as you perform this movement. Hold the dumbel in the position and fel the contraction in the shoulders for a second.
While inhaling lower the weight acros your body back into the starting position.
Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.
Switch arms and repeat the movement.

name: One-Arm Kettlebell Clean
directions: Place a ketlebel betwen your fet. As you bend down to grab the ketlebel, push your but back and kep your eyes loking forward.
Clean the ketlebel to your shoulders by extending through the legs and hips as you raise the ketlebel towards your shoulder. The wrist should rotate as you do so.
Return the weight to the starting position.

name: One-Arm Kettlebell Clean and Jerk
directions: Hold a ketlebel by the handle.
Clean the ketlebel to your shoulder by extending through the legs and hips as you pul the ketlebel towards your shoulder. Rotate your wrist as you do so, so that the palm faces forward.
Dip your body by bending the knes, keping your torso upright.

Imediately reverse direction, driving through the hels, in esence jumping to create momentum. As you do so, pres the ketlebel overhead to lockout by extending the arms, using your body's momentum to move the weight.
Receive the weight overhead by returning to a squat position underneath the weight.
Keping the weight overhead, return to a standing position. Lower the weight to the flor to perform the next repetition.

name: One-Arm Kettlebell Floor Press
directions: Lie on the flor holding a ketlebel with one hand, with your uper arm suported by the flor. The palm should be facing in.
Pres the ketlebel straight up toward the ceiling, rotating your wrist.
Lower the ketlebel back to the starting position and repeat.

name: One-Arm Kettlebell Jerk
directions: Hold a ketlebel by the handle. Clean the ketlebel to your shoulder by extending through the legs and hips as you pul the ketlebel towards your shoulder. Rotate your wrist as you do so, so that the palm faces forward. This wil be your starting position.
Dip your body by bending the knes, keping your torso upright.

Imediately reverse direction, driving through the hels, in esence jumping to create momentum. As you do so, pres the ketlebel overhead to lockout by extending the arms, using your body's momentum to move the weight. Receive the weight overhead by returning to a squat position underneath the weight. Keping the weight overhead, return to a standing position.
Lower the weight to perform the next repetition.

name: One-Arm Kettlebell Military Press To The Side
directions: Clean a ketlebel to your shoulder. Clean the ketlebel to your shoulder by extending through the legs and hips as you pul the ketlebel towards your shoulder. Rotate your wrist as you do so, so that the palm faces inward. This wil be your starting position.
Lok at the ketlebel and pres it up and out until it is locked out overhead.
Lower the ketlebel back to your shoulder under control and repeat. Make sure to contract your lat, but, and stomach forcefuly for aded stability and strength.

name: One-Arm Kettlebell Para Press
directions: Clean a ketlebel to your shoulder. Clean the ketlebel to your shoulder by extending through the legs and hips as you pul the ketlebel towards your shoulder. Rotate your wrist as you do so, so that the palm faces forward. This wil be your starting position.
Hold the ketlebel with the elbow out to the side, and pres it up and out until it is locked out overhead.
Lower the ketlebel back to your shoulder under control and repeat. Make sure to contract your lat, but, and stomach forcefuly for aded stability and strength.

name: One-Arm Kettlebell Push Press
directions: Hold a ketlebel by the handle. Clean the ketlebel to your shoulder by extending through the legs and hips as you pul the ketlebel towards your shoulder. Rotate your wrist as you do so, so that the palm faces forward. This wil be your starting position.
Dip your body by bending the knes, keping your torso upright.

Imediately reverse direction, driving through the hels, in esence jumping to create momentum. As you do so, pres the ketlebel overhead to lockout by extending the arms, using your body's momentum to move the weight. Lower the weight to perform the next repetition.

name: One-Arm Kettlebell Row
directions: Place a ketlebel in front of your fet. Bend your knes slightly and then push your but out as much as posible as you bend over to get in the starting position. Grab the ketlebel and pul it to your stomach, retracting your shoulder blade and flexing the elbow. Kep your back straight. Lower and repeat.

name: One-Arm Kettlebell Snatch
directions: Place a ketlebel betwen your fet. Bend your knes and push your but back to get in the proper starting position.
Lok straight ahead and swing the ketlebel back betwen your legs.

Imediately reverse the direction and drive through with your hips and knes, acelerating the ketlebel upward. As the ketlebel rises to your shoulder rotate your hand and punch straight up, using momentum to receive the weight locked out overhead.

name: One-Arm Kettlebell Split Jerk
directions: Hold a ketlebel by the handle. Clean the ketlebel to your shoulder by extending through the legs and hips as you pul the ketlebel towards your shoulder. Rotate your wrist as you do so, so that the palm faces forward. This wil be your starting position.
Dip your body by bending the knes, keping your torso upright.

Imediately reverse direction, driving through the hels, in esence jumping to create momentum. As you do so, pres the ketlebel overhead to lockout by extending the arms, using your body's momentum to move the weight.
Receive the weight overhead by returning to a squat position underneath the weight, positioning one leg in front of you and one leg behind you.
Keping the weight overhead, return to a standing position and bring your fet together. Lower the weight to perform the next repetition.

name: One-Arm Kettlebell Split Snatch
directions: Hold a ketlebel in one hand by the handle.
Squat towards the flor, and then reverse the motion, extending the hips, knes, and finaly the ankles, to raise the ketlebel overhead.

After fuly extending the body, descend into a lunge position to receive the weights overhead, one leg forward and one leg back. Ensure you drive through with your hips and lock the ketlebels overhead in one uninterupted motion.
Return to a standing position, holding the weight overhead, and bring the fet together. Lower the weight to return to the starting position.

name: One-Arm Long Bar Row
directions: Position a bar into a landmine or in a corner to kep it from moving. Load an apropriate weight onto your end.
Stand next to the bar, and take a grip with one hand close to the colar. Using your hips and legs, rise to a standing position.
Asume a bent-kne stance with your hips back and your chest up. Your arm should be extended. This wil be your starting position.
Pul the weight to your side by retracting the shoulder and flexing the elbow. Do not jerk the weight or cheat during the movement.
After a brief pause, return to the starting position.

name: One-Arm Medicine Ball Slam
directions: Start in a standing position with a stagered, athletic stance. Hold a medicine bal in one hand, on the same side as your back leg. This wil be your starting position.
Begin by winding the arm, raising the medicine bal above your head. As you do so, extend through the hips, knes, and ankles to load up for the slam.
At peak extension, flex the shoulders, spine, and hips to throw the bal hard into the ground directly in front of you.
Catch the bal on the bounce and continue for the desired number of repetitions.

name: One-Arm Open Palm Kettlebell Clean
directions: Place one ketlebel betwen your fet.

Grab the handle with one hand and raise the ketlebel rapidly, let it flip so that the bal of the ketlebel lands in the palm of
your hand.
Throw the ketlebel out in front of you and catch the handle with one hand.
Take the ketlebel to the flor and repeat. Make sure to work both arms.

name: One-Arm Overhead Kettlebell Squats
directions: Clean and pres a ketlebel with one arm. Clean the ketlebel to your shoulder by extending through the legs and hips as you pul the ketlebel towards your shoulder. Rotate your wrist as you do so. Pres the weight overhead by extending through the elbow.This wil be your starting position.
Loking straight ahead and keping a ketlebel locked out above you, flex the knes and hips and lower your torso betwen your legs, keping your head and chest up.
Pause at the botom position for a second before rising back to the top, driving through the hels of your fet.

name: One-Arm Side Deadlift
directions: Stand to the side of a barbel next to its center. Bend your knes and lower your body until you are able to reach the barbel.

Grasp the bar as if you were grabing a briefcase (palms facing you since the bar is sideways). You may ned a wrist wrap if you are using a significant amount of weight. This is your starting position.
Use your legs to help lift the barbel up while exhaling. Your arms should extend fuly as bring the barbel up until you are in a standing position.
Slowly bring the barbel back down while inhaling. Tip: Make sure to bend your knes while lowering the weight to avoid any injury from ocuring.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.
Switch arms and repeat the movement.

name: One-Arm Side Laterals
directions: Pick a dumbel and place it in one of your hands. Your non lifting hand should be used to grab something steady such as an incline bench pres. Lean towards your lifting arm and away from the hand that is griping the incline bench as this wil alow you to kep your balance.
Stand with a straight torso and have the dumbel by your side at arms length with the palm of the hand facing you. This wil be your starting position.

While maintaining the torso stationary (no swinging), lift the dumbel to your side with a slight bend on the elbow and your hand slightly tilted forward as if pouring water in a glas. Continue to go up until you arm is paralel to the flor. Exhale as you execute this movement and pause for a second at the top.
Lower the dumbel back down slowly to the starting position as you inhale.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.
Switch arms and repeat the exercise.

name: One-Legged Cable Kickback
directions: Hok a leather ankle cuf to a low cable puley and then atach the cuf to your ankle.
Face the weight stack from a distance of about two fet, grasping the stel frame for suport.

While keping your knes and hips bent slightly and your abs tight, contract your glutes to slowly "kick" the working leg back in a semicircular arc as high as it wil comfortably go as you breathe out. Tip: At ful extension, squeze your glutes for a second in order to achieve a peak contraction.
Now slowly bring your working leg forward, resisting the pul of the cable until you reach the starting position.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.
Switch legs and repeat the movement for the other side.

name: Open Palm Kettlebell Clean
directions: Place one ketlebel betwen your fet. Clean the ketlebel by extending through the legs and hips as you raise the ketlebel towards your shoulders.
Release the ketlebel as it comes up, and let it flip so that the bal of the ketlebel lands in the palms of your hands.
Release the ketlebel out in front of you and catch the handle with both hands. Lower the ketlebel to the starting position and repeat.

name: Otis-Up
directions: Secure your fet and lay back on the flor. Your knes should be bent. Hold a weight with both hands to your chest. This wil be your starting position.
Initiate the movement by flexing the hips and spine to raise your torso up from the ground.
As you move up, pres the weight up so that it is above your head at the top of the movement.
Return the weight to your chest as you reverse the sit-up motion, ensuring not to go al the way down to the flor.

name: Overhead Cable Curl
directions: To begin, set a weight that is comfortable on each side of the puley machine. Note: Make sure that the amount of weight selected is the same on each side.
Now adjust the height of the puleys on each side and make sure that they are positioned at a height higher than that of your shoulders.

Stand in the midle of both sides and use an underhand grip (palms facing towards the ceiling) to grab each handle. Your arms should be fuly extended and paralel to the flor with your fet positioned shoulder width apart from each other. Your body should be evenly aligned the handles. This is the starting position.
While exhaling, slowly squeze the biceps on each side until your forearms and biceps touch.
While inhaling, move your forearms back to the starting position. Note: Your entire body is stationary during this exercise except for the forearms.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions prescribed in your program.

name: Overhead Lat
directions: Sit upright on the flor with your partner behind you. Raise one arm straight up, and flex the elbow, atempting to touch your hand to your back. Your parner should hold your tricep and wrist. This wil be your starting position.
Atempt to pul your uper arm to your side as your partner prevents you from doing actualy doing so.
After 10-20 seconds, relax the arm and alow your partner to further stretch the lat by aplying gentle presure to the tricep. Hold for 10-20 seconds, and then switch sides.

name: Overhead Slam
directions: Hold a medine bal with both hands and stand with your fet at shoulder width. This wil be your starting position.
Initiate the countermovement by raising the bal above your head and fuly extending your body.
Reverse the motion, slaming the bal into the ground directly in front of you as hard as you can.
Receive the bal with both hands on the bounce and repeat the movement.

name: Overhead Squat
directions: Start out by having a barbel in front of you on the flor. Your fet should be wider than shoulder width apart from each other.

Bend the knes and use a pronated grip (palms facing you) to grab the barbel. Your hands should be at a wider than shoulder width apart from each other before lifting. Once you are positioned, lift the barbel up until you can rest it on your chest.

Move the barbel over and slightly behind your head and make sure your arms are fuly extended. Kep your head up at al times and also maintain a straight back. Retract your shoulder blades. This is your starting position.

Slowly lower the weight by bending your knes until your thighs are paralel to the ground while inhaling. Tip: Kep your back straight while performing this exercise to avoid any injuries and your arms should remain extended and over your head at al times.
Now use your fet and legs to help bring the weight back up to the starting position while exhaling.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Overhead Stretch
directions: Standing straight up, lace your fingers together and open your palms to the ceiling. Kep your shoulders down as you extend your arms up.
To create a ful torso stretch, pul your tailbone down and stabilize your torso as you do this. Stretch the muscles on both the front and the back of the torso.

name: Overhead Triceps
directions: Sit upright on the flor with your partner behind you. Raise one arm straight up, and flex the elbow, atempting to touch your hand to your back. Your parner should hold your elbow and wrist. This wil be your starting position.
Atempt to extend the arm straight into the air as your partner prevents you from doing actualy doing so.
After 10-20 seconds, relax the arm and alow your partner to further stretch the tricep by aplying gentle presure to the wrist. Hold for 10-20 seconds, and then switch sides.

name: Pallof Press
directions: Conect a standard handle to a tower, andif posibleposition the cable to shoulder height. If not, a low puley wil sufice.
With your side to the cable, grab the handle with both hands and step away from the tower. You should be aproximately arms length away from the puley, with the tension of the weight on the cable.
With your fet positioned hip-width apart and knes slightly bent, hold the cable to the midle of your chest. This wil be your starting position.
Pres the cable away from your chest, fuly extending both arms. You core should be tight and engaged.
Hold the repetition for several seconds before returning to the starting position.
At the conclusion of the set, repeat facing the other direction.

name: Pallof Press With Rotation
directions: Conect a standard handle to a tower, and position the cable to shoulder height.

With your side to the cable, grab the handle with one hand and step away from the tower. You should be aproximately arms length away from the puley, with the tension of the weight on the cable. Align outstretched arm with cable.
With your fet positioned hip-width apart, pul the cable into your chest and grab the handle with your other hand. Both hands should be on the handle at this time.
Facing forward, pres the cable away from your chest. You core should be tight and engaged.
Keping your hips straight, twist your torso away from the puley until you get a ful quarter rotation.
Maintain your rigid stance and straight arms. Return to the neutral position in a slow and controled maner. Your arms should be extended in front of you.
With the side tension stil engaging your core, bring your hands to your chest and imediately pres outward to a fuly extended position. This constitutes one rep.
Repeat to failure.
Then, reposition and repeat the same series of movements on the oposite side.

name: Palms-Down Dumbbell Wrist Curl Over A Bench
directions: Start out by placing two dumbels on one side of a flat bench.
Knel down on both of your knes so that your body is facing the flat bench.

Use your arms to grab both of the dumbels with a pronated grip (palms facing down) and bring them up so that your forearms are resting against the flat bench. Your wrists should be hanging over the edge.
Start out by curling your wrist upwards and exhaling.
Slowly lower your wrists back down to the starting position while inhaling.
Your forearms should be stationary as your wrist is the only movement neded to perform this exercise.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

This exercise can also be performed siting down by using your thighs as a resting position for your forearms. Your wrist can hang over your knes and the same movements as mentioned above can be performed.
You can also use a barbel instead of a dumbel.

name: Palms-Down Wrist Curl Over A Bench
directions: Start out by placing a barbel on one side of a flat bench.
Knel down on both of your knes so that your body is facing the flat bench.
Use your arms to grab the barbel with a pronated grip (palms down) and bring them up so that your forearms are resting against the flat bench. Your wrists should be hanging over the edge.
Start out by curling your wrist upwards and exhaling.
Slowly lower your wrists back down to the starting position while inhaling.
Your forearms should be stationary as your wrist is the only movement neded to perform this exercise.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

This exercise can also be performed siting down by using your thighs as a resting position for your forearms. Your wrist can hang over your knes and the same movements as mentioned above can be performed.
You can also use a dumbel instead of a barbel.

name: Palms-Up Barbell Wrist Curl Over A Bench
directions: Start out by placing a barbel on one side of a flat bench.
Knel down on both of your knes so that your body is facing the flat bench.
Use your arms to grab the barbel with a supinated grip (palms up) and bring them up so that your forearms are resting against the flat bench. Your wrists should be hanging over the edge.
Start out by curling your wrist upwards and exhaling.
Slowly lower your wrists back down to the starting position while inhaling.
Your forearms should be stationary as your wrist is the only movement neded to perform this exercise.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

This exercise can also be performed siting down by using your thighs as a resting position for your forearms. Your wrist can hang over your knes and the same movements as mentioned above can be performed.
You can also use a dumbel instead of a barbel.

name: Palms-Up Dumbbell Wrist Curl Over A Bench
directions: Start out by placing two dumbels on one side of a flat bench.
Knel down on both of your knes so that your body is facing the flat bench.
Use your arms to grab both of the dumbels with a supinated grip (palms up) and bring them up so that your forearms are resting against the flat bench. Your wrists should be hanging over the edge.
Start out by curling your wrist upwards and exhaling.
Slowly lower your wrists back down to the starting position while inhaling. Make sure to inhale during this part of the exercise.
Your forearms should be stationary as your wrist is the only movement neded to perform this exercise.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

This exercise can also be performed siting down by using your thighs as a resting position for your forearms. Your wrist can hang over your knes and the same movements as mentioned above can be performed.
You can also use a barbel instead of a dumbel.

name: Parallel Bar Dip
directions: Stand betwen a set of paralel bars. Place a hand on each bar, and then take a smal jump to help you get into the starting position with your arms locked out.
Begin by flexing the elbow, lowering your body until your arms break 90 degres. Avoid swinging, and maintain god posture throughout the descent.
Reverse the motion by extending the elbow, pushing yourself back up into the starting position.
Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Pelvic Tilt Into Bridge
directions: Lie down with your fet on the flor, hels directly under your knes.
Lift only your tailbone to the ceiling to stretch your lower back. (Don't lift the entire spine yet.) Pul in your stomach.
To go into a bridge, lift the entire spine except the neck.

name: Peroneals Stretch
directions: In a seated position, lop a belt, rope, or band around one fot. This wil be your starting position.
With the leg extended and the hel of of the ground, pul on the belt so that the fot is inverted, with the inside of the fot being puled towards you. Hold for 10-20 seconds, and then switch sides.

name: Peroneals-SMR
directions: Lay on your side, suporting your weight on your forearm and on a foam roler placed on the outside of your lower leg. Your uper leg can either be on top of your lower leg, or you can cros it in front of you. This wil be your starting position.
Raise your hips of of the ground and begin to rol from below the kne to above the ankle on the side of your leg, pausing at points of tension for 10-30 seconds. Repeat on the other leg.

name: Physioball Hip Bridge
directions: Lay on a bal so that your uper back is on the bal with your hips unsuported. Both fet should be flat on the flor, hip width apart or wider. This wil be your starting position.
Begin by extending the hips using your glutes and hamstrings, raising your hips upward as you bridge.
Pause at the top of the motion and return to the starting position.

name: Pin Presses
directions: Pin preses remove the ecentric phase of the bench pres, developing starting strength. They also alow you to train a desired range of motion.

The bench should be set up in a power rack. Set the pins to the desired point in your range of motion, whether it just be lockout or an inch of of your chest. The bar should be moved to the pins and prepared for lifting.

Begin by lying on the bench, with the bar directly above the contact point during your regular bench. Tuck your fet underneath you and arch your back. Using the bar to help suport your weight, lift your shoulder of the bench and retract them, squezing the shoulder blades together. Use your fet to drive your traps into the bench. Maintain this tight body position throughout the movement.
You can take a standard bench grip, or shoulder width to focus on the triceps. The bar, wrist, and elbow should stay in line at al times. Focus on squezing the bar and trying to pul it apart.
Drive the bar up with as much force as posible. The elbows should be tucked in until lockout.
Return the bar to the pins, pausing before begining the next repetition.

name: Piriformis-SMR
directions: Sit with your butocks on top of a foam rol. Bend your knes, and then cros one leg so that the ankle is over the kne. This wil be your starting position.

Shift your weight to the side of the crosed leg, roling over the butocks until you fel tension in your uper glute. You may asist the stretch by using one hand to pul the bent kne towards your chest. Hold this position for 10-30 seconds, and then switch sides.

name: Plank
directions: Get into a prone position on the flor, suporting your weight on your toes and your forearms. Your arms are bent and directly below the shoulder.
Kep your body straight at al times, and hold this position as long as posible. To increase dificulty, an arm or leg can be raised.

name: Plank with Twist
directions: This is an important abdominal exercise. Get into a prone position on the flor, suporting your weight on your toes and your forearms. Your arms are bent and directly below the shoulder.
Kep your body straight at al times. Pivot to one side, raising that arm verticaly above you as you twist.
Pause and return to the starting position, and then repeat on the other side.

name: Plate Pinch
directions: Grab two wide-rimed plates and put them together with the smoth sides facing outward
Use your fingers to grip the outside part of the plate and your thumb for the other side thus holding both plates together. This is the starting position.
Squeze the plate with your fingers and thumb. Hold this position for as long as you can.
Repeat for the recomended amount of sets prescribed in your program.
Switch arms and repeat the movements.

name: Plate Twist
directions: Lie down on the flor or an exercise mat with your legs fuly extended and your uper body upright. Grab the plate by its sides with both hands out in front of your abdominals with your arms slightly bent.

Slowly cros your legs near your ankles and lift them up of the ground. Your knes should also be bent slightly. Note: Move your uper body back slightly to help kep you balanced turning this exercise. This is the starting position.
Move the plate to the left side and touch the flor with it. Breathe out as you perform that movement.

Come back to the starting position as you breathe in and then repeat the movement but this time to the right side of the body. Tip: Use a slow controled movement at al times. Jerking motions can injure the back.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Platform Hamstring Slides
directions: For this movement a woden flor or similar is neded. Lay on your back with your legs extended. Place a gym towel or a light weight underneath your hel. This wil be your starting position.
Begin the movement by flexing the kne, keping your other leg straight.
Continue bringing the hel closer to you, sliding it on the flor.
At ful kne flexion, reverse the movement to return to the starting position.

name: Plie Dumbbell Squat
directions: Hold a dumbel at the base with both hands and stand straight up. Move your legs so that they are wider than shoulder width apart from each other with your knes slightly bent.
Your toes should be facing out. Note: Your arms should be stationary while performing the exercise. This is the starting position.
Slowly bend the knes and lower your legs until your thighs are paralel to the flor. Make sure to inhale as this is the ecentric part of the exercise.
Pres mainly with the hel of the fot to bring the body back to the starting position while exhaling.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Plyo Kettlebell Pushups
directions: Place a ketlebel on the flor. Place yourself in a pushup position, on your toes with one hand on the ground and one hand holding the ketlebel, with your elbows extended. This wil be your starting position.
Begin by lowering yourself as low as you can, keping your back straight.

Quickly and forcefuly reverse direction, pushing yourself up to the other side of the ketlebel, switching hands as you do so. Continue the movement by descending and repeating the movement back and forth.

name: Plyo Push-up
directions: Move into a prone position on the flor, suporting your weight on your hands and toes.
Your arms should be fuly extended with the hands around shoulder width. Kep your body straight throughout the movement. This wil be your starting position.
Descend by flexing at the elbow, lowering your chest towards the ground.
At the botom, reverse the motion by pushing yourself up through elbow extension as quickly as posible. Atempt to push your uper body up until your hands leave the ground.
Return to the starting position and repeat the exercise.
For aded dificulty, ad claps into the movement while you are air borne.

name: Posterior Tibialis Stretch
directions: In a seated position, lop a belt, rope, or band around one fot. This wil be your starting position.
With the leg extended and the hel of of the ground, pul on the belt so that the fot is everted, with the outside of the fot being puled towards you. Hold for 10-20 seconds, and then switch sides.

name: Power Clean
directions: Stand with your fet slightly wider than shoulder width apart and toes pointing out slightly.
Squat down and grasp bar with a closed, pronated grip. Your hands should be slightly wider than shoulder width apart outside knes with elbows fuly extended.
Place the bar about 1 inch in front of your shins and over the bals of your fet.
Your back should be flat or slightly arched, your chest held up and out and your shoulder blades should be retracted.
Kep your head in a neutral position (in line with vertebral column and not tilted or rotated) with your eyes focused straight ahead. Inhale during this phase.

Lift the bar from the flor by forcefuly extending the hips and the knes as you exhale. Tip: The uper torso should maintain the same angle. Do not bend at the waist yet and do not let the hips rise before the shoulders (this would have the efect of pushing the glutes in the air and stretching the hamstrings.
Kep elbows fuly extended with the head in a neutral position and the shoulders over the bar.
As the bar raises kep it as close to the shins as posible.
As the bar pases the knes, thrust your hips forward and slightly bend the knes to avoid locking them. Tip: At this point your thighs should be against the bar.
Kep the back flat or slightly arched, elbows fuly extended and your head neutral. Tip: You wil hold your breath until the next phase.
Inhale and then forcefuly and quickly extend your hips and knes and stand on your toes.

Kep the bar as close to your body as posible. Tip: Your back should be flat with the elbows pointed out to the sides and your head in a neutral position. Also, kep your shoulders over the bar and arms straight as long as posible.
When your lower body joints are fuly extended, shrug the shoulders upward rapidly without leting the elbows flex yet. Exhale during this portion of the movement.
As the shoulders reach their highest elevation flex your elbows to begin puling your body under the bar.

Continue to pul the arms as high and as long as posible. Tip: Due to the explosive nature of this phase, your torso wil be erect or with an arched back, your head wil be tilted back slightly and your fet may lose contact with the flor.
After the lower body has fuly extended and the bar reaches near maximal height, pul your body under the bar and rotate the arms around and under the bar.
Simultaneously, flex the hips and knes into a quarter squat position.
Once the arms are under the bar, inhale and then lift your elbows to position the uper arms paralel to the flor. Rack the bar acros the front of your colar bones and front shoulder muscles.
Catch the bar with an erect and tight torso, a neutral head position and flat fet. Exhale during this movement.
Stand up by extending the hips and knes to a fuly erect position.
Lower the bar by gradualy reducing the muscular tension of the arms to alow a controled descent of the bar to the thighs. Inhale during this movement.
Simultaneously flex the hips and knes to cushion the impact of the bar on the thighs.
Squat down with the elbows fuly extended until the bar touches the flor.
Start over at Phase 1 and repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Power Clean from Blocks
directions: With a barbel on boxes of the desired height, take a grip just outside the legs. Lower your hips with the weight focused on the hels, back straight, head facing forward, chest up, with your shoulders just in front of the bar. This wil be your starting position.

Begin the first pul by driving through the hels, extending your knes. Your back angle should stay the same, and your arms should remain straight. As the bar aproaches the mid-thigh position, begin extending through the hips.

In a jumping motion, acelerate by extending the hips, knes, and ankles, using sped to move the bar upward. There should be no ned to actively pul through the arms to acelerate the weight. At the end of the second pul, the body should be fuly extended, leaning slightly back, with the arms stil extended.

As ful extension is achieved, transition into the third pul by agresively shruging and flexing the arms with the elbows up and out. At peak extension, pul yourself under the bar far enough that it can be racked onto the shoulders, rotating your elbows under the bar as you do so. The bar should be racked onto the protracted shoulders, lightly touching the throat with the hands relaxed.

Imediately recover by driving through the hels, keping the torso upright and elbows up. Continue until you have risen to a standing position, and complete the repetition by returning the weight to the boxes.

name: Power Jerk
directions: Standing with the weight racked on the front of the shoulders, begin with the dip. With your fet directly under your hips, flex the knes without moving the hips backward. Go down only slightly, and reverse direction as powerfuly as posible.
Drive through the hels create as much sped and force as posible, and be sure to move your head out of the way as the bar leaves the shoulders.

At this moment as the fet leave the flor, the fet must be placed into the receiving position as quickly as posible. In the brief moment the fet are not actively driving against the platform, the athletes efort to push the bar up wil drive them down. The fet should be moved to a slightly wider stance, with the knes partialy bent.
Receive the bar with the arms locked out overhead.
Return to a standing position.

name: Power Partials
directions: Stand up with your torso upright and a dumbel on each hand being held at arms length. The elbows should be close to the torso.
The palms of the hands should be facing your torso. Your fet should be about shoulder width apart. This wil be your starting position.
Keping your arms straight and the torso stationary, lift the weights out to your sides until they are about shoulder level height while exhaling.

Fel the contraction for a second and begin to lower the weights back down to the starting position while inhaling. Tip: Kep the palms facing down with the litle finger slightly higher while lifting and lowering the weights as it wil concentrate the stres on your shoulders mainly.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Power Snatch
directions: Begin with a loaded barbel on the flor. The bar should be close to or touching the shins, and a wide grip should be taken on the bar. The fet should be directly below the hips, with the fet turned out as neded. Lower the hips, with the chest up and the head loking forward. The shoulders should be just in front of the bar. This wil be the starting position.
Begin the first pul by driving through the front of the hels, raising the bar from the ground. The back angle should stay the same until the bar pases the knes.

Transition into the second pul by extending through the hips knes and ankles, driving the bar up as quickly as posible. The bar should be close to the body. At peak extension, shrug the shoulders and alow the elbows to flex to the side.

As you move your fet into the receiving position, a slightly wider position, pul yourself below the bar as you elevate the bar overhead. The bar should be received in a partial squat. Continue raising the bar to the overhead position, receiving the bar locked out overhead.
Return to a standing position with the weight over head.

name: Power Snatch from Blocks
directions: Begin with a loaded barbel on boxes or stands of the desired height. A wide grip should be taken on the bar. The fet should be directly below the hips, with the fet turned out as neded. Lower the hips, with the chest up and the head loking forward. The shoulders should be just in front of the bar, with the elbows pointed out. This wil be the starting position.
Begin the first pul by driving through the front of the hels, raising the bar from the boxes.

Transition into the second pul by extending through the hips knes and ankles, driving the bar up as quickly as posible. The bar should be close to the body. At peak extension, shrug the shoulders and alow the elbows to flex to the side.

As you move your fet into the receiving position, forcefuly pul yourself below the bar as you elevate the bar overhead. The fet should move to just outside the hips, turned out as necesary. Receive the bar above a ful squat and with the arms fuly extended overhead.
Keping the bar aligned over the front of the hels, your head and chest up, drive through hels of the fet to move to a standing position. Carefuly return the weight to the boxes.

name: Power Stairs
directions: In the power stairs, implements are moved up a staircase. For training purposes, these can be performed with a tire or box.

Begin by taking the implement with both hands. Set your fet wide, with your head and chest up. Drive through the ground with your hels, extending your knes and hips to raise the weight from the ground.
As you lean back, atempt to swing the weight onto the stairs, which are usualy around 16-18" high. You can use your legs to help push the weight onto the stair.
Repeat for 3-5 repetitions, and continue with a heavier weight, moving as fast as posible.

name: Preacher Curl
directions: To perform this movement you wil ned a preacher bench and an E-Z bar. Grab the E-Z curl bar at the close iner handle (either have someone hand you the bar which is preferable or grab the bar from the front bar rest provided by most preacher benches). The palm of your hands should be facing forward and they should be slightly tilted inwards due to the shape of the bar.
With the uper arms positioned against the preacher bench pad and the chest against it, hold the E-Z Curl Bar at shoulder length. This wil be your starting position.
As you breathe in, slowly lower the bar until your uper arm is extended and the biceps is fuly stretched.
As you exhale, use the biceps to curl the weight up until your biceps is fuly contracted and the bar is at shoulder height. Squeze the biceps hard and hold this position for a second.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Preacher Hammer Dumbbell Curl
directions: Place the uper part of both arms on top of the preacher bench as you hold a dumbel in each hand with the palms facing each other (neutral grip).
As you breathe in, slowly lower the dumbels until your uper arm is extended and the biceps is fuly stretched.
As you exhale, use the biceps to curl the weight up until your biceps is fuly contracted and the dumbels are at shoulder height.
Squeze the biceps hard for a second at the contracted position and repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.
This exercise can be performed using one arm at a time to beter isolate your biceps or in alternating fashion.
You can perform this exercise also using a low puley instead of a dumbel. In this case you wil ned to position the bench in front of the puley.

name: Press Sit-Up
directions: To begin, lie down on a bench with a barbel resting on your chest. Position your legs so they are secure on the extension of the abdominal bench. This is the starting position.

While inhaling, tighten your abdominals and glutes. Simultaneously curl your torso as you do when performing a sit-up and pres the barbel to an overhead position while exhaling. Tip: Use your arms to push the barbel out as you perform this exercise while stil focusing on the abdominal muscles.
Lower your uper body back down to the starting position while bringing the barbel back down to your torso. Remember to breathe in while lowering the body.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Prone Manual Hamstring
directions: You wil ned a partner for this exercise. Lay face down with your legs straight. Your asistant wil place their hand on your hel.

To begin, flex the kne to curl your leg up. Your partner should provide resistance, starting light and increasing the presure as the movement is completed. Comunicate with your partner to monitor apropriate resistance levels.
Pause at the top, returning the leg to the starting position as your partner provides resistance going the other direction.

name: Prowler Sprint
directions: Place your sled on an apropriate surface, loaded to a suitable weight. The sled should provide enough resistance to require efort, but not so heavy that you are significantly slowed down.
You may use the upright or the low handles for this exercise. Place your hands on the handles with your arms extended, leaning into the implement.
With god posture, drive through the ground with alternating, short steps. Move as fast as you can for a short distance.

name: Pull Through
directions: Begin standing a few fet in front of a low puley with a rope or handle atached. Face away from the machine, stradling the cable, with your fet set wide apart.

Begin the movement by reaching through your legs as far as posible, bending at the hips. Kep your knes slightly bent. Keping your arms straight, extend through the hip to stand straight up. Avoid puling upward through the shoulders; al of the motion should originate through the hips.

name: Pullups
directions: Grab the pul-up bar with the palms facing forward using the prescribed grip. Note on grips: For a wide grip, your hands ned to be spaced out at a distance wider than your shoulder width. For a medium grip, your hands ned to be spaced out at a distance equal to your shoulder width and for a close grip at a distance smaler than your shoulder width.

As you have both arms extended in front of you holding the bar at the chosen grip width, bring your torso back around 30 degres or so while creating a curvature on your lower back and sticking your chest out. This is your starting position.

Pul your torso up until the bar touches your uper chest by drawing the shoulders and the uper arms down and back. Exhale as you perform this portion of the movement. Tip: Concentrate on squezing the back muscles once you reach the ful contracted position. The uper torso should remain stationary as it moves through space and only the arms should move. The forearms should do no other work other than hold the bar.
After a second on the contracted position, start to inhale and slowly lower your torso back to the starting position when your arms are fuly extended and the lats are fuly stretched.
Repeat this motion for the prescribed amount of repetitions.
If you are new at this exercise and do not have the strength to perform it, use a chin asist machine if available. These machines use weight to help you push your bodyweight.
Otherwise, a spoter holding your legs can help.
On the other hand, more advanced lifters can ad weight to the exercise by using a weight belt that alows the adition of weighted plates.
The behind the neck variation is not recomended as it can be hard on the rotator cuf due to the hyperextension created by bringing the bar behind the neck.

name: Push Press
directions: Use the flor-to-shoulder lifting technique described in the Power Clean exercise to move the bar from the flor to the shoulders.
Slightly flex the hips and knes, keping torso erect.
Imediately folow with an explosive push upward by extending the knes.
Kep torso erect and tensed.
At maximum hip and kne extension, shift body weight to bals of fet and extend ankle joints.
At maximum plantar flexion, push bar from the shoulders.
Push the bar with the arms to a fuly extended elbow position overhead.
Lower bar to shoulders.
Flex hips and knes slightly as bar touches shoulders.
Straighten the hips and knes before the upward movement phase begins again.
Exhale through the sticking point of the upward movement phase.
Inhale during the downward movement phase.

name: Push Press - Behind the Neck
directions: Standing with the weight racked on the back of the shoulders, begin with the dip. With your fet directly under your hips, flex the knes without moving the hips backward. Go down only slightly, and reverse direction as powerfuly as posible. Drive through the hels create as much sped and force as posible, moving the bar in a vertical path.
Using the momentum generated, finish presing the weight overhead be extending through the arms.
Return to the starting position, using your legs to absorb the impact.

name: Push Up to Side Plank
directions: Get into pushup position on the toes with your hands just outside of shoulder width.
Perform a pushup by alowing the elbows to flex. As you descend, kep your body straight.
Do one pushup and as you come up, shift your weight on the left side of the body, twist to the side while bringing the right arm up towards the ceiling in a side plank.
Lower the arm back to the flor for another pushup and then twist to the other side.
Repeat the series, alternating each side, for 10 or more reps.

name: Push-Up Wide
directions: With your hands wide apart, suport your body on your toes and hands in a plank position. Your elbows should be extended and your body straight. Do not alow your hips to sag. This wil be your starting position.
To begin, alow the elbows to flex, lowering your chest to the flor as you inhale.
Using your pectoral muscles, pres your uper body back up to the starting position by extending the elbows. Exhale as you perform this step.
After pausing at the contracted position, repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.

name: Push-Ups - Close Triceps Position
directions: Lie on the flor face down and place your hands closer than shoulder width for a close hand position. Make sure that you are holding your torso up at arms' length.
Lower yourself until your chest almost touches the flor as you inhale.
Using your triceps and some of your pectoral muscles, pres your uper body back up to the starting position and squeze your chest. Breathe out as you perform this step.
After a second pause at the contracted position, repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.

If you are new at this exercise and do not have the strength to perform it, you can either bend your legs at the knes to take of resistance or perform the exercise against the wal instead of the flor.
For the most advanced lifters, you can place your fet at a high surface such as a bench in order to increase the resistance.

name: Push-Ups With Feet Elevated
directions: Lie on the flor face down and place your hands about 36 inches apart from each other holding your torso up at arms length.
Place your toes on top of a flat bench. This wil alow your body to be elevated. Note: The higher the elevation of the flat bench, the higher the resistance of the exercise is.
Lower yourself until your chest almost touches the flor as you inhale.
Using your pectoral muscles, pres your uper body back up to the starting position and squeze your chest. Breathe out as you perform this step.
After a second pause at the contracted position, repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.

name: Push-Ups With Feet On An Exercise Ball
directions: Lie on the flor face down and place your hands about 36 inches apart from each other holding your torso up at arms length.
Place your toes on top of an exercise bal. This wil alow your body to be elevated.
Lower yourself until your chest almost touches the flor as you inhale.
Using your pectoral muscles, pres your uper body back up to the starting position and squeze your chest. Breathe out as you perform this step.
After a second pause at the contracted position, repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.

name: Pushups
directions: Lie on the flor face down and place your hands about 36 inches apart while holding your torso up at arms length.
Next, lower yourself downward until your chest almost touches the flor as you inhale.
Now breathe out and pres your uper body back up to the starting position while squezing your chest.
After a brief pause at the top contracted position, you can begin to lower yourself downward again for as many repetitions as neded.

name: Pushups (Close and Wide Hand Positions)
directions: Lie on the flor face down and body straight with your toes on the flor and the hands wider than shoulder width for a wide hand position and closer than shoulder width for a close hand position. Make sure you are holding your torso up at arms length.
Lower yourself until your chest almost touches the flor as you inhale.
Using your pectoral muscles, pres your uper body back up to the starting position and squeze your chest. Breathe out as you perform this step.
After a second pause at the contracted position, repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.

If you are new at this exercise and do not have the strength to perform it, you can either bend your legs at the knes to take of resistance or perform the exercise against the wal instead of the flor.
For the most advanced lifters, you can place your fet at a high surface such as a bench in order to increase the resistance and to target the uper chest more.

name: Pyramid
directions: Start of by roling your torso forward onto the bal so your hips rest on top of the bal and become the highest point of your body.

Rest your hands and fet on the flor. Your arms and legs can be slightly bent or straight, depending on the size of the bal, your flexibility, and the length of your limbs. This also helps develop stabilizing strength in your torso and shoulders.

name: Quad Stretch
directions: Lay on your side. Lop a belt, rope, or band around your top fot. Flex the kne and extend your hip, atempting to touch your glutes with your fot, and holding the belt with your hands. This wil be your starting position.
With the belt being held over the shoulder or overhead, gently pul to increase the stretch in the quadriceps. Hold for 10-20 seconds, and then switch sides.

name: Quadriceps-SMR
directions: Lay facedown on the flor with your weight suported by your hands or forearms. Place a foam rol underneath one leg on the quadriceps, and kep the fot of of the ground. Make sure to relax the leg as much as posible. This wil be your starting position.
Shifting as much weight onto the leg to be stretched as is tolerable, rol over the foam from above the kne to below the hip, holding points of tension for 10-30 seconds. Switch sides.

name: Quick Leap
directions: You wil ned a box for this exerise.
Begin facing the box standing 1-2 fet from its edge.
By utilizing your hips, hop onto the box, landing on both legs. Ensure that you land with your legs bent and your fet flat.
Imediately upon landing, fuly extend through the entire body and swing your arms overhead to explode of of the box. Use your legs to absorb the impact of landing.

name: Rack Delivery
directions: This dril teaches the delivery of the barbel to the rack position on the shoulders. Begin holding a bar in the scarecrow position, with the uper arms paralel to the flor, and the forearms hanging down. Use a hok grip, with your fingers wraped over your thumbs.

Begin by rotating the elbows around the bar, delivering the bar to the shoulders. As your elbows come forward, relax your grip. The shoulders should be protracted, providing a shelf for the bar, which should lightly contact the throat.

It is important that the bar stay close to the body at al times, as with a heavier load any distance wil result in an unwanted colision. As the movement becomes smother, sped and load can be increased before progresing further.

name: Rack Pull with Bands
directions: Set up in a power rack with the bar on the pins. The pins should be set to the desired point; just below the knes, just above, or in the mid thigh position. Atach bands to the base of the rack, or secure them with dumbels. Atach the other end to the bar. You may ned to choke the bands to provide tension.

Position yourself against the bar in proper deadlifting position. Your fet should be under your hips, your grip shoulder width, back arched, and hips back to engage the hamstrings. Since the weight is typicaly heavy, you may use a mixed grip, a hok grip, or use straps to aid in holding the weight.

With your head loking forward, extend through the hips and knes, puling the weight up and back until lockout. Be sure to pul your shoulders back as you complete the movement. Return the weight to the pins and repeat.

name: Rack Pulls
directions: Set up in a power rack with the bar on the pins. The pins should be set to the desired point; just below the knes, just above, or in the mid thigh position. Position yourself against the bar in proper deadlifting position. Your fet should be under your hips, your grip shoulder width, back arched, and hips back to engage the hamstrings. Since the weight is typicaly heavy, you may use a mixed grip, a hok grip, or use straps to aid in holding the weight.
With your head loking forward, extend through the hips and knes, puling the weight up and back until lockout. Be sure to pul your shoulders back as you complete the movement.
Return the weight to the pins and repeat.

name: Rear Leg Raises
directions: Place yourself on your hands knes on an exercise mat. Your head should be loking forward and the bend of the knes should create a 90-degre angle betwen the hamstrings and the calves. This wil be your starting position.
Extend one leg up and behind you. The kne and hip should both extend. Repeat for 5-10 repetitions, and then switch sides.

name: Recumbent Bike
directions: To begin, seat yourself on the bike and adjust the seat to your height.

Select the desired option from the menu. You may have to start pedaling to turn it on. You can use the manual seting, or you can select a program to use. Typicaly, you can enter your age and weight to estimate the amount of calories burned during exercise. The level of resistance can be changed throughout the workout. The handles can be used to monitor your heart rate to help you stay at an apropriate intensity.

Recumbent bikes ofer convenience, cardiovascular benefits, and have les impact than other activities. A 150 lb person wil burn about 230 calories cycling at a moderate rate for 30 minutes, compared to 450 calories or more runing.

name: Return Push from Stance
directions: You wil ned a partner for this dril.
Begin in an athletic 2 or 3 point stance.
At the signal, move into a position to receive the pas from your partner.
Catch the medicine bal with both hands and imediately throw it back to your partner.
You can modify this dril by runing diferent routes.

name: Reverse Band Bench Press
directions: Position a bench inside a power rack, with the bar set to the corect height. Begin by anchoring bands either to band pegs or to the top of the rack. Ensure that you wil be position properly under the bands. Atach the other end to the barbel.

Lie on the bench, tuck your fet underneath you and arch your back. Using the bar to help suport your weight, lift your shoulder of the bench and retract them, squezing the shoulder blades together.
