Use your fet to drive your traps into the bench. Maintain this tight body position throughout the movement. However wide your grip, it should cover the ring on the bar.

Pul the bar out of the rack without protracting your shoulders. Focus on squezing the bar and trying to pul it apart. Lower the bar to your lower chest or uper stomach. The bar, wrist, and elbow should stay in line at al times.
Pause when the barbel touches your torso, and then drive the bar up with as much force as posible. The elbows should be tucked in until lockout.

name: Reverse Band Box Squat
directions: Begin in a power rack with a box at the apropriate height behind you. Set up the bands either on band pegs or atached to the top of the rack, ensuring they wil be directly above the bar during the squat. Atach the other end to the bar.

Begin by steping under the bar and placing it acros the back of the shoulders. Squeze your shoulder blades together and rotate your elbows forward, atempting to bend the bar acros your shoulders. Remove the bar from the rack, creating a tight arch in your lower back, and step back into position. Place your fet wider for more emphasis on the back, glutes, aductors, and hamstrings, or closer together for more quad development. Kep your head facing forward.

With your back, shoulders, and core tight, push your knes and but out and you begin your descent. Sit back with your hips until you are seated on the box. Idealy, your shins should be perpendicular to the ground. Pause when you reach the box, and relax the hip flexors. Never bounce of of a box.

Keping the weight on your hels and pushing your fet and knes out, drive upward of of the box as you lead the movement with your head. Continue upward, maintaining tightnes head to toe. Use care to return the barbel to the rack.

name: Reverse Band Deadlift
directions: Set the bar up in a power rack. Atach bands to the top of the rack, using either bands pegs or the frame itself. Atach the other end of the bands to the bar.

Aproach the bar so that it is centered over your fet. You fet should be about hip width apart. Bend at the hip to grip the bar at shoulder width, alowing your shoulder blades to protract. Typicaly, you would use an overhand grip or an over/under grip on heavier sets.

With your fet, and your grip set, take a big breath and then lower your hips and bend the knes until your shins contact the bar. Lok forward with your head, kep your chest up and your back arched, and begin driving through the hels to move the weight upward.
After the bar pases the knes, agresively pul the bar back, puling your shoulder blades together as you drive your hips forward into the bar.
Lower the bar by bending at the hips and guiding it to the flor.

name: Reverse Band Power Squat
directions: Begin in a power rack with the pins and bar set at the apropriate height. After loading the bar, atach bands to the top of the rack, using either pegs or the frame itself. Atach the other end of the bands to the bar.

Begin by steping under the bar and placing it acros the back of the shoulders. Squeze your shoulder blades together and rotate your elbows forward, atempting to bend the bar acros your shoulders. Remove the bar from the rack, creating a tight arch in your lower back, and step back into position. Place your fet wide for more emphasis on the back, glutes, aductors, and hamstrings.

Kep your head facing forward. With your back, shoulders, and core tight, push your knes and but out and you begin your descent. Sit back with your hips as much as posible. Idealy, your shins should be perpendicular to the ground. Lower bar position necesitates a greater torso lean to kep the bar over the hels. Continue until you break paralel, which is defined as the crease of the hip being in line with the top of the kne.

Keping the weight on your hels and pushing your fet and knes out, drive upward as you lead the movement with your head. Continue upward, maintaining tightnes head to toe, until you have returned to the starting position.

name: Reverse Band Sumo Deadlift
directions: Begin with a bar loaded on the flor inside of a power rack. Atach bands to the top of the rack, using either pegs or the frame itself. Atach the other end to the barbel.

Aproach the bar so that the bar intersects the midle of the fet. The fet should be set very wide, near the colars. Bend at the hips to grip the bar. The arms should be directly below the shoulders, inside the legs, and you can use a pronated grip, a mixed grip, or hok grip. Relax the shoulders, which in efect lengthens your arms.

Take a breath, and then lower your hips, loking forward with your head with your chest up. Drive through the flor, spreading your fet apart, with your weight on the back half of your fet. Extend through the hips and knes.
As the bar pases through the knes, lean back and drive the hips into the bar, puling your shoulder blades together.
Return the weight to the ground by bending at the hips and controling the weight on the way down.

name: Reverse Barbell Curl
directions: Stand up with your torso upright while holding a barbel at shoulder width with the elbows close to the torso. The palm of your hands should be facing down (pronated grip). This wil be your starting position.

While holding the uper arms stationary, curl the weights while contracting the biceps as you breathe out. Only the forearms should move. Continue the movement until your biceps are fuly contracted and the bar is at shoulder level. Hold the contracted position for a second as you squeze the muscle.
Slowly begin to bring the bar back to starting position as your breathe in.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Reverse Barbell Preacher Curls
directions: Grab an EZ-bar using a shoulder width and palms down (pronated) grip.
Now place the uper part of both arms on top of the preacher bench and have your arms extended. This wil be your starting position.
As you exhale, use the biceps to curl the weight up until your biceps are fuly contracted and the barbel is at shoulder height. Squeze the biceps hard for a second at the contracted position.
As you breathe in, slowly lower the barbel until your uper arms are extended and the biceps is fuly stretched.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.
This exercise can be performed using an e-z bar, cables or dumbels.

name: Reverse Cable Curl
directions: Stand up with your torso upright while holding a bar atachment that is atached to a low puley using a pronated (palms down) and shoulder width grip. Make sure also that you kep the elbows close to the torso. This wil be your starting position.

While holding the uper arms stationary, curl the weights while contracting the biceps as you breathe out. Only the forearms should move. Continue the movement until your biceps are fuly contracted and the bar is at shoulder level. Hold the contracted position for a second as you squeze the muscle.
Slowly begin to bring the bar back to starting position as your breathe in.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Reverse Crunch
directions: Lie down on the flor with your legs fuly extended and arms to the side of your torso with the palms on the flor. Your arms should be stationary for the entire exercise.
Move your legs up so that your thighs are perpendicular to the flor and fet are together and paralel to the flor. This is the starting position.
While inhaling, move your legs towards the torso as you rol your pelvis backwards and you raise your hips of the flor. At the end of this movement your knes wil be touching your chest.
Hold the contraction for a second and move your legs back to the starting position while exhaling.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Reverse Flyes
directions: To begin, lie down on an incline bench with the chest and stomach presing against the incline. Have the dumbels in each hand with the palms facing each other (neutral grip).
Extend the arms in front of you so that they are perpendicular to the angle of the bench. The legs should be stationary while aplying presure with the bal of your toes. This is the starting position.

Maintaining the slight bend of the elbows, move the weights out and away from each other (to the side) in an arc motion while exhaling. Tip: Try to squeze your shoulder blades together to get the best results from this exercise.
The arms should be elevated until they are paralel to the flor.
Fel the contraction and slowly lower the weights back down to the starting position while inhaling.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Reverse Flyes With External Rotation
directions: To begin, lie down on an incline bench set at a 30-degre angle with the chest and stomach presing against the incline.

Have the dumbels in each hand with the palms facing down to the flor. Your arms should be in front of you so that they are perpendicular to the angle of the bench. Tip: Your elbows should have a slight bend. The legs should be stationary while aplying presure with the bal of your toes (your hels should not be touching the flor). This is the starting position.
Maintaining the slight bend of the elbows, move the weights out and away from each other in an arc motion while exhaling.

As you lift the weight, your wrist should externaly rotate by 90-degres so that you go from a palms down (pronated) grip to a palms facing each other (neutral) grip. Tip: Try to squeze your shoulder blades together to get the best results from this exercise.
The arms should be elevated until they are level with the head.
Fel the contraction and slowly lower the weights back down to the starting position while inhaling.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Reverse Grip Bent-Over Rows
directions: Stand erect while holding a barbel with a supinated grip (palms facing up).

Bend your knes slightly and bring your torso forward, by bending at the waist, while keping the back straight until it is almost paralel to the flor. Tip: Make sure that you kep the head up. The barbel should hang directly in front of you as your arms hang perpendicular to the flor and your torso. This is your starting position.

While keping the torso stationary, lift the barbel as you breathe out, keping the elbows close to the body and not doing any force with the forearm other than holding the weights. On the top contracted position, squeze the back muscles and hold for a second.
Slowly lower the weight again to the starting position as you inhale.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.
This exercise is not recomended for people with back problems. A Low Puley Row is a beter choice for people with back isues.
Also, just like with the bent kne dead-lift, if you have a healthy back, ensure perfect form and never slouch the back forward as this can cause back injury.
Be cautious as wel with the weight used; in case of doubt, use les weight rather than more.

name: Reverse Grip Triceps Pushdown
directions: Start by seting a bar atachment (straight or e-z) on a high puley machine.

Facing the bar atachment, grab it with the palms facing up (supinated grip) at shoulder width. Lower the bar by using your lats until your arms are fuly extended by your sides. Tip: Elbows should be in by your sides and your fet should be shoulder width apart from each other. This is the starting position.
Slowly elevate the bar atachment up as you inhale so it is aligned with your chest. Only the forearms should move and the elbows/uper arms should be stationary by your side at al times.
Then begin to lower the cable bar back down to the original staring position while exhaling and contracting the triceps hard.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Reverse Hyperextension
directions: Place your fet betwen the pads after loading an apropriate weight. Lay on the top pad, alowing your hips to hang of the back, while grasping the handles to hold your position.
To begin the movement, flex the hips, puling the legs forward.
Reverse the motion by extending the hips, kicking the leg back. It is very important not to over-extend the hip on this movement, stoping short of your ful range of motion.
Return by again flexing the hip, puling the cariage forward as far as you can.
Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Reverse Machine Flyes
directions: Adjust the handles so that they are fuly to the rear. Make an apropriate weight selection and adjust the seat height so the handles are at shoulder level. Grasp the handles with your hands facing inwards. This wil be your starting position.
In a semicircular motion, pul your hands out to your side and back, contracting your rear delts.
Kep your arms slightly bent throughout the movement, with al of the motion ocuring at the shoulder joint.
Pause at the rear of the movement, and slowly return the weight to the starting position.

name: Reverse Plate Curls
directions: Start by standing straight with a weighted plate held by both hands and arms fuly extended. Use a pronated grip (palms facing down) and make sure your fingers grab the rough side of the plate while your thumb grabs the smoth side. Note: For the best results, grab the weighted plate at an 1:0 and 1:0 o'clock position.
Your fet should be shoulder width apart from each other and the weighted plate should be near the groin area. This is the starting position.
Slowly lift the plate up while keping the elbows in and the uper arms stationary until your biceps and forearms touch while exhaling. The plate should be evenly aligned with your torso at this point.
Fel the contraction for a second and begin to lower the weight back down to the starting position while inhaling
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Reverse Triceps Bench Press
directions: Lie back on a flat bench. Using a close, supinated grip (around shoulder width), lift the bar from the rack and hold it straight over you with your arms locked extended in front of you and perpendicular to the flor. This wil be your starting position.

As you breathe in, come down slowly until you fel the bar on your midle chest. Tip: Make sure that as oposed to a regular bench pres, you kep the elbows close to the torso at al times in order to maximize triceps involvement.

After a second pause, bring the bar back to the starting position as you breathe out and push the bar using your triceps muscles. Lock your arms in the contracted position, hold for a second and then start coming down slowly again. Tip: It should take at least twice as long to go down than to come up.
Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.
When you are done, place the bar back in the rack.

name: Rhomboids-SMR
directions: Lay down with your back on the flor. Place a foam rol underneath your uper back, and cros your arms in front of you, protracting your shoulders. This wil be your starting position.
Raise your hips of of the ground, placing your weight onto the foam rol. Shift your weight to one side at a time, roling over your midle and uper back. Pause at points of tension for 10-30 seconds.

name: Rickshaw Carry
directions: Position the frame at the starting point, and load with the apropriate weight. Standing in the center of the frame, begin by griping the handles and driving through your hels to lift the frame. Ensure your chest and head are up and your back is straight.

Imediately begin walking briskly with quick, controled steps. Kep your chest up and head forward, and make sure you continue breathing. Bring the frame to the ground after you have reached the end point.

name: Rickshaw Deadlift
directions: Load the frame with the desired weight. Center yourself betwen the handles. You fet should be about hip width apart. Bend at the hips to grip the handles, alowing your shoulder blades to protract.

With your fet and your grip set, take a big breath and then lower your hips and flex the knes. Lok forward with your head, kep your chest up and your back arched, and begin driving through the hels to move the weight upward. As the weight comes up, pul your shoulder blades together as you drive your hips forward.
Lower the weight by bending at the hips and guiding it to the ground.

name: Ring Dips
directions: Grip a ring in each hand, and then take a smal jump to help you get into the starting position with your arms locked out.
Begin by flexing the elbow, lowering your body until your arms break 90 degres. Avoid swinging, and maintain god posture throughout the descent.
Reverse the motion by extending the elbow, pushing yourself back up into the starting position.
Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Rocket Jump
directions: Begin in a relaxed stance with your fet shoulder width apart and hold your arms close to the body.
To initiate the move, squat down halfway and explode back up as high as posible.
Fuly extend your entire body, reaching overhead as far as posible. As you land, absorb your impact through the legs.

name: Rocking Standing Calf Raise
directions: This exercise is best performed inside a squat rack for safety purposes. To begin, first set the bar on a rack that best matches your height. Once the corect height is chosen and the bar is loaded, step under the bar and place it on the back of your shoulders (slightly below the neck).
Hold on to the bar using both arms at each side and lift it of the rack by first pushing with your legs and at the same time straightening your torso.

Step away from the rack and position your legs using a shoulder width medium stance with the toes slightly pointed out. Kep your head up at al times as loking down wil get you of balance. Also maintain a straight back and kep the knes with a slight bend; never locked. This wil be your starting position.

Raise your hels as you breathe out by extending your ankles as high as posible and flexing your calf. Ensure that the kne is kept stationary at al times. There should be no bending (other than the slight initial bend we created during positioning) at any time. Hold the contracted position by a second before you start to go back down.
Go back slowly to the starting position as you breathe in by lowering your hels as you bend the ankles until calves are stretched.
Now lift your toes by contracting the tibia muscles in the front of the calves as you breathe out.
Hold for a second and bring them back down as you breathe in.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Rocky Pull-Ups/Pulldowns
directions: Grab the pul-up bar with the palms facing forward using a wide grip.

As you have both arms extended in front of you holding the bar at the chosen grip width, bring your torso back around 30 degres or so while creating a curvature on your lower back and sticking your chest out. This is your starting position.

Pul your torso up until the bar touches your uper chest by drawing the shoulders and the uper arms down and back. Exhale as you perform this portion of the movement. Tip: Concentrate on squezing the back muscles once you reach the ful contracted position. The uper torso should remain stationary as it moves through space and only the arms should move. The forearms should do no other work other than hold the bar.
After a second on the contracted position, start to inhale and slowly lower your torso back to the starting position when your arms are fuly extended and the lats are fuly stretched.

Now repeat the same movements as described above except this time your torso wil remain straight as you go up and the bar wil touch the back of the neck instead of the uper chest. Tip: Use the head to lean forward slightly as it wil help you properly execute this portion of the exercise.
Once you have lowered yourself back down to the starting position, repeat the exercise for the prescribed amount of repetitions in your program.
If you are new at this exercise and do not have the strength to perform it, use a chin asist machine if available. These machines use weight to help you push your bodyweight.
Otherwise, a spoter holding your legs can help.
You can also use a pul-down machine.

name: Romanian Deadlift
directions: Put a barbel in front of you on the ground and grab it using a pronated (palms facing down) grip that a litle wider than shoulder width. Tip: Depending on the weight used, you may ned wrist wraps to perform the exercise and also a raised platform in order to alow for beter range of motion.
Bend the knes slightly and kep the shins vertical, hips back and back straight. This wil be your starting position.
Keping your back and arms completely straight at al times, use your hips to lift the bar as you exhale. Tip: The movement should not be fast but steady and under control.

Once you are standing completely straight up, lower the bar by pushing the hips back, only slightly bending the knes, unlike when squating. Tip: Take a dep breath at the start of the movement and kep your chest up. Hold your breath as you lower and exhale as you complete the movement.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Romanian Deadlift from Deficit
directions: Begin standing while holding a bar at arms length in front of you. You can stand on a raised platform to increase the range of motion.

Begin by flexing the knes slightly, and then flex at the hip, moving your but back as far as posible, lowering the torso as far as flexibility alows. The back should remain in absolute extension at al times, and the bar should remain in contact with the legs. If done properly, there should be heavy tension felt in the hamstrings.
Reverse the motion to return to the starting position.

name: Rope Climb
directions: Grab the rope with both hands above your head. Pul down on the rope as you take a smal jump.
Wrap the rope around one leg, using your fet to pinch the rope. Reach up as high as posible with your arms, griping the rope tightly.
Release the rope from your fet as you pul yourself up with your arms, bringing your knes towards your chest.
Resecure your fet on the rope, and then stand up to take another high hold on the rope. Continue until you reach the top of the rope.
To lower yourself, losen the grip of your fet on the rope as you slide down using a hand over hand motion.

name: Rope Crunch
directions: Knel 1-2 fet in front of a cable system with a rope atached.
After selecting an apropriate weight, grasp the rope with both hands reaching overhead. Your torso should be upright in the starting position.
To begin, flex at the spine, atempting to bring your rib cage to your legs as you pul the cable down.
Pause at the botom of the motion, and then slowly return to the starting position.
These can be done with twists or to the side to hit the obliques.

name: Rope Jumping
directions: Hold an end of the rope in each hand. Position the rope behind you on the ground. Raise your arms up and turn the rope over your head bringing it down in front of you. When it reaches the ground, jump over it. Find a god turning pace that can be maintained. Diferent speds and techniques can be used to introduce variation.
Rope jumping is exciting, chalenges your cordination, and requires a lot of energy. A 150 lb person wil burn about 350 calories jumping rope for 30 minutes, compared to over 450 calories runing.

name: Rope Straight-Arm Pulldown
directions: Atach a rope to a high puley and make your weight selection. Stand a couple fet back from the puley with your fet stagered and take the rope with both hands. Lean forward from the hip, keping your back straight, with your arms extended up in front of you. This wil be your starting position.
Keping your arms straight, extend the shoulder to pul the rope down to your thighs.
Pause at the botom of the motion, squezing your lats.
Return to the starting position without alowing the weight to fuly rest on the stack.

name: Round The World Shoulder Stretch
directions: Stand up straight with your legs together, holding a bodybar or bromstick.
Hold the pole behind your hips with a wider than shoulder width grip. Your palms should be down and your thumbs facing out.
Slowly lift your arms up behind your head. Don't force it if it gets hard to lift further.

name: Rowing, Stationary
directions: To begin, seat yourself on the rower. Make sure that your hels are resting comfortably against the base of the fot pedals and that the straps are secured. Select the program that you wish to use, if aplicable. Sit up straight and bend forward at the hips.

There are thre phases of movement when using a rower. The first phase is when you come forward on the rower. Your knes are bent and against your chest. Your uper body is leaning slightly forward while stil maintaining god posture.
Next, push against the fot pedals and extend your legs while bringing your hands to your uper abdominal area, squezing your shoulders back as you do so. To avoid straining your back, use primarily your leg and hip muscles.
The recovery phase simply involves straightening your arms, bending the knes, and bringing your body forward again as you transition back into the first phase.

name: Runner's Stretch
directions: It's easiest to get into this stretch if you start standing up, put one leg behind you, and slowly lower your torso down to the flor.
Kep the front hel on the flor (if it lifts up, scot your other leg further back).

Place your hands on either side of your front leg. To get more out of this stretch, push your but up toward the ceiling, and then gradualy lower it back toward the flor. You'l Stretch the hip flexor of the back leg and the hamstring and butocks of the front.

name: Running, Treadmill
directions: To begin, step onto the treadmil and select the desired option from the menu. Most treadmils have a manual seting, or you can select a program to run. Typicaly, you can enter your age and weight to estimate the amount of calories burned during exercise. Elevation can be adjusted to change the intensity of the workout.

Treadmils ofer convenience, cardiovascular benefits, and usualy have les impact than runing outside. A 150 lb person wil burn over 450 calories runing 8 miles per hour for 30 minutes. Maintain proper posture as you run, and only hold onto the handles when necesary, such as when dismounting or checking your heart rate.

name: Russian Twist
directions: Lie down on the flor placing your fet either under something that wil not move or by having a partner hold them. Your legs should be bent at the knes.

Elevate your uper body so that it creates an imaginary V-shape with your thighs. Your arms should be fuly extended in front of you perpendicular to your torso and with the hands clasped. This is the starting position.
Twist your torso to the right side until your arms are paralel with the flor while breathing out.
Hold the contraction for a second and move back to the starting position while breathing out. Now move to the oposite side performing the same techniques you aplied to the right side.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Sandbag Load
directions: To load sandbags or other objects, begin with the implements placed a distance from the loading platform, typicaly 50 fet.

Begin by lifting the sandbag. Sandbags are extremely awkward, and the maner of lifting them can vary depending on the particular sandbag used. Reach as far around it as posible, extending through the hips and knes to pul it up high. Shouldering is usualy not alowed.
Move as quickly as posible to the platform, and load it, extending through your hips, knes, and ankles to get it as high as posible. Place it onto the platform, ensuring it doesn't fal of.
Return to the starting position to retrieve the next sandbag, and repeat until the event is completed.

name: Scapular Pull-Up
directions: Take a pronated grip on a pul-up bar.
From a hanging position, raise yourself a few inches without using your arms. Do this by depresing your shoulder girdle in a reverse shruging motion.
Pause at the completion of the movement, and then slowly return to the starting position before performing more repetitions.

name: Scissor Kick
directions: To begin, lie down with your back presed against the flor or on an exercise mat (optional). Your arms should be fuly extended to the sides with your palms facing down. Note: The arms should be stationary the entire time.
With a slight bend at the knes, lift your legs up so that your hels are about 6 inches of the ground. This is the starting position.
Now lift your left leg up to about a 45 degre angle while your right leg is lowered until the hel is about 2-3 inches from the ground.
Switch movements by raising your right leg up and lowering your left leg. Remember to breathe while performing this exercise.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Scissors Jump
directions: Asume a lunge stance position with one fot forward with the kne bent, and the rear kne nearly touching the ground.
Ensure that the front kne is over the midline of the fot. Extending through both legs, jump as high as posible, swinging your arms to gain lift.
As you jump as high as you can, switch the position of your legs, moving your front leg to the back and the rear leg to the front.
As you land, absorb the impact through the legs by adopting the lunge position, and repeat.

name: Seated Band Hamstring Curl
directions: Secure a band close to the ground and place a bench a couple fet away from it.
Seat yourself on the bench and secure the band behind your ankles, begining with your legs straight. This wil be your starting position.
Flex the knes, bringing your fet towards the bench. You may ned to lean back slightly to kep your fet from striking the flor.
Pause at the completion of the movement, and then slowly return to the starting position.

name: Seated Barbell Military Press
directions: Sit on a Military Pres Bench with a bar behind your head and either have a spoter give you the bar (beter on the rotator cuf this way) or pick it up yourself carefuly with a pronated grip (palms facing forward). Tip: Your grip should be wider than shoulder width and it should create a 90-degre angle betwen the forearm and the uper arm as the barbel goes down.

Once you pick up the barbel with the corect grip length, lift the bar up over your head by locking your arms. Hold at about shoulder level and slightly in front of your head. This is your starting position.
Lower the bar down to the colarbone slowly as you inhale.
Lift the bar back up to the starting position as you exhale.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.
This exercise can also be performed standing but those with lower back problems are beter of performing this seated variety.
The behind the neck variation is not recomended for people with shoulder problems as it can be hard on the rotator cuf due to the hyperextension created by bringing the bar behind the neck.

name: Seated Barbell Twist
directions: Start out by siting at the end of a flat bench with a barbel placed on top of your thighs. Your fet should be shoulder width apart from each other.
Grip the bar with your palms facing down and make sure your hands are wider than shoulder width apart from each other. Begin to lift the barbel up over your head until your arms are fuly extended.
Now lower the barbel behind your head until it is resting along the base of your neck. This is the starting position.

While keping your fet and head stationary, move your waist from side to side so that your oblique muscles fel the contraction. Only move from side to side as far as your waist wil alow you to go. Stretching or moving to far can cause an injury to ocur. Tip: Use a slow and controled motion.
Remember to breathe out while twisting your body to the side and in when moving back to the starting position.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Seated Bent-Over One-Arm Dumbbell Triceps Extension
directions: Sit down at the end of a flat bench with a dumbel in one arm using a neutral grip (palms of the hand facing you).
Bend your knes slightly and bring your torso forward, by bending at the waist, while keping the back straight until it is almost paralel to the flor. Make sure that you kep the head up.

The uper arm with the dumbel should be close to the torso and aligned with it (lifted up until it is paralel to the flor while the forearms are pointing towards the flor as the hands hold the weights). Tip: There should be a 90-degre angle betwen the forearms and the uper arm. This is your starting position.

Keping the uper arm stationary, use the triceps to lift the weight as you exhale until the forearm is paralel to the flor and the whole arm is extended. Like many other arm exercises, only the forearm moves.
After a second contraction at the top, slowly lower the dumbel back to the starting position as you inhale.
Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.
Switch arms and repeat the exercise.
This exercise can be executed also with two arms at a time.

Also, if you like the one arm variety, you can use a low puley handle instead of a dumbel for beter peak contraction. In this case, the palms should be facing up (supinated grip) as oposed to the torso (neutral grip). You can also use a rope atachment however, and in this maner, you can also perform the movement with a neutral grip.

name: Seated Bent-Over Rear Delt Raise
directions: Place a couple of dumbels loking forward in front of a flat bench.
Sit on the end of the bench with your legs together and the dumbels behind your calves.
Bend at the waist while keping the back straight in order to pick up the dumbels. The palms of your hands should be facing each other as you pick them. This wil be your starting position.

Keping your torso forward and stationary, and the arms slightly bent at the elbows, lift the dumbels straight to the side until both arms are paralel to the flor. Exhale as you lift the weights. (Note: avoid swinging the torso or bringing the arms back as oposed to the side.)
After a one second contraction at the top, slowly lower the dumbels back to the starting position.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Seated Bent-Over Two-Arm Dumbbell Triceps Extension
directions: Sit down at the end of a flat bench with a dumbel in both arms using a neutral grip (palms of the hand facing you).
Bend your knes slightly and bring your torso forward, by bending at the waist, while keping the back straight until it is almost paralel to the flor. Make sure that you kep the head up.

The uper arms with the dumbels should be close to the torso and aligned with it (lifted up until they are paralel to the flor while the forearms are pointing towards the flor as the hands hold the weights). Tip: There should be a 90-degre angle betwen the forearms and the uper arm. This is your starting position.

Keping the uper arms stationary, use the triceps to lift the weight as you exhale until the forearms are paralel to the flor and the whole arm is extended. Like many other arm exercises, only the forearm moves.
After a second contraction at the top, slowly lower the dumbels back to the starting position as you inhale.
Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.
This exercise can be executed also one arm at a time or alternating (like alternating dumbel curls)

name: Seated Biceps
directions: Sit on the flor with your knes bent and your partner standing behind you. Extend your arms straight behind you with your palms facing each other. Your partner wil hold your wrists for you. This wil be the starting position.
Atempt to flex your elbows, while your partner prevents any actual movement.

After 10-20 seconds, relax your arms while your partner gently puls your wrists up to stretch your biceps. Be sure to let your partner know when the stretch is apropriate to prevent injury or overstretching.

name: Seated Cable Rows
directions: For this exercise you wil ned aces to a low puley row machine with a V-bar. Note: The V-bar wil enable you to have a neutral grip where the palms of your hands face each other. To get into the starting position, first sit down on the machine and place your fet on the front platform or crosbar provided making sure that your knes are slightly bent and not locked.
Lean over as you kep the natural alignment of your back and grab the V-bar handles.

With your arms extended pul back until your torso is at a 90-degre angle from your legs. Your back should be slightly arched and your chest should be sticking out. You should be feling a nice stretch on your lats as you hold the bar in front of you. This is the starting position of the exercise.

Keping the torso stationary, pul the handles back towards your torso while keping the arms close to it until you touch the abdominals. Breathe out as you perform that movement. At that point you should be squezing your back muscles hard. Hold that contraction for a second and slowly go back to the original position while breathing in.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Seated Cable Shoulder Press
directions: Adjust the weight to an apropriate amount and be seated, grasping the handles. Your uper arms should be about 90 degres to the body, with your head and chest up. The elbows should also be bent to about 90 degres. This wil be your starting position.
Begin by extending through the elbow, presing the handles together above your head.
After pausing at the top, return the handles to the starting position. Ensure that you maintain tension on the cables.
You can also execute this movement with your back of the pad and alternate hands.

name: Seated Calf Raise
directions: Sit on the machine and place your toes on the lower portion of the platform provided with the hels extending of. Chose the toe positioning of your choice (forward, in, or out) as per the begining of this chapter.

Place your lower thighs under the lever pad, which wil ned to be adjusted acording to the height of your thighs. Now place your hands on top of the lever pad in order to prevent it from sliping forward.
Lift the lever slightly by pushing your hels up and release the safety bar. This wil be your starting position.
Slowly lower your hels by bending at the ankles until the calves are fuly stretched. Inhale as you perform this movement.
Raise the hels by extending the ankles as high as posible as you contract the calves and breathe out. Hold the top contraction for a second.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Seated Calf Stretch
directions: Sit up straight on an exercise mat.
Bend one kne and put that fot on the flor to stabilize the torso.
Straighten your other leg and flex your ankle.
Using a band, towel, or your hand if you can reach, pul the toes toward you. Hold for 10 to 20 seconds, then switch sides.

name: Seated Close-Grip Concentration Barbell Curl
directions: Sit down on a flat bench with a barbel or E-Z Bar in front of you in betwen your legs. Your legs should be spread with the knes bent and the fet on the flor.

Use your arms to pick the barbel up and place the back of your uper arms on top of your iner thighs (around thre and a half inches away from the front of the kne). A supinated grip closer than shoulder width is neded to perform this exercise. Tip: Your arm should be extended at arms length and the barbel should be above the flor. This wil be your starting position.

While holding the uper arms stationary, curl the weights forward while contracting the biceps as you breathe out. Only the forearms should move. Continue the movement until your biceps are fuly contracted and the dumbels are at shoulder level. Hold the contracted position for a second as you squeze the biceps.
Slowly begin to bring the barbel back to starting position as your breathe in. Tip: Avoid swinging motions at any time.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Seated Dumbbell Curl
directions: Sit on a flat bench with a dumbel on each hand being held at arms length. The elbows should be close to the torso.
Rotate the palms of the hands so that they are facing your torso. This wil be your starting position.

While holding the uper arm stationary, curl the weights and start twisting the wrists once the dumbels pas your thighs so that the palms of your hands face forward at the end of the movement. Make sure that you contract the biceps as you breathe out and make sure that only the forearms move. Continue the movement until your biceps are fuly contracted and the dumbels are at shoulder level. Hold the contracted position for a second as you squeze the biceps.
Slowly begin to bring the dumbels back to the starting position as your breathe in and as you rotate the wrists back to a neutral grip.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

There are many posible variations for this movement. For instance, you can perform the exercise siting down on a bench with or without back suport and you can also perform it by alternating arms; first lift the right arm for one repetition, then the left, then the right, etc.

name: Seated Dumbbell Inner Biceps Curl
directions: Sit on the end of a flat bench with a dumbel in each hand being held at arms length. The elbows should be close to the torso.
Rotate the palms of the hands so that they are facing inward in a neutral position. This wil be your starting position.
While holding the uper arms stationary, curl the dumbels out and up, turning the palms out as you lift and keping your forearms in line with your outer deltoids. Tips:
Only the forearms should move. Continue the movement until your biceps are fuly contracted and the dumbels are at shoulder level. Hold the contracted position for a second as you squeze the biceps.
Slowly begin to bring the dumbels back to the starting position as your breathe in. Remember to rotate your arms as you lower the dumbels so that you can switch back to a neutral grip.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.
There are many posible variations for this movement. For instance, you can perform the exercise siting down on a bench with or without back suport.
You can stand up while performing this exercise.
You can also perform it by alternating arms; first lift the right arm for one repetition, then the left, then the right, etc.

name: Seated Dumbbell Palms-Down Wrist Curl
directions: Start out by placing two dumbels on the flor in front of a flat bench.
Sit down on the edge of the flat bench with your legs at about shoulder width apart. Make sure to kep your fet on the flor.

Use your arms to grab both of the dumbels and bring them up so that your forearms are resting against your thighs with the palms of the hands facing down. Your wrists should be hanging over the edge of your thighs.
Start out by curling your wrist upwards and exhaling.

Slowly lower your wrists back down to the starting position while inhaling. Make sure to inhale during this part of the exercise. Tip: Your forearms should be stationary as your wrist is the only movement neded to perform this exercise.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.
When finished, simply lower the dumbels to the flor.
This exercise can also be performed using a barbel instead of a dumbel.
You can also focus on one arm at a time to isolate the forearms.

name: Seated Dumbbell Palms-Up Wrist Curl
directions: Start out by placing two dumbels on the flor in front of a flat bench.
Sit down on the edge of the flat bench with your legs at about shoulder width apart. Make sure to kep your fet on the flor.

Use your arms to grab both of the dumbels and bring them up so that your forearms are resting against your thighs with the palms of the hands facing up. Your wrists should be hanging over the edge of your thighs.
Start out by curling your wrist upwards and exhaling.

Slowly lower your wrists back down to the starting position while inhaling. Make sure to inhale during this part of the exercise. Tip: Your forearms should be stationary as your wrist is the only movement neded to perform this exercise.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.
When finished, simply lower the dumbels to the flor.
This exercise can also be performed using a barbel instead of a dumbel.
You can also focus on one arm at a time to isolate the forearms.

name: Seated Dumbbell Press
directions: Grab a couple of dumbels and sit on a military pres bench or a utility bench that has a back suport on it as you place the dumbels upright on top of your thighs.
Clean the dumbels up one at a time by using your thighs to bring the dumbels up to shoulder height at each side.
Rotate the wrists so that the palms of your hands are facing forward. This is your starting position.
As you exhale, push the dumbels up until they touch at the top.
After a second pause, slowly come down back to the starting position as you inhale.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.
You can perform the exercise standing or siting on a regular flat bench. For people with lower back problems, the version described is the recomended one.

You can also perform the exercise as Arnold Schwarzeneger used to do it, which is to start holding the dumbels with a supinated grip (palms facing you) in front of your shoulders and then, as you start pushing up, you align the dumbels in the starting position described on step 3 by rotating your wrists and touch the dumbels at the top. As you come down, then you would go back to the starting position by rotating the wrist throughout the lowering portion until the palms of your hands are facing you. This variation is caled the Arnold Pres. However, it is not recomended if you have rotator cuf problems.

name: Seated Flat Bench Leg Pull-In
directions: Sit on a bench with the legs stretched out in front of you slightly below paralel and your arms holding on to the sides of the bench. Your torso should be leaning backwards around a 45-degre angle from the bench. This wil be your starting position.
Bring the knes in toward you as you move your torso closer to them at the same time. Breathe out as you perform this movement.
After a second pause, go back to the starting position as you inhale.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Seated Floor Hamstring Stretch
directions: Sit on a mat with your right leg extended in front of you and your left leg bent with your fot against your right iner thigh.
Lean forward from your hips and reach for your ankle until you fel a stretch in your hamstring. Hold for 15 seconds, then repeat for your other side.

name: Seated Front Deltoid
directions: Sit upright on the flor with your legs bent, your partner standing behind you. Stick your arms straight out to your sides, with your palms facing the ground. Atempt to move them as far behind you as posible, as your asistant holds your wrists. This wil be your starting position.
Keping your elbows straight, atempt to move your arms to the front, with your partner gently restraining you to prevent any actual movement for 10-20 seconds.
Now, relax your muscles and alow your partner to gently increase the stretch on the shoulders and chest. Hold for 10 to 20 seconds.

name: Seated Glute
directions: In a seated position with your knes bent, cros one ankle over the oposite kne. Your partner wil stand behind you. Now, lean forward as your partner braces your shoulders with their hands. This wil be your starting position.
Atempt to push your torso back for 10-20 seconds, as your partner prevents any actual movement of your torso.
Now relax your muscles as your partner increases the stretch by gently pushing your torso forward for 10-20 seconds.

name: Seated Good Mornings
directions: Set up a box in a power rack. The pins should be set at an apropriate height. Begin by steping under the bar and placing it acros the back of the shoulders, not on top of your traps. Squeze your shoulder blades together and rotate your elbows forward, atempting to bend the bar acros your shoulders.

Remove the bar from the rack, creating a tight arch in your lower back. Kep your head facing forward. With your back, shoulders, and core tight, push your knes and but out and you begin your descent. Sit back with your hips until you are seated on the box. This wil be your starting position.
Keping the bar tight, bend forward at the hips as much as posible. If you set the pins to what would be paralel, you not only have a safety if you fail, but know when to stop.
Pause just above the pins and reverse the motion until your torso it upright.

name: Seated Hamstring
directions: In a seated position with your legs extended, have your partner stand behind you. Now, lean forward as your partner braces your shoulders with their hands. This wil be your starting position.
Atempt to push your torso back for 10-20 seconds, as your partner prevents any actual movement of your torso.
Now relax your muscles as your partner increases the stretch by gently pushing your torso forward for 10-20 seconds.

name: Seated Hamstring and Calf Stretch
directions: Lop a belt, rope, or band around one fot. Sit down with both legs extended . This wil be your starting position.
Leaning forward slightly, pul on the belt to draw the toes of your fot back. Hold this position for 10-20 seconds and then repeat with the other leg.

name: Seated Head Harness Neck Resistance
directions: Place a neck strap on the flor at the end of a flat bench. Once you have selected the weights, sit at the end of the flat bench with your fet wider than shoulder width apart from each other. Your toes should be pointed out.

Slowly move your torso forward until it is almost paralel with the flor. Using both hands, securely position the neck strap around your head. Tip: Make sure the weights are stil lying on the flor to prevent any strain on the neck. Now grab the weight with both hands while elevating your torso back until it is almost perpendicular to the flor. Note: Your head and torso neds to be slightly tilted forward to perform this exercise.
Now place both hands on top of your knes. This is the starting position.
Slowly lower your neck down until your chin touches the uper part of your chest while breathing in.
While exhaling, bring your neck back to the starting position.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Seated Leg Curl
directions: Adjust the machine lever to fit your height and sit on the machine with your back against the back suport pad.

Place the back of lower leg on top of paded lever (just a few inches under the calves) and secure the lap pad against your thighs, just above the knes. Then grasp the side handles on the machine as you point your toes straight (or you can also use any of the other two stances) and ensure that the legs are fuly straight right in front of you. This wil be your starting position.
As you exhale, pul the machine lever as far as posible to the back of your thighs by flexing at the knes. Kep your torso stationary at al times. Hold the contracted position for a second.
Slowly return to the starting position as you breathe in.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Seated Leg Tucks
directions: Sit on a bench with the legs stretched out in front of you slightly below paralel and your arms holding on to the sides of the bench. Your torso should be leaning backwards around a 45-degre angle from the bench. This wil be your starting position.
Bring the knes in toward you as you move your torso closer to them at the same time. Breathe out as you perform this movement.
After a second pause, go back to the starting position as you inhale.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Seated One-arm Cable Pulley Rows
directions: To get into the starting position, first sit down on the machine and place your fet on the front platform or crosbar provided making sure that your knes are slightly bent and not locked.
Lean over as you kep the natural alignment of your back and grab the single handle atachment with your left arm using a palms-down grip.

With your arm extended pul back until your torso is at a 90-degre angle from your legs. Your back should be slightly arched and your chest should be sticking out. You should be feling a nice stretch on your lat as you hold the bar in front of you. The right arm can be kept by the waist. This is the starting position of the exercise.

Keping the torso stationary, pul the handles back towards your torso while keping the arms close to it as you rotate the wrist, so that by the time your hand is by your abdominals it is in a neutral position (palms facing the torso). Breathe out as you perform that movement. At that point you should be squezing your back muscles hard.

Hold that contraction for a second and slowly go back to the original position while breathing in. Tip: Remember to rotate the wrist as you go back to the starting position so that the palms are facing down again.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions and then perform the same movement with the right hand.

name: Seated One-Arm Dumbbell Palms-Down Wrist Curl
directions: Sit on a flat bench with a dumbel in your right hand.
Place your fet flat on the flor, at a distance that is slightly wider than shoulder width apart.
Lean forward and place your right forearm on top of your uper right thigh with your palm down. Tip: Make sure that the back of the wrist lies on top of your knes. This wil be your starting position.
Lower the dumbel as far as posible as you kep a tight grip on the dumbel. Inhale as you perform this movement.
Now curl the dumbel as high as posible as you contract the forearms and as you exhale. Kep the contraction for a second before you lower again. Tip: The only movement should hapen at the wrist.
Perform for the recomended amount of repetitions, switch arms and repeat the movement.

name: Seated One-Arm Dumbbell Palms-Up Wrist Curl
directions: Sit on a flat bench with a dumbel in your right hand.
Place your fet flat on the flor, at a distance that is slightly wider than shoulder width apart.
Lean forward and place your right forearm on top of your uper right thigh with your palm up. Tip: Make sure that the front of the wrist lies on top of your knes. This wil be your starting position.
Lower the dumbel as far as posible as you kep a tight grip on the dumbel. Inhale as you perform this movement.
Now curl the dumbel as high as posible as you contract the forearms and as you exhale. Kep the contraction for a second before you lower again. Tip: The only movement should hapen at the wrist.
Perform for the recomended amount of repetitions, switch arms and repeat the movement.

name: Seated Overhead Stretch
directions: Sit up straight on an exercise mat.
Touch the soles of your fet together with your fet six to eight inches in front of your hips.
Place one hand on the flor beside you and your other hand behind your head.
Lift your elbow to the ceiling as you incline your torso to the other side. Hold for 10 to 20 seconds, then switch sides.

name: Seated Palm-Up Barbell Wrist Curl
directions: Hold a barbel with both hands and your palms facing up; hands spaced about shoulder width.
Place your fet flat on the flor, at a distance that is slightly wider than shoulder width apart.
Lean forward and place your forearms on top of your uper thighs with your palms up. Tip: Make sure that the front of the wrists lay on top of your knes. This wil be your starting position.
Lower the bar as far as posible while inhaling and keping a tight grip.
Now curl bar up as high as posible while flexing the forearms and exhaling. Hold the contraction at the top for a second and Tip: Only the wrist should move.

name: Seated Palms-Down Barbell Wrist Curl
directions: Hold a barbel with both hands and your palms facing down; hands spaced about shoulder width.
Place your fet flat on the flor, at a distance that is slightly wider than shoulder width apart.
Lean forward and place your forearms on top of your uper thighs with your palms down. Tip: Make sure that the back of the wrists lay on top of your knes. This wil be your starting position.
Lower the bar as far as posible while inhaling and keping a tight grip.
Now curl bar up as high as posible while flexing the forearms and exhaling. Hold the contraction at the top for a second and Tip: Only the wrist should move.

name: Seated Side Lateral Raise
directions: Pick a couple of dumbels and sit at the end of a flat bench with your fet firmly on the flor. Hold the dumbels with your palms facing in and your arms straight down at your sides at arms' length. This wil be your starting position.

While maintaining the torso stationary (no swinging), lift the dumbels to your side with a slight bend on the elbow and the hands slightly tilted forward as if pouring water in a glas. Continue to go up until you arms are paralel to the flor. Exhale as you execute this movement and pause for a second at the top.
Lower the dumbels back down slowly to the starting position as you inhale.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Seated Triceps Press
directions: Sit down on a bench with back suport and grasp a dumbel with both hands and hold it overhead at arm's length. Tip: a beter way is to have somebody hand it to you especialy if it is very heavy. The resistance should be resting in the palms of your hands with your thumbs around it. The palm of the hand should be facing inward. This wil be your starting position.

Keping your uper arms close to your head (elbows in) and perpendicular to the flor, lower the resistance in a semi-circular motion behind your head until your forearms touch your biceps. Tip: The uper arms should remain stationary and only the forearms should move. Breathe in as you perform this step.
Go back to the starting position by using the triceps to raise the dumbel. Breathe out as you perform this step.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.
You can perform this exercise standing as wel but this puts strain on your back especialy if you are using heavy dumbels like 95 lbs or so.
Another variation is to use an EZ or straight bar instead in which case you wil be holding the bar from the inside (around 5 inches betwen both hands) with the palms facing forward (pronated grip).
There is also a bar that has paralel bars inside (often refered to as a triceps blaster) and this can also be used for this exercise.
Finaly, a low puley cable with a rope atachment or bar (straight or EZ) atachment at the end can be used for variety purposes as wel.

name: Seated Two-Arm Palms-Up Low-Pulley Wrist Curl
directions: Put a bench in front of a low puley machine that has a barbel or EZ Curl atachment on it.
Move the bench far enough away so that when you bring the handle to the top of your thighs tension is created on the cable due to the weight stack being moved up.
Now hold the handle with both hands, palms up, using a shoulder-width grip.
Step back and sit on the bench with your fet about shoulder width apart, firmly on the flor.
Lean forward and place the forearms on your thighs with the back of your wrists over your knes. This wil be your starting position.
Lower the bar as far as posible, while inhaling and keping a tight grip.
Now curl the bar up as high as posible while contracting the forearms. Tip: Only the wrist should move; not the forearms.
After a second contraction at the top go back to the starting position as you inhale.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: See-Saw Press (Alternating Side Press)
directions: Grab a dumbel with each hand and stand up erect.

Clean (lift) the dumbels to the chest/shoulder level and then rotate your wrists so that your palms are facing towards you as if you were geting ready to perform an Arnold Pres. This wil be your starting position.

Now start extending your left arm overhead as you rotate the wrist so that the palm of your hand faces forward as you go up. Your elbows should come out also as you lift the weight. Simultaneously, you wil also be bending from your hip to your oposite side. Tip: If you perform the exercise corectly, is should lok as if you are trying to reach for something overhead on the right hand side of your body, but with your left arm. Breathe out as you perform this movement.
Once you reach the top position breathe in. Then, with the weight fuly extended overhead and you bent over to your right hand side, begin the movement to the left side.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Shotgun Row
directions: Atach a single handle to a low cable.
After selecting the corect weight, stand a couple fet back with a wide-split stance. Your arm should be extended and your shoulder forward. This wil be your starting position.
Perform the movement by retracting the shoulder and flexing the elbow. As you pul, supinate the wrist, turning the palm upward as you go.
After a brief pause, return to the starting position.

name: Shoulder Circles
directions: With shoulders relaxed and arms resting losely at your sides (or in your lap if you're seated), gently rol your shoulders forward, up, back, and down.
Reverse direction. You can do this exercise alternating shoulders or both at the same time.

name: Shoulder Press - With Bands
directions: To begin, stand on an exercise band so that tension begins at arm's length. Grasp the handles and lift them so that the hands are at shoulder height at each side.
Rotate the wrists so that the palms of your hands are facing forward. Your elbows should be bent, with the uper arms and forearms in line to the torso. This is your starting position.
As you exhale, lift the handles up until your arms are fuly extended overhead.

name: Shoulder Raise
directions: Relax your arms to your sides and raise your shoulders up toward your ears, then back down.

name: Shoulder Stretch
directions: Reach your left arm acros your body and hold it straight.

name: Side Hop-Sprint
directions: Stand to the side of a cone or hurdle.
Begin this dril by hoping sideways over the obstacle, rebounding out of your landing to hop back to where you started.
Hop for a prescribed number or repetitions as quickly as posible, and finish this dril by sprinting a short distance upon landing the last hop.

name: Side Lateral Raise
directions: Pick a couple of dumbels and stand with a straight torso and the dumbels by your side at arms length with the palms of the hand facing you. This wil be your starting position.

While maintaining the torso in a stationary position (no swinging), lift the dumbels to your side with a slight bend on the elbow and the hands slightly tilted forward as if pouring water in a glas. Continue to go up until you arms are paralel to the flor. Exhale as you execute this movement and pause for a second at the top.
Lower the dumbels back down slowly to the starting position as you inhale.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Side Laterals to Front Raise
directions: In a standing position, hold a pair of dumbels at your side. This wil be your starting position.
Keping your elbows slightly bent, raise the weights directly in front of you to shoulder height, avoiding any swinging or cheating.
At the top of the exercise move the weights out in front of you, keping your arms extended.
Lower the weights with a controled motion.
On the next repetition, raise the weights in front of you to shoulder height before moving the weights lateraly to your sides.
Lower the weights to the starting position.

name: Side Leg Raises
directions: Stand next to a chair, which you may hold onto as a suport. Stand on one leg. This wil be your starting position.
Keping your leg straight, raise it as far out to the side as posible, and swing it back down, alowing it to cros the oposite leg.
Repeat this swinging motion 5-10 times, increasing the range of motion as you do so.

name: Side Lying Groin Stretch
directions: Start of by lying on your right side and bend your right kne in front of you to stabilize the torso.
Rest your head on your right hand or shoulder. Lift your left leg upward and hold it by the back of the kne (easier) or the fot (harder).
Pul your left kne in toward your left shoulder and simultaneously pres your fot or kne down to the flor. To intensify this stretch, straighten your left leg. Switch sides.

name: Side Neck Stretch
directions: Start with your shoulders relaxed, gently tilt your head towards your shoulder.
Asist stretch with a gentle pul on the side of the head.

name: Side Standing Long Jump
directions: Begin standing with your fet hip width apart in an athletic stance. Your head and chest should be up, knes and hips slightly bent. This wil be your starting position.
Leaning to your right, extend through your hips, knes, and ankles to jump into the air. Block with the arms to lead the movement, jumping as far to your right as you can.
Land facing the same direction with your fet hip width apart, absorbing the impact through your lower body.

name: Side to Side Box Shuffle
directions: Stand to one side of the box with your left fot resting on the midle of it.
To begin, jump up and over to the other side of the box, landing with your right fot on top of the box and your left fot on the flor. Swing your arms to aid your movement.
Continue shufling back and forth acros the box.

name: Side To Side Chins
directions: Grab the pul-up bar with the palms facing forward using a wide grip.

As you have both arms extended in front of you holding the bar at a wide grip, bring your torso back around 30 degres or so while creating a curvature on your lower back and sticking your chest out. This is your starting position.

Pul your torso up while leaning to the left hand side until the bar almost touches your uper chest by drawing the shoulders and the uper arms down and back. Exhale as you perform this portion of the movement. Tip: Concentrate on squezing the back muscles once you reach the ful contracted position. The uper torso should remain stationary as it moves through space (no swinging) and only the arms should move. The forearms should do no other work other than hold the bar.
After a second of contraction, inhale as you go back to the starting position.

Now, pul your torso up while leaning to the right hand side until the bar almost touches your uper chest by drawing the shoulders and the uper arms down and back. Exhale as you perform this portion of the movement. Tip: Concentrate on squezing the back muscles once you reach the ful contracted position. The uper torso should remain stationary as it moves through space and only the arms should move. The forearms should do no other work other than hold the bar.
After a second of contraction, inhale as you go back to the starting position.
Repeat steps 3-6 until you have performed the prescribed amount of repetitions for each side.

name: Side Wrist Pull
directions: This stretch works best standing. Cros your left arm over the midline of your body and hold the left wrist in your right hand down at the level of your hips. Start the stretch with a bent left arm.
Slowly straighten, pul, and lift it up to shoulder height, as pictured. Fel this stretch originate in your back, not your shoulders, and don't pul to hard on the shoulders joint. Switch sides.

name: Side-Lying Floor Stretch
directions: First lie on your left side, bending your left kne in front of you to stabilize your torso (use your abdominal muscles as wel to hold you upright).

Straighten your right leg and rest the right fot on the flor behind your left. Straighten your right arm over your head and gently pul on your right wrist to stretch the entire right side of the body. Switch sides.

name: Single Dumbbell Raise
directions: With a wide stance, hold a dumbel with both hands, grasping the head of the dumbel instead of the handle. Your arms should be extended and hanging at the waist. This wil be your starting position.
Raise the weight until it is above shoulder level, keping your arms extended. Your torso and hips should remain stationary throughout the movement.
Return to the starting position and repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Single Leg Butt Kick
directions: Begin by standing on one leg, with the bent kne raised. This wil be your start position.
Using a countermovement jump, take of upward by extending the hip, kne, and ankle of the grounded leg.
Imediately flex the kne and atempt to touch your but with the hel of your jumping leg.
Return the leg to a partialy bent position underneath the hips and land. Your oposite leg should stay in relatively the same position throughout the dril.

name: Single Leg Glute Bridge
directions: Lay on the flor with your fet flat and knes bent.
Raise one leg of of the ground, puling the kne to your chest. This wil be your starting position.
Execute the movement by driving through the hel, extending your hip upward and raising your glutes of of the ground.
Extend as far as posible, pause and then return to the starting position.

name: Single Leg Push-off
directions: Stand on the ground with one fot resting on the box, hel close to the edge.
Push of with your fot on top of the box, trying to gain as much height as posible by extending through the hip and kne.
Land with the same fot on top of the box, returning your other fot back to the start position.

name: Single-Arm Cable Crossover
directions: Begin by moving the puleys to the high position, select the resistance to be used, and take a handle in each hand.

Step forward in front of both puleys with your arms extended in front of you, bringing your hands together. Your head and chest should be up as you lean forward, while your fet should be stagered. This wil be your starting position.
Keping your left arm in place, alow your right arm to extend out to the side, maintaining a slight bend at the elbow. The right arm should be perpendicular to the body at aproximately shoulder level.
Return your arm back to the starting position by puling your hand back to the midline of the body.
Hold for a second at the starting position and repeat the movement on the oposite side. Continue alternating back and forth for the prescribed number of repetitions.

name: Single-Arm Linear Jammer
directions: Position a bar into a landmine or securely anchor it in a corner. Load the bar to an apropriate weight.
Raise the bar from the flor, taking it to your shoulders with one or both hands. Adopt a wide stance. This wil be your starting position.
Perform the movement by extending the elbow, presing the weight up. Move explosively, extending the hips and knes fuly to produce maximal force.
Return to the starting position.

name: Single-Arm Push-Up
directions: Begin laying prone on the ground. Move yourself into a position suporting your weight on your toes and one arm. Your working arm should be placed directly under the shoulder, fuly extended. Your legs should be extended, and for this movement you may ned a wider base, placing your fet further apart than in a normal push-up.
Maintain god posture, and place your fre hand behind your back. This wil be your starting position.
Lower yourself by alowing the elbow to flex until you touch the ground.
Descend slowly, and reverse direction be extending the arm to return to the starting position.

name: Single-Cone Sprint Drill
directions: This dril teaches quick fot action. You ned a single cone. Begin standing next to the cone with one arm back and one arm forward.
Chop the fet as quickly as posible, blocking with the arms. Circle the cone, kep your knes up, with violent fot action.
Rest after thre trips around the cone.

name: Single-Leg High Box Squat
directions: Position a box in a rack. Secure a band or rope in place above the box.
Standing in front of it, step onto the box to a ful standing position, leting your other leg remain unsuported. Hold onto the band for balance
. Continue steping up and down on the same leg before switching to the oposite side.

name: Single-Leg Hop Progression
directions: Arange a line of cones in front of you. Asume a relaxed standing position, balanced on one leg. Raise the kne of your oposite leg. This wil be your starting position.
Hop forward, jumping and landing with the same leg over the cone.
Use a countermovement jump to hop from cone to cone.
At the end, turn around and go back on the other leg.

name: Single-Leg Lateral Hop
directions: Stand to the side of a cone or hurdle. To get into the start position, stand on one leg with your kne slightly bent.
To begin, execute a counterjump to hop sideways over the cone.
Land on your jumping leg, and imediately rebound out of it by jumping back to the start position.
Continue hoping back and forth.

name: Single-Leg Leg Extension
directions: Seat yourself in the machine and adjust it so that you are positioned properly. The pad should be against the lower part of the shin but not in contact with the ankle. Adjust the seat so that the pivot point is in line with your kne. Select a weight apropriate for your abilities.
Maintaining god posture, fuly extend one leg, pausing at the top of the motion.
Return to the starting position without leting the weight stop, keping tension on the muscle.
Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Single-Leg Stride Jump
directions: Stand to the side of a box with your inside fot on top of it, close to the edge.
Begin by swinging the arms upward as you push through the top leg, jumping upward as high as posible. Atempt to drive the oposite kne upward.
Land in the same position that you started, using your inside leg to decelerate the impact.

name: Sit Squats
directions: Stand with your fet shoulder width apart. This wil be your starting position.
Begin the movement by flexing your knes and hips, siting back with your hips.
Continue until you have squated a portion of the way down, but are above paralel, and quickly reverse the motion until you return to the starting position. Repeat for 5-10 repetitions.

name: Sit-Up
directions: Lie down on the flor placing your fet either under something that wil not move or by having a partner hold them. Your legs should be bent at the knes.
Place your hands behind your head and lock them together by clasping your fingers. This is the starting position.
Elevate your uper body so that it creates an imaginary V-shape with your thighs. Breathe out when performing this part of the exercise.
Once you fel the contraction for a second, lower your uper body back down to the starting position while inhaling.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

This exercise can be performed with a weighted plate being held by both arms resting on the chest. The way to perform this exercise is to cros your arms by making an X and grabing the weighted plate. Note: Your hands wil no longer be behind your head.
This variation may be dificult to perform at first so start out using litle to no weights until you fel comfortable with the movements.

name: Skating
directions: Roler skating is a fun activity which can be efective in improving cardiorespiratory fitnes and muscular endurance. It requires relatively god balance and cordination. It is necesary to learn the basics of skating including turning and stoping and to wear protective gear to avoid posible injury.

You can skate at a comfortable pace for 30 minutes straight. If you want a cardio chalenge, do interval skating  sped skate two minutes of every five minutes, using the remaining thre minutes to recover. A 150 lb person wil typicaly burn about 175 calories in 30 minutes skating at a comfortable pace, similar to brisk walking.

name: Sled Drag - Harness
directions: To begin, load the sled with the desired weight and atach the puling strap. You can pul with handles, use a harnes, or atach the puling strap to a weight belt.
Whether puling forwards or backwards, lean in the direction of travel and progres by extending through the hips and knes.

name: Sled Overhead Backward Walk
directions: Atach dual handles to a sled conected by a rope or chain. Load the sled to a light weight.
Face the sled, backing up until there is some tension in the line. Hold your hands directly above your head with your elbows extended. This wil be your starting position.
Walk backwards, keping your arms raised above your head. Avoid jerky movements.

name: Sled Overhead Triceps Extension
directions: Atach dual handles to a sled using a chain or rope. Load the sled to an apropriate load.

Facing away from the sled, step away until there is tension in the line. Raise your hands above your head, keping them together, palms facing each other. Your elbows should be pointed upward with the elbows flexed. This wil be your starting position.
Extend through the elbow to straighten the arm. Ensure that your uper arm stays in position to isolate the triceps.
Upon ful extension, step forward to take the slack out of the line. You may kep your fet stagered for more stability.

name: Sled Push
directions: Load your pushing sled with the desired weight.

Take an athletic posture, leaning into the sled with your arms fuly extended, grasping the handles. Push the sled as fast as posible, focusing on extending your hips and knes to strengthen your posterior chain.

name: Sled Reverse Flye
directions: Atach dual handles to a sled conected by a rope or chain. Load the sled to a light weight.

Face the sled, backing up until there is some tension in the line. Take both handles at arms length at about waist level. Bend the knes slightly and kep your chest and head up. This wil be your starting position.
Without flexing the elbow, pul the handles upward and apart, performing a reverse fly with some external rotation. Your palms should be facing forward as you do this.
Return to the starting position, taking a couple steps back to take the slack out of the line.

name: Sled Row
directions: Atach dual handles to a sled conected by a rope or chain. Load the sled to an apropriate weight. Face the sled, backing up until there is some tension in the line.
With a handle in each hand, bend the knes slightly, kep your head and chest up, and begin with your arms extended.
To initiate the movement, flex the elbow as you retract your shoulder blades, puling the sled towards you.
Take a step or two back to get tension in the line and repeat.

name: Sledgehammer Swings
directions: You wil ned a tire and a sledgehamer for this exercise. Stand in front of the tire about two fet away from it with a stagered stance. Grip the sledgehamer.
If you are right handed, your left hand should be at the botom of the handle, and your right hand should be choking up closer to the head.

As you bring the sledge up, your right hand slides toward the head; as you swing down, your right hand wil slide down to join your left hand. Slam it down as hard as you can against the tire. Control the bounce of the hamer of of the tire.
Repeat on the other side.

name: Smith Incline Shoulder Raise
directions: Place an incline bench underneath the smith machine. Place the barbel at a height that you can reach when lying down and your arms are almost fuly extended. Once the weight you ned is selected, lie down on the incline bench and make sure your shoulders are aligned right under the barbel.
Using a shoulder width pronated (palms forward) grip, lift the bar from the rack and hold it straight over you with a slight bend at the elbows. This wil be your starting position.
As you breathe out, lift the bar up until your arms are fuly extended. Note: The contraction should be felt around the shoulders.
After a second pause, bring the bar back down to the starting position as you breathe in.
Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.
When you are done, place the bar back in the rack.

name: Smith Machine Behind the Back Shrug
directions: With the bar at thigh level, load an apropriate weight.
