Stand with the bar behind you, taking a shoulder-width, pronated grip on the bar and unhok the weight. You should be standing up straight with your head and chest up and your arms extended. This wil be your starting position.
Initiate the movement by shruging your shoulders straight up. Do not flex the arms or wrist during the movement.
After a brief pause return the weight to the starting position.
Repeat for the desired number of repetitions before engaging the hoks to rack the weight.

name: Smith Machine Bench Press
directions: Place a flat bench underneath the smith machine. Now place the barbel at a height that you can reach when lying down and your arms are almost fuly extended. Once the weight you ned is selected, lie down on the flat bench. Using a pronated grip that is wider than shoulder width, unlock the bar from the rack and hold it straight over you with your arms locked. This wil be your starting position.
As you breathe in, come down slowly until you fel the bar on your midle chest.

After a second pause, bring the bar back to the starting position as you breathe out and push the bar using your chest muscles. Lock your arms in the contracted position, hold for a second and then start coming down slowly again. Tip: It should take at least twice as long to go down than to come up.
Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.
When you are done, lock the bar back in the rack.

name: Smith Machine Bent Over Row
directions: Set the barbel atached to the smith machine to a height that is about 2 inches below your knes.
Bend your knes slightly and bring your torso forward, by bending at the waist, while keping the back straight until it is almost paralel to the flor. Tip: Make sure that you kep the head up.

Now grasp the barbel using an overhand (pronated) grip and unlock it from the smith machine rack. Then let it hang directly in front of you as your arms hang extended perpendicular to the flor and your torso. This is your starting position.

While keping the torso stationary, lift the barbel as you breathe out, keping the elbows close to the body and not doing any force with the forearm other than holding the weights. On the top contracted position, squeze the back muscles and hold for a second.
Slowly lower the weight again to the starting position as you inhale.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.
This exercise is not recomended for people with back problems. A Low Puley Row is a beter choice for people with back isues.
Also, just like with the bent kne deadlift, if you have a healthy back, ensure perfect form and never slouch the back forward as this can cause back injury.
Be cautious as wel with the weight used; in case of doubt, use les weight rather than more.

name: Smith Machine Calf Raise
directions: Place a block or weight plate below the bar on the Smith machine. Set the bar to a position that best matches your height. Once the corect height is chosen and the bar is loaded, step onto the plates with the bals of your fet and place the bar on the back of your shoulders.
Take the bar with both hands facing forward. Rotate the bar to unrack it. This wil be your starting position.

Raise your hels as high as posible by pushing of of the bals of your fet, flexing your calf at the top of the contraction. Your knes should remain extended. Hold the contracted position for a second before you start to go back down.
Return slowly to the starting position as you breathe in while lowering your hels.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Smith Machine Close-Grip Bench Press
directions: Place a flat bench underneath the smith machine. Place the barbel at a height that you can reach when lying down and your arms are almost fuly extended. Once the weight you ned is selected, lie down on the flat bench. Using a close and pronated grip (palms facing forward) that is around shoulder width, unlock the bar from the rack and hold it straight over you with your arms locked. This wil be your starting position.

As you breathe in, come down slowly until you fel the bar on your midle chest. Tip: Make sure that as oposed to a regular bench pres, you kep the elbows close to the torso at al times in order to maximize triceps involvement.

After a second pause, bring the bar back to the starting position as you breathe out and push the bar using your triceps muscles. Lock your arms in the contracted position, hold for a second and then start coming down slowly again. Tip: It should take at least twice as long to go down than to come up.
Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.
When you are done, lock the bar back in the rack.

name: Smith Machine Decline Press
directions: Position a decline bench in the rack so that the bar wil be above your chest. Load an apropriate weight and take your place on the bench.
Rotate the bar to unhok it from the rack and fuly extend your arms. Your back should be slightly arched and your shoulder blades retracted. This wil be your starting position.
Begin the movement by flexing your arms, lowering the bar to your chest.
Pause briefly, and then extend your arms to push the weight back to the starting position.
After completing the desired number of repetitions, rotate the bar to rack the weight.

name: Smith Machine Hang Power Clean
directions: Position the bar at kne height and load it to an apropriate weight.

Take a pronated grip on the bar outside of shoulder width and unhok the bar from the machine. Your arms should be fuly extended with your head and chest up. Your elbows should be pointed out with your shoulders back and down. Your hips should be back, loading the tension into the hamstrings. This wil be your starting position.
Initate the movement by forcefuly extending the hips and knes, acelerating into the bar. Ensure that you kep your arms straight during this part of the motion.
Upon ful extension, rebend the hips and knes to lower your receiving position.
Alow the arms to flex at this point, rotating the elbows around the bar to receive it on your shoulders.
Extend through the hips and knes to come to a standing position with the bar racked on your shoulders to complete the movement.

name: Smith Machine Hip Raise
directions: Position a bench in the rack and load the bar to an apropriate weight. Lie down on the bench, placing the botom of your fet against the bar. Unlock the bar and extend your legs. You may ned to use your hands to asist you. For aded stability grasp the sides of the Smith Machine. This wil be your starting position.
Initiate the movement by rotating your pelvis, flexing your spine to raise your hips of of the bench. Maintain a slight bend in the knes throughout the motion.
After a brief pause, return the hips to the bench.
Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

name: Smith Machine Incline Bench Press
directions: Place an incline bench underneath the smith machine. Place the barbel at a height that you can reach when lying down and your arms are almost fuly extended. Once the weight you ned is selected, lie down on the incline bench and make sure your uper chest is aligned with the barbel. Using a pronated grip (palms facing forward) that is wider than shoulder width, unlock the bar from the rack and hold it straight over you with your arms locked. This wil be your starting position.
As you breathe in, come down slowly until you fel the bar on your uper chest.

After a second pause, bring the bar back to the starting position as you breathe out and push the bar using your chest muscles. Lock your arms in the contracted position, hold for a second and then start coming down slowly again. Tip: It should take at least twice as long to go down than to come up.
Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.
When you are done, place the bar back in the rack.

name: Smith Machine Leg Press
directions: Position a Smith machine bar a couple fet of of the ground. Ensure that it is resting on the safeties. After loading the bar to an apropriate weight, lie underneath the bar. Place the midle of your fet on the bar, tucking your knes to your chest. This wil be your starting position.
Begin the movement by driving through your fet to move the bar upward, extending the hips and knes. Do not lock out your knes.
At the top of the motion, pause briefly before returning to the starting position.

name: Smith Machine One-Arm Upright Row
directions: With the bar at thigh level, load an apropriate weight.

Take a wide grip on the bar and unhok the weight, removing your of hand from the bar. Your arm should be extended as you stand up straight with your head and chest up. This wil be your starting position.
Begin the movement by flexing the elbow, raising the uper arm with the elbow pointed out. Continue until your uper arm is paralel to the flor.
After a brief pause, return the weight to the starting position.
Repeat for the desired number of repetitions before engaging the hoks to rack the weight.

name: Smith Machine Overhead Shoulder Press
directions: To begin, place a flat bench (or preferably one with back suport) underneath a smith machine. Position the barbel at a height so that when seated on the flat bench, the arms must be almost fuly extended to reach the barbel.

Once you have the corect height, sit slightly in behind the barbel so that there is an imaginary straight line from the tip of your nose to the barbel. Your fet should be stationary. Grab the barbel with the palms facing forward, unlock it and lift it up so that your arms are fuly extended. This is the starting position.
Slowly begin to lower the barbel until it is level with your chin while inhaling.
Then lift the barbel back to the starting position using your shoulders while exhaling.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Smith Machine Pistol Squat
directions: To begin, first set the bar to a position that best matches your height. Step under it and position the bar acros the back of your shoulders.

Take the bar with your hands facing forward, unlock it and lift it of the rack by extending your legs.
3

Move one fot forward about 12 inches in front of the bar. Extend the other leg out in front of you, holding it of the ground. Lok forward at al times and maintain a neutral or slightly arched spine. This wil be your starting position.
Maintaining god posture, lower yourself by flexing the kne and hip, going down as far as flexibility alows.
Pause briefly at the botom and then return to the starting position by driving through the hel of your fot, extending the kne and hip.

name: Smith Machine Reverse Calf Raises
directions: Adjust the barbel on the smith machine to fit your height and align a raised platform right under the bar.
Stand on the platform with the hels of your fet secured on top of it with the bals of your fet extending of it. Position your toes facing forward with a shoulder width stance.

Now, place your shoulders under the barbel while maintaining the fot positioning described and push the barbel up by extending your hips and knes until your torso is standing erect. The knes should be kept with a slight bend; never locked. This wil be your starting position. Tip: The barbel on your back is only for balance purposes.

Raise the bals of your fet as you breathe out by extending your toes as high as posible and flexing your calf. Ensure that the kne is kept stationary at al times. There should be no bending at any time. Hold the contracted position for a second before you start to go back down.
Slowly go back down to the starting position as you breathe in by lowering the bals of your fet and toes.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Smith Machine Shrug
directions: To begin, set the bar height on the smith machine around the midle of your thighs. Once the corect height is chosen and the bar is loaded, grab the bar using a pronated grip (palms facing you) shoulder width apart from each other.
Lift the barbel up and fuly extend your arms with your back straight. This is the starting position.
While exhaling, elevate the bar by raising your shoulders until they come close to touching your ears.
Hold the contraction for a second before lowering the bar back down to the starting position while inhaling.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

This exercise can be performed using a squat rack with a barbel. However, be careful not to select a weight that is so heavy that it causes you to break god form as you do not have the suport of the smith machine for this variation. To much weight can harm your back.
You can also use dumbels to perform this exercise.

name: Smith Machine Squat
directions: To begin, first set the bar on the height that best matches your height. Once the corect height is chosen and the bar is loaded, step under the bar and place the back of your shoulders (slightly below the neck) acros it.
Hold on to the bar using both arms at each side (palms facing forward), unlock it and lift it of the rack by first pushing with your legs and at the same time straightening your torso.

Position your legs using a shoulder width medium stance with the toes slightly pointed out. Kep your head up at al times and also maintain a straight back. This wil be your starting position. (Note: For the purposes of this discusion we wil use the medium stance which targets overal development; however you can chose any of the thre stances discused in the fot stances section).

Begin to slowly lower the bar by bending the knes as you maintain a straight posture with the head up. Continue down until the angle betwen the uper leg and the calves becomes slightly les than 90-degres (which is the point in which the uper legs are below paralel to the flor). Inhale as you perform this portion of the movement. Tip: If you performed the exercise corectly, the front of the knes should make an imaginary straight line with the toes that is perpendicular to the front. If your knes are past that imaginary line (if they are past your toes) then you are placing undue stres on the kne and the exercise has ben performed incorectly.
Begin to raise the bar as you exhale by pushing the flor with the hel of your fot as you straighten the legs again and go back to the starting position.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Smith Machine Stiff-Legged Deadlift
directions: To begin, set the bar on the smith machine to a height that is around the midle of your thighs. Once the corect height is chosen and the bar is loaded, grasp the bar using a pronated (palms forward) grip that is shoulder width apart. You may ned some wrist wraps if using a significant amount of weight.

Lift the bar up by fuly extending your arms while keping your back straight. Stand with your torso straight and your legs spaced using a shoulder width or narower stance. The knes should be slightly bent. This is your starting position.

Keping the knes stationary, lower the barbel to over the top of your fet by bending at the waist while keping your back straight. Kep moving forward as if you were going to pick something from the flor until you fel a stretch on the hamstrings. Exhale as you perform this movement
Start bringing your torso up straight again as son as you fel the hamstrings stretch by extending your hips and waist until you are back at the starting position. Inhale as you perform this movement.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Smith Machine Upright Row
directions: To begin, set the bar on the smith machine to a height that is around the midle of your thighs. Once the corect height is chosen and the bar is loaded, grasp the bar using a pronated (palms forward) grip that is shoulder width apart. You may ned some wrist wraps if using a significant amount of weight.
Lift the barbel up and fuly extend your arms with your back straight. There should be a slight bend at the elbows. This is the starting position.

Use your side shoulders to lift the bar as you exhale. The bar should be close to the body as you move it up. Continue to lift it until it nearly touches your chin. Tip: Your elbows should drive the motion. As you lift the bar, your elbows should always be higher than your forearms. Also, kep your torso stationary and pause for a second at the top of the movement.
Lower the bar back down slowly to the starting position. Inhale as you perform this portion of the movement.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Smith Single-Leg Split Squat
directions: To begin, place a flat bench 2-3 fet behind the smith machine. Then, set the bar on the height that best matches your height. Once the corect height is chosen and the bar is loaded, step under the bar and place the back of your shoulders (slightly below the neck) acros it.
Hold on to the bar using both arms at each side (palms facing forward), unlock it and lift it of the rack by first pushing with your legs and at the same time straightening your torso.
Position your legs by placing one fot slightly forward under the bar and extending your other leg back and place the top of your fot on the bench. This wil be your starting position

Begin to slowly lower the bar by bending the kne as you maintain a straight posture with the head up. Continue down until the angle betwen the uper leg and the calf becomes slightly les than 90-degres (which is the point in which the uper legs are below paralel to the flor). Inhale as you perform this portion of the movement. Tip: If you performed the exercise corectly, the front of the kne should make an imaginary straight line with the toes that is perpendicular to the front. If your kne is past that imaginary line (if it is past your toes) then you are placing undue stres on the kne and the exercise has ben performed incorectly.
Begin to raise the bar as you exhale by pushing the flor with the hel of your fot mainly as you straighten your leg again and go back to the starting position.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.
Switch legs and repeat the movement.

name: Snatch
directions: Place your fet at a shoulder width stance with the barbel resting right above the conection betwen the toes and the rest of the fot.

With a palms facing down grip, bend at the knes and keping the back flat grab the bar using a wider than shoulder width grip. Bring the hips down and make sure that your body drops as if you were going to sit on a chair. This wil be your starting position.
Start pushing the flor as if it were a moving platform with your fet and simultaneously start lifting the barbel keping it close to your legs.
As the bar reaches the midle of your thighs, push the flor with your legs and lift your body to a complete extension in an explosive motion.
Lift your shoulders back in a shruging movement as you bring the bar up while lifting your elbows out to the side and keping them above the bar for as long as posible.

Now in a very quick but powerful motion, you have to get your body under the barbel when it has reached a high enough point where it can be controled and drop while locking your arms and holding the barbel overhead as you asume a squat position.
Finalize the movement by rising up out of the squat position to finish the lift. At the end of the lift both fet should be on line and the arms fuly extended holding the barbel overhead.

name: Snatch Balance
directions: Begin with the fet in the puling position, the bar racked acros the back of the shoulders, and the hands placed in a wide snatch grip.
Pop the bar with an abrupt dip and drive of the knes, and agresively drive under the bar, transitioning the fet into the receiving position.
Receive the bar locked out overhead near the botom of the squat. The torso should remain vertical, lowering the hips betwen the legs.
Continue to descend to ful depth, and return to a standing position. Carefuly lower the weight.

name: Snatch Deadlift
directions: The snatch deadlift strengthens the first pul of the snatch. Begin with a wide snatch grip with the barbel placed on the platform. The fet should be directly under the hips, with the fet turned out. Squat down to the bar, keping the back in absolute extension with the head facing forward.
Initiate the movement by driving through the hels, raising the hips. The back angle should remain the same until the bar pases the knes.
At that point, drive your hips through the bar as you lay back. Return the bar to the platform by reversing the motion.

name: Snatch from Blocks
directions: Begin with a loaded barbel on boxes or stands of the desired height. A wide grip should be taken on the bar. The fet should be directly below the hips, with the fet turned out as neded. Lower the hips, with the chest up and the head loking forward. The shoulders should be just in front of the bar, with the elbows pointed out. This wil be the starting position.
Begin the first pul by driving through the front of the hels, raising the bar from the boxes.

Transition into the second pul by extending through the hips knes and ankles, driving the bar up as quickly as posible. The bar should be close to the body. At peak extension, shrug the shoulders and alow the elbows to flex to the side.

As you move your fet into the receiving position, forcefuly pul yourself below the bar as you elevate the bar overhead. The fet should move to just outside the hips, turned out as necesary. Receive the bar with your body as low as posible and the arms fuly extended overhead.
Keping the bar aligned over the front of the hels, your head and chest up, drive through hels of the fet to move to a standing position. Carefuly return the weight to the boxes.

name: Snatch Pull
directions: With a barbel on the flor close to the shins, take a wide snatch grip. Lower your hips with the weight focused on the hels, back straight, head facing forward, chest up, with your shoulders just in front of the bar. This wil be your starting position.

Begin the first pul by driving through the hels, extending your knes. Your back angle should stay the same, and your arms should remain straight. Move the weight with control as you continue to above the knes.

Next comes the second pul, the main source of aceleration for the pul. As the bar aproaches the mid-thigh position, begin extending through the hips. In a jumping motion, acelerate by extending the hips, knes, and ankles, using sped to move the bar upward.

There should be no ned to actively pul through the arms to acelerate the weight; at the end of the second pul, the body should be fuly extended, leaning slightly back. Ful extension should be violent and abrupt, and ensure that you do not prolong the extension for longer than necesary.

name: Snatch Shrug
directions: Begin with a wide grip, with the bar hanging at the mid thigh position. You can use a hok or overhand grip. Your back should be straight and inclined slightly forward.
Shrug your shoulders towards your ears. While this exercise can usualy by loaded with heavier weight than a snatch, avoid overloading to the point that the execution slows down.

name: Speed Band Overhead Triceps
directions: For this exercise anchor a band to the ground. We used an incline bench and anchored the band to the base, standing over the bench. Alternatively, this could be performed standing on the band.
To begin, pul the band behind your head, holding it with a pronated grip and your elbows up. This wil be your starting position.
To perform the movement, extend through the elbow to to straighten your arms, ensuring that you kep your uper arm in place.
Pause, and then return to the starting position.

name: Speed Band Pushdown
directions: Choke a band onto a pul up bar.
Grasp the band with a pronated grip, hands close together.
Begining with the elbow flexed, extend the elbow to straighten your arms, ensuring you kep your uper arm in place.
Pause briefly, and return to the starting position.

name: Speed Box Squat
directions: Atach bands to the bar that are securely anchored near the ground. You may ned to choke the bands to get adequate tension.

Use a box of an apropriate height for this exercise. Load the bar to a weight that stil requires efort, but isn't so heavy that sped is compromised. Typicaly, that wil be betwen 50-70% of your one rep max.
Position the bar on your uper back, shoulder blades retracted, back arched and everything tight head to toe. This wil be the starting position.
Unrack the bar and position yourself in front of the box. Sit back with your hips until you are seated on the box, ensuring that you descend under control and don't crash onto the surface.
Pause briefly, and explode of of the box, extending through the hips and knes.

name: Speed Squats
directions: This exercise is best performed inside a squat rack for safety purposes. To begin, first set the bar on a rack that best matches your height. Once the corect height is chosen and the bar is loaded, step under the bar and place the back of your shoulders (slightly below the neck) acros it.
Hold on to the bar using both arms at each side and lift it of the rack by first pushing with your legs and at the same time straightening your torso.

Step away from the rack and position your legs using a shoulder width medium stance with the toes slightly pointed out. Kep your head up at al times as loking down wil get you of balance and also maintain a straight back. This wil be your starting position. (Note: For the purposes of this discusion we wil use the medium stance which targets overal development; however you can chose any of the thre stances discused in the fot stances section).

Begin to lower the bar by bending the knes as you maintain a straight posture with the head up. Continue down until the angle betwen the uper leg and the calves becomes slightly les than 90-degres (which is the point in which the uper legs are below paralel to the flor). Inhale as you perform this portion of the movement. Tip: If you performed the exercise corectly, the front of the knes should make an imaginary straight line with the toes that is perpendicular to the front. If your knes are past that imaginary line (if they are past your toes) then you are placing undue stres on the kne and the exercise has ben performed incorectly.

Begin to raise the bar as fast as posible without involving momentum as you exhale by pushing the flor with the hel of your fot mainly as you straighten the legs again and go back to the starting position. Note: You should perform these exercises as fast as posible but without breaking perfect form and without involving momentum.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Spell Caster
directions: Hold a dumbel in each hand with a pronated grip. Your fet should be wide with your hips and knes extended. This wil be your starting position.
Begin the movement by puling both of the dumbels to one side next to your hip, rotating your torso.
Keping your arms straight and the dumbels paralel to the ground, rotate your torso to swing the weights to your oposite side.
Continue alternating, rotating from one side to the other until the set is complete.

name: Spider Crawl
directions: Begin in a prone position on the flor. Suport your weight on your hands and toes, with your fet together and your body straight. Your arms should be bent to 90 degres. This wil be your starting position.
Initiate the movement by raising one fot of of the ground. Externaly rotate the leg and bring the kne toward your elbow, as far forward as posible.
Return this leg to the starting position and repeat on the oposite side.

name: Spider Curl
directions: Start out by seting the bar on the part of the preacher bench that you would normaly sit on. Make sure to align the barbel properly so that it is balanced and wil not fal of.

Move to the front side of the preacher bench (the part where the arms usualy lay) and position yourself to lay at a 45 degre slant with your torso and stomach presed against the front side of the preacher bench.
Make sure that your fet (especialy the toes) are wel positioned on the flor and place your uper arms on top of the pad located on the inside part of the preacher bench.
Use your arms to grab the barbel with a supinated grip (palms facing up) at about shoulder width apart or slightly closer from each other.
Slowly begin to lift the barbel upwards and exhale. Hold the contracted position for a second as you squeze the biceps.
Slowly begin to bring the barbel back to the starting position as your breathe in. .
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Spinal Stretch
directions: Sit in a chair so your back is straight and your fet planted on the flor.
Interlace your fingers behind your head, elbows out and your chin down.
Twist your uper body to one side about 3 times as far as you can. Then lean forward and twist your torso to reach your elbow to the flor on the inside of your kne.
Return to upright position and then repeat for your other side.

name: Split Clean
directions: With a barbel on the flor close to the shins, take an overhand grip just outside the legs. Lower your hips with the weight focused on the hels, back straight, head facing forward, chest up, with your shoulders just in front of the bar. This wil be your starting position.

Begin the first pul by driving through the hels, extending your knes. Your back angle should stay the same, and your arms should remain straight. Move the weight with control as you continue to above the knes.

Next comes the second pul, the main source of aceleration for the clean. As the bar aproaches the mid-thigh position, begin extending through the hips. In a jumping motion, acelerate by extending the hips, knes, and ankles, using sped to move the bar upward. There should be no ned to actively pul through the arms to acelerate the weight; at the end of the second pul, the body should be fuly extended, leaning slightly back, with the arms stil extended.

As ful extension is achieved, transition into the third pul by agresively shruging and flexing the arms with the elbows up and out. At peak extension, agresively pul yourself down, rotating your elbows under the bar as you do so.

Receive the bar with the fet split, agresively moving one fot forward and one fot back. The bar should be racked onto the protracted shoulders, lightly touching the throat with the hands relaxed. Continue to descend to the botom position, which wil help in the recovery.
Imediately recover by driving through the hels, keping the torso upright and elbows up. Bring the fet together as you stand up.

name: Split Jerk
directions: Standing with the weight racked on the front of the shoulders, begin with the dip. With your fet directly under your hips, flex the knes without moving the hips backward.

Go down only slightly, and reverse direction as powerfuly as posible. Drive through the hels create as much sped and force as posible, and be sure to move your head out of the way as the bar leaves the shoulders. At this moment as the fet leave the flor, the fet must be placed into the receiving position as quickly as posible.

In the brief moment the fet are not actively driving against the platform, the athletes efort to push the bar up wil drive them down. The fet should be moved to a split stance, one fot forward, one fot back, with the knes partialy bent. Receive the bar with the arms locked out overhead.
Return to a standing position, bringing the fet together.

name: Split Jump
directions: Asume a lunge stance position with one fot forward with the kne bent, and the rear kne nearly touching the ground.
Ensure that the front kne is over the midline of the fot.
Extending through both legs, jump as high as posible, swinging your arms to gain lift.
As you jump, bring your fet together, and move them back to their initial positions as you land.
Absorb the impact by reverting back to the starting position.

name: Split Snatch
directions: Begin with a loaded barbel on the flor. The bar should be close to or touching the shins, and a wide grip should be taken on the bar. The fet should be directly below the hips, with the fet turned out as neded. Lower the hips, with the chest up and the head loking forward. The shoulders should be just in front of the bar. This wil be the starting position.
Begin the first pul by driving through the front of the hels, raising the bar from the ground. The back angle should stay the same until the bar pases the knes.

Transition into the second pul by extending through the hips knes and ankles, driving the bar up as quickly as posible. The bar should be close to the body. At peak extension, shrug the shoulders and alow the elbows to flex to the side.

As you move your fet into the receiving position, forcefuly pul yourself below the bar as you elevate the bar overhead. The fet should move forcefuly to a split position, one fot forward one fot back. Receive the bar with your body as low as posible and the arms fuly extended overhead.
Keping the bar aligned over the front of the hels, your head and chest up, drive through hels of the fet to move to a standing position, bringing your fet together.
Carefuly return the weight to flor.

name: Split Squat with Dumbbells
directions: Position yourself into a stagered stance with the rear fot elevated and front fot forward.
Hold a dumbel in each hand, leting them hang at the sides. This wil be your starting position.
Begin by descending, flexing your kne and hip to lower your body down. Maintain god posture througout the movement. Kep the front kne in line with the fot as you perform the exercise.
At the botom of the movement, drive through the hel to extend the kne and hip to return to the starting position.

name: Split Squats
directions: Being in a standing position. Jump into a split leg position, with one leg forward and one leg back, flexing the knes and lowering your hips slightly as you do so.
As you descend, imediately reverse direction, standing back up and jumping, reversing the position of your legs. Repeat 5-10 times on each leg.

name: Squat Jerk
directions: Standing with the weight racked on the front of the shoulders, begin with the dip. With your fet directly under your hips, flex the knes without moving the hips backward. Go down only slightly, and reverse direction as powerfuly as posible. Drive through the hels create as much sped and force as posible, and be sure to move your head out of the way as the bar leaves the shoulders.

At this moment as the fet leave the flor, the fet must be placed into the receiving position as quickly as posible. In the brief moment the fet are not actively driving against the platform, the athletes efort to push the bar up wil drive them down. The fet should move forcefuly to just outside the hips, turned out as necesary. Receive the bar with your body in a ful squat and the arms fuly extended overhead.
Keping the bar aligned over the front of the hels, your head and chest up, drive throught hels of the fet to move to a standing position. Carefuly return the weight to flor.

name: Squat with Bands
directions: Set up the bands on the sleves, secured to either band pegs, the rack, or dumbels so that there is apropriate tension.

Begin by steping under the bar and placing it acros the back of the shoulders. Squeze your shoulder blades together and rotate your elbows forward, atempting to bend the bar acros your shoulders. Remove the bar from the rack, creating a tight arch in your lower back, and step back into position. Place your fet wide for more emphasis on the back, glutes, aductors, and hamstrings. Kep your head facing forward.

With your back, shoulders, and core tight, push your knes and but out and you begin your descent. Sit back with your hips as much as posible. Idealy, your shins should be perpendicular to the ground. Lower bar position necesitates a greater torso lean to kep the bar over the hels. Continue until you break paralel, which is defined as the crease of the hip being in line with the top of the kne.

Keping the weight on your hels and pushing your fet and knes out, drive upward as you lead the movement with your head. Continue upward, maintaining tightnes head to toe, until you have returned to the starting position.

name: Squat with Chains
directions: To set up the chains, begin by loping the leader chain over the sleves of the bar. The heavy chain should be atached using a snap hok. Adjust the length of the lead chain so that a few links are stil on the flor at the top of the movement.

Begin by steping under the bar and placing it acros the back of the shoulders. Squeze your shoulder blades together and rotate your elbows forward, atempting to bend the bar acros your shoulders. Remove the bar from the rack, creating a tight arch in your lower back, and step back into position. Place your fet wide for more emphasis on the back, glutes, aductors, and hamstrings. Kep your head facing forward.

With your back, shoulders, and core tight, push your knes and but out and you begin your descent. Sit back with your hips as much as posible. Idealy, your shins should be perpendicular to the ground. Lower bar position necesitates a greater torso lean to kep the bar over the hels. Continue until you break paralel, which is defined as the crease of the hip being in line with the top of the kne.

Keping the weight on your hels and pushing your fet and knes out, drive upward as you lead the movement with your head. Continue upward, maintaining tightnes head to toe, until you have returned to the starting position.

name: Squat with Plate Movers
directions: To begin, first set the bar on a rack to just below shoulder level. Position a weight plate on the ground a couple fet back from the rack. Once the bar is loaded, step under it and place the back of your shoulders acros it.
Hold on to the bar with both hands and lift it of the rack by first pushing with your legs and at the same time straighten your torso.
Step away from the rack and adopt a wide stance with the toes slightly pointed out, with one fot on the weight plate. Kep your head up at al times. This wil be your starting position.
Begin to slowly lower the bar by bending the knes and hips. Continue down until the angle betwen the uper leg and the calves becomes slightly les than 90-degres.
Raise the bar as you exhale by pushing the flor with the hels of your fet as you extend the hips and knes.
At the top of the movement, side step, bringing your fet together on the oposite side of the plate.
Using your inside fot, push the weight plate, sliding it acros the flor to where you were just standing.
Place your inside fot on the weight plate, adopting a wide stance for the next repetition.

name: Squats - With Bands
directions: To start out, make sure that the exercise band is at an even split betwen both the left and right side of the body. To do this, use your hands to grab both sides of the band and place both fet in the midle of the band. Your fet should be shoulder width apart from each other.

When holding the bands, they should be the same height on each side. You should be using a pronated grip (palms facing forward) and have the handles of the bands next to your face for this exercise. This is the starting position.
Slowly start to bend the knes and lower the legs so that your thighs are paralel to the flor while exhaling.
Use the hel of your fet to push your body up to the starting position as you exhale.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Stairmaster
directions: To begin, step onto the stairmaster and select the desired option from the menu. You can chose a manual seting, or you can select a program to run. Typicaly, you can enter your age and weight to estimate the amount of calories burned during exercise.

Pump your legs up and down in an established rhythm, driving the pedals down but not al the way to the flor. It is recomended that you maintain your grip on the handles so that you dont fal. The handles can be used to monitor your heart rate to help you stay at an apropriate intensity.

Stairmasters ofer convenience, cardiovascular benefits, and usualy have les impact than runing outside. They are typicaly much harder than other cardio equipment. A 150 lb person wil typicaly burn over 30 calories in 30 minutes, compared to about 175 calories walking.

name: Standing Alternating Dumbbell Press
directions: Stand with a dumbel in each hand. Raise the dumbels to your shoulders with your palms facing forward and your elbows pointed out. This wil be your starting position.
Extend one arm to pres the dumbel straight up, keping your of hand in place. Do not lean or jerk the weight during the movement.
After a brief pause, return the weight to the starting position.
Repeat for the oposite side, continuing to alternate betwen arms.

name: Standing Barbell Calf Raise
directions: This exercise is best performed inside a squat rack for safety purposes. To begin, first set the bar on a rack that best matches your height. Once the corect height is chosen and the bar is loaded, step under the bar and place the bar on the back of your shoulders (slightly below the neck).
Hold on to the bar using both arms at each side and lift it of the rack by first pushing with your legs and at the same time straightening your torso.

Step away from the rack and position your legs using a shoulder width medium stance with the toes slightly pointed out. Kep your head up at al times as loking down wil get you of balance and also maintain a straight back. The knes should be kept with a slight bend; never locked. This wil be your starting position. Tip: For beter range of motion you may also place the bal of your fet on a woden block but be careful as this option requires more balance and a sturdy block.

Raise your hels as you breathe out by extending your ankles as high as posible and flexing your calf. Ensure that the kne is kept stationary at al times. There should be no bending at any time. Hold the contracted position by a second before you start to go back down.
Go back slowly to the starting position as you breathe in by lowering your hels as you bend the ankles until calves are stretched.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Standing Barbell Press Behind Neck
directions: This exercise is best performed inside a squat rack for easier pick up of the bar. To begin, first set the bar on a rack that best matches your height. Once the corect height is chosen and the bar is loaded, step under the bar and place the back of your shoulders (slightly below the neck) acros it.
Hold on to the bar using both arms at each side and lift it of the rack by first pushing with your legs and at the same time straightening your torso.

Step away from the rack and position your legs using a shoulder width medium stance with the toes slightly pointed out. Your back should be kept straight while performing this exercise. This wil be your starting position.
Elevate the barbel overhead by fuly extending your arms while breathing out.
Hold the contraction for a second and lower the barbel back down to the starting position by inhaling.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Standing Bent-Over One-Arm Dumbbell Triceps Extension
directions: With a dumbel in one hand and the palm facing your torso, bend your knes slightly and bring your torso forward, by bending at the waist, while keping the back straight until it is almost paralel to the flor. Make sure that you kep the head up.

The uper arm should be close to the torso and paralel to the flor while the forearm is pointing towards the flor as the hand holds the weight. Tip: There should be a 90-degre angle betwen the forearm and the uper arm. This is your starting position.

Keping the uper arms stationary, use the triceps to lift the weights as you exhale until the forearms are paralel to the flor and the whole arm is extended. Like many other arm exercises, only the forearm moves.
After a second contraction at the top, slowly lower the dumbel back to the starting position as you inhale.
Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.
Switch arms and repeat the exercise.

name: Standing Bent-Over Two-Arm Dumbbell Triceps Extension
directions: With a dumbel in each hand and the palms facing your torso, bend your knes slightly and bring your torso forward, by bending at the waist, while keping the back straight until it is almost paralel to the flor. Make sure that you kep the head up. The uper arms should be close to the torso and paralel to the flor while the forearms are pointing towards the flor as the hands hold the weights. Tip: There should be a 90-degre angle betwen the forearms and the uper arm. This is your starting position.

Keping the uper arms stationary, use the triceps to lift the weights as you exhale until the forearms are paralel to the flor and the whole arms are extended. Like many other arm exercises, only the forearm moves.
After a second contraction at the top, slowly lower the dumbels back to their starting position as you inhale.
Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.
This exercise can be executed also one arm at a time.

Also, if you like the one arm variety, you can use a single hand handle or rope atachment instead of a dumbel for beter peak contraction. In this case of the single hand handle, the palms should be facing up as oposed to the torso.

name: Standing Biceps Cable Curl
directions: Stand up with your torso upright while holding a cable curl bar that is atached to a low puley. Grab the cable bar at shoulder width and kep the elbows close to the torso. The palm of your hands should be facing up (supinated grip). This wil be your starting position.

While holding the uper arms stationary, curl the weights while contracting the biceps as you breathe out. Only the forearms should move. Continue the movement until your biceps are fuly contracted and the bar is at shoulder level. Hold the contracted position for a second as you squeze the muscle.
Slowly begin to bring the curl bar back to starting position as your breathe in.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Standing Biceps Stretch
directions: Clasp your hands behind your back with your palms together, straighten arms and then rotate them so your palms face downward.
Raise your arms up and hold until you fel a stretch in your biceps.

name: Standing Bradford Press
directions: Place a loaded bar at shoulder level in a rack. With a pronated grip at shoulder width, begin with the bar racked acros the front of your shoulders. This is your starting position.
Initiate the lift by extending the elbows to pres the bar overhead. Avoid locking out the elbow as you move the weight behind your head.
Lower the bar down to the back of the head until your elbow forms a right angle.
Lift the bar back over your head by extending the elbows
Lower the bar down to the starting position.
Alternate in this maner until you complete the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Standing Cable Chest Press
directions: Position dual puleys to chest height and select an apropriate weight. Stand a fot or two in front of the cables, holding one in each hand. You can stager your stance for beter stability.
Position the uper arm at a 90 degre angle with the shoulder blades together. This wil be your starting position.
Keping the rest of the body stationary, extend through the elbows to pres the handles forward, drawing them together in front of you.
Pause at the top of the motion, and return to the starting position.

name: Standing Cable Lift
directions: Conect a standard handle on a tower, and move the cable to the lowest puley position.

With your side to the cable, grab the handle with one hand and step away from the tower. You should be aproximately arms length away from the puley, with the tension of the weight on the cable. Your outstretched arm should be aligned with the cable.
With your fet positioned shoulder width apart, squat down and grab the handle with both hands. Your arms should stil be fuly extended.
In one motion, pul the handle up and acros your body until your arms are in a fuly-extended position above your head.
Kep your back straight and your arms close to your body as you pivot your back fot and straighten your legs to get a ful range of motion.
Retract your arms and then your body. Return to the neutral position in a slow and controled maner.
Repeat to failure.
Then, reposition and repeat the same series of movements on the oposite side.

name: Standing Cable Wood Chop
directions: Conect a standard handle to a tower, and move the cable to the highest puley position.

With your side to the cable, grab the handle with one hand and step away from the tower. You should be aproximately arms length away from the puley, with the tension of the weight on the cable. Your outstretched arm should be aligned with the cable.
With your fet positioned shoulder width apart, reach upward with your other hand and grab the handle with both hands. Your arms should stil be fuly extended.
In one motion, pul the handle down and acros your body to your front kne while rotating your torso.
Kep your back and arms straight and core tight while you pivot your back fot and bend your knes to get a ful range of motion.
Maintain your stance and straight arms. Return to the neutral position in a slow and controled maner.
Repeat to failure.
Then, reposition and repeat the same series of movements on the oposite side.

name: Standing Calf Raises
directions: Adjust the paded lever of the calf raise machine to fit your height.

Place your shoulders under the pads provided and position your toes facing forward (or using any of the two other positions described at the begining of the chapter). The bals of your fet should be secured on top of the calf block with the hels extending of it. Push the lever up by extending your hips and knes until your torso is standing erect. The knes should be kept with a slight bend; never locked. Toes should be facing forward, outwards or inwards as described at the begining of the chapter. This wil be your starting position.

Raise your hels as you breathe out by extending your ankles as high as posible and flexing your calf. Ensure that the kne is kept stationary at al times. There should be no bending at any time. Hold the contracted position by a second before you start to go back down.
Go back slowly to the starting position as you breathe in by lowering your hels as you bend the ankles until calves are stretched.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Standing Concentration Curl
directions: Taking a dumbel in your working hand, lean forward. Alow your working arm to hang perpendicular to the ground with the elbow pointing out. This wil be your starting position.
Flex the elbow to curl the weight, keping the uper arm stationary. At the top of the repetition, flex the biceps and pause.
Lower the dumbel back to the starting position.
Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.

name: Standing Dumbbell Calf Raise
directions: Stand with your torso upright holding two dumbels in your hands by your sides. Place the bal of the fot on a sturdy and stable woden board (that is around 2-3 inches tal) while your hels extend of and touch the flor. This wil be your starting position.

With the toes pointing either straight (to hit al parts equaly), inwards (for emphasis on the outer head) or outwards (for emphasis on the iner head), raise the hels of the flor as you exhale by contracting the calves. Hold the top contraction for a second.
As you inhale, go back to the starting position by slowly lowering the hels.
Repeat for the recomended amount of times.

name: Standing Dumbbell Press
directions: Standing with your fet shoulder width apart, take a dumbel in each hand. Raise the dumbels to head height, the elbows out and about 90 degres. This wil be your starting position.
Maintaining strict technique with no leg drive or leaning back, extend through the elbow to raise the weights together directly above your head.
Pause, and slowly return the weight to the starting position.

name: Standing Dumbbell Reverse Curl
directions: To begin, stand straight with a dumbel in each hand using a pronated grip (palms facing down). Your arms should be fuly extended while your fet are shoulder width apart from each other. This is the starting position.

While holding the uper arms stationary, curl the weights while contracting the biceps as you breathe out. Only the forearms should move. Continue the movement until your biceps are fuly contracted and the dumbels are at shoulder level. Hold the contracted position for a second as you squeze the muscle.
Slowly begin to bring the dumbels back to starting position as your breathe in.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Standing Dumbbell Straight-Arm Front Delt Raise Above Head
directions: Hold the dumbels in front of your thighs, palms facing your thighs.
Kep your arms straight with a slight bend at the elbows but kep them locked. This wil be your starting position.
Raise the dumbels in a semicircular motion to arm's length overhead as you exhale.
Slowly return to the starting position using the same path as you inhale.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Standing Dumbbell Triceps Extension
directions: To begin, stand up with a dumbel held by both hands. Your fet should be about shoulder width apart from each other. Slowly use both hands to grab the dumbel and lift it over your head until both arms are fuly extended.
The resistance should be resting in the palms of your hands with your thumbs around it. The palm of the hands should be facing up towards the ceiling. This wil be your starting position.

Keping your uper arms close to your head with elbows in and perpendicular to the flor, lower the resistance in a semicircular motion behind your head until your forearms touch your biceps. Tip: The uper arms should remain stationary and only the forearms should move. Breathe in as you perform this step.
Go back to the starting position by using the triceps to raise the dumbel. Breathe out as you perform this step.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

Another way to perform this exercise is to use an e-z or straight bar instead in which case you wil be holding the bar from the inside (around 5 inches betwen both hands) with the palms facing forward (pronated grip).
There is also a bar that has paralel bars inside (often refered to as a triceps blaster) and this can also be used for this exercise.
Finaly, a low puley cable with a rope atachment or bar (straight or e-z) atachment at the end can be used as wel for variety purposes as wel.

name: Standing Dumbbell Upright Row
directions: Grasp a dumbel in each hand with a pronated (palms forward) grip that is slightly les than shoulder width. The dumbels should be resting on top of your thighs. Your arms should be extended with a slight bend at the elbows and your back should be straight. This wil be your starting position.

Use your side shoulders to lift the dumbels as you exhale. The dumbels should be close to the body as you move it up and the elbows should drive the motion. Continue to lift them until they nearly touch your chin. Tip: Your elbows should drive the motion. As you lift the dumbels, your elbows should always be higher than your forearms. Also, kep your torso stationary and pause for a second at the top of the movement.
Lower the dumbels back down slowly to the starting position. Inhale as you perform this portion of the movement.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Standing Elevated Quad Stretch
directions: Start by standing with your back about two to thre fet away from a bench or step.
Lift one leg behind you and rest your fot on the step,either on your instep or the bal of your fot, whichever you find most comfortable.
Kep your suporting kne slightly bent and avoid leting that kne extend out beyond your toes. Switch sides.

name: Standing Front Barbell Raise Over Head
directions: To begin, stand straight with a barbel in your hands. You should grip the bar with palms facing down and a closer than shoulder width grip apart from each other.
Your fet should be shoulder width apart from each other. Your elbows should be slightly bent. This is the starting position.
Lift the barbel up until it is directly over your head while exhaling. Make sure to kep your elbows slightly bent when performing each repetition.
Once you fel the contraction, begin to lower the barbel back down to the starting position as you inhale.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Standing Gastrocnemius Calf Stretch
directions: Place your right hel on a step with your kne extended and lean forward to grab your right toe with your right hand. Your left kne should be slightly bent and your back should be straight.
Suport your weight on your left leg and place your left hand on your left thigh.
Pul your right toes toward your kne until you fel a stretch in your calf.

name: Standing Hamstring and Calf Stretch
directions: Being by loping a belt, band, or rope around one fot. While standing, place that fot forward.
Bend your back leg, while keping the front one straight. Now raise the toes of your front fot of of the ground and lean forward.
Using the belt, pul on the top of the fot to increase the stretch in the calf. Hold for 10-20 seconds and repeat with the other fot.

name: Standing Hip Circles
directions: Begin standing on one leg, holding to a vertical suport.
Raise the unsuported kne to 90 degres. This wil be your starting position.
Open the hip as far as posible, atempting to make a big circle with your kne.
Perform this movement slowly for a number of repetitions, and repeat on the other side.

name: Standing Hip Flexors
directions: Stand up straight with the spine vertical, the left fot slightly in front of the right.

Bend both knes and lift the back hel of the flor as you pres the right hip forward. You can't get a thorough, dep stretch in this position, however, because it's hard to relax the hip flexor and stand on it at the same time. Switch sides.

name: Standing Inner-Biceps Curl
directions: Stand up with a dumbel in each hand being held at arms length. The elbows should be close to the torso. Your legs should be at about shoulder's width apart from each other.
Rotate the palms of the hands so that they are facing inward in a neutral position. This wil be your starting position.

While holding the uper arms stationary, curl the weights out while contracting the biceps as you breathe out. Your wrist should turn so that when the weights are fuly elevated you have supinated grip (palms facing up).
Only the forearms should move. Continue the movement until your biceps are fuly contracted and the dumbels are at shoulder level. Tip: Kep the forearms aligned with your outer deltoids.
Hold the contracted position for a second as you squeze the biceps.
Slowly begin to bring the dumbels back to the starting position as your breathe in. Remember to rotate the wrists as you lower the weight in order to switch back to a neutral grip.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.
There are many posible variations for this movement. For instance, you can perform the exercise siting down on a bench with or without back suport.
You can also perform it by alternating arms; first lift the right arm for one repetition, then the left, then the right, etc.

name: Standing Lateral Stretch
directions: Take a slightly wider than hip distance stance with your knes slightly bent.
Place your right hand on your right hip to suport the spine.
Raise your left arm in a vertical line and place your left hand behind your head. Kep it there as you incline your torso to the right.
Kep your weight evenly distributed betwen both legs (don't lean into your left hip). Switch sides.

name: Standing Leg Curl
directions: Adjust the machine lever to fit your height and lie with your torso bent at the waist facing forward around 30-45 degres (since an angled position is more favorable for hamstrings recruitment) with the pad of the lever on the back of your right leg (just a few inches under the calves) and the front of the right leg on top of the machine pad.
Keping the torso bent forward, ensure your leg is fuly stretched and grab the side handles of the machine. Position your toes straight. This wil be your starting position.
As you exhale, curl your right leg up as far as posible without lifting the uper leg from the pad. Once you hit the fuly contracted position, hold it for a second.
As you inhale, bring the legs back to the initial position. Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.
Perform the same exercise now for the left leg.

name: Standing Long Jump
directions: This dril is best done in sand or other soft landing surface. Ensure that you are able to measure distance. Stand in a partial squat stance with fet shoulder width apart.
Utilizing a big arm swing and a countermovement of the legs, jump forward as far as you can.
Atempt to land with your fet out in front you, reaching as far as posible with your legs.
Measure the distance from your landing point to the starting point and track results.

name: Standing Low-Pulley Deltoid Raise
directions: Start by standing to the right side of a low puley row. Use your left hand to come acros the body and grab a single handle atached to the low puley with a pronated grip (palms facing down). Rest your arm in front of you. Your right hand should grab the machine for beter suport and balance.
Make sure that your back is erect and your fet are shoulder width apart from each other. This is the starting position.
Begin to use the left hand and come acros your body out until it is elevated to shoulder height while exhaling.
Fel the contraction at the top for a second and begin to slowly lower the handle back down to the original starting position while inhaling.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.
Switch arms and repeat the exercise.

name: Standing Low-Pulley One-Arm Triceps Extension
directions: Grab a single handle with your left arm next to the low puley machine. Turn away from the machine keping the handle to the side of your body with your arm fuly extended. Now use both hands to elevate the single handle directly above the head with the palm facing forward. Kep your uper arm completely vertical (perpendicular to the flor) and put your right hand on your left elbow to help kep it steady. This is the starting position.

Keping your uper arms close to your head (elbows in) and perpendicular to the flor, lower the resistance in a semicircular motion behind your head until your forearms touch your biceps. Tip: The uper arms should remain stationary and only the forearms should move. Breathe in as you perform this step.
Go back to the starting position by using the triceps to raise the single handle. Breathe out as you perform this step.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.
Switch arms and repeat the exercise.

name: Standing Military Press
directions: Start by placing a barbel that is about chest high on a squat rack. Once you have selected the weights, grab the barbel using a pronated (palms facing forward) grip. Make sure to grip the bar wider than shoulder width apart from each other.
Slightly bend the knes and place the barbel on your colar bone. Lift the barbel up keping it lying on your chest. Take a step back and position your fet shoulder width apart from each other.

Once you pick up the barbel with the corect grip length, lift the bar up over your head by locking your arms. Hold at about shoulder level and slightly in front of your head. This is your starting position.
Lower the bar down to the colarbone slowly as you inhale.
Lift the bar back up to the starting position as you exhale.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.
This exercise can also be performed siting as those with lower back problems are beter of performing this seated variety.
The behind the neck variation is not recomended for people with shoulder problems as it can be hard on the rotator cuf due to the hyperextension created by bringing the bar behind the neck.
Another option is to use dumbels when performing this exercise for beter isolation.

name: Standing Olympic Plate Hand Squeeze
directions: To begin, stand straight while holding a weight plate by the ridge at arm's length in each hand using a neutral grip (palms facing in). You fet should be shoulder width apart from each other. This wil be your starting position.
Lower the plates until the fingers are nearly extended but can stil hold weights. Inhale as you lower the plates.
Now raise the plates back to the starting position as you exhale by closing your hands.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions prescribed in your program.

name: Standing One-Arm Cable Curl
directions: Start out by grabing single handle next to the low puley machine. Make sure you are far enough from the machine so that your arm is suporting the weight.

Make sure that your uper arm is stationary, perpendicular to the flor with elbows in and palms facing forward. Your non lifting arm should be grabing your waist. This wil alow you to kep your balance.
Slowly begin to curl the single handle upwards while keping the uper arm stationary until your forearm touches your bicep while exhaling. Tip: Only the forearm should move.
Hold the contraction position as you squeze the bicep and then lower the single handle back down to the starting position as you inhale.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.
Switch arms while performing this exercise.

name: Standing One-Arm Dumbbell Curl Over Incline Bench
directions: Stand on the back side of an incline bench as if you were going to be a spoter for someone. Have a dumbel in one hand and rest it acros the incline bench with a supinated (palms up) grip.

Position your non lifting hand at the corner or side of the incline bench. The chest should be presed against the top part of the incline and your fet should be presed against the flor at a wide stance. This is the starting position.

While holding the uper arm stationary, curl the dumbel upward while contracting the biceps as you breathe out. Only the forearms should move. Continue the movement until your biceps are fuly contracted and the dumbel is at shoulder level. Hold the contracted position for a second.
Slowly begin to bring the dumbels back to starting position as your breathe in.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.
Switch arms while performing this exercise.

name: Standing One-Arm Dumbbell Triceps Extension
directions: To begin, stand up with a dumbel held in one hand. Your fet should be about shoulder width apart from each other. Now fuly extend the arm with the dumbel over your head. Tip: The smal finger of your hand should be facing the ceiling and the palm of your hand should be facing forward. The dumbel should be above your head.
This wil be your starting position.

Keping your uper arm close to your head (elbows in) and perpendicular to the flor, lower the resistance in a semicircular motion behind your head until your forearm touch your bicep. Tip: The uper arm should remain stationary and only the forearm should move. Breathe in as you perform this step.
Go back to the starting position by using the triceps to raise the dumbel. Breathe out as you perform this step.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.
Switch arms and repeat the exercise.

name: Standing Overhead Barbell Triceps Extension
directions: To begin, stand up holding a barbel or e-z bar using a pronated grip (palms facing forward) with your hands closer than shoulder width apart from each other. Your fet should be about shoulder width apart.
Now elevate the barbel above your head until your arms are fuly extended. Kep your elbows in. This wil be your starting position.

Keping your uper arms close to your head and elbows in, perpendicular to the flor, lower the resistance in a semicircular motion behind your head until your forearms touch your biceps. Tip: The uper arms should remain stationary and only the forearms should move. Breathe in as you perform this step.
Go back to the starting position by using the triceps to raise the barbel. Breathe out as you perform this step.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Standing Palm-In One-Arm Dumbbell Press
directions: Start by having a dumbel in one hand with your arm fuly extended to the side using a neutral grip. Use your other arm to hold on to an incline bench to kep your balance.

Your fet should be shoulder width apart from each other. Now slowly lift the dumbel up until you create a 90 degre angle with your arm. Note: Your forearm should be perpendicular to the flor. Continue to maintain a neutral grip throughout the entire exercise.
Slowly lift the dumbel up until your arm is fuly extended. This the starting position.
While inhaling lower the weight down until your arm is at a 90 degre angle again.

Fel the contraction for a second and then lift the weight back up towards the starting position while exhaling. Remember to hold on to the incline bench and kep your fet positioned to kep balance during the exercise.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.
Switch arms and repeat the exercise.

name: Standing Palms-In Dumbbell Press
directions: Start by having a dumbel in each hand with your arm fuly extended to the side using a neutral grip. Your fet should be shoulder width apart from each other. Now slowly lift the dumbels up until you create a 90 degre angle with your arms. Note: Your forearms should be perpendicular to the flor. This the starting position.
Continue to maintain a neutral grip throughout the entire exercise. Slowly lift the dumbels up until your arms are fuly extended.
While inhaling lower the weights down until your arm is at a 90 degre angle again.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Standing Palms-Up Barbell Behind The Back Wrist Curl
directions: Start by standing straight and holding a barbel behind your glutes at arm's length while using a pronated grip (palms wil be facing back away from the glutes) and having your hands shoulder width apart from each other.
You should be loking straight forward while your fet are shoulder width apart from each other. This is the starting position.
While exhaling, slowly elevate the barbel up by curling your wrist in a semi-circular motion towards the ceiling. Note: Your wrist should be the only body part moving for this exercise.
Hold the contraction for a second and lower the barbel back down to the starting position while inhaling.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.
When finished, lower the barbel down to the squat rack or the flor by bending the knes. Tip: It is easiest to either pick it up from a squat rack or have a partner hand it to you.

name: Standing Pelvic Tilt
directions: Start of with your fet hip-distance apart.
Bend your knes slightly to kep them soft and springy.
You may want to move your pelvis forward and backward and back few times before holding the tailbone forward in this stretch.

name: Standing Rope Crunch
directions: Atach a rope to a high puley and select an apropriate weight.
Stand with your back to the cable tower. Take the rope with both hands over your shoulders, holding it to your uper chest. This wil be your starting position.
Perform the movement by flexing the spine, crunching the weight down as far as you can.
Hold the peak contraction for a moment before returning to the starting position.

name: Standing Soleus And Achilles Stretch
directions: Stand with your fet hip-distance apart, one fot slightly in front of the other.
Bend both knes, keping your back hel on the flor. Switch sides.

name: Standing Toe Touches
directions: Stand with some space in front and behind you.
Bend at the waist, keping your legs straight, until you can relax and let your uper body hang down in front of you. Let your arms and hands hang down naturaly. Hold for 10 to 20 seconds.

name: Standing Towel Triceps Extension
directions: To begin, stand up with both arms fuly extended above the head holding one end of a towel with both hands. Your elbows should be in and the arms perpendicular to the flor with the palms facing each other while your fet should be shoulder width apart from each other. This is the starting position.

Now comunicate with your partner so that he/she can grip the other side of the towel to aply resistance. Keping your uper arms close to your head (elbows in) and perpendicular to the flor, lower the resistance in a semicircular motion behind your head until your forearms touch your biceps. Tip: The uper arms should remain stationary and only the forearms should move. Breathe in as you perform this step.
Go back to the starting position by using the triceps to raise the towel. Breathe out as you perform this step.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Standing Two-Arm Overhead Throw
directions: Stand with your fet shoulder width apart holding a medicine bal in both hands. To begin, reach the medicine bal dep behind your head as you bend the knes slightly and lean back.
Violently throw the bal forward, flexing at the hip and using your whole body to complete the movement.
The medicine bal can be thrown to a partner or to a wal, receiving it as it bounces back.

name: Star Jump
directions: Begin in a relaxed stance with your fet shoulder width apart and hold your arms close to the body.
To initiate the move, squat down halfway and explode back up as high as posible. Fuly extend your entire body, spreading your legs and arms away from the body.
As you land, bring your limbs back in and absorb your impact through the legs.

name: Step Mill
directions: To begin, step onto the stepmil and select the desired option from the menu. You can chose a manual seting, or you can select a program to run. Typicaly, you can enter your age and weight to estimate the amount of calories burned during exercise. Use caution so that you dont trip as you climb the stairs. It is recomended that you maintain your grip on the handles so that you dont fal.

Stepmils ofer convenience, cardiovascular benefits, and usualy have les impact than runing outside while ofering a similar rate of calories burned. They are typicaly much harder than other cardio equipment. A 150 lb person wil typicaly burn over 30 calories in 30 minutes, compared to about 175 calories walking.

name: Step-up with Knee Raise
directions: Stand facing a box or bench of an apropriate height with your fet together. This wil be your starting position.

Begin the movement by steping up, puting your left fot on the top of the bench. Extend through the hip and kne of your front leg to stand up on the box. As you stand on the box with your left leg, flex your right kne and hip, bringing your kne as high as you can.
Reverse this motion to step down of the box, and then repeat the sequence on the oposite leg.

name: Stiff Leg Barbell Good Morning
directions: This exercise is best performed inside a squat rack for safety purposes. To begin, first set the bar on a rack that best matches your height. Once the corect height is chosen and the bar is loaded, step under the bar and place the back of your shoulders (slightly below the neck) acros it.
Hold on to the bar using both arms at each side and lift it of the rack by first pushing with your legs and at the same time straightening your torso.

Step away from the rack and position your legs using a shoulder width medium stance. Kep your head up at al times as loking down wil get you of balance and also maintain a straight back. This wil be your starting position.
Keping your legs stationary, move your torso forward by bending at the hips while inhaling. Lower your torso until it is paralel with the flor.
Begin to raise the bar as you exhale by elevating your torso back to the starting position.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Stiff-Legged Barbell Deadlift
directions: Grasp a bar using an overhand grip (palms facing down). You may ned some wrist wraps if using a significant amount of weight.
Stand with your torso straight and your legs spaced using a shoulder width or narower stance. The knes should be slightly bent. This is your starting position.

Keping the knes stationary, lower the barbel to over the top of your fet by bending at the hips while keping your back straight. Kep moving forward as if you were going to pick something from the flor until you fel a stretch on the hamstrings. Inhale as you perform this movement.
Start bringing your torso up straight again by extending your hips until you are back at the starting position. Exhale as you perform this movement.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Stiff-Legged Dumbbell Deadlift
directions: Grasp a couple of dumbels holding them by your side at arm's length.
Stand with your torso straight and your legs spaced using a shoulder width or narower stance. The knes should be slightly bent. This is your starting position.

Keping the knes stationary, lower the dumbels to over the top of your fet by bending at the waist while keping your back straight. Kep moving forward as if you were going to pick something from the flor until you fel a stretch on the hamstrings. Exhale as you perform this movement
Start bringing your torso up straight again by extending your hips and waist until you are back at the starting position. Inhale as you perform this movement.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Stomach Vacuum
directions: To begin, stand straight with your fet shoulder width apart from each other. Place your hands on your hips. This is the starting position.

Now slowly inhale as much air as posible and then start to exhale as much as posible while bringing your stomach in as much as posible and hold this position. Try to visualize your navel touching your backbone.
One isometric contraction is around 20 seconds. During the 20 second hold, try to breathe normaly. Then inhale and bring your stomach back to the starting position.
Once you have practiced this exercise, try to perform this exercise for longer than 20 seconds. Tip: You can work your way up to 40-60 seconds.
Repeat for the recomended amount of sets.

name: Straight Bar Bench Mid Rows
directions: Place a loaded barbel on the end of a bench. Standing on the bench behind the bar, take a medium, pronated grip. Stand with your hips back and chest up, maintaining a neutral spine. This wil be your starting position.
Row the bar to your torso by retracting the shoulder blades and flexing the elbows. Use a controled movement with no jerking.
After a brief pause, slowly return the bar to the starting position, ensuring to go al the way down.

name: Straight Raises on Incline Bench
directions: Place a bar on the ground behind the head of an incline bench.
Lay on the bench face down. With a pronated grip, pick the barbel up from the flor, keping your arms straight. Alow the bar to hang straight down. This wil be your starting position.
To begin, raise the barbel out in front of your head while keping your arms extended.
Return to the starting position.

name: Straight-Arm Dumbbell Pullover
directions: Place a dumbel standing up on a flat bench.

Ensuring that the dumbel stays securely placed at the top of the bench, lie perpendicular to the bench (torso acros it as in forming a cros) with only your shoulders lying on the surface. Hips should be below the bench and legs bent with fet firmly on the flor. The head wil be of the bench as wel.

Grasp the dumbel with both hands and hold it straight over your chest at arms length. Both palms should be presing against the underside one of the sides of the dumbel.
