This wil be your starting position. Caution: Always ensure that the dumbel used for this exercise is secure. Using a dumbel with lose plates can result in the dumbel faling apart and faling on your face.
While keping your arms straight, lower the weight slowly in an arc behind your head while breathing in until you fel a stretch on the chest.
At that point, bring the dumbel back to the starting position using the arc through which the weight was lowered and exhale as you perform this movement.
Hold the weight on the initial position for a second and repeat the motion for the prescribed number of repetitions.
You can perform this exercise using a barbel or an e-z bar instead of dumbels.
Also, if using dumbels like Powerblocks, just use a dumbel on each hand with the palms of your hands facing each other.

name: Straight-Arm Pulldown
directions: You wil start by grabing the wide bar from the top puley of a puldown machine and using a wider than shoulder-width pronated (palms down) grip. Step backwards two fet or so.

Bend your torso forward at the waist by around 30-degres with your arms fuly extended in front of you and a slight bend at the elbows. If your arms are not fuly extended then you ned to step a bit more backwards until they are. Once your arms are fuly extended and your torso is slightly bent at the waist, tighten the lats and then you are ready to begin.
While keping the arms straight, pul the bar down by contracting the lats until your hands are next to the side of the thighs. Breathe out as you perform this step.
While keping the arms straight, go back to the starting position while breathing in.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Stride Jump Crossover
directions: Stand to the side of a box with your inside fot on top of it, close to the edge.
Begin by swinging the arms upward as you push through the top leg, jumping upward as high as posible. Atempt to drive the oposite kne upward.
Land in the oposite position that you started, on the oposite side of the box. The fot that was initialy on the box wil now be on the ground, with the oposite fot now on the box.
Repeat the movement, crosing back over to the other side.

name: Sumo Deadlift
directions: Begin with a bar loaded on the ground. Aproach the bar so that the bar intersects the midle of the fet. The fet should be set very wide, near the colars. Bend at the hips to grip the bar. The arms should be directly below the shoulders, inside the legs, and you can use a pronated grip, a mixed grip, or hok grip. Relax the shoulders, which in efect lengthens your arms.

Take a breath, and then lower your hips, loking forward with your head with your chest up. Drive through the flor, spreading your fet apart, with your weight on the back half of your fet. Extend through the hips and knes.
As the bar pases through the knes, lean back and drive the hips into the bar, puling your shoulder blades together.
Return the weight to the ground by bending at the hips and controling the weight on the way down.

name: Sumo Deadlift with Bands
directions: To deadlift with short bands, simply lop them over the bar before you start, and step into them to set up. Ensure that they under the back half of your fot, directly where you are driving into the flor.

Begin with a bar loaded on the ground. Aproach the bar so that the bar intersects the midle of the fet. The fet should be set very wide, near the colars. Bend at the hips to grip the bar. The arms should be directly below the shoulders, inside the legs, and you can use a pronated grip, a mixed grip, or hok grip.

Take a breath, and then lower your hips, loking forward with your head with your chest up. Drive through the flor, spreading your fet apart, with your weight on the back half of your fet. Extend through the hips and knes.
As the bar pases through the knes, lean back and drive the hips into the bar, puling your shoulder blades together.
Return the weight to the ground by bending at the hips and controling the weight on the way down.

name: Sumo Deadlift with Chains
directions: You can atach the chains to the sleves of the bar, or just drape the midle over the bar so there is a greater weight increase as you lift. Atempt to kep the ends of the chains away from the plates so you don't hit them when you lower the weight.

Begin with a bar loaded on the ground. Aproach the bar so that the bar intersects the midle of the fet. The fet should be set very wide, near the colars. Bend at the hips to grip the bar. The arms should be directly below the shoulders, inside the legs, and you can use a pronated grip, a mixed grip, or hok grip. Relax the shoulders, which in efect lengthens your arms.

Take a breath, and then lower your hips, loking forward with your head with your chest up. Drive through the flor, spreading your fet apart, with your weight on the back half of your fet. Extend through the hips and knes.
As the bar pases through the knes, lean back and drive the hips into the bar, puling your shoulder blades together.
Return the weight to the ground by bending at the hips and controling the weight on the way down.

name: Superman
directions: To begin, lie straight and face down on the flor or exercise mat. Your arms should be fuly extended in front of you. This is the starting position.

Simultaneously raise your arms, legs, and chest of of the flor and hold this contraction for 2 seconds. Tip: Squeze your lower back to get the best results from this exercise. Remember to exhale during this movement. Note: When holding the contracted position, you should lok like superman when he is flying.
Slowly begin to lower your arms, legs and chest back down to the starting position while inhaling.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions prescribed in your program.

name: Supine Chest Throw
directions: This dril is great for chest pases when you lack a partner or a wal of suficient strength. Lay on the ground on your back with your knes bent.
Begin with the bal on your chest, held with both hands on the botom.
Explode up, extending through the elbow to throw the bal directly above you as high as posible.
Catch the bal with both hands as it comes down.

name: Supine One-Arm Overhead Throw
directions: Lay on the ground on your back with your knes bent. Hold the bal with one hand, extending the arm fuly behind your head. This wil be your starting position.
Initiate the movement at the shoulder, throwing the bal directly forward of you as you sit up, atempting to go for maximum distance.
The bal can be thrown to a partner or bounced of of a wal.

name: Supine Two-Arm Overhead Throw
directions: Lay on the ground on your back with your knes bent.
Hold the bal with both hands, extending the arms fuly behind your head. This wil be your starting position.
Initiate the movement at the shoulder, throwing the bal directly forward of you as you sit up, atempting to go for maximum distance.
The bal can be thrown to a partner or bounced of of a wal.

name: Suspended Fallout
directions: Adjust the straps so the handles are at an apropriate height, below waist level.
Begin standing and grasping the handles. Lean into the straps, moving to an incline push-up position. This wil be your starting position.
Keping your arms straight, lean further into the suspension straps, bringing your body closer to the ground, alowing your shoulders to extend, raising your arms up and over your head.
Maintain a neutral spine and kep the rest of your body straight, your shoulders being the only joints alowed to move.
Pause during the peak contraction, and then return to the starting position.

name: Suspended Push-Up
directions: Anchor your suspension straps securely to the top of a rack or other object.

Leaning into the straps, take a handle in each hand and move into a push-up plank position. You should be as close to paralel to the ground as you can manage with your arms fuly extended, maintaining god posture.
Maintaining a straight, rigid torso, descend slowly by alowing the elbows to flex.
Continue until your elbows break 90 degres, pausing before you extend to return to the starting position.

name: Suspended Reverse Crunch
directions: Secure a set of suspension straps with the handles hanging about a fot of of the ground. Move yourself into a pushup plank position facing away from the rack.
Place your fet into the handles. You should maintain a straight posture, not alowing the hips to sag. This wil be your starting position.
Begin the movement by flexing the knes and hips, drawing the knes to your torso. As you do so, anteriorly tilt your pelvis, alowing your spine to flex.
At the top of the controled motion, return to the starting position.

name: Suspended Row
directions: Suspend your straps at around chest height. Take a handle in each hand and lean back. Kep your body erect and your head and chest up. Your arms should be fuly extended. This wil be your starting position.
Begin by flexing the elbow to initiate the movement. Protract your shoulder blades as you do so.
At the completion of the motion pause, and then return to the starting position.

name: Suspended Split Squat
directions: Suspend your straps so the handles are 18-30 inches from the flor.
Facing away from the setup, place your rear fot into the handle behind you. Kep your head loking forward and your chest up, with your kne slightly bent. This wil be your starting position.
Descend by flexing the kne and hips, lowering yourself to the ground. Kep your weight on the hel of your fot and maintain your posture throughout the exercise.
At the botom of the movement, reverse the motion, extending through the hip and kne to return to the starting position.

name: T-Bar Row with Handle
directions: Position a bar into a landmine or in a corner to kep it from moving. Load an apropriate weight onto your end.
Stand over the bar, and position a Double D row handle around the bar next to the colar. Using your hips and legs, rise to a standing position.
Asume a wide stance with your hips back and your chest up. Your arms should be extended. This wil be your starting position.
Pul the weight to your uper abdomen by retracting the shoulder blades and flexing the elbows. Do not jerk the weight or cheat during the movement.
After a brief pause, return to the starting position.

name: Tate Press
directions: Lie down on a flat bench with a dumbel in each hand on top of your thighs. The palms of your hand wil be facing each other.

By using your thighs to help you get the dumbels up, clean the dumbels one arm at a time so that you can hold them in front of you at shoulder width. Note: when holding the dumbels in front of you, make sure your arms are wider than shoulder width apart from each other using a pronated (palms forward) grip. Alow your elbows to point out. This is your starting position.

Keping the uper arms stationary, slowly move the dumbels in and down in a semi circular motion until they touch the uper chest while inhaling. Kep ful control of the dumbels at al times and do not move the uper arms nor rest the dumbels on the chest.

As you breathe out, move the dumbels up using your triceps and the same semi-circular motion but in reverse. Atempt to kep the dumbels together as they move up. Lock your arms in the contracted position, hold for a second and then start coming down again slowly again. Tip: It should take at least twice as long to go down than to come up.
Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions of your training program.

name: The Straddle
directions: Begin in a seated, upright position. Start by extending your legs in front of you in a V.
With your hands on the flor, lean forward as far as posible. Hold for 10 to 20 seconds.

name: Thigh Abductor
directions: To begin, sit down on the abductor machine and select a weight you are comfortable with. When your legs are positioned properly, grip the handles on each side. Your entire uper body (from the waist up) should be stationary. This is the starting position.
Slowly pres against the machine with your legs to move them away from each other while exhaling.
Fel the contraction for a second and begin to move your legs back to the starting position while breathing in. Note: Remember to kep your uper body stationary to prevent any injuries from ocuring.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Thigh Adductor
directions: To begin, sit down on the aductor machine and select a weight you are comfortable with. When your legs are positioned properly on the leg pads of the machine, grip the handles on each side. Your entire uper body (from the waist up) should be stationary. This is the starting position.
Slowly pres against the machine with your legs to move them towards each other while exhaling.

Fel the contraction for a second and begin to move your legs back to the starting position while breathing in. Note: Remember to kep your uper body stationary and avoid fast jerking motions in order to prevent any injuries from ocuring.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Tire Flip
directions: Begin by griping the botom of the tire on the tread, and position your fet back a bit. Your chest should be driving into the tire.
To lift the tire, extend through the hips, knes, and ankles, driving into the tire and up.

As the tire reaches a 45 degre angle, step forward and drive a kne into the tire. As you do so adjust your grip to the uper portion of the tire and push it forward as hard as posible to complete the turn. Repeat as necesary.

name: Toe Touchers
directions: To begin, lie down on the flor or an exercise mat with your back presed against the flor. Your arms should be lying acros your sides with the palms facing down.
Your legs should be touching each other. Slowly elevate your legs up in the air until they are almost perpendicular to the flor with a slight bend at the knes. Your fet should be paralel to the flor.
Move your arms so that they are fuly extended at a 45 degre angle from the flor. This is the starting position.
While keping your lower back presed against the flor, slowly lift your torso and use your hands to try and touch your toes. Remember to exhale while perform this part of the exercise.
Slowly begin to lower your torso and arms back down to the starting position while inhaling. Remember to kep your arms straight out pointing towards your toes.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Torso Rotation
directions: Stand upright holding an exercise bal with both hands. Extend your arms so the bal is straight out in front of you. This wil be your starting position.
Rotate your torso to one side, keping your eyes on the bal as you move. Now, rotate back to the oposite direction. Repeat for 10-20 repetitions.

name: Trail Running/Walking
directions: Runing or hiking on trails wil get the blod pumping and heart beating almost imediately. Make sure you have god shoes. While you use the muscles in your calves and butocks to pul yourself up a hil, the knes, joints and ankles absorb the bulk of the pounding coming back down. Take smaler steps as you walk downhil, kep your knes bent to reduce the impact and slow down to avoid faling.
A 150 lb person can burn over 20 calories for 30 minutes walking uphil, compared to 175 on a flat surface. If runing the trail, a 150 lb person can burn wel over 50 calories in 30 minutes.

name: Trap Bar Deadlift
directions: For this exercise load a trap bar, also known as a hex bar, to an apropriate weight resting on the ground. Stand in the center of the aparatus and grasp both handles.
Lower your hips, lok forward with your head and kep your chest up.
Begin the movement by driving through the hels and extend your hips and knes. Avoid rounding your back at al times.
At the completion of the movement, lower the weight back to the ground under control.

name: Tricep Dumbbell Kickback
directions: Start with a dumbel in each hand and your palms facing your torso. Kep your back straight with a slight bend in the knes and bend forward at the waist. Your torso should be almost paralel to the flor. Make sure to kep your head up. Your uper arms should be close to your torso and paralel to the flor. Your forearms should be pointed towards the flor as you hold the weights. There should be a 90-degre angle formed betwen your forearm and uper arm. This is your starting position.
Now, while keping your uper arms stationary, exhale and use your triceps to lift the weights until the arm is fuly extended. Focus on moving the forearm.
After a brief pause at the top contraction, inhale and slowly lower the dumbels back down to the starting position.
Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.

name: Tricep Side Stretch
directions: Bring right arm acros your body and over your left shoulder, holding your elbow with your left hand, until you fel a stretch in your tricep. Then repeat for your other arm.

name: Triceps Overhead Extension with Rope
directions: Atach a rope to a low puley. After selecting an apropriate weight, grasp the rope with both hands and face away from the cable.

Position your hands behind your head with your elbows point straight up. Your elbows should start out flexed, and you can stager your stance and lean gently away from the machine to create greater stability. This wil be your starting position.
To perform the movement, extend through the elbow while keping the uper arm in position, raising your hands above your head.
Squeze your triceps at the top of the movement, and slowly lower the weight back to the start position.

name: Triceps Pushdown
directions: Atach a straight or angled bar to a high puley and grab with an overhand grip (palms facing down) at shoulder width.

Standing upright with the torso straight and a very smal inclination forward, bring the uper arms close to your body and perpendicular to the flor. The forearms should be pointing up towards the puley as they hold the bar. This is your starting position.

Using the triceps, bring the bar down until it touches the front of your thighs and the arms are fuly extended perpendicular to the flor. The uper arms should always remain stationary next to your torso and only the forearms should move. Exhale as you perform this movement.
After a second hold at the contracted position, bring the bar slowly up to the starting point. Breathe in as you perform this step.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Triceps Pushdown - Rope Attachment
directions: Atach a rope atachment to a high puley and grab with a neutral grip (palms facing each other).

Standing upright with the torso straight and a very smal inclination forward, bring the uper arms close to your body and perpendicular to the flor. The forearms should be pointing up towards the puley as they hold the rope with the palms facing each other. This is your starting position.

Using the triceps, bring the rope down as you bring each side of the rope to the side of your thighs. At the end of the movement the arms are fuly extended and perpendicular to the flor. The uper arms should always remain stationary next to your torso and only the forearms should move. Exhale as you perform this movement.
After holding for a second, at the contracted position, bring the rope slowly up to the starting point. Breathe in as you perform this step.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Triceps Pushdown - V-Bar Attachment
directions: Atach a V-Bar to a high puley and grab with an overhand grip (palms facing down) at shoulder width.

Standing upright with the torso straight and a very smal inclination forward, bring the uper arms close to your body and perpendicular to the flor. The forearms should be pointing up towards the puley as they hold the bar. The thumbs should be higher than the smal finger. This is your starting position.

Using the triceps, bring the bar down until it touches the front of your thighs and the arms are fuly extended perpendicular to the flor. The uper arms should always remain stationary next to your torso and only the forearms should move. Exhale as you perform this movement.
After a second hold at the contracted position, bring the V-Bar slowly up to the starting point. Breathe in as you perform this step.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Triceps Stretch
directions: Reach your hand behind your head, grasp your elbow and gently pul. Hold for 10 to 20 seconds, then switch sides.

name: Tuck Crunch
directions: To begin, lie down on the flor or an exercise mat with your back presed against the flor. Your arms should be lying acros your sides with the palms facing down.

Your legs should be crosed by wraping one ankle around the other. Slowly elevate your legs up in the air until your thighs are perpendicular to the flor with a slight bend at the knes. Note: Your knes and toes should be paralel to the flor as oposed to the thighs.
Move your arms from the flor and cros them so they are resting on your chest. This is the starting position.
While keping your lower back presed against the flor, slowly lift your torso. Remember to exhale while perform this part of the exercise.
Slowly begin to lower your torso back down to the starting position while inhaling.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Two-Arm Dumbbell Preacher Curl
directions: Grab a dumbel with each arm and place the uper arms on top of the preacher bench or the incline bench. The dumbel should be held at shoulder length. This wil be your starting position.
As you breathe in, slowly lower the dumbels until your uper arm is extended and the biceps is fuly stretched.
As you exhale, use the biceps to curl the weights up until your biceps is fuly contracted and the dumbels are at shoulder height.
Squeze the biceps hard for a second at the contracted position and repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Two-Arm Kettlebell Clean
directions: Place two ketlebels betwen your fet. To get in the starting position, push your but back and lok straight ahead.
Clean the ketlebels to your shoulders by extending through the legs and hips as you raise the ketlebels towards your shoulders. Rotate your wrists as you do so.
Lower the ketlebels back to the starting position and repeat.

name: Two-Arm Kettlebell Jerk
directions: Clean two ketlebels to your shoulders. Clean the ketlebels to your shoulders by extending through the legs and hips as you swing the ketlebels towards your shoulders. Rotate your wrists as you do so, so that the palms face forward. Squat down a few inches and reverse the motion rapidly driving both ketlebels overhead. Imediately after the initial push, squat down again and get under the ketlebels. Once the ketlebels are locked out, stand upright to complete the exercise.

name: Two-Arm Kettlebell Military Press
directions: Clean two ketlebels to your shoulders. Clean the ketlebels to your shoulders by extending through the legs and hips as you swing the ketlebels towards your shoulders. Rotate your wrists as you do so, so that the palms face forward.

Pres the ketlebels up and out. As the ketlebels pas your head, lean into the weights so that the ketlebels are racked behind your head. Make sure to contract your lats, but, and stomach for aded stability.

name: Two-Arm Kettlebell Row
directions: Place two ketlebels in front of your fet. Bend your knes slightly and then push your but out as much as posible as you bend over to get in the starting position.
Grab both ketlebels and pul them to your stomach, retracting your shoulder blades and flexing the elbows. Kep your back straight. Lower and repeat.

name: Underhand Cable Pulldowns
directions: Sit down on a pul-down machine with a wide bar atached to the top puley. Adjust the kne pad of the machine to fit your height. These pads wil prevent your body from being raised by the resistance atached to the bar.
Grab the pul-down bar with the palms facing your torso (a supinated grip). Make sure that the hands are placed closer than the shoulder width.

As you have both arms extended in front of you holding the bar at the chosen grip width, bring your torso back around 30 degres or so while creating a curvature on your lower back and sticking your chest out. This is your starting position.

As you breathe out, pul the bar down until it touches your uper chest by drawing the shoulders and the uper arms down and back. Tip: Concentrate on squezing the back muscles once you reach the fuly contracted position and kep the elbows close to your body. The uper torso should remain stationary as your bring the bar to you and only the arms should move. The forearms should do no other work other than hold the bar.
After a second on the contracted position, while breathing in, slowly bring the bar back to the starting position when your arms are fuly extended and the lats are fuly stretched.
Repeat this motion for the prescribed amount of repetitions.

name: Upper Back Stretch
directions: Clasp fingers together with your thumbs pointing down, round your shoulders as you reach your hands forward.

name: Upper Back-Leg Grab
directions: While seated, bend forward to hug your thighs from underneath with both arms.
Kep your knes together and your legs extended out as you bring your chest down to your knes. You can also stretch your midle back by puling your back away from your knes as your huging them.

name: Upright Barbell Row
directions: Grasp a barbel with an overhand grip that is slightly les than shoulder width. The bar should be resting on the top of your thighs with your arms extended and a slight bend in your elbows. Your back should also be straight. This wil be your starting position.

Now exhale and use the sides of your shoulders to lift the bar, raising your elbows up and to the side. Kep the bar close to your body as you raise it. Continue to lift the bar until it nearly touches your chin. Tip: Your elbows should drive the motion, and should always be higher than your forearms. Remember to kep your torso stationary and pause for a second at the top of the movement.
Lower the bar back down slowly to the starting position. Inhale as you perform this portion of the movement.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Upright Cable Row
directions: Grasp a straight bar cable atachment that is atached to a low puley with a pronated (palms facing your thighs) grip that is slightly les than shoulder width. The bar should be resting on top of your thighs. Your arms should be extended with a slight bend at the elbows and your back should be straight. This wil be your starting position.

Use your side shoulders to lift the cable bar as you exhale. The bar should be close to the body as you move it up. Continue to lift it until it nearly touches your chin. Tip: Your elbows should drive the motion. As you lift the bar, your elbows should always be higher than your forearms. Also, kep your torso stationary and pause for a second at the top of the movement.
Lower the bar back down slowly to the starting position. Inhale as you perform this portion of the movement.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Upright Row - With Bands
directions: To begin, stand on an exercise band so that tension begins at arm's length. Grasp the handles using a pronated (palms facing your thighs) grip that is slightly les than shoulder width. The handles should be resting on top of your thighs. Your arms should be extended with a slight bend at the elbows and your back should be straight. This wil be your starting position.

Use your side shoulders to lift the handles as you exhale. The handles should be close to the body as you move them up. Continue to lift the handles until they nearly touches your chin. Tip: Your elbows should drive the motion. As you lift the handles, your elbows should always be higher than your forearms. Also, kep your torso stationary and pause for a second at the top of the movement.
Lower the handles back down slowly to the starting position. Inhale as you perform this portion of the movement.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Upward Stretch
directions: Extend both hands straight above your head, palms touching.
Slowly push your hands up and back, keping your back straight.

name: V-Bar Pulldown
directions: Sit down on a pul-down machine with a V-Bar atached to the top puley.
Adjust the kne pad of the machine to fit your height. These pads wil prevent your body from being raised by the resistance atached to the bar.

Grab the V-bar with the palms facing each other (a neutral grip). Stick your chest out and lean yourself back slightly (around 30-degres) in order to beter engage the lats. This wil be your starting position.

Using your lats, pul the bar down as you squeze your shoulder blades. Continue until your chest nearly touches the V-bar. Exhale as you execute this motion. Tip: Kep the torso stationary throughout the movement.
After a second hold on the contracted position, slowly bring the bar back to the starting position as you breathe in.
Repeat for the prescribed number of repetitions.

name: V-Bar Pullup
directions: Start by placing the midle of the V-bar in the midle of the pul-up bar (asuming that the pul-up station you are using does not have neutral grip handles). The V-Bar handles wil be facing down so that you can hang from the pul-up bar through the use of the handles.

Once you securely place the V-bar, take a hold of the bar from each side and hang from it. Stick your chest out and lean yourself back slightly in order to beter engage the lats. This wil be your starting position.

Using your lats, pul your torso up while leaning your head back slightly so that you do not hit yourself with the chin-up bar. Continue until your chest nearly touches the V-bar. Exhale as you execute this motion.
After a second hold on the contracted position, slowly lower your body back to the starting position as you breathe in.
Repeat for the prescribed number of repetitions.
If you are new at this exercise and do not have the strength to perform it, use a pul-up asist machine if available. These machines use weight to help you push your bodyweight.
Otherwise, a spoter holding your legs can help.

name: Vertical Swing
directions: Alow the dumbel to hang at arms length betwen your legs, holding it with both hands. Kep your back straight and your head up.
Swing the dumbel betwen your legs, flexing at the hips and bending the knes slightly.
Powerfuly reverse the motion by extending at the hips, knes, and ankles to propel yourself upward, swinging the dumbel over your head.
As you land, absorb the impact through your legs and draw the dumbel to your torso before the next repetition.

name: Walking, Treadmill
directions: To begin, step onto the treadmil and select the desired option from the menu. Most treadmils have a manual seting, or you can select a program to run. Typicaly, you can enter your age and weight to estimate the amount of calories burned during exercise. Elevation can be adjusted to change the intensity of the workout.

Treadmils ofer convenience, cardiovascular benefits, and usualy have les impact than walking outside. When walking, you should move at a moderate to fast pace, not a leisurely one. Being an activity of lower intensity, walking doesnt burn as many calories as some other activities, but stil provides great benefit. A 150 lb person wil burn about 175 calories walking 4 miles per hour for 30 minutes, compared to 450 calories runing twice as fast. Maintain proper posture as you walk, and only hold onto the handles when necesary, such as when dismounting or checking your heart rate.

name: Weighted Ball Hyperextension
directions: To begin, lie down on an exercise bal with your torso presing against the bal and paralel to the flor. The bal of your fet should be presed against the flor to help kep you balanced. Place a weighted plate under your chin or behind your neck. This is the starting position.
Slowly raise your torso up by bending at the waist and lower back. Remember to exhale during this movement.
Hold the contraction on your lower back for a second and lower your torso back down to the starting position while inhaling.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions prescribed in your program.

name: Weighted Ball Side Bend
directions: To begin, lie down on an exercise bal with your left side of the torso (waist, hips and shoulder) presed against the bal.

Your fet should be on the flor while your legs are crosed and hanging from the bal. Hold a weighted plate with your right hand directly to the right side of your head. Tip: Make sure the smoth side of the plate is resting against your head.
Place your left arm acros your torso so that your palm is on your obliques. There should be a right angle betwen your left forearm and uper arm. This is the starting position.
Raise the side of your torso up by lateraly flexing at the waist while exhaling.
Hold the contraction for a second and slowly lower yourself back down to the starting position while inhaling.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.
Switch sides and repeat the exercise.

name: Weighted Bench Dip
directions: For this exercise you wil ned to place a bench behind your back and another one in front of you. With the benches perpendicular to your body, hold on to one bench on its edge with the hands close to your body, separated at shoulder width. Your arms should be fuly extended.

The legs wil be extended forward on top of the other bench. Your legs should be paralel to the flor while your torso is to be perpendicular to the flor. Have your partner place the dumbel on your lap. Note: This exercise is best performed with a partner as placing the weight on your lap can be chalenging and cause injury without asistance. This wil be your starting position.

Slowly lower your body as you inhale by bending at the elbows until you lower yourself far enough to where there is an angle slightly smaler than 90 degres betwen the uper arm and the forearm. Tip: Kep the elbows as close as posible throughout the movement. Forearms should always be pointing down.
Using your triceps to bring your torso up again, lift yourself back to the starting position while exhaling.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Weighted Crunches
directions: Lie flat on your back with your fet flat on the ground or resting on a bench with your knes bent at a 90 degre angle.
Hold a weight to your chest, or you may hold it extended above your torso. This wil be your starting position.
Now, exhale and slowly begin to rol your shoulders of the flor. Your shoulders should come up of the flor about 4 inches while your lower back remains on the flor.
At the top of the movement, flex your abdominals and hold for a brief pause.
Then inhale and slowly lower yourself back down to the starting position.

name: Weighted Jump Squat
directions: Position a lightly loaded barbel acros the back of your shoulders. You could also use a weighted vest, sandbag, or other type of resistance for this exercise.
The weight should be light enough that it doesn't slow you down significantly. Your fet should be just outside of shoulder width with your head and chest up. This wil be your starting position.

Using a countermovement, squat partialy down and imediately reverse your direction to explode of of the ground, extending through your hips, knes, and ankles. Maintain god posture throughout the jump.
As you return to the ground, absorb the impact through your legs.

name: Weighted Pull Ups
directions: Atach a weight to a dip belt and secure it around your waist. Grab the pul-up bar with the palms of your hands facing forward. For a medium grip, your hands should be spaced at shoulder width. Both arms should be extended in front of you holding the bar at the chosen grip.
Youl want to bring your torso back about 30 degres while creating a curvature in your lower back and sticking your chest out. This wil be your starting position.
Now, exhale and pul your torso up until your head is above your hands. Concentrate on squezing yourshoulder blades back and down as you reach the top contracted position.
After a brief moment at the top contracted position, inhale and slowly lower your torso back to the starting position with your arms extended and your lats fuly stretched.

name: Weighted Sissy Squat
directions: Standing upright, with fet at shoulder width and toes raised, use one hand to hold onto the beams of a squat rack and the oposite arm to hold a plate on top of your chest. This is your starting position.

As you use one arm to hold yourself, bend at the knes and slowly lower your torso toward the ground by bringing your pelvis and knes forward. Inhale as you go down and stop when your uper and lower legs almost create a 90-degre angle. Hold the stretch position for a second.
After your one second hold, use your thigh muscles to bring your torso back up to the starting position. Exhale as you move up.
Repeat for the recomended amount of times.

name: Weighted Sit-Ups - With Bands
directions: Start out by straping the bands around the base of the decline bench. Place the handles towards the inside of the decline bench so that when lying down, you can reach for both of them.

Position your legs through the decline machine until they are secured. Now reach for the exercise bands with both hands. Use a pronated (palms forward) grip to grasp the handles. Position them near your colar bone and rotate your wrist to a neutral grip (palms facing the torso). Note: Your arms should remain stationary throughout the exercise. This is the starting position.
Move your torso upward until your uper body is perpendicular to the flor while exhaling. Hold the contraction for a second and lower your uper body back down to the starting position while inhaling.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Weighted Squat
directions: Start by positioning two flat benches shoulder width apart from each other. Stand on top of them and wrap the weighted belt around your waist with the amount of weight you fel comfortable with. Make sure your toes are facing out.
Once you are standing straight up with the weight hanging in betwen your legs, position your arms so that they are fuly extended to the side of your body. This is the starting position.

Begin by bending the knes as you maintain a straight posture with the head up. Continue down until the angle betwen the uper leg and the calves becomes slightly les than 90-degres (which is the point in which the uper legs are below paralel to the flor). Inhale as you perform this portion of the movement. Tip: If you performed the exercise corectly, the front of the knes should make an imaginary straight line with the toes that are perpendicular to the front. If your knes are past that imaginary line (if they are past your toes) then you are placing undue stres on the kne and the exercise has ben performed incorectly.

Begin to move the body back up by pushing the flor of the flat bench with the bal of your fot mainly as you straighten the legs again and go back to the starting position. Exhale as you perform this portion of the exercise.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Wide Stance Barbell Squat
directions: This exercise is best performed inside a squat rack for safety purposes. To begin, first set the bar on a rack that best matches your height. Once the corect height is chosen and the bar is loaded, step under the bar and place the back of your shoulders (slightly below the neck) acros it.
Hold on to the bar using both arms at each side and lift it of the rack by first pushing with your legs and at the same time straightening your torso.

Step away from the rack and position your legs using a wider-than-shoulder-width stance with the toes slightly pointed out. Kep your head up at al times as loking down wil get you of balance, and also maintain a straight back. This wil be your starting position.

Begin to slowly lower the bar by bending the knes as you maintain a straight posture with the head up. Continue down until the angle betwen the uper leg and the calves becomes slightly les than 90-degres (which is the point in which the uper legs are below paralel to the flor). Inhale as you perform this portion of the movement. Tip: If you performed the exercise corectly, the front of the knes should make an imaginary straight line with the toes that is perpendicular to the front. If your knes are past that imaginary line (if they are past your toes) then you are placing undue stres on the kne and the exercise has ben performed incorectly.
Begin to raise the bar as you exhale by pushing the flor with the hel of your fot as you straighten the legs again and go back to the starting position.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Wide Stance Stiff Legs
directions: Begin with a barbel loaded on the flor. Adopt a wide stance, and then bend at the hips to grab the bar. Your hips should be as far back as posible, and your legs nearly straight. Kep your back straight, and your head and chest up. This wil be your starting position.

Begin the movement be engaging the hips, driving them forward as you alow the arms to hang straight. Continue until you are standing straight up, and then slowly return the weight to the starting position. For sucesive reps, the weight ned not touch the flor.

name: Wide-Grip Barbell Bench Press
directions: Lie back on a flat bench with fet firm on the flor. Using a wide, pronated (palms forward) grip that is around 3 inches away from shoulder width (for each hand), lift the bar from the rack and hold it straight over you with your arms locked. The bar wil be perpendicular to the torso and the flor. This wil be your starting position.
As you breathe in, come down slowly until you fel the bar on your midle chest.

After a second pause, bring the bar back to the starting position as you breathe out and push the bar using your chest muscles. Lock your arms and squeze your chest in the contracted position, hold for a second and then start coming down slowly again. Tip: It should take at least twice as long to go down than to come up.
Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.
If you are new at this exercise, it is advised that you use a spoter. If no spoter is available, then be conservative with the amount of weight used.
Also, beware of leting the bar drift to far forward. You want the bar to fal on your midle chest and nowhere else.
Don't bounce the weight of your chest. You should be in ful control of the barbel at al times.

name: Wide-Grip Decline Barbell Bench Press
directions: Lie back on a decline bench with the fet securely locked at the front of the bench. Using a wide, pronated (palms forward) grip that is around 3 inches away from shoulder width (for each hand), lift the bar from the rack and hold it straight over you with your arms locked. The bar wil be perpendicular to the torso and the flor. This wil be your starting position.
As you breathe in, come down slowly until you fel the bar on your lower chest.

After a second pause, bring the bar back to the starting position as you breathe out and push the bar using your chest muscles. Lock your arms and squeze your chest in the contracted position, hold for a second and then start coming down slowly again. Tip: It should take at least twice as long to go down than to come up.
Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions.
If you are new at this exercise, it is advised that you use a spoter. If no spoter is available, then be conservative with the amount of weight used.
Also, beware of leting the bar drift to far forward. You want the bar to fal on your midle chest and nowhere else.
Don't bounce the weight of your chest. You should be in ful control of the barbel at al times.

name: Wide-Grip Decline Barbell Pullover
directions: Lie down on a decline bench with both legs securely locked in position. Reach for the barbel behind the head using a pronated grip (palms facing out). Make sure to grab the barbel wider than shoulder width apart for this exercise. Slowly lift the barbel up from the flor by using your arms.
When positioned properly, your arms should be fuly extended and perpendicular to the flor. This is the starting position.

Begin by moving the barbel back down in a semicircular motion as if you were going to place it on the flor, but instead, stop when the arms are paralel to the flor. Tip: Kep the arms fuly extended at al times. The movement should only hapen at the shoulder joint. Inhale as you perform this portion of the movement.
Now bring the barbel up while exhaling until you are back at the starting position. Remember to kep ful control of the barbel at al times.
Repeat the movement for the prescribed amount of repetitions of your training program.
When finished with your set, slowly lower the barbel back down until it is level with your head and release it.

name: Wide-Grip Lat Pulldown
directions: Sit down on a pul-down machine with a wide bar atached to the top puley. Make sure that you adjust the kne pad of the machine to fit your height. These pads wil prevent your body from being raised by the resistance atached to the bar.

Grab the bar with the palms facing forward using the prescribed grip. Note on grips: For a wide grip, your hands ned to be spaced out at a distance wider than shoulder width. For a medium grip, your hands ned to be spaced out at a distance equal to your shoulder width and for a close grip at a distance smaler than your shoulder width.

As you have both arms extended in front of you holding the bar at the chosen grip width, bring your torso back around 30 degres or so while creating a curvature on your lower back and sticking your chest out. This is your starting position.

As you breathe out, bring the bar down until it touches your uper chest by drawing the shoulders and the uper arms down and back. Tip: Concentrate on squezing the back muscles once you reach the ful contracted position. The uper torso should remain stationary and only the arms should move. The forearms should do no other work except for holding the bar; therefore do not try to pul down the bar using the forearms.

After a second at the contracted position squezing your shoulder blades together, slowly raise the bar back to the starting position when your arms are fuly extended and the lats are fuly stretched. Inhale during this portion of the movement.
Repeat this motion for the prescribed amount of repetitions.

name: Wide-Grip Pulldown Behind The Neck
directions: Sit down on a pul-down machine with a wide bar atached to the top puley. Make sure that you adjust the kne pad of the machine to fit your height. These pads wil prevent your body from being raised by the resistance atached to the bar.

Grab the bar with the palms facing forward using the prescribed grip. Note on grips: For a wide grip, your hands ned to be spaced out at a distance wider than your shoulder width. For a medium grip, your hands ned to be spaced out at a distance equal to your shoulder width and for a close grip at a distance smaler than your shoulder width.

As you have both arms extended in front of you holding the bar at the chosen grip width, bring your torso and head forward. Think of an imaginary line from the center of the bar down to the back of your neck. This is your starting position.

As you breathe out, bring the bar down until it touches the back of your neck by drawing the shoulders and the uper arms down and back. Tip: Concentrate on squezing the back muscles once you reach the ful contracted position. The uper torso should remain stationary and only the arms should move. The forearms should do no other work except for holding the bar; therefore do not try to pul down the bar using the forearms.

After a second on the contracted position squezing your shoulder blades together, slowly raise the bar back to the starting position when your arms are fuly extended and the lats are fuly stretched. Inhale during this portion of the movement.
Repeat this motion for the prescribed amount of repetitions.

name: Wide-Grip Rear Pull-Up
directions: Grab the pul-up bar with the palms facing forward using a wide grip.

As you have both arms extended in front of you holding the bar, bring your torso forward and head so that there is an imaginary line from the pul-up bar to the back of your neck. This is your starting position.

Pul your torso up until the bar is near the back of your neck. To do this, draw the shoulders and uper arms down and back while slightly leaning your head forward. Exhale as you perform this portion of the movement. Tip: Concentrate on squezing the back muscles once you reach the ful contracted position. The uper torso should remain stationary as it moves through space and only the arms should move. The forearms should do no other work other than hold the bar.
After a second on the contracted position, start to inhale and slowly lower your torso back to the starting position when your arms are fuly extended and the lats are fuly stretched.
Repeat this motion for the prescribed amount of repetitions.
If you are new at this exercise and do not have the strength to perform it, use a chin asist machine if available. These machines use weight to help you push your bodyweight.
Otherwise, a spoter holding your legs can help.

name: Wide-Grip Standing Barbell Curl
directions: Stand up with your torso upright while holding a barbel at the wide outer handle. The palm of your hands should be facing forward. The elbows should be close to the torso. This wil be your starting position.
While holding the uper arms stationary, curl the weights forward while contracting the biceps as you breathe out. Tip: Only the forearms should move.
Continue the movement until your biceps are fuly contracted and the bar is at shoulder level. Hold the contracted position for a second and squeze the biceps hard.
Slowly begin to bring the bar back to starting position as your breathe in.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.
You can also perform this movement using an E-Z bar or E-Z atachment hoked to a low puley. This variation sems to realy provide a god contraction at the top of the movement.
You may also use the closer grip for variety purposes.

name: Wind Sprints
directions: Hang from a pul-up bar using a pronated grip. Your arms and legs should be extended. This wil be your starting position.

Begin by quickly raising one kne as high as you can. Do not swing your body or your legs.
3
Imediately reverse the motion, returning that leg to the starting position. Simultaneously raise the oposite kne as high as posible.
Continue alternating betwen legs until the set is complete.

name: Windmills
directions: Lie on your back with your arms extended out to the sides and your legs straight. This wil be your starting position.
Lift one leg and quickly cros it over your body, atempting to touch the ground near the oposite hand.
Return to the starting position, and repeat with the oposite leg. Continue to alternate for 10-20 repetitions.

name: World's Greatest Stretch
directions: This is a thre-part stretch. Begin by lunging forward, with your front fot flat on the ground and on the toes of your back fot. With your knes bent, squat down until your kne is almost touching the ground. Kep your torso erect, and hold this position for 10-20 seconds.

Now, place the arm on the same side as your front leg on the ground, with the elbow next to the fot. Your other hand should be placed on the ground, paralel to your lead leg, to help suport you during this portion of the stretch.

After 10-20 seconds, place your hands on either side of your front fot. Raise the toes of the front fot of of the ground, and straighten your leg. You may ned to reposition your rear leg to do so. Hold for 10-20 seconds, and then repeat the entire sequence for the other side.

name: Wrist Circles
directions: Start by standing straight with your fet being shoulder width apart from each other. Elevate your arms to the side of you until they are fuly extended and paralel to the flor at a height that is evenly aligned with your shoulders. Tip: Your torso and arms should form the leter "T: Your palms should be facing down. This is the starting position.

Keping your entire body stationary except for the wrists, begin to rotate both wrists forward in a circular motion. Tip: Pretend that you are trying to draw circles by using your hands as the brush. Breathe normaly as you perform this exercise.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Wrist Roller
directions: To begin, stand straight up grabing a wrist roler using a pronated grip (palms facing down). Your fet should be shoulder width apart.

Slowly lift both arms until they are fuly extended and paralel to the flor in front of you. Note: Make sure the rope is not wraped around the roler. Your entire body should be stationary except for the forearms. This is the starting position.
Rotate one wrist at a time in an upward motion to bring the weight up to the bar by roling the rope around the roler.
Once the weight has reached the bar, slowly begin to lower the weight back down by rotating the wrist in a downward motion until the weight reaches the starting position.
Repeat for the prescribed amount of repetitions in your program.

name: Wrist Rotations with Straight Bar
directions: Hold a barbel with both hands and your palms facing down; hands spaced about shoulder width. This wil be your starting position.
Alternating betwen each of your hands, perform the movement by extending the wrist as though you were roling up a newspaper. Continue alternating back and forth until failure.
Reverse the motion by flexing the wrist, roling the oposite direction. Continue the alternating motion until failure.

name: Yoke Walk
directions: The yoke is usualy done with a yoke aparatus, but is sometimes sen with refrigerators or other heavy objects.
Begin by racking the aparatus acros the back of the shoulders. With your head loking forward and back arched, lift the yoke by driving through the hels.

Begin walking as quickly as posible using short, quick steps. You may hold the side posts of the yoke to help steady it and hold it in position. Continue for the given distance as fast as posible, usualy 75-10 fet.

name: Zercher Squats
directions: This exercise is best performed inside a squat rack for safety purposes. To begin, first set the bar on a rack that best matches your height. The corect height should be anywhere above the waist but below the chest. Once the corect height is chosen and the bar is loaded, lock your hands together and place the bar on top of your arms in betwen the forearm and uper arm.
Lift the bar up so that it is resting on top of your forearms. If you are holding the bar properly, it should lok as if you have your arms crosed but with a bar runing acros them.

Step away from the rack and position your legs using a shoulder width medium stance with the toes slightly pointed out. Kep your head up at al times as loking down wil get you of balance and also maintain a straight back. This wil be your starting position. (Note: For the purposes of this discusion we wil use the medium stance described above which targets overal development; however you can chose any of the thre stances discused in the fot stances section).

Begin to lower the bar by bending the knes as you maintain a straight posture with the head up. Continue down until the angle betwen the uper leg and the calves becomes slightly les than 90-degres (which is the point in which the uper legs are below paralel to the flor). Inhale as you perform this portion of the movement. Tip: If you performed the exercise corectly, the front of the knes should make an imaginary straight line with the toes that is perpendicular to the front. If your knes are past that imaginary line (if they are past your toes) then you are placing undue stres on the kne and the exercise has ben performed incorectly.
Begin to raise the bar as you exhale by pushing the flor with the bal of your fot mainly as you straighten the legs again and go back to the starting position.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Zottman Curl
directions: Stand up with your torso upright and a dumbel in each hand being held at arms length. The elbows should be close to the torso.
Make sure the palms of the hands are facing each other. This wil be your starting position.

While holding the uper arm stationary, curl the weights while contracting the biceps as you breathe out. Only the forearms should move. Your wrist should rotate so that you have a supinated (palms up) grip. Continue the movement until your biceps are fuly contracted and the dumbels are at shoulder level.
Hold the contracted position for a second as you squeze the biceps.
Now during the contracted position, rotate your wrist until you now have a pronated (palms facing down) grip with the thumb at a higher position than the pinky.
Slowly begin to bring the dumbels back down using the pronated grip.
As the dumbels close your thighs, start rotating the wrist so that you go back to a neutral (palms facing your body) grip.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.

name: Zottman Preacher Curl
directions: Grab a dumbel in each hand and place your uper arms on top of the preacher bench or the incline bench. The dumbels should be held at shoulder height and the elbows should be flexed. Hold the dumbels with the palms of your hands facing down. This wil be your starting position.
As you breathe in, slowly lower the dumbels keping the palms down until your uper arm is extended and your biceps are fuly stretched.
Now rotate your wrists once you are at the botom of the movement so that the palms of the hands are facing up.

As you exhale, use your biceps to curl the weights up until they are fuly contracted and the dumbels are at shoulder height. Again, remember that to ensure ful contraction you ned to bring that smal finger higher than the thumb.
Squeze the biceps hard for a second at the contracted position and rotate your wrists so that the palms are facing down again.
Repeat for the recomended amount of repetitions.
